Since 1975, PhillipCapital has grown as an integrated Asian financial house with a global presence that offers a full range of quality and innovative services to retail, corporate and institutional customers.

Our comprehensive suite of financial products and services includes fund management, managed accounts, unit trusts, insurance planning, regular savings, contracts for difference, exchange traded funds, investment research, equity financing, property; and broking in bonds, securities, futures, foreign exchange, precious metals and commodities. Institutions can also benefit from our corporate finance and advisory services as well as information technology solutions.

PhillipCapital (with headquarters in Singapore) operates in the financial hubs of 16 countries, with offices in Singapore, Malaysia, Cambodia, Indonesia, Thailand, Hong Kong, China, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, UAE, UK, France, Turkey, Australia and USA.

Responsibilities:

  • Report project progresses in charge

​Requirements:

  • Degree in Engineering/Science/Maths

  • Working experience with SQL and Python is a must
  • Working experience with Scala, Java, Hadoop, Spark, DevOps, MLOps is a plus
  • Proven track records of applying Python, R, Scala or Java in ML/DL/NLP
  • Ability to multitask and roadmap project needs
  • Sound time-management and prioritizing skills
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Excellent team player

Based in Singapore, TheSeafoodCompany specializes in the distribution of frozen seafood products from around the world. Since 2005, we have grown to be a trusted supplier for the local catering industry and built our business to become one of the largest distributors of seafood in Singapore.

The Incumbent should be self-driven, motivated, a fast learner and be able to adapt to different analytical situations. The individual is tasked to manage and to drive our end to end process of our business automation ERP project (Microsoft 365).

RESPONSIBILITIES

·       Collect, analyze and report on data to meet business needs.

·       Work closely with the management in driving our IT transformation and embracing new technologies and /or digital innovation opportunities.

·       Assist in the development and maintenance of our EPR system using Microsoft Business 365 and coach automated reports and dashboards.

·       Plan, execute and report on database projects to identify any data-quality issues.

·       Analyse marketing program requirements for data and conduct a gap analysis to determine the status of existing data

·       Define and implement data acquisition and update activities to maintain the database desired coverage and quality levels

·       Ensure that new data entries are compliant through maintenance upkeep and protection regulations

·      Supports and provides IT assistance to staff on best practices as well as the onboarding of new staff.

- Utilizing data to help the business estimate market share, price products, time sales, optimize transportation costs, etc.

·       Managing of our IT software development and hardware environment.

REQUIREMENTS

·      Advanced Diploma in Information Technology/Computer Engineering

·       5 years in IT Industry & Project Management preferred (Applications, Data analysis, End user experience, etc.)

·       Good understanding and working knowledge of current IT trends and modern IT digital technologies.

·       Hands on experience in handling ERP projects or similar software

·       Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)

·       Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

·       Keen learner and self-motivated team player, ability to multi tasks/projects

·       Strong communication and interpersonal skill

column5: Wilmar International Limited, founded in 1991 and headquartered in Singapore, is today Asia’s leading agribusiness group. Wilmar is ranked amongst the largest listed companies by market capitalisation on the Singapore Exchange.

column4: <div>

column5: Wilmar’s business activities include oil palm cultivation, oilseed crushing, edible oils refining, sugar milling and refining, manufacturing of consumer products, specialty fats, oleochemicals, biodiesel and fertilisers as well as flour and rice milling. At the core of Wilmar’s strategy is an integrated agribusiness model that encompasses the entire value chain of the agricultural commodity business, from cultivation, processing, merchandising to manufacturing of a wide range of agricultural products. It has over 500 manufacturing plants and an extensive distribution network covering China, India, Indonesia and some 50 other countries. The Group has a multinational workforce of about 90,000 people.

column4: <div>

column5: Wilmar’s portfolio of high quality processed agricultural products is the preferred choice of consumers and the food manufacturing industry. Its consumer-packed products have a leading share in many Asian and African countries. Through scale, integration and the logistical advantages of its business model, Wilmar is able to extract margins at every step of the value chain, thereby reaping operational synergies and cost efficiencies. Wilmar is a firm advocate of sustainable growth and is committed to its role as a responsible corporate citizen.

column4: <div>

3,data,/en/job/lead-business-intelligence-9358799,9358799,"Lead, Business Intelligence",False,False,,,SGD,AIA SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED,11 hours ago,False,,,201106386R,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"

AIA Group Limited and its subsidiaries (collectively “AIA” or the “Group”) comprise the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group. It has a presence in 18 markets – wholly-owned branches and subsidiaries in Mainland China, Hong Kong SAR(1), Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, Cambodia, Indonesia, Myanmar, New Zealand, the Philippines, South Korea, Sri Lanka, Taiwan (China), Vietnam, Brunei and Macau SAR(2), and a 49 per cent joint venture in India.

The business that is now AIA was first established in Shanghai more than a century ago in 1919. It is a market leader in Asia (ex-Japan) based on life insurance premiums and holds leading positions across the majority of its markets. It had total assets of US$330 billion as of 30 June 2021.

AIA meets the long-term savings and protection needs of individuals by offering a range of products and services including life insurance, accident and health insurance and savings plans. The Group also provides employee benefits, credit life and pension services to corporate clients. Through an extensive network of agents, partners and employees across Asia, AIA serves the holders of more than 39 million individual policies and over 16 million participating members of group insurance schemes.

AIA Group Limited is listed on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited under the stock code “1299” with American Depositary Receipts (Level 1) traded on the over-the-counter market (ticker symbol: “AAGIY”).

","

Bring your career aspirations to life with AIA!

Be a part of a dynamic team responsible for reports preparation, analyzing data and producing data insights to support our Partner Distribution channels.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data analysis and generation of management reports for External Partners (Distributors) & Internal Partners (Regional & Local) in terms of sales & productivity, etc.
  • Preparation of timely and accurate reporting for management information/analysis
  • Responsible for sales campaigns tracking & rewards incentives results
  • Measuring the campaign effectiveness
  • Design and implement effective integration solutions to extract, merge, store and utilize data from various data sources
  • Recommend and implement solutions on improving existing reporting methodologies
  • Create a blueprint for designing, testing and maintaining that reports, dashboards and deliverables, based on Partners’ requirements on data points required
  • Drive for report automation through scripting
  • Effectively script and automate reports which allow for customizations when requirements evolve
  • Offer support by responding to system issues or enquiries in a timely manner

Minimum Job Requirements

  • Education – Diploma / Degree
  • Experience – At least 2-5 years of data and reporting function experience
  • Special skills – Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel VBA, Tableau, SQL, Alteryx
  • Soft skills
  • Strong knowledge of database structure systems, data mining and scripting.
  • Excellent organizational and analytical abilities
  • Outstanding problem solver
  • Team Player who communicates effectively to key stakeholders and able to work independently

Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live healthier, longer, better lives.

You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

column2: NTT DATA Business Solutions is a business unit of NTT DATA Corporation — a top 10 global IT services company. NTT DATA was established in 1967 as Data Communication Headquarter of Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Public Corporation.

Today with business operations in more than 50 countries, NTT DATA Business Solutions offers a powerful, unified combination of businesses delivering full-service solutions globally, providing premier professional services from consulting, system development to business IT outsourcing.NTT DATA is your Innovation Partner anywhere around the world, every day around the world we help clients explore new ways to respond to market dynamics with flexibility and speed, reduce costs with less risk, and increase productivity to enable growth","

As the leading analytics provider in APAC and part of our Company growth, we are looking for dynamic, motivated and dedicated individuals to be part of our team in Singapore. If you have the right skill set, is driven and demonstrates a can-do attitude, come join us as a Consultant

Responsibilities

  • Deliver end-to-end Business Intelligence and Analytics solutions to customer
  • Provide product and application support and maintenance
  • Support sales and pre-sales team

Requirements

  • Diploma/Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Analytics or equivalent
  • Minimum 1 year of relevant experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics or equivalent
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in ETL development tools or equivalent (e.g. Talend, Qlik, SAP Business Objects Data Services)
  • BI tools such as Talend, Qlik, Power BI, SSIS,SAP Business Objects, Oracle BIEE
  • Extensively worked on creating data models using dimensional modelling techniques.
  • Extensive knowledge of relational database concepts and SQL in Oracle/MS SQL Server
  • Independent and good team player who takes initiative and engages their colleagues
  • Ability to communicate with clarity and confidence with colleagues and customers
  • Likes technology, taking initiative to learn more and share knowledge within the team
  • Knowledge in any of following tools or technologies are not mandatory but will be an added advantage:
  • Data Science Platforms e.g., SAS, Dataiku, RapidMiner
  • Python/R Programming
  • Cloud and network concepts
  • Relational database concepts and SQL knowledge
  • Databases such as Oracle, MS SQL Server
  • Programming languages such as Java, Unix, Python, ASP.Net with C#.Net or VB.Net
  • AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform services and product.

5,data,/en/job/manager-data-quality-analysis-9405033,9405033,"Manager, Data Quality & Analysis",False,False,3000,4500,SGD,eGENTIC Asia Pacific Pte Ltd,22-Mar-22,False,,,200915799E,,,1 - 50 Employees,,Harbourfront Centre,"

eGENTIC is a leading provider for state-of-the-art B2C lead generation (permission-based marketing, Telemarketing data, and digital marketing solutions including Email and SMS).

We rank among the largest online marketing contributors in the online world and support more than 1000 companies in their efforts to generate new customers each month.

eGENTIC was founded in 2001 in Germany and since then have expanded into over 20 countries around the world focusing on Europe, Asia-Pacific, Africa and South America.

Big Bang Ads is a private affiliate network of eGENTIC where we host our own direct-to-consumer offers. We are one of the largest advertisers in affiliate marketing worldwide.

We have started expansion into the Asia Pacific from our regional headquarter in Singapore since 2009.

From our Singapore office, we cover the Asia Pacific markets and target all major local markets in the region including Hong Kong, Taiwan, Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, Thailand, South Africa, Australia and New Zealand.

","

Benefits

  • 5 days working week. Currently both in-office and work from home.
  • Centrally Located Office with easy transport options
  • 20 days Annual Leave
  • Training & Development Support
  • Medical & Dental Coverage
  • Work with state-of-the-art technology
  • Opportunity to travel to attend conferences and events

Job Descriptions

  • Gather data and compile meaningful reports for customer data analysis and internal data quality scoring
  • Analyze customer and campaign data - focusing on data that accurately measures actionable results.
  • Develop ongoing and ad-hoc reports to track key performance metrics
  • Assist in creating and maintaining client-facing & internal business-reports/dashboards
  • Monitor and improve data quality from our marketing partners
  • Supporting team requirements in pulling stats and data for analysis
  • Work closely with the Head of Data Performance to improve results
  • Able to perform in a fast-paced environment that requires a high degree of energy and focus with an emphasis on speed and quality of deliverables.

Job Requirements

  • Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, in Economics, Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent field.
  • At least 2 years of data analysis experience.
  • Familiar with at least one programming/scripting language.
  • Strong analytical and research skills with the ability to create actionable insights by aggregating and distilling large-scale data sets.
  • Self-directed, able to work and able to deliver timely and accurate results with minimal supervision.
  • Exceptional analytical mindset and problem-solving skills.
  • Able to work with a large amount of data meticulously.
  • Excellent communications, presentations & creative skills (Both written and Oral in English).
  • Solid understanding of digital marketing principles, best practices and technologies.
  • Detail-oriented, meticulous, multi-task and able to respond well under pressure.
  • Positive working attitude with a pleasant personality.
  • Results-oriented, strong work ethic and a strong team player. Ability to work with a wide range of people at all decision-making levels.

6,data,/en/job/data-analyst-9341680,9341680,Data Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,ACAMS SINGAPORE,18-Mar-22,False,,,201716827D,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div>

The Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists (ACAMS®) seeks for an Operations Executive for its Singapore office.  ACAMS is a global association of professionals in the Anti-Money Laundering/Financial Crime field.  It has over 76,000 members working in financial institutions, regulatory bodies and law enforcement agencies in over 175 countries/ regions.  ACAMS provides a tiered approach to training and education in AML/Financial Crime, including its flagship program - the Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS®) qualification - and also organizes in-person training seminars and web seminars, conferences and other AML training events. ACAMS has established the ACAMS Singapore Chapter, Hong Kong Chapter, South India Chapter, Macau Chapter and Philippine Chapter, and is in the process of forming chapters in other Asian financial centers.  Since the opening of offices in different countries/ regions, including the Regional Head Office in Hong Kong, regional offices in Japan, Singapore, China, Taiwan etc., ACAMS has signed a number of partnerships in Asia to promote the CAMS® certification and AML education and training.  Additional information on ACAMS can be found at www.acams.org or www.acams.org.cn .  We are looking for an Operations Executive in Singapore office to meet the needs of our regional expansion.

","

Scope of employment shall include:

• Reporting, Dashboards and KPI Delivery, Support and Maintenance

• Data Governance and Quality

• Ad-hoc Analytic

Job Specific

• Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization

• Respond to data and product related inquiries to support business and technical teams

• Responsible for developing and executing tools/reports to monitor and report on data quality

• Conduct in-depth review and find out root cause of bad data

• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

• Conduct detailed data analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new feature

• Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization

• Provide training support for business units when needed.

• Work with management to prioritize business and information needs

• To input and extract data from SalesForce.com

• To handle tasks assigned by the Management

Completes other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements                        

• Attention to detail as data analysis and reporting must be precise

• An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving

• Knowledge of SalesForce administration and reporting is highly preferred

• Excellent computing skills in office software including Excel (Formulas, Pivot Table, Data Management), Word (Mail Merge), PowerPoint and Outlook

• Fluency (speaking, reading and writing) in English and Chinese

• Knowledge of other Asian language(s) is a plus

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

• A “Do Whatever It Takes” attitude to get things done – either to meet individual or team objectives/goals

• Able to communicate effectively with all levels within organization

• Ability to learn and understand ACAMS’s services and training offerings (Study of the ACAMS Coursework is required)

• Familiarity with banking and finance, training, financial institution regulation or compliance a plus

AIA Group Limited and its subsidiaries (collectively “AIA” or the “Group”) comprise the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group. It has a presence in 18 markets – wholly-owned branches and subsidiaries in Mainland China, Hong Kong SAR(1), Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, Cambodia, Indonesia, Myanmar, New Zealand, the Philippines, South Korea, Sri Lanka, Taiwan (China), Vietnam, Brunei and Macau SAR(2), and a 49 per cent joint venture in India.

The business that is now AIA was first established in Shanghai more than a century ago in 1919. It is a market leader in Asia (ex-Japan) based on life insurance premiums and holds leading positions across the majority of its markets. It had total assets of US$330 billion as of 30 June 2021.

AIA meets the long-term savings and protection needs of individuals by offering a range of products and services including life insurance, accident and health insurance and savings plans. The Group also provides employee benefits, credit life and pension services to corporate clients. Through an extensive network of agents, partners and employees across Asia, AIA serves the holders of more than 39 million individual policies and over 16 million participating members of group insurance schemes.

AIA Group Limited is listed on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited under the stock code “1299” with American Depositary Receipts (Level 1) traded on the over-the-counter market (ticker symbol: “AAGIY”).

","

Bring your career aspirations to life with AIA!

Summary

The Data Governance Specialist will be leading the approach, design, and execution of Data Governance initiatives of AIA Singapore.

The Data Governance Specialist will participate in the planning, estimation of varied tasks associated with a holistic Data Governance framework. He/she is expected to work closely with Technology on solutioning, architecture, feasibility, tool evaluation and project management for supporting Data Governance.

The Data Governance Specialist will be responsible for providing timely updates back to key stakeholders along with any associated issues and risks.

Responsibilities

  •  Drive the overall Data Governance Framework setup and execution across AIA.
  • Define, obtain endorsement, and maintain key Data Governance documents and areas including, but not limited to: target operating model, roles & responsibilities, policies, standards and processes.
  • Execution of Data Quality assessment for key systems and critical data elements.
  • Implementation of Data Governance tools like metadata management, reference data management, master data management and data quality.
  • Facilitate the resolution of data quality and governance issues on a day-to-day basis.
  • Chair and run the periodic Data Governance Working Group meeting.
  • Work collaboratively with your Data, Analytics and BI colleagues to deliver on your objectives and openly share knowledge amongst the organization.
  • Build and maintain strong effective relationships with key internal and external stakeholders to ensure that your data platform solutions meet the expectation of key business stakeholders.
  • Assess and understand the business requirements through liaison with the business stakeholders, Business Analysts and Project Managers.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree and above in Analytics, Information Systems Management, Computer Science or related fields.
  • 3-4 years of experience in data governance and data quality related projects.
  • Hands-on experience on any of the Data Governance related tool namely IDQ, AXON, EDC, IDQ, Data360. Also working experience in SQL, Tableau or BI Tool
  • Good knowledge of the overall Information Management framework, including operating model, data governance, data management, data security, data quality and data architecture.
  • Good understanding of metadata management, reference data management, master data management, and data quality.
  • Day to day execution experience of implementing a data governance framework.
  • Change management experience of transforming an organization to be more data focused.

Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live healthier, longer, better lives.

You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

8,data,/en/job/data-analyst-9392173,9392173,Data Analyst,False,False,4000,6000,SGD,Baozun Asia Pte. Ltd.,17-Mar-22,False,,,202201244R,,,,,,"

Baozun is the leading brand E-commerce solutions provider in China. Our integrated capabilities encompass all aspects of the E-commerce value chain covering IT solutions, store operations, digital marketing, customer services, warehousing and fulfillment. We help brand execute their E-commerce strategies in China by selling their goods directly to customers online or by providing services to assist with their E-commerce operations. Our business ranges from China’s well-known online shopping platforms – Tmall and JD.com, as well as social mobile shopping malls, to brands’ official stores and off-line smart stores. Rooted in the evolving digital business, driven by technology, we dig into each area of supply chains, make customized solutions for brands, and build a communication bridge with customers.Technology is the essence of future retail, and is, our DNA. By integrating cloud computing, big data and AI technology, we continuously invest to build a leading e-commerce technology platform.

Achievements

Baozun was founded at Shanghai, China in year 2007. Over the past ten years, we have branches spread all over Hangzhou, Beijing, Hongkong and Taiwan, with overseas offices located in Japan, Korea and the USA.Baozun was listed on NASDAQ in May, 2015 and completes the secondary listing on HKEX in September, 2021. Baozun’s competitive advantages have enabled the Company to achieve rapid growth in the number of its brand partners to 281 brand partners as of March 31, 2021, including 15 out of the top 50 most valuable global brands according to BrandZ Top 100 Most Valuable Global Brands. Baozun has delivered huge success with brands to localize their digital strategy in China market.

Mission, Vision and Core Values

Mission: Driven by technological innovation and customer needs, we strive to become the leading global brand e-commerce business partner.

Vision: Technology empowers the future success.

4I Core Values: • Interpretation • Implementation • Integration • Innovation

","

Responsibilities:

  • Communicate with Brand representative to understand their needs for online store platform.
  • Manage website's activities, including product listing, promotions, inventory planning etc..
  • Analyze data traffic, market data and marketing campaigns to optimize customer experience and propose creative ideas.
  • Business performance review: Provide reporting with insights on what are the key drivers to business growth (vs Forecast, vs Last Year) from the perspective of Lines of Business (LOB), Division (Footwear, Apparel, Equipment), buyer, countries, Platforms, clickstream web funnel data, marketing channel performance.
  • Weekly updates: Provide overview of Week-to-Date trends and an estimated landing of the retail week based on trends, highlight any opportunities that the team can leverage on to bridge the gap against Forecast,
  • Drive members growth: Analytical support on the members growth rate with strategic initiatives for improvement such as landscape, members retentions.
  • Forecasting: Provide upcoming months' financial Forecast using a bottom-up view from KPI lens (Traffic and Conversion by Devices) that considers the planned consumer moments and BAU trends.
  • Provide a post-campaign analysis of all consumer moments from the perspectives of Lines of Business (LOB), Division (Footwear, Apparel, Equipment), Buyer, Countries, Platforms, Clickstream web funnel data, Marketing Channel performance and any recommendations for future improvements on consumer experience.
  • Communicate with e-commerce platform key account manager.
  • Perform ad hoc projects assigned by Managers.

To be successful in this role, you will need to have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in BBA, E-commerce, Statistics or Marketing is preferred.
  • At least 3-4 years of experience in E-commerce.
  • Prior work experience in reputable e-commerce platforms would be an advantage.
  • Strong marketing sense, especially on digital business.
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills.

9,data,/en/job/data-analyst-9364006,9364006,Data Analyst,False,False,3500,4200,SGD,YouTrip,18-Mar-22,False,,20 days,201628225C,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"
YouTrip is a regional financial technology startup based in Singapore and Hong Kong, dedicated to creating the best mobile financial services for travellers by simplifying overseas spending and creating a fuss-free travel experience. YouTrip's mission is to help people across Southeast Asia manage their money in a simpler yet smarter way, starting with a core focus on travellers. YouTrip partnered with Ez-Link and Mastercard to launch in Singapore in August 2018.
","

Data Analyst – Data & Analytics Team, YouTrip, Singapore

What is it about in one line?

This role is responsible for generating business insights and developing integrated business analysis / projections for strategic decision-making. You’ll also be supporting data visualization needs across several business units within Youtrip and across the Southeast Asia region.

Sounds interesting? Here’s more about us

YouTrip is a Southeast Asian neobank offering the region’s first and leading multi-currency wallet. As a regional financial technology startup, it is dedicated to creating the best mobile financial services by simplifying foreign currency payments and offering the best exchange rates. Launched in 2018, YouTrip has been voted the #1 multi-currency account in Singapore, with the largest user base in the region following its successful launch in Thailand in partnership with Karsikornbank in 2019.

YouTrip is a Major Payment Institution licensed under the Monetary Authority of Singapore. It was recognized as a Top FinTech Leader at the SFF Global FinTech Awards 2021, and awarded ASEAN’s Best Fintech Start-up 2019 by the Rice Bowl Start-up Awards.

Our culture is entrepreneurial, open & inclusive, and teamwork-oriented. We are looking for talents with the aspiration to thrive in a rapidly growing business in the exciting FinTech space

As a member of the Data & Analytics team in Singapore, you will be setting up revenue-generating hypotheses, verifying them, and generating actionable insights for the business or strategic planning per Country Team.

You will:

●     Develop a deep understanding of our existing business and the payment industry through access to a wide range of data, including transaction, marketing channels performance, app usage, and financial data.

●     Collect, analyze and synthesize data from a variety of sources to generate insights and bring to life actionable initiatives that feed into the business’s core planning cycle. A successful Data Analyst will also be creating new metrics to measure business objectives, product features, customer success, and our competitors.

●     Act as an internal partner with a set of stakeholders to grow the extent of data-driven planning and decision-making in their area. Some examples of stakeholders you will work with: Marketing, Corporate Finance, Product, Compliance and Customer Service teams

●     Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations and reports through integrating business unit-specific KPIs from multiple data sources, which will over time support these teams to self-service their data and insight needs.

●     Support day-to-day data extract and analysis to also answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance

●     Work closely with country teams on building customer engagement through various projects, particularly on acquiring, activating, and maintaining customers

You are:

●     Data analysis enthusiast – you’ve racked up at least 1-2 years of experience in data analysis preferred in the Financial / Payment industry and are passionate about data and driving business decisions. 

●     Creative thinker and Problem solver – you possess excellent problem-solving skills with demonstrated experience in figuring out complex business data questions & suggesting actionable initiatives with other teams regionally.

●     Technical know-how – Strong analytical skills - able to collect, organize and analyze significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Proficient in Excel and SQL; familiar with business intelligence / dashboarding tools (e.g. Tableau).

●     Excellent communicator – use storytelling to bring insights to life and make connections on the business level.

●     Fearless self-starter – you are not afraid to suggest new initiatives to tackle complex business issues/data analytics, as long as the rationale is logical and sound.

What can you expect from us?

●     A free hand to innovate and continuously develop new content

●     The most innovative travel payment product to use and to create content around

●     Direct report to Data & Analytics Lead and be part of the fastest growing team in the Singapore business

●     Access to a deep bench of technical and business experts to work together

●     Working with an entrepreneurial team of people in Singapore & Thailand

10,data,/en/job/data-protection-executive-9400761,9400761,Data Protection Executive,False,False,,,SGD,Raffles Hotel Singapore,21-Mar-22,False,,,52918810D,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"

Raffles Hotel Singapore welcomed guests in August 2019 after a careful and sensitive restoration breathing new life into its beautiful building. One of the few remaining great 19th century hotels in the world, the hotel is perfectly preserved both inside and out, giving it an intoxicating blend of luxury, history and classic colonial design. Its distinctive architecture, legendary heritage and iconic service continue to enthrall visitors while restored suites, new social spaces, restaurants and bars have been enhanced for discerning travellers. 

","

The Data Protection Executive is responsible for establishing and sustaining the data protection system in Raffles Hotel Singapore.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Acts as the primary point of contact within the organisation for colleagues, regulators and any relevant bodies on issues related to data protection.
  • Ensures organisation’s policy is in accordance with Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) and codes of practice.
  • Evaluates the existing data protection framework and identifies areas of non or partial compliance, and rectifies any issues.
  • Devises training plans, provides data protection advice and supports colleagues.
  • Informs and advises the Data Controller or Data Processor on all matters related to data protection.
  • Promotes a culture of data protection compliance across all units of the organisation.
  • Provides expert advice and educates colleagues on important data compliance requirements.
  • Drafts new and amends existing internal data protection policies, guidelines and procedures, in consultation with key stakeholders.
  • Conducts training with colleagues across different business units who are involved in data handling or processing.
  • Proactively conducts audits to ensure compliance and addresses potential issues.
  • Maintains record of all data processing activities carried out by the organisation.
  • Serves as the point of contact between the organisation and the data protection authorities.

Candidate Profile

Knowledge and Skills

  • Bachelor’s university degree or equivalent.
  • Experience working in data protection compliance or a related field, and within a legal, audit and/or risk function department preferred.
  • Knowledge in Singapore data protection laws and practices including an in-depth understanding of the PDPA.
  • Good knowledge of IT software such as Microsoft Office Suite, systems and network will be an advantage.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Oral and written fluency in English, and ability to speak other languages will be an advantage.

Competencies

  • Good interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with all levels of colleagues.
  • Ability to work independently and has good initiative under dynamic environment.
  • Ability to work effectively and contribute in a team.
  • Service oriented with an eye for details and has an inquisitive mind.
  • Ability to manage sensitive and confidential information.
  • Flexible and able to embrace and respond to change effectively.
  • Self-motivated, energetic and work well under pressure.

15,data,/en/job/network-engineer-data-center-network-9354067,9354067,Network Engineer (Data Center Network),False,False,7000,13000,SGD,Sea,22-Mar-22,False,,1 day,200908142H,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"
Sea is an internet platform company. We focus on in Greater Southeast Asia, a region that includes Indonesia, Taiwan, Vietnam, Thailand, the Philippines, Malaysia, and Singapore. We operate three industry-leading platforms across digital entertainment, e-commerce and digital financial services.

Our Garena digital entertainment platform is the largest online game ecosystem in our region by revenues and operates in all seven markets. It offers consumers and global game developers a unique combination of localized game operations, payments, eSports events, video streaming, content sharing, user chat, and online forums.

Shopee is one of our region’s fastest growing e-commerce marketplaces, with operations across all seven markets and a mobile-centric approach. It empowers small businesses and buyers by offering a safe and trusted shopping environment, supported by integrated payment and third-party logistics capabilities. Shopee has achieved over US$ 3.0 billion of annualized GMV achieved less than two years after launching in 2015.

SeaMoney, our digital financial services platform, provides e-wallet services to consumers via the AirPay mobile App and to small businesses through the AirPay counter application. This has scaled to become one of the largest e-wallet service providers in our region by gross transaction volume, bringing about greater convenience for customers, efficiency for merchants, and broad financial inclusion for a large number of historically unbanked consumers.

Our three platforms share substantial common capabilities across talent, technology development, marketing, and infrastructure, creating a true multi-platform company, Sea. Sea has a global group of investors from over 10 countries, including several of our region’s most respected sovereign funds and business families and a distinguished group of international partners from Asia, North America, and Europe. 
","

Our Infrastructure team provides end-to-end managed services and solutions for the Group's entire Internet infrastructure alongside running business applications. We excel in building the architecture, providing solutions and operations of data centre, connectivity, cloud, networking, system, storage and security. We are a proud provider of high-quality and stable running business applications and services to our internal business units.

As a Network Engineer, you will develop network architecture that supports the high bandwidth and low latency requirements of products and services. As part of the team, you will ensure that data center network is always efficient, robust, scalable, and secure.

Job Description

  • Perform network design, planning and setup of network Infrastructure based on technical requirement
  • Provide overall solution proposal with High Level Design (HLD) and BU presentation
  • Drive network optimisation to improve convergence, performance and latency
  • Maintain updated schematic diagrams for infrastructure and low-level architecture design diagram
  • Proof of concept testing on customisation network solution
  • Manage the inventory of network devices
  • Create and maintain documentation related to network configuration, policies, procedures and service records
  • Provide network operation support, problem determination, network incidents troubleshooting and escalate to vendors/management accordingly
  • Participate and provide technical support in network implementation projects wherever and whenever required

Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree or above in Telecommunication/Computer Engineering or related fields
  • Minimum 3+ years hands-on experience in deploying massive scale data center network
  • Strong technical knowledge on switching and routing such as VLAN, STP, VPC/MLAG, HSRP/VRRP, NAT, IPSec, MPLS, OSPF, BGP, VxLAN, EVPN and Segment Routing
  • Hands on experience in either Arista, Cisco, Huawei, Mellanox, A10, Fortinet and Palo Alto
  • Experience in AI SuperPod architecture design and implementation is added advantage
  • Experience in Linux system administration and coding such as Ansible, Python
  • Network related certification (e.g CCNP/CCIE) is a plus
  • Able to manage multiple tasks and projects with minimal supervision
  • Good communication and stakeholder management skills with both internal and external parties
  • Proficient in both English and Mandarin due to regional coverage
  • Required to provide on-call support occasionally

16,data,/en/job/enterprise-analytics-specialist-9328722,9328722,"Enterprise Analytics, Specialist",False,False,,,SGD,AIA SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED,16-Mar-22,False,,,201106386R,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"

AIA Group Limited and its subsidiaries (collectively “AIA” or the “Group”) comprise the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group. It has a presence in 18 markets – wholly-owned branches and subsidiaries in Mainland China, Hong Kong SAR(1), Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, Cambodia, Indonesia, Myanmar, New Zealand, the Philippines, South Korea, Sri Lanka, Taiwan (China), Vietnam, Brunei and Macau SAR(2), and a 49 per cent joint venture in India.

The business that is now AIA was first established in Shanghai more than a century ago in 1919. It is a market leader in Asia (ex-Japan) based on life insurance premiums and holds leading positions across the majority of its markets. It had total assets of US$330 billion as of 30 June 2021.

AIA meets the long-term savings and protection needs of individuals by offering a range of products and services including life insurance, accident and health insurance and savings plans. The Group also provides employee benefits, credit life and pension services to corporate clients. Through an extensive network of agents, partners and employees across Asia, AIA serves the holders of more than 39 million individual policies and over 16 million participating members of group insurance schemes.

AIA Group Limited is listed on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited under the stock code “1299” with American Depositary Receipts (Level 1) traded on the over-the-counter market (ticker symbol: “AAGIY”).

","

Bring your career aspirations to life with AIA!

You will be responsible for changing AIA’s analytics landscape and business formulas by delivering best-in-class advanced analytical solutions to drive business growth, improve efficiencies and reduce costs.

Role & Responsibilities

  • Design, implement and evaluate advanced statistical and machine learning models and approaches for application to various business problem statements.
  • Communicate findings from analytical modelling results to relevant stakeholders that will give insights to improve decision making and drive business performance.
  • Implement analytical models into production systems by collaborating with relevant stakeholders.
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance, as well as implement improvements as needed. 
  • Provide support in building the foundation of technical analytics capabilities within Enterprise Analytics department, including sharing of best coding, modelling and data science practices within the team.
  • Drive analytics innovation by keeping abreast of industry’s trends, evaluating and adapting new and improved data science approaches for the business.
  • Develop in depth understanding of the business and be able to advise the business on the right analytics approach by participating in business discussions and presentations as applicable.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree holder, ideally in STEM disciplines (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math); graduate degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Data Science or other related quantitative field is preferred.
  • Approximately 3-5 years’ of working experience in data science.
  • Experience using programming languages (e.g. Python, R, SQL) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau), Excel, PowerPoint.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree, random forest, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Experience in productionisation and maintenance of machine learning systems.
  • Experience of working on Azure based cloud technologies will be highly desirable.
  • Experience in SPARK based technologies is highly desirable.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Strong analytical skills, deductive reasoning, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
  • Excellent relationship management, strong team building, and the ability to work across business units and functions to drive positive business outcomes.
  • Project management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Strong sense of urgency and accountability to drive business outcomes

Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live healthier, longer, better lives.

You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

18,data,/en/job/data-management-analyst-9329554,9329554,Data Management Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,Pacific Life Re Limited,16-Mar-22,False,,24 days,T08FC7244G,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

Pacific Life Re Limited is a growing life reinsurer offering a comprehensive range of reinsurance solutions and support to insurance clients in the UK, Ireland and Asia. They also operate a life retrocession business in North America.

The Singapore Branch Office is the Regional Headquarters for the Asia Pacific Region. In line with our ambitious growth plans for Asia, we are seeking a high calibre personnel to be part of our team to provide general office support and assist with the smooth running of the office.

","

SAP is Pacific Life Re’s core administration system; it processes data from treaties to enable processing of client accounts, valuation, pricing, risk and financial management analysis. It is critical that our global business processing system is proficient in supporting Asia’s business growth and innovation needs; accounts and its underlying data are processed enabling accurate and timely analysis of data for pricing, risk, financial management and reporting purposes; and Asia stakeholders can tap onto the business information available with little further interrogation of data to manage all cedant data and internal reporting tools.

Placed within the Data Management Team (“DMT”) of Asia Operations team, this role’s primary responsibilities include all technical aspects of the administration of reinsurance contracts. This includes the verification and provision of data for; valuation, pricing, risk and financial management analysis as well as administration of data required for business systems.

Duties of the role:

1. Delivering accurate information for valuation extracts and experience analysis as well as internal and external reporting which involves:

  • Loading client’s data into SAP data warehouse
  • Working closely with Corporate Actuarial and Finance teams to ensure the provision of accurate data for valuation and reporting
  • Working closely with R&D to ensure the provision of validated data for experience analysis
  • Working closely with Client Accounts Team within Ops to ensure treaty service level agreements are met
  • Prepare any other reconciliation or internal reports as required

2. Support manager in taking lead to guide DMT members to ensure effective yet proportionate controls are in place and appropriately monitored across all areas of our work.

  • The role may also be required to coach colleagues as assigned by manager.

3. Project and Operations responsibilities:

  • Provide support to Treaty implementations Team as requested to aid in DMT deliverables
  • Provide support to allocated Projects including but not limited to Technology, Divisional Operations, or projects to meet Asia Operations, Asia Business Unit objectives.
  • Provide support to Client Accounts Team to attend to requests from front office on set up of novel deals, product solutions in SAP.

Qualifications & Experience

  • At least 2 years’ working experience in (re)insurance industry, using (re)Insurance operations/administration systems
  • Strong capability on MS Excel and SQL will be considered essential
  • Experience working in SAP Data Services will be preferred
  • Prior experience requirement gathering in business analyst capacity and have been part of project implementations is an added advantage
  • Prior experience working with and analysing large volumes of data
  • Senior Data Management Analyst
  • Prior Insurance / Reinsurance experience is preferred and good knowledge of reinsurance finance, valuation, pricing, underwriting and claims functions is a plus
  • Proven experience in coaching or training team members is useful

column4: SEEK has evolved from being a domestic online employment classifieds business, to the largest global online marketplace, operating in 19 countries. Our reach includes Australia, New Zealand, China, Brazil, Mexico, South East Asia, Southern Africa, India and Bangladesh.

column3: <div>

column4: Founded in Melbourne, Australia in 1997, there are now over 6,000 people working for SEEK globally. We believe the key to our success is creating a work environment which is challenging, rewarding and inclusive.

column3: <div>

column3: <div>

column4: SEEK’s strategy is to match more candidates to opportunities than anyone else through using its marketplace scale to build a radically more efficient and effective marketplace.

column3: <div>

column4: A cornerstone of SEEK’s growth since its inception has been the quality of its people, its award winning culture and strong commitment to its values. This will continue to be at the core of ongoing success and growth for SEEK in all locations.

column3: <div>

column4: Formed from the recent merger of the two leading portals in the region, JobStreet.com and jobsDB, SEEK’s Asian operation now employs 1,500 people operating across 7 countries in South East Asian countries. Operating across 7 countries in South East Asian countries, it now has ambitious growth plans that includes expanding its product set and customer base. To support this, we are transforming our sales and service organization including moving to a more solution based selling approach, increasing use of digital channels and becoming more data driven.

column1:
","

The Role

SEEK is undertaking a large scale enterprise wide Unification program to consolidate their technology platforms across its Asia Pacific business and standardising operating processes across Asia to support this. 

As part of this Unification program, the Asia CRM project objective is to replace SEEK Asia’s custom CRM systems with Salesforce, aligning to the existing implementation in Australia and New Zealand, supported by consolidated and aligned process and requirements across the different Asian countries. This will enable SEEK to have all client data integrated and available through one central platform, enabling our growth aspirations and increasing our competitiveness in all our Asian markets.

A Reporting analyst is required to deliver the project’s reporting needs over the next 24 months. You will be responsible for assisting in driving the reporting solution including analysis of the current and to-be state and designing and delivering the solution across both Salesforce and Tableu.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the development and implementation of reporting governance frameworks and processes to ensure reporting quality standards are met.
  • Gather reporting requirements and design future state reports.
  • Work with the delivery partner resources collaboratively within the reporting team
  • Build strong empathetic relationships with stakeholder groups internal and external to SEEK and delivery partners
  • Work with the reporting team to ensure data hierarchies are set up to support CRM Master Data, Reporting and business practices
  • Facilitate workshops for requirements gathering, produce stories that articulate the business rules for reporting
  • Define future state reporting requirements across Sales, Service and Billing, including consolidation and translation of current state across 6 countries across Asia for delivery via Salesforce and/or business intelligence tools
  • Understand the data landscape and ensure platform integrations support master data governance principles/best practice.
  • Resolve issues and mitigate risks through effective collaboration and negotiation with the project team and stakeholders.
  • Be an advocate for the Salesforce CRM system within the organisation and promote its expanded use as a means of capturing deeper data & insights
  • Assist the change management team with the development of end user reporting training and documentation.

So, what are looking for?

  • Tertiary degree in Mathematics /Statistics / Computer Science /Business Administration
  • Proven experience in managing successful reporting and analytics solutions
  • Extensive hands on experience with reporting tools including Salesforce and Tableau.
  • Experience working in projects using a combination of Agile and Waterfall methodologies 
  • Strong understanding of SQL and data modelling
  • Demonstrated experience liaising with subject matter experts, understanding of reporting processes, developing operational reports and reconciliation reports to enable business reporting self-service
  • Interpersonal skills to foster effective relationships with business representatives and project team members to define reporting requirements and standards
  • Demonstrated strong analytical skills, commercial and business acumen, and an understanding of the complexities of data.
  • Experience in conducting workshops with business and technical audiences to elicit business requirements and defining user stories with acceptance criteria and user personas
  • Ability to challenge the status quo.
  • Ability to quickly breakdown problems and find innovative solutions.
  • An ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

22,data,/en/job/data-operations-engineer-9326954,9326954,Data Operations Engineer,False,False,5000,10000,SGD,Xiaomi Technologies Singapore Pte. Ltd.,15-Mar-22,False,,,202127014Z,,,,,,"

Xiaomi Corporation, registered in Asia as Xiaomi Inc., is a Chinese designer and manufacturer of consumer electronics and related software, home appliances, and household items. Behind Samsung, it is the second largest manufacturer of smartphones, all of which run the MIUI operating system, a fork of Android. In 2020, the company sold 146.3 million smartphones and, as of August 2021, its MIUI operating system had over 450 million monthly active users. It also is a major manufacturer of appliances including televisions, flashlights, unmanned aerial vehicles, and air purifiers using its Internet of Things and Xiaomi Smart Home product ecosystems. The name ""Xiaomi"" literally means millet and rice, and is based on the Buddhist concept of starting from the bottom before aiming for the top.

","

About The Company:

Xiaomi Corporation was founded in April 2010 and listed on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on July 9, 2018 (1810.HK). Xiaomi is a consumer electronics and smart manufacturing company with smartphones Cand smart hardware connected by an IoT platform at its core.

Embracing our vision of “Make friends with users and be the coolest company in the users’ hearts”, Xiaomi continuously pursues innovations, high-quality user experience and operational efficiency. The company relentlessly builds amazing products with honest prices to let everyone in the world enjoy a better life through innovative technology.

Xiaomi is one of the world's leading smartphone companies. The company’s market share in terms of smartphone shipments ranked no. 2 globally in the second quarter of 2021.

Job Description:

  • Responsible for the research and development of overseas data efficiency tools for IoT cloud services in Singapore operations center
  • Responsible for overseas service operation and maintenance, data management operation and maintenance and data security of IoT cloud service in Singapore operation center
  • Responsible for IoT cloud service overseas business data demand support, and work closely with domestic teams

Job Requirement：

  • 1、Bachelor degree or above, more than 3 years of work experience
  • Have a deep understanding of data processing, can in-depth analysis, locate business problems, and use data to solve business problems
  • It is better to have rich experience in big data projects and related efficiency research and development tools
  • Familiar with at least one of the languages such as C++/GO/JAVA/Python, and have some experience in linux shell development
  • Excellent communication, coordination, organization, teamwork skills and sense of responsibility, and independent problem-solving skills

23,data,/en/job/data-engineer-senior-data-engineer-9389113,9389113,Data Engineer/ Senior Data Engineer,False,False,,,SGD,DSBJ PTE. LTD.,17-Mar-22,False,,10 days,201907626H,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"
DSBJ is a leading worldwide technology partner providing critical components for loT intelligence, with a special focus on Telecommunication Equipment and Metal Precision, LED technologies and Interconnect solutions.  With a vision focused on technological breakthroughs, we constantly bring new innovative solutions, high-tech products and high-quality services that propel our customers to success.

DSBJ takes surefooted steps forward and takes them quickly.  In April 2010, 30 years after our inception, we were listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.  We've continually evolved over three decades, perpetually innovating and strategically transforming ourselves time and time again.  From a small manufacturing company to a prestigious global player, our successful journey is testament to our vision, innovative spirit and determined belief in technology.  As we embrace future challenges, we will remain steadfast in our pursuit to benefit both stakeholders and the wider society.

Technological innovation is in our DNA and is the cornerstone of DSBJ.  With cutting-edge production facilities and advanced technology, we constantly deliver state-of-the-art products and quality services.  Our global network of research bases and offices keeps us abreast of the latest tech breakthroughs, so we can effectively allocate resources wherever they're needed.  With an established presence in mainland China, Taiwan, South Korea, Finland, India, Sweden, Germany, Poland, Estonia, the US and Mexico, we meet customer needs quickly and competently, providing sales locally in addition to customer service and warehousing capabilities.

While deeply proud of our past, we never lose focus of the future.  We believe that each and every step is a starting point.  Through investments, acquisitions and new facilities, we've streamlined our business and expanded frontiers.  In 2016 we boosted our revenue by acquiring NASDAQ-listed MFLEX, a top 5 player globally in the FPC industry, operating from the US.  In July 2018 we acquired another world-renowed company from the US: PCB solution specialists Multek.

At DSBJ, we embrace every opportunity while keeping up to speed with the changing landscape.  We consistently explore new avenues and seek next-generation breakthroughs.  Looking forward, we have the unwavering determination to deliver critical components and innovative solutions that advance loT development and build a smarter, more connected world.  DSBJ, building a better-connected world for tomorrow.
","

DSBJ is a leading worldwide technology partner providing critical components for IoT intelligence, with a special focus on Telecommunication Equipment and Metal Precision, LED technologies and Interconnect solutions. Technological innovation is in the DNA of the entire organization and is also the cornerstone of DSBJ’s success. With cutting-edge production facilities and advanced technology, we constantly deliver state-of-the-art products and quality services. Towards this, DSBJ has established the data analytics COE to fully incorporate Big data and Artificial Intelligence into the strategic roadmap and enable digital transformation and smart manufacturing initiatives.

The Data Engineer will be responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of data pipeline and data lake/warehouse systems in a scalable, repeatable and secure manner. He/she will focus on defining optimal solutions to data ingestion, processing and warehousing using modern big data technologies and cloud platform. Meanwhile, he/she will work closely with downstream data consumers to turn data into valuable business insights through multiple channels (e.g. BI, data science, self-service analytics).

Main Responsibilities:

  • Understand business requirement to design and implement technical solutions that address business needs while adhering to big data architectural principles.
  • Work with the broader data engineer/IT team to ingest various types of data (e.g. structured and unstructured) in appropriate manner (e.g. batch/real-time) from a variety of data sources.
  • Test data pipelines thoroughly for scalability and reliability to process high data volume, variety and velocity.
  • Develop and implement reliable data transformation and modeling solutions to achieve data curation and build company wide data warehouse by taking advantage of cloud native solution and in-house developed components.
  • Identify and implement internal process improvements to automate data processing and ensure data integrity while meeting data security standards.
  • Implement and monitor system performance, data security and privacy measures on existing data solutions.
  • Develop backup data archiving systems to ensure system continuity.
  • Perform progress check, code review and documentation on the regular basis.
  • Work with data scientist and business analytics team to further process data in order to generate business value.
  • Provide technical guidance and coaching to junior data engineer.

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Business Analytics or equivalent. Advanced university degree would be an additional advantage.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in data warehousing/lake system (e.g. Hadoop)
  • Experience with data integration in the cloud environment (e.g. Azure, AWS)
  • Expert in building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets.
  • Expert in building curated and semantic data layer with systematic approach.
  • Experience in data ingestion, cleaning and enrichment.
  • Excellent experience in data processing using Scala/Python/Java
  • Proficient in Big data tools and ecosystem (e.g. HIVE, HBase, Kafka, Spark)
  • Knowledge & practices of SDLC process and agile methodologies
  • Strong in user requirements gathering, maintenance, and support.
  • Highly organized, self-motivated, proactive, and able to plan.
  • Experience in semiconductor/PCB manufacturing, digital supply chain is a plus.
  • Proficiency in both English and Chinese, to liaise with the Chinese-speaking associates in China Headquarter office.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
TikTok is a global short-form mobile video platform that allows you to express yourself by creating content. It gives rise to engaging, interactive challenges and trending topics in which anyone can participate. TikTok aims to capture and showcase the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter, directly from your mobile phone. TikTok has global offices in many cities, including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.","

About Us

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, Moscow, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

TikTok is seeking a Talent Sourcer to support our technical (R&D) team. In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to partner with multiple stakeholders to support our continued rapid growth. This role is a 12-month full-time, fixed-term contract based in Singapore.

Responsibilities

- Manage sourcing for multiple, complex searches to find and engage key technical talents of all levels.

- Collaborate closely with the Recruiting team (Recruiters, Coordinators, other Sourcers) & hiring managers throughout the recruitment lifecycle to ensure business's needs and goals are fulfilled.

- Develop a holistic business understanding and manage stakeholder relationships including HR, hiring managers, and external partners.

- Own and drive innovative sourcing strategies, initiate new projects and/or optimise current processes to improve recruiting process and efficiency

- Conduct complex data analysis and share up-to-date, accurate, and value-adding market intelligence to business leaders to support business growth.

- Ensuring a great candidate experience and advocate TikTok as a great place to work for all candidates.

Minimum Qualifications

- 2+ years of equivalent sourcing experience in a high-volume environment (via search firm or in-house recruiting environment).

- Proven experience with research/sourcing tools (ie. Boolean, LinkedIn and other alternative sourcing techniques) to identify & engage passive candidates within the internet industry talent space.

- Strong analytical and problem solving skills with capability to analyze high amounts of data to support business strategies and decisions.

- Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport quickly with stakeholders and communicate effectively across all levels of the organization internally, as well as externally.

- Experience partnering with recruiters, hiring teams and external partners across different offices.

- Ability to contribute in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment and prioritize multiple functions and tasks.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

25,data,/en/job/principal-customer-research-insights-9358852,9358852,"Principal, Customer Research & Insights",False,False,,,SGD,AIA SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED,11 hours ago,False,,,201106386R,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"

AIA Group Limited and its subsidiaries (collectively “AIA” or the “Group”) comprise the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group. It has a presence in 18 markets – wholly-owned branches and subsidiaries in Mainland China, Hong Kong SAR(1), Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, Cambodia, Indonesia, Myanmar, New Zealand, the Philippines, South Korea, Sri Lanka, Taiwan (China), Vietnam, Brunei and Macau SAR(2), and a 49 per cent joint venture in India.

The business that is now AIA was first established in Shanghai more than a century ago in 1919. It is a market leader in Asia (ex-Japan) based on life insurance premiums and holds leading positions across the majority of its markets. It had total assets of US$330 billion as of 30 June 2021.

AIA meets the long-term savings and protection needs of individuals by offering a range of products and services including life insurance, accident and health insurance and savings plans. The Group also provides employee benefits, credit life and pension services to corporate clients. Through an extensive network of agents, partners and employees across Asia, AIA serves the holders of more than 39 million individual policies and over 16 million participating members of group insurance schemes.

AIA Group Limited is listed on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited under the stock code “1299” with American Depositary Receipts (Level 1) traded on the over-the-counter market (ticker symbol: “AAGIY”).

","

Bring your career aspirations to life with AIA!

We are looking for a passionate leader to work within and outside of the organisation to research, spot prospective trends and identify opportunities that contribute to the development and creation of stronger and more compelling customer propositions to better meet the needs of the customer.

Part of the Customer and Digital Division, this role leads the team to utilise customer and data driven insights to deliver compelling customer propositions, drive better business decisions and achieve our ambitions.

Role & Responsibilities:

  • Lead the team on customer research and intelligence initiatives; identify future consumer trends and use both qualitative and quantitative methodologies to deliver customer insights that help to solve challenges and propose new focuses and opportunities across a wide range of business topics including customer proposition, product development, customer satisfaction and digital solutions
  • Analyze and distil findings, translating insights into actionable information to drive more informed and better business decisions; craft and present the findings/recommendations to different group of stakeholders.
  • Develop research framework and introduce new research techniques

Key Requirements:

  • Minimum 10 years of working experience in Market Research, Business Intelligence or equivalent
  • Analytical with ability to synthesise data and information to logically structure and derive insights
  • Strong presentation skills, able to communicate complex ideas effectively both verbally and in writing
  • Future-thinking, independent, resourceful and adaptable team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Experience in life insurance, strategy and/or marketing and communications functions would be a plus

Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live healthier, longer, better lives.

You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

As a Business Analyst, you will participate in Digital Collaboration Platform implementation & rollout projects. Based on user requirements analysis you will prepare functional designs, system configuration, perform relevant testing and deployment of the designed business solution

************************************************************************

WHAT WILL BE YOUR RESPONSIBILITY

************************************************************************

  1. Implement Weaver’s Enterprise Digital Collaboration platform based on user requirements analysis
  2. Propose, program or configure, document, and test business solution according to the functional and technical requirements
  3. Build professional relationships with clients, management, and team members to ensure the delivery of proposed solutions. support for the development of business possibilities and for personal development
  4. Contribute to high productivity and motivation of working team with the use of communication skills and cooperation; reach and realize project aims and outputs
  5. Perform Project Management tasks and conduct interactive sessions (e.g. Requirement Gathering, Design Workshops, Product Training) with key project stakeholders throughout the implementation phases base on Weaver delivery standard.

************************************************************************

QUALIFICATIONS

************************************************************************

28,data,/en/job/analyst-customer-service-9379318,9379318,Analyst Customer Service,False,False,3000,4500,SGD,AIA SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED,11 hours ago,False,,,201106386R,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"

AIA Group Limited and its subsidiaries (collectively “AIA” or the “Group”) comprise the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group. It has a presence in 18 markets – wholly-owned branches and subsidiaries in Mainland China, Hong Kong SAR(1), Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, Cambodia, Indonesia, Myanmar, New Zealand, the Philippines, South Korea, Sri Lanka, Taiwan (China), Vietnam, Brunei and Macau SAR(2), and a 49 per cent joint venture in India.

The business that is now AIA was first established in Shanghai more than a century ago in 1919. It is a market leader in Asia (ex-Japan) based on life insurance premiums and holds leading positions across the majority of its markets. It had total assets of US$330 billion as of 30 June 2021.

AIA meets the long-term savings and protection needs of individuals by offering a range of products and services including life insurance, accident and health insurance and savings plans. The Group also provides employee benefits, credit life and pension services to corporate clients. Through an extensive network of agents, partners and employees across Asia, AIA serves the holders of more than 39 million individual policies and over 16 million participating members of group insurance schemes.

AIA Group Limited is listed on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited under the stock code “1299” with American Depositary Receipts (Level 1) traded on the over-the-counter market (ticker symbol: “AAGIY”).

","

Bring your career aspirations to life with AIA!

- Prime mover of improving customer experience in various stages (learn, buy, service, claim) of customer journey

- Collaborate with local business units and group office to develop strategic roadmaps

- Work closely with various stakeholders to identify gaps and implement improvement plans

- Collaborate with various departments in customer empathy task force to upskill and future proof staff of Life Ops

- Heighten customer satisfaction leading to improvement in overall CSAT and NPS score

  • Support annual customer relationship and Agent survey

  • Facilitate and conduct regular meetings with stakeholders to share survey results and actionable items
  • Feedback collation on both qualitative and quantitative feedback to ensure proactive action is taken to enhance positive experiences
  • Collaborate closely with touchpoint to ensure timely proactive recovery is taken by respective touchpoints
  • Identify area of improvement to streamline processes or initiative for quicker TAT to improve CSAT
  • Support training comms, development of materials and implementation
  • Any other ad-hoc duties assigned

Prerequisites:

  • University Degree preferably in banking and finance.
  • At least 3 years of experience in FI or insurance industry is preferred
  • Self-driven, resourceful and results oriented individual with proven track record
  • Strong interpersonal skills, energetic and enthusiastic individual who is able to engage with all levels of employees in the company
  • Good communication skills, strong writing skills and excellent presenter
  • Enjoys working in a dynamic and fast paced environment

29,data,/en/job/big-data-software-engineer-9319198,9319198,Big Data Software Engineer,False,False,6000,12000,SGD,Xiaomi Technologies Singapore Pte. Ltd.,11-Mar-22,False,,,202127014Z,,,,,,"

Xiaomi Corporation, registered in Asia as Xiaomi Inc., is a Chinese designer and manufacturer of consumer electronics and related software, home appliances, and household items. Behind Samsung, it is the second largest manufacturer of smartphones, all of which run the MIUI operating system, a fork of Android. In 2020, the company sold 146.3 million smartphones and, as of August 2021, its MIUI operating system had over 450 million monthly active users. It also is a major manufacturer of appliances including televisions, flashlights, unmanned aerial vehicles, and air purifiers using its Internet of Things and Xiaomi Smart Home product ecosystems. The name ""Xiaomi"" literally means millet and rice, and is based on the Buddhist concept of starting from the bottom before aiming for the top.

","

About The Company:

Xiaomi Corporation was founded in April 2010 and listed on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on July 9, 2018 (1810.HK). Xiaomi is a consumer electronics and smart manufacturing company with smartphones and smart hardware connected by an IoT platform at its core.

Embracing our vision of “Make friends with users and be the coolest company in the users’ hearts”, Xiaomi continuously pursues innovations, high-quality user experience and operational efficiency. The company relentlessly builds amazing products with honest prices to let everyone in the world enjoy a better life through innovative technology.

Xiaomi is one of the world's leading smartphone companies. The company’s market share in terms of smartphone shipments ranked no. 2 globally in the second quarter of 2021.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with product managers and data analysts to design data-related products.
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • Build the infrastructure and tools required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
  • Design and implement Data as a Service ( DaaS ) for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in developing intelligent agile operation.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.

Qualifications:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Science or related major.
  • Experienced working knowledge of big data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.
  • Familar with common SQL/NoSQL databases such as MySQL, Redis, etc.
  • Deep understanding of computer architectures, data structures and algorithms.
  • Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Java, etc.)
  • Have good communication and collaboration skills.
