Associate / Analyst, Big Data Analyst, Institutional Banking Group Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD32779)
Business FunctionGroup Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.Job RoleBig Data Analysts gather data from multiple sources and company data warehouses and analyze and interpret the data to extract such information that can be beneficial for businesses. They must be able to report their findings by preparing comprehensive reports or updates to management. These data findings helps all the stakeholders (both technical and non-technical) to understand it better. Once everyone can visualize the idea clearly, the entire IT and business team can brainstorm as to how to use the insights in improving business decisions, boosting revenues, influencing customer decisions, enhancing customer satisfaction, and much more.Responsibilities 
  • Involve in the technical design of Analytics and big data systems including ETL, data transformations, reporting and analytics services.

  • Examine and evaluate Analytics & big data requirements for various business units across the organization.

  • Applying architecture and engineering concepts to design solutions that adhere to organization standards and cater for re-usability, scalability, maintainability and security. 

  • Contributing to analytics strategy and architecture that will align investments with the highest impact areas, while producing a suite of complementary models, tools and capabilities.

  • Working with cross-functional teams to discover and develop actionable, high-impact data analytics requirements and opportunity statements in a variety of core business areas.

  • Assessing tool implementations and architectures in the Analytics & Big data space, reviewing for gaps against business needs and industry best practices.

  • Contributing to business process design and re-engineering impacted areas.

  • Providing oversight to analytics and data warehousing activities in the team to ensure alignment of priorities, coordination of inter-related projects and ensuring success stories are leveraged.

  • Effectively communicating analyses, recommendations, status, and results to both business & technology leads.

  • Define data sources and requirements, design and implement processes and models for complex, large-scale datasets used for predictive modelling, data mining, and research purposes.

  • Develop the abilities of data champions and analysts within the technology teams to mentor, build new capabilities, support/contribute to thought leadership and build out new skills in the creation of high quality models, analytics, and visuals.
Key Accountabilities
  • Must be able to drive deliveries

  • Keen eye for details for improvement
Requirements 
  • With experience in Analytics and big data architecture.

  • Proven ability in structured problem solving, process improvement, data-driven analysis and deriving actionable outcomes with large datasets. 

  • Advanced data analytics and modelling ability with high proficiency in developing applications in QlikView, Tableau and other business intelligence tools.

  • Interests in key technologies and concepts, e.g. Hadoop, Hive, Spark, SparkR, Mahout, SAS, Python/Java, Teradata are necessary

  • Excellent interpersonal, communications, public speaking and ability to articulate with strong presentation skills will be an advantage.

  • Experience in working in an Agile environment is an advantage

  • Good communication skill
Apply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Since 1975, PhillipCapital has grown as an integrated Asian financial house with a global presence that offers a full range of quality and innovative services to retail, corporate and institutional customers.

Our comprehensive suite of financial products and services includes fund management, managed accounts, unit trusts, insurance planning, regular savings, contracts for difference, exchange traded funds, investment research, equity financing, property; and broking in bonds, securities, futures, foreign exchange, precious metals and commodities. Institutions can also benefit from our corporate finance and advisory services as well as information technology solutions.

As part of the Contract for Difference (CFD) Market Making Team, you will be reporting to the Dealing Manager. You will be responsible for maintaining a comprehensive data resource library, and developing meaningful analyses to support the optimisation of CFD Marketing Making trading strategies. 

Responsibilities

  • Organise and maintain a comprehensive CFD Market Making database
  • Analyse data sets using statistical tools and develop insights from the data sets
  • Document analytical processes and data sets for predictive and prescriptive analysis
  • Develop reports and summary analyses in a dashboard
  • Automate fundamental data processing processes

Requirements

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or equivalent
  • Prior work experience of at least 1 year in data analysis is preferred
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, VBA, and Powerpoint
  • Knowledge in data analytical tools, statistical tools, and/ or mathematical models
  • Knowledge in IT programming (especially Python) is an advantage 
  • Fundamental knowledge in machine learning and financial engineering concepts
  • Certifications in CMFAS M1a, M5 & M6 and M6a is an advantage

column2:
The Learning Lab is the leading education centre for preschool, primary, secondary and junior college students in Singapore. We develop and run educational programmes in English, Mathematics and the Sciences. For the past 20 years, we have helped tens of thousands of students to achieve their personal bests at major national examinations and to develop essential life skills such as critical thinking and communication. We take great pride in designing learning approaches which go beyond helping students meet their exam needs to also help them build the key knowledge, skills and dispositions to find success in school and in life. The Learning Lab now operates in Singapore from eight facilities across the East, West, Northeast and Central regions at Marine Parade Central, Century Square, Tampines Mall, Rochester Mall, Jem, Choa Chu Kang Centre, Seletar Mall and United Square.","

The Learning Lab (TLL) is a leading organization in the private education sector. We recruit talented and dynamic people with a passion for nurturing the love of learning.

We are looking for an extraordinary Marketing Analytics Lead to drive our digital transformation journey to greater heights. Reporting to the Head of Marketing and Communications, you will have a highly visible role and will have a direct impact on the company’s direction.

Your mission is to ensure The Learning Lab’s marketing campaigns are powered by data. This means deep-diving into data to unlock customer insights and devise strategies to drive marketing effectiveness and deeper customer engagement. You must be inquisitive by nature, extremely detail-oriented, and thoroughly enjoy using data to validate hypotheses and justify business decisions.

This is an excellent opportunity for you to be part of a progressive leading educational brand that has consistently delivered inspiring learning experiences and outstanding learning outcomes for students. As part of its vision to become Asia’s leading after school K12 education group, The Learning Lab continuously strives to evolve and deliver the best-in-class customer experience for our parents and students.

Job responsibilities

  • Marketing Strategy.
  • Lead Adobe Analytics implementation across web and mobile as part of TLL’s digital transformation journey.
  • Exploit effective use of Adobe Analytics and the Adobe suite of products to track effectiveness of marketing campaigns to generate insights for process and channel improvements.
  • Analyse and transform raw data from site and CRM database into meaningful, actionable insights to drive strategic direction (e.g. forecasting of marketing budgets, identify new market opportunities, deepen customer engagement etc.) and tactical campaign execution (e.g. re-allocation of budgets across channels, campaign-level efficiency, conversion rates, re-engagement activities, etc.).
  • Assist in strategic planning for efficient allocation of marketing budget and resources.
  • Map customer data strategy based on our customer journey and review effectiveness of data collection and usage.
  • Data Analysis and Reporting.
  • Develop reporting structure for performance marketing channels.
  • Create automated KPI dashboards or visualisation for analysis and reporting to drive marketing insights.
  • Work cross-functionally with IT and Finance to define and integrate data sources and, or automate data collection for attribution and performance analysis.
  • Support marketing and communication team to set up campaigns with well-defined metrics for performance tracking.
  • Manage data collection processes and ensure quality tracking across all channels.

Snapshots of our ideal candidate

  • Possesses a recognised Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Business Analytics, Marketing Analytics or Statistics with at least 2 years of experience in digital marketing analytics.
  • Expert user of Adobe Analytics; experience in other digital analytics platform such as Google Analytics is a plus.
  • Strong understanding of performance marketing channels and experienced in optimising campaigns by relevant KPIs such as CTR, CPA, etc.
  • Expert user of MS Excel/Power Pivot and data visualisation tools such as Power BI/Tableau.
  • Proficiency in Adobe Experience Cloud is a strong advantage.
  • Excellent interpersonal communication, written, and presentation skills to articulate insights to non-technical audiences effectively.
  • Comfortable with working cross-functionally within the Marketing and Communications team, as well as with other business functions.
  • Creative and analytical individual with a positive mind-set and a strong desire to learn and collaborate.
  • Resourceful and highly independent, detail oriented with excellent time-management skills.

Expect the best for the best – an attractive remuneration package.

To find out more, please visit www.thelearninglab.com.sg. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted within 2 weeks.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.","
How Will You Make an Impact?
You will be focused on supporting the marketing operations for the Life Sciences Solutions business in APJ region. You will be involved in supplying data, analyzing data, tracking performance KPIs to maximize marketing team’s commercial impact. You will need to have a passion to work within a data-driven marketing organization and have a keen sense of how to use data to innovate and drive the marketing organization forward by facilitating and encouraging daily management via KPIs and data analytics insights.
What will you do?

How will you get here?
Education

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
  • Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint (preferred)

  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
  • Learning outcome (at least 3 points):
  • Gain hands on experience in extracting data, design & develop reports in excel or power bi for marketers
  • Learn important marketing metrics and how marketing drives commercial impact
  • Utilizing PPI tools and daily management to solve problem and develop a process improvement mindset

column2:
ComfortDelGro Corporation Limited (CDG) is one of the world’s largest land transport companies with a total fleet size of more than 40,000 buses, taxis and rental vehicles. Headquartered in Singapore, the CDG also has operations in China, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, Vietnam, and Malaysia. More information about CDG can be found at http://www.comfortdelgro.com","
About ComfortDelGro
We are one of the largest land transport companies in the world with a global workforce, a global shareholder base and a global outlook. We operate in seven countries and has a global fleet of about 40,000 vehicles.
ComfortDelGro’s businesses include bus, taxi, rail, car rental and leasing, automotive engineering services, inspection and testing services, driving centres, non-emergency patient transport services, insurance broking services and outdoor advertising.
Apart from being the market leader in Singapore, ComfortDelGro has a significant overseas presence. The Group’s operations currently extend from the United Kingdom and Ireland to Australia, Vietnam, Malaysia, New Zealand and across nine cities in China, including Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenyang and Chengdu.
About the Role
The Data Engineer works with the data team on systems to facilitate access to and finding information. He/She supports the planning, designing, developing, and testing internal information-delivery solutions and data models, focusing on providing a positive user experience. He works with end-users to specify requirements to create and implement designs meeting internal and client-facing objectives. In addition, he works with the data team on information management standards and practices in compliance with data privacy policies and ethics and governance frameworks.
The Data Engineer supports the design, implementation and maintenance of data flow channels and data processing systems that support the collection, storage, batch and real-time processing and analysis of information in a scalable, repeatable and secure manner. He/She focuses on defining optimal data collection, processing, and warehousing solutions. He designs, codes and tests data systems and implements those into the internal infrastructure. In addition, he focuses on collecting, parsing, managing, analysing and visualising large sets of data to turn information into insights accessible through multiple platforms.
He/She is proficient in database systems, scripting and programming languages the organisation requires. He is also familiar with the relevant software platforms the solution runs on.
The Data Engineer is passionate about numbers and works with large data sets. In addition, he has a keenness for understanding business processes and resolving challenges to provide solutions with the help of clean and interlinked databases and architectures.
Job Responsibilities:(1) Identify Business Needs
  • Determine data engineering requirements across all systems, platforms and applications based on artificial intelligence solution
  • Advise the business on data requirements based on information and insights desired
  • Establish and implement data ethics, privacy and security guidelines and policies for potential new business cases that involve data engineering processes
  • Advise on latest machine learning libraries, strategies, and products in database and data processing software based on business requirements
  • Identify suitable data structures based on business needs to ensure availability and accessibility of data
  • Determine technical system requirements based on data needs
(2) Design Data Architecture
  • Define the desired state of information flows through the organisation to determine the organisation's data architecture
  • Assess existing systems to evaluate their usability, usefulness, visual design and content
  • Guide the alignment of information management standards with the enterprise architectural plan and information security standards
  • Develop strategies for seamless and low-risk migration of data between systems
  • Communicate the data architecture, design and recommendations to stakeholders
(3) Build and maintain data pipeline
  • Assist in building scalable data pipelines to extract, transform, load and integrate data
  • Develop codes and scripts to process structured and unstructured data in real-time from a variety of data sources
  • Test data pipelines for scalability and reliability to process high data volume, variety and velocity
  • Consolidate and create data storage solutions for storage and retrieval of information
  • Develop prototypes and Proofs-of-Concept for data solutions
  • Monitor data system performance
  • Support the handling and logging of errors
  • Develop backup data archiving systems to ensure system continuity
  • Implement and monitor data security and privacy measures on existing data solutions
(4) Optimise solution performance
  • Assist in the integration of data systems with existing infrastructure
  • Develop tools to improve data flows among internal, external systems and the data warehouse
  • Automate the data collection and analysis processes, data releasing and reporting tools
  • Test data system configurations to increase efficiency
Requirements:
  • Possess 3-5 years of experience in Data Engineering (e.g. data modelling, data pipeline, data architecture, ELT/ETL)
  • Extensive experience in SQL, Python or other scripting languages. Comfortable in deploying scripts and familiar with data management / ETL tools, such as Data Catalog, Azure Data Factory, DataBrick and Synapse
  • Experience with Cloud technologies (Azure), such as Data Lake, Azure SQL, is a plus
  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores
  • Experience with other aspects of data management such as data governance, security, metadata management, archival, data lifecycle management
  • Good at analytical thinking, have good communication skills and problem-solving skills
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
  • Good interpersonal skills and good team player
  • Highly organised, self-motivated, pro-active, flexible and able to plan
  • Attention to details, a self-starter and self-learner continuously keeping up to date with industry developments
  • Creative problem solver and ability to think out of the box
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Founded in Year 1996 in the Republic of Singapore, Frontken is the industry leader in surface metamorphosis solutions comprising a premier group of companies possessing unique combination of surface and mechanical engineering capabilities for servicing and manufacturing of mission critical equipment and its components from Start-to-Finish.

Frontken - publicly listed on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia, has presence today in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Taiwan, China and recently in Indonesia; with a combined workforce of about 1,000 employees, 15 engineering plants and 4 sales offices which are certified with, amongst others, ISO 9001:2008, AS9100:2004, NADCAP, API SpecQ1, API ISO/TS29001 and ISO 14001:2004.

Backed by solid infrastructures, capabilities, technologies and know-how, we have been serving a very wide spectrum of industries ranging from Oil & Gas, Refineries, Marine & Offshore, Power Generation to Semiconductors/Hard-disk Manufacturing, Aerospace, Renewable Energy and many more. Our established track record as Authorized Service Centres, Authorized Service Partner and Technology Transfer Partner of global OEMs is one clear testimony of our market position.

As a Total Integrated Engineering Solutions provider, Frontken has a long history of developing customized cost-effective solutions to undertake and overcome wide plethora of tough industry-specific engineering challenges; minimizing the need for clients to micro-manage their outsourcing and translating convenience into high quality jobs, faster lead-time, shorter downtime and cost-savings.

Frontken’s recovery, maintenance, upgrade and re-engineering expertise also ensure consistency in client’s product quality/operations and even allow frequent joint-researches to explore cutting-edge innovation in overcoming emerging engineering challenges faced by many industries. Complementing the above strengths is our expansive unwavering presence in the Asia Pacific region, making Frontken the compelling choice for discerning operations/maintenance stakeholders.

The Data Management and Analytics Research Lab at the School of Computer Science & Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (DAML) seeks applications for the position of Research Assistant. The Research Assistant will work on a funded data science grant, and will work closely with the Principal Investigator at DAML to support the University's research on entity resolution and data cleaning.

The project seeks to use data analytics to extract and clean bibliographic data sources and address the challenging name disambiguation problem of authors.

The Research Assistant will be responsible for research and development of techniques for addressing name disambiguation problem in bibliographic data sources. Through taking part in this project, the Research Assistant will have the opportunity contribute positively to research at the intersection of entity resolution and data science, which has important implications in real-world bibliographic data sources such as DBLP, Scopus.

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Research in name disambiguation problem

  • Implement novel techniques for data integration, data cleaning, and name disambiguation using Python

  • Assists with the editing and preparation of manuscripts, reports and presentations

  • Engage in discussions with PI and collaborators

  • Perform other tasks as required by the Principal Investigators

Job Requirements: 

  • Bachelors in Computer Science-related areas with a focus in Data analytics

  • Solid programming and application development skills with experience in Python

  • Ability to read and understand methodologies in research papers

  • Fluent in English and good team-player

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2:
Avensys is a leader in providing technology enabled business solutions and services. Since inception, Avensys has helped clients use IT more efficiently to improve their operations and profitability, focus on core competencies and achieve business results such as increased agility, innovation and profitable growth. Our in-depth technical knowledge coupled with industry experience and our unique methodologies enable us to successfully deliver and meet our customer’s expectations.","
  • Job Description
    Avensys is a reputed global IT professional services company headquartered in Singapore. Our service spectrum includes enterprise solution consulting, business intelligence, business process automation and managed services. Given our decade of success, we have evolved to become one of the top trusted providers in Singapore and service a client base across banking and financial services, insurance, information technology, healthcare, retail and supply chain.
    We are currently looking to hire Network Data Analyst who has proven track record in IT Industry. This is an exciting opportunity to expand your skill set, achieve job satisfaction and work-life balance. More details as below.
    Network Data Analyst
    Responsibilities:
    • Comprehend eco-system data across business systems to run queries and validation reports
    • Perform analysis on Network Data
    • Perform Network audits to maintain the reliability of the Data
    • Utilize statistical methods and sampling procedures to identify audit findings with an appropriate confidence level and desired precision
    • Review and communicate audit results/ risks by preparing a final report; discuss findings with the analyst
    • Partner closely with cross functional Network Teams to ensure on-time delivery of data relevant to the roadmap
    • Collaborate with data analyst in reviewing network audit discrepancies

column2: About Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: A*STAR is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
The Advanced Remanufacturing and Technology Centre (ARTC) is a research institute under A*STAR’s Science and Engineering Research Council, partnering with Nanyang Technological University to build an advanced manufacturing and remanufacturing ecosystem to accelerate the transfer of innovation from applied research to industrial applications. As a collaborative platform which brings together industry players, public sector research institutes and academia, the ARTC has a membership consortium with over 80 members, ranging from global multinational corporations (MNCs) to small and medium enterprises (SMEs).","Advanced Remanufacturing and Technology Center (ARTC)'s Virtual Manufacturing Group(VMG) is searching for Development Scientist who will lead and support projects on end-to-end software and system integration solutions for both manufacturing and supply chain sectors.
Responsibilities:
-Design and develop data fabric architectural framework of manufacturing and supply chain framework by integrating operational research solutions, heterogeneous enterprise systems and bespoke solutions, to increase resiliency and flexibility of manufacturing and supply chains operations.
-Understand data design requirements and implement the state-of-art data integration techniques for industrial data management systems such as ERP, MES, PLM, SCM, WMS, etc.
-Build knowledge graph with big data analytics and machine learning capabilities for enabling fast decision-making scenario in multi-echelon supply chain network.
-Deploy blockchain and smart contract solutions as well as privacypreserving data sharing for establishing transparent, tamper-proof, traceable supply chain ecosystem.
-Evangelize the Singapore public-private ecosystem on ARTC's virtual and physical testbeds for smart manufacturing and supply chain domains.
Job requirements
-PhD in Computer Science, Electronics, Electrical or Network engineering.
-At least one first author publication among areas of machine learning, database, and network security in top, high-impact conference.
-Writing high-quality code in JavaScript, Python, or any other programming languages as required.
-Strong foundation in computer science would be great to have, with strong competencies in SQL/ No SQL/ cloud databases
-Strong modelling, analytical and problem-solving skills.
-Knowledge of Industrial IoT and its standard/ protocol including OPCUA, MQTT is welcomed.
-Knowledge of designing APIs and microservices.
-Prior experience with platforms such as Azure DevOps is desirable
-Team player and good in interpersonal and communication (verbal & written) skills.",[],Entry Level,,,Doctorate (PhD),,"Full-Time, Contract",,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://careers.a-star.edu.sg//online.aspx?ID=0,70100,Singapore,sg

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

We’re more than just another investment app. With over 50 years of combined experience in the finance and tech industries, our founders came together and built a team, now more than 200 employees strong, to make curated, cost-efficient investments possible across the region.","REQUIREMENTS

Must-Haves:

  • Strong academic credentials, preferably with a degree or equivalent qualification in Statistics, Business Analytics, or Data Science
  • 5-7 years experience in the analytics space
  • Has people management experience, and enjoys working with people and influencing them to be more data driven
  • Proficient in analysis and data wrangling skills
  • Expert level in any of the following languages/frameworks: SQL, R, Python, SAS, SPSS
  • Strong knowledge of statistical concepts, e.g. clustering, regression and hypothesis testing
  • Great communicator of data insights and complex ideas to stakeholders of all levels
  • Good commercial acumen with a bias for action and output

​Benefits

Employee financial and physical well-being

  • Compensation package: you will receive a competitive total compensation package with Employee Stock Options (if you are a full-time employee).
  • Personalized insurance coverage: reimbursement of your personal hospitalization and surgical insurance premium as well as panel outpatient GP, specialist, and dental claims.
  • Expatriate Pension Fund (ExPF): this employer-matching plan is made available via Stash Away Work Place if you are a full-time expatriate based in Singapore.
  • Management fee discount: you will receive discounts on asset management fees when you invest with us.

Flexible work arrangements and policies

  • Work-from-home policy: you may choose to work from home or the office depending on what works best for you and your team.
  • Work-from-anywhere policy: you can request to work remotely for up to eight weeks in another country.
  • Unlimited paid annual leave: it should be simple for you to decide if you would like to take more or fewer days off. We trust that you are accountable for your work and know best if you need 10 or 30 days of paid annual leave that year.
  • Personal work equipment budget: to help you set up your optimal workstation wherever you are.

Learning and development opportunities

  • Annual L&D budget: you will be given SGD 1,000 with the aim to encourage and reinforce a culture of continuous learning for professional and personal development.

Team bonding budget and initiatives

  • Quarterly team bonding budget per tax (depending on COVID restrictions)
  • Bi-annual off-sites (once in Apr and Oct): a full day of company-wide team bonding activities and challenges.

99,data,/en/job/assistant-manager-manager-population-health-finance-policy-data-analytics-9353535,9353535,"Assistant Manager/ Manager, Population Health Finance Policy (Data Analytics)",False,False,,,SGD,SingHealth Community Hospitals,22-Mar-22,False,,26 days,53351398K,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"
SingHealth Community Hospitals (SCH) oversees the management of the three Community Hospitals under the SingHealth cluster - Bright Vision Hospital, and the new Sengkang Community Hospital and Outram Community Hospital coming up in 2018 and 2020 respectively.

SCH aims to deliver a seamless and integrated care path for patients requiring sub-acute, rehabilitation and palliative care. The focus is to bring value-driven outcomes for patients and set new standards of care for community hospitals. SCH is supported by the medical expertise and research capabilities of the SingHealth-Duke NUS Academic Medical Centre.
","

You will report to the Assistant Director of Population Health Finance Policy section to assist with Bundled Payments, OneRehab and Population Health Financing, which are new MOH subvention/ funding frameworks at the cluster level. You will partner with various stakeholders and cross functional teams in the course of your work, especially the Finance offices within the cluster. 

For Bundled payments, you will assist the Assistant Director to ensure fair distribution of funding to all affected institutions within the cluster on a sound allocation basis. You will carry out analysis of Bundled episodes by leveraging on data from MOH as well as the cluster data warehouse to simulate financial sustainability, and highlight actionable insights for improvement and change. In addition, you are also expected to work with the relevant stakeholders to develop a framework to incentivize institutions towards fulfilling bundled payment outcomes. This entails involve regular monitoring of Bundled Care KPIs and reporting of anomaly performance on a quarterly basis, through performance dashboards at various forums. You are expected to assist Assistant Director as a key financial resource to provide value-added support to the clinical and operational partners in the bundled payments framework. You will also design and build financial models and simulations to support the decision making for Bundled Payments work.

You will also assist Assistant Director to develop financial policies to support Population Health projects that are closely aligned with Bundled Payments implementation and OneRehab. As part of the bundled payments implementation, you would also support the Institution Finance teams on the Costing Systemization (Cosy) project, so that you can understand how cost data are derived and eventually use the data to verify the norm costs for various types of bundles. You will also make use of the Cosy data for financial simulations, so as to optimize bundled payments funding. For OneRehab, you will look into the harmonised MT subsidy tiers and pricing structure to address any pricing gradient issues, track the Rehab costs and quantify the likely financial implications brought about by the changes under OneRehab. 

In addition, you will also assist Assistant Director to design and build financial models and simulations for patient population served by the cluster for Population Health Financing. You will also look into financial incentives that will inculcate patient’s personal stewardship towards preventive care and healthy living, as well as encourage patient “stickiness” and right-siting of care within the cluster to optimise the use of healthcare resources, in order to meet the long-term objectives and vision of Population Health led by MOH. 

You will look into innovative ways of streamlining data-mining processes and leverage data technologies that can better support the analytical demands of Population Health and Bundled Payments.

You will assist in ad-hoc projects as and when assigned.

Job Requirements

  •  Degree in Engineering with MBA or Degree in Business / Accounting with cross-disciplinary knowledge/ experience in Data Transformation and Analytics
  • For Assistant Manager position, at least 6 years of relevant working experience in Finance / Business Analytics or Data Analytics field
  • For Manager position, at least 8 years of relevant working experience in Finance / Business Analytics or Data Analytics field, preferably with at least 2 years of managerial / supervisory experience.
  • Prior experience in Management Accounting, Reporting, Costing, Financial Modelling and Multivariate Analysis
  • Prior working experience in a healthcare setting preferred
  • Able to work in a dynamic and fast paced environment
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), SAP, Data visualization applications such as Tableau, Power BI, Power-pivot DAX, SQL, SPSS and Programming languages such as R and Python
  • Passion and deep interest in working with rich Big Data sets and using BI techniques to data-mine and discover new actionable insights
  • Resourceful and think Out of the Box.
  • Goal getter with a Can-do attitude and willingness to take up challenges.

Responsibilities:
  • The Data Analyst purpose is to ‘turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.'
  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques
  • Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Undertaking data collection, pre-processing (structured and unstructured data), data-filtering, data-cleansing and analysis
  • Analyze large amounts of raw information to discover trends and find patterns
  • Work with business stakeholders to prioritize business decision and information needs using Analytics
  • Building models to address business problems using predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
  • Presenting information using data visualization techniques
  • Collaborate with business teams to use data to identify and resolve issues causing operational inefficiency and ineffectiveness
  • Use data to locate and define new business process improvement opportunities

  • Minimum Degree in Mathematics, Information Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics or other relevant streams
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant working experience
  • Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++
  • Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI) and data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets
  • Knowledge of using Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence tools on AWS, Azure or Google would be beneficial
  • Good interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
  • Good analytical, problem solving and solution building skills
  • Analytical mind and business acumen
  • Strong mathematical skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)
  • Strong aptitude to learn and become adept in new programming languages

103,data,/en/job/data-quality-analyst-9393194,9393194,Data Quality Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,Media Partners Asia,20-Mar-22,False,,,201133928N,,,1 - 50 Employees,,Raffles Place,"
Founded in 2001, Media Partners Asia (MPA) is the leading independent provider of advisory, consulting and research services, focusing on media, telecommunications and entertainment industries in Asia Pacific. To learn more about MPA and its capabilities, visit www.media-partners-asia.com
","

Established in 2001, Media Partners Asia (MPA) is the leading independent provider of research, advisory and consulting services across digital media and telecoms industries in Asia Pacific. 

Our offering includes AMPD, a fast growing research platform incubated in 2019 with an IMDA trust certificate. AMPD Research uses passive measurement to provide actual customer behaviour data and insights across the rapidly growing digital ecosystem. AMPD is focused primarily on the rapidly growing digital streaming video landscape as well as connectivity and telecoms. The AMPD Vision Analytics platform operates in 14 markets and its sector focus will expand in the future to deep dive insights on Advertising, Gaming and Streaming Audio / Music. 

Reporting to the Data Operations Director, we need an data quality analyst with entry to intermediate experience to help us maintain our industry content library databases and related services.

In return we are offering competitive salary in an innovative start-up business offering challenging projects and formal training.

If you are passionate about data quality with a genuine interest in the TV and Movies business please read the following :

  • Monitor, maintain, revise and improve our entertainment industry library databases in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Provide quality control reporting and reconciliation and feedback to a small team of data collection and entry staff.
  • Manage, examine amend where necessary, and improve data delivered by 3rd party data supply vendors.
  • Respond to client feedback on data quality issues while developing solution that mitigate data anomalies.

Responsibilities

  • Raising data quality and performance levels in our AMPD Research division.
  • Providing a high level of data quality awareness across multiple stakeholder including management, support staff, front-line staff and clients.
  • Proactively improving the quality of company reporting.
  • Evaluating and identifying where system enhancements are required.

Desired Personal skills

  • Extremely meticulous approach to work
  • Outstanding attention to detail
  • Proven ability to meet established deadlines
  • Talent for quickly learning new tasks
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Good multi-tasking skills
  • A strong drive for results
  • Good influencing skills
  • Extensive latitude for independent judgment
  • Strong character, Team Player, Flexibility
  • Ability to function in a high volume setting with tight deadlines
  • Good command of written/communications background in English and Chinese.

Technical and Data Quality Skills

  • Advanced Excel skills, including formulas.
  • Data matching and profiling.
  • Data discovery.
  • Root cause analysis.

Qualifications and Experience

  • Between 1 and 3 years’ experience in a data quality and data entry focused role
  • Educated to degree level is preferred, but the right candidate is more important than formal qualifications as training will be provided

Candidates will be looked upon favourably if they have the following interests and experience:

  • A passion for TV and Movies.
  • Experience writing programming code in Python or any other language.
  • Experience in data processing and dashboard creation.
  • Knowledge of another Asian language is a plus
  • Experience working for an Entertainment or Market Research company.

column3: <div>

column4: About YCH Group

column3: <div>

column4: Founded in 1955, YCH Group is Asia Pacific’s leading integrated end-to-end supply chain management and logistics partner to some of the world’s largest companies across Asia Pacific. Our suite of end-to-end award winning supply chain management solution delivers powerful competitive advantages that are best in class across industry clusters from consumers and electronics to chemical and health care as well as e-commerce.

column3: <div>

column4: Headquartered in Singapore, YCH Group has a presence in 12 countries across Asia Pacific with an entrenched network strategically located in more than 100 locations in Greater China, India, and ASEAN countries such as Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam as well as Australia and Korea.

column3: <div>

column4: Talent management is one of YCH’s five strategic pillars. YCH is continuously promoting values that focus on growth, performance and community, and strive to be a high-performance and people-focused organisation.

column1:
","

DESCRIPTION OF PRIMARY FUNCTION

1.
column2:
The primary function of the Senior Manager – Data Analyst is a Digital Transformation role which involves firstly creating and maintaining data warehouse consisting of the entire billing data of the YCH Group in Singapore and across the region in addition to all the financial data from the Oracle Systems

2.
column3:
This function enables digital transformation of the billing process to harness the wealth of the billable operational data for:

•
column4:
Billing operational efficiency, 

•
column5:
Business analysis on operational activities review and profitability analysis, 

•
column7:
Benchmarking purposes to secure prospective new accounts

•
column8:
Assessment of billing accuracy against customers’ contracts  

3.
column9:
The setting up of the data warehouse involves extracting the right fields from the Logistics Operating systems (WX3, TX3 etc) and reconciling such data to what is posted in the Billing module of the Oracle financial systems.

4.
column10:
Upon setting up the data warehouse with the appropriate data structure and achieving a single version of truth, this function would further 

•
column11:
Develop and implement Business Intelligence solutions to facilitate the use of information for the entire operation of YCH Group in Singapore and the region.

•
column12:
Create informative Dashboard through BI visualization features to enhance the use of data.

5.
column13:
Deploy RPA tools for process improvement and to facilitate integration of data.

6.
column14:
In short, the Senior Manager – Data Analyst has to be familiar with data administrator work but more importantly possess the understanding of how the business is being carried out resulting in the eventual billing of the customers. The understanding of the business activities will enable the person to better organize and group the data which can then be transformed into a structure database residing in data warehouse. With the in-depth knowledge of the business and its processes coupled with the technical knowledge of managing and administering the data, Business Intelligence solutions can then be deployed for business analysis to drive the top line and improve the bottom line. 

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

1.
column15:
Oversee data analytics, oracle system support and billing support system

2.
column16:
Oversee and put in place transformation initiatives for digital workspace automation including but not limited to procurement process, RFQ and onboarding process.

3.
column17:
Focusing on Data warehouse, big data implementations project in Logistics and Supply Chain Industry, Financial Services industry and Global Markets;

4.
column18:
Developing and maintaining our centralized, automated, visual and interactive reporting solutions, in line with the strategy and solution outlined by the Management;

5.
column19:
Be the contact point for assessing requirements, design the solution and perform data mapping, analysis & reconciliations;

6.
column20:
Providing continuous process improvement and facilitate integration of data by deploying RPA tools;

7.
column21:
Providing maintenance and development of the centralized reporting systems and internal databases;

8.
column22:
Developing and implementing Business Intelligence solutions to that ‘raise the bar' in terms of data analysis, analytical insight and user experience;

9.
column23:
Provide efficient delivery of key financial data/information to the management and other function teams;

10.
column24:
Creating informative Dashboard to enhance the use of data;

11.
column25:
Supporting smooth and steady migration of routine labor-intensive reporting to centralized/automated solution;

12.
column26:
Supporting the development pipeline and aggressively progress the teams' adoption of centralized reporting solutions.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

•
column27:
Degree in a Finance or Data related discipline (Economics, Statistics or Computing Science, etc);

•
column28:
Possess Technical expertise regarding data models, UI/UX, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques;

•
column29:
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc), data systems, SQL databases, programming (XML, Javascript or ETL frameworks);

•
column30:
Knowledge of BI tools in the Market (eg. Power BI, Tableau, Cognos, etc);

•
column31:
Ability to work autonomously but with a good awareness of overall team objectives

•
column32:
Strong analytical skills with the ability to make analytical recommendations and provide business insights to the management;

•
column33:
Demonstrate a strong passion for accuracy with high levels of attention to details;

•
column34:
At least 5-7 years of related experience in business intelligence, business data analysis, comparable experience in other data-drive environment.

column3: Society currently faces a number of daunting challenges. The world’s population is growing rapidly, more and more megacities are forming and demand for energy continues to spiral across the globe. In addition, the rising need for climate protection calls for new approaches to energy consumption in many areas of everyday life.

Infineon Technologies AG offers semiconductor and system solutions addressing three central challenges to modern society: energy efficiency, mobility, and security. In the 2014 fiscal year (ending September 30), the company reported revenues of 4.32 billion euros with approximately 29,800 employees worldwide. In January 2015, Infineon acquired US-based International Rectifier Corporation, a leading provider of power management technology, with revenues of USD 1.1 billion (fiscal year 2014 ending June 29) and approximately 4,200 employees.

column1:
","
Part of your life. Part of tomorrow.
We make life easier, safer and greener - with technology that achieves more, consumes less and is accessible to everyone. Microelectronics from Infineon is the key to a better future. Efficient use of energy, environmentally-friendly mobility and security in a connected world - we solve some of the most critical challenges that our society faces while taking a conscientious approach to the use of natural resources.

In accordance with the requirements set by the Singaporean Government, Infineon Technologies Asia Pacific Pte Ltd (""Infineon"") can only allow individuals who are (a) fully vaccinated, (b) certified to be medically ineligible for a vaccine or (c) have recovered from COVID-19 within a prescribed period, onto company premises. Therefore, Infineon requires all new employees, as well as contractors and business partners, to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. ""Fully vaccinated"" means individuals have completed the full regime of an approved COVID-19 Vaccine as listed under the World Health Organization (WHO) Emergency Use Listing (EUL) including the respective post-vaccination period to ensure the vaccine has become full effective. Anyone who is unable to be vaccinated due to an approved and/or recognised exemption condition may apply for special consideration.
In your new role you will:
  • Set up master data in Infineon's logistics systems for use in production, business units and order processing
  • Be the process owner for master data processes
  • Provide consultation to business unit users for new supply chain and business requirements
  • Support team ramp-up, provide product support and prepare product master data
  • Execute data management maintenance, error correction and archive obsolete data
  • Collaborate with IT department to implement work processes in optimizing work efficiency
You are best equipped for this task if you have:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration / Economics, Electronic / Electrical Engineering with 1-3 year experience of supply chain processes / manufacturing execution system (MES) / data management in Semiconductor industries
  • Strong analytical skill, in terms of data, system and process management
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to be the ideal team player in a multinational environment
  • Work independently and possess a structured, hands-on approach towards work
  • Experience in project management
  • Entry level candidates with relevant internship experience and able to commit to a 12-month contract period are welcome to apply

<div>
<div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div>
The Institution:

DigiPen Institute of Technology Singapore is a specialized university for the digital economy, with a focus on computer science, embedded systems engineering, UX/UI design, and digital art and animation.

Beginning in 1998, DigiPen Institute of Technology became the first school in the world to offer a four-year degree with a primary emphasis on preparing students for the complex challenges of creating real-time 3D graphics for games and animations. Today, our academic programs continue to provide a solid educational pathway for students looking to enter — and advance — the digital entertainment and technology industries as skilled engineers, artists, designers, and more.

In 2008, at the invitation of the Singapore Economic Development Board, DigiPen (Singapore) opened as the U.S.-headquartered college’s first international campus, which today offers five bachelor’s degree programs, a graduate degree program, as well as continuing education courses for Singaporeans looking to change or advance their careers. DigiPen (Singapore) graduates have gone on to work in a variety of sectors — including enterprise software, virtual reality, finance, digital entertainment, and automotive technology — of Singapore’s growing digital economy.
The Programs:
At DigiPen (Singapore), students will experience a comprehensive and renowned education designed to prepare them for exciting job opportunities within the global digital economy.
- Bachelor of Science in Computer Science in Real-Time Interactive Simulation
- Bachelor of Science in Computer Science in Interactive Media and Game Development
- Bachelor of Engineering in Systems Engineering (ElectroMechanical Systems)
- Bachelor of Arts in User Experience and Game Design
- Bachelor of Fine Arts in Digital Art and Animation
- Master of Science in Computer Vision
- Continuing Education Attach-and-Train (AnT) Programs
- Continuing Education Technology in Finance Immersion Programme (TFIP)
Other Information
Connect with us at www.digipen.edu.sg

","

Lecturer, Data Analytics & Data Engineering

Department of Continuing Education

Campus: DigiPen (Singapore)

Description:

Full-time Lecturer (Data Analytics & Data Engineering) in Department of Continuing Education, DigiPen Institute of Technology Singapore. We expect to make an appointment at the Lecturer level or higher, commensurate with the candidates’ academic credentials and prior experience. Teaching experience is preferred but not required.

Educational and Experience Requirements:

·Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Computer Science or a closely related field.

· At least 5 years of industry/research experience in the field of study or a closely related area.

· Strong background in the theoretical and applied aspects of Data Analytics & Data Engineering

·Strong expertise in one or more of the following languages: Python, R Java, C/C++, SQL. Python will be preferred.

· Good knowledge and experience with visualisation tools such as Apache Superset, Tableau, Power BI

· Good knowledge of CRISP-DM, SEMMA, data mining and warehousing.

· Solid understanding of Big data technologies like HDFS, Hive, Spark, Yarn, Kafka, etc

· Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g. MariaDB, Oracle / MongoDB, Cassandra)

·  Familiar with linear algebra, vector calculus, probability & statistics, information theory

· Familiar with data pre-processing techniques, machine learning algorithms.

Responsibilities:

The key responsibilities include the teaching of courses, curriculum & content development, workflow automation and R&D. Depending on candidate’s background, candidate may be requested to participate in courses to further expand or improve their technical knowledge to perform duties expected of the role. Other responsibilities may include institutional service, academic administration and appropriate scholarly activity.

Starting Date: Immediate

Salary: Salary is competitive and commensurate with experience and education.

108,data,/en/job/data-entry-cum-admin-clerk-6-months-contract-9357060,9357060,Data Entry cum Admin Clerk (6 months contract),False,False,,,SGD,Frontier Healthcare Holdings Pte Ltd,22-Mar-22,False,,29 days,200208335M,,,51 - 200 Employees,,Eunos / Ubi,"

Frontier Healthcare Group was formed in year 2002 through the merger of 3 general practice clinics. Currently, we are operating 11 general practice clinics and one primary care medical centre. These clinics are staffed by a core team of Family Physicians and General Practitioners. We recognise that it is important for our doctors to be trained and certified in postgraduate family medicine to deliver high standards of care to our community. In addition, our clinic assistants are required to undergo continuing training to maintain the Group’s minimum standards in delivery of healthcare services. In this way, we strive to build a quality healthcare team.

Our doctors are actively involved in undergraduate and postgraduate Family Medicine teaching, working closely with the Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine in the National University of Singapore, the Family Medicine Department in the National University Health System (NUHS) and the College of Family Physicians Singapore.

In 2012, our Group in collaboration with the Agency for Integrated Care, pioneered and operationalised the Primary Care Network (PCN) in Singapore. The PCN model has evolved from the pilot phase then to the current MOH-endorsed national framework. The Frontier Primary Care Network comprises a network of GP clinics formed from Frontier’s clinics and independent small GP clinics in the community. The PCN model aims to support private GPs to deliver quality team-based care in chronic disease management.

Being a member of Hong Kong Broadband Network Group, JOS has been established in the industry for more than 50 years and today our clients include the best-known MNCs in diverse industries such as FSI, Healthcare, Trade & Commerce, Manufacturing, Telecom, Education, Government and Commercial.","

Responsible for ensuring the availability and reliability of the Data Centre (DC) to meet the company’s operational requirements.

Support in all DC modification projects by providing DC design inputs and leading the activities on site.

Provision of new servers and network equipment, following documented standards and processes.

Prepare and build physical and virtual servers according to the company’s global engineering standards and user requirements.

Design, perform and coordinate physical on-site installation of hardware in racks, including PDUs, network equipment, servers and storage devices, cable management, etc.

Supervise, coordinate, and manage the timeline, delivery, installation, maintenance, decommission, and disposal of all hardware equipment required in the DC.

Coordinate with multiple technical parties including application development, database, systems, network, infrastructure, and security administrators.

Coordinate with DC partners to understand and ensure facilities like cooling, fire suppression, UPS system, etc. are working properly and in accordance with the requirements.

Administer and coordinate tasks for Change Management process, Incident Management process, physical access control process, and request management.

Document and update equipment inventory management system and rack elevations.

Assist in updating standards for DC-related procedures.

Prepare and submit DC capacity and all DC-related reports to DC Manager.

Manage backup tape requests and maintain accurate inventory records.

1-2 monthly activities – escorting, cabling, onsite coordinator.

Installation of racks usually done in weekend or after office hour.

Skills Requirements

Data Centre admin skills

Network & server hardware knowledge

Structured cabling & cables knowledge

Asset management

Tape backup management

ITIL for ServiceNow

Advanced knowledge in Excel

Preferably with HPE server hardware knowledge

Dress code : Smart Causal ( ie. Polo Tee & Jeans / pants)

We pride ourselves on being open, positive, and flexible in this energetic family. Most Welcome high talents join us.","

Mission Statement

Gather, analyze and formalize operation team’s data analysis, prepare monthly and quarter report and process; Manage to prepare training material and deliver training to internal and external.

Responsibilities

  1.  Communicate with operation managers, customer supports, business owners and stakeholders to gather operation data on monthly basis
  2.  Data analysis, data-base creation and management, for easy trace of all operation data and report generation.
  3. Actively coordinate within team, cross-function team within company and 3rd party suppliers for data preparation.
  4. Familiar with operation procedure and identify and implement process improvements
  5. Plan and scheduling the training for members within the department.
  6. Draft and keep training materials up-to-date.
  7. Support the maintaining and updating of product information on website.
  8. Keeping records of customer interactions, comments and complaints.
  9. Ad-hoc task as assigned by supervisor.

Requirement

  1. Good excel, powerpoint or other software, Power BI and data analysis skills so as to help out in group report and presentation slides is a must; Python SQL, ML Tableau is a prefer.
  2. Clear mind and good writing and present skills so as to create data base and display the data in a neat and tidy way, also provide suggestions based on the data analysis result
  3. Take initiative, work independently, enjoy working in a challenging environment and make a difference. 
  4.  Degree in data analyst/Banking/Finance/Accounting or equivalent qualifications. 
  5. Minimum 3 years of relevant work in data analysis. Relevant experience from the financial, forex or fintech industry will be an advantage. 
  6.  Strong self-discipline with initiative and learning spirit with positive attitude, team work and responsibility, self-learning and problem solving. 
  7. Bilingual languages in English and Mandarin in order to communicate with global colleagues.

column2: We are a well-established Group of Companies listed on the Main Board of the Singapore Exchange.

column1: <div>

column2: Singapore Land Group Limited (“SLGL” or the “Company”, and together with its group of companies, the “Group”) is a leading real estate company listed since 1971. SLGL is formerly known as United Industrial Corporation Limited.

column1: <div>

column2: SLGL’s diversified portfolio comprises commercial investment properties, residential development properties, hotels and IT services. Our core activities are in property development and investment.

column1: <div>

column2:
SLGL Group of Companies do not accept unsolicited assistance from search or recruitment firms for employment opportunities. All CVs/resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search or service agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our Company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our Company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific.","

Key deliverables and responsibilities areas follow:

  • Entails performing analyses in support of the operating performance of the Group’s commercial assets, and providing assistance with budgeting/re-forecasting including revenue assumptions, operating expenses and  
  • capital expenditures
  • Providing support on business plans, budgets, forecasts for assets in the portfolio
  • Providing support for the Commercial Leasing Team on leases and setting up and maintaining lease profiles and rent rolls
  • Responsible for monthly reviews of operating reports and budget monitoring
  • Responsible for managing files and records
  • Responsible for monthly, quarterly, and yearly consolidated reporting for the Group
  • Monitors income, expense and budget variance through monthly and quarterly reporting and summarizing findings to the SGM, Commercial.
  • Partners with the Commercial Leasing Team on the compilation of market studies, competitors’ analysis, and strategy. Provide and compile/summarize research on the market, in relation to both the local and overseas portfolio of the Group.
  • Any other tasks that may be assigned from time to time.

Job Requirements 

  • A minimum of Degree in Bachelor of Science (Real Estate) or equivalent professional qualification.
  • Broad knowledge and experience in commercial real estate, accounting principles, financial modelling and projections.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, collaborative, and organizational skills.
  • Proficiency in Excel and MS office applications. 
  • Capability to work in a team-oriented environment.
  • Candidates who are not fully vaccinated need not apply.

112,data,/en/job/head-data-analytics-and-insights-9401774,9401774,"Head, Data Analytics and Insights",False,False,5000,10000,SGD,IQPC Worldwide Pte Ltd,21-Mar-22,False,,,199702288Z,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"
IQPC provides business executives around the world with tailored practical conferences, large scale events, topical seminars and in-house training programs, keeping them up-to-date with industry trends, technological developments and the regulatory landscape. IQPC's large scale conferences are market leading “must attend” events for their respective industries. IQPC produces more than 1,500 events annually around the world, and continues to grow. Founded in 1973, IQPC now has offices in major cities across six continents including: Berlin, Dubai, London, Madrid, New York, Sao Paulo, Singapore, Sydney, and Toronto. IQPC leverages a global research base of best practices to produce an unrivalled portfolio of conferences.
","

IQPC provides business executives around the world with tailored practical conferences, large-scale events, topical seminars, in-house training programs, and delivers a full suite of B2B digital opportunities, keeping them up-to-date with industry trends. IQPC produces more than 1,500 events annually around the world, and continues to grow. Founded in 1973, IQPC now has offices in major cities across six continents including Berlin, Dubai, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and Tampa. IQPC's large-scale conferences are market leading “must attend” events for their respective industries.

SSON Analytics is the global data analytics centre of the Shared Services & Outsourcing Network (SSON), a division of IQPC. At SSON Analytics, we offer visual data insights that are simple, accurate, and digestible through a variety of data tools and analytics reports to the SSON community (i.e. global business services executives and business leaders who leverage technology and best practices to improve operational efficiency).

Job description:

We are looking for an experienced data analytics and commercial manager, to design, innovate and deliver business reports, data tools and data insights for a variety of B2B sectors using a sophisticated combination of internal and external combination of datasets.

The Manager is heavily involved in the overall commercial success of the business with specific responsibility for motivating and managing the team to meet their targets, including the volume, timeliness, completeness and accuracy of products. Key duties include recruitment, training, defining goals, allocating resources appropriately across the team, performance management and staff development.

We are looking for experienced manager with an entrepreneurial mind-set and strong leadership qualities to join us in this senior leadership role. You are a critical member of the leadership and project team and will be heavily involved in leading and managing strategic projects and engagements within our key verticals.

Responsibilities:

· Hire and manage the analytics team. Collaborate with engineering and design teams to deliver the required features and data, including preparing necessary technical specifications, coordinating development activity and tracking progress of in-flight projects

· Work closely with sales, marketing, customers and technology partners to deeply understand, document, analyze and synthesize customer needs into product priorities, roadmap plans, and detailed specifications

· Design and automate the production of insights reports and data models based on queries to the prepared dataset and source external datasets to enhance those reports and products.

· Process, review and interpret large bodies of qualitative and quantitative data on customer usage patterns to uncover new insights

· Ensuring the reports or data models are well-written/presented, unbiased, complete, accurate and up-to-date

· Build deep understanding and empathy for business users. Help clients interpret the insights reports, carrying out deep-dive data analyses where needed to provide further clarification

· Manage complex, cross-functional projects across multiple teams. As part of a larger team, support project/program management for all project planning and technical assessment. Act as a point of contact within the business for all technical matters and provide technical support during project implementation.

· Assist with the compilation and distribution of key metrics and regular reports relating to profile data

· Gain expertise in a subject matter domain; evaluate and recommend technology or solutions based on technical capability/ functionality, cost-benefit and risk criteria as well as alignment with overall digital strategy.

· Innovate and add value to existing data products.

Requirements:

· A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering with experience in a related field and at least 7 years of experience in the analytics domain. Knowledge and experience in Data Mining, Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations Research or a related field would be an advantage.

· Strong skills in large scale optimization models, frontier models, frontier extension models, large scale geo-spatial risk assessment models, gravity models, population flow models, census methods and ecological sampling techniques.

· Minimum one year’s experience of managing and motivating a team within a commercial data/information operation, creating new metrics, indices, and performance measurement.

· Advanced usage of analytical tools. Strong ability to analyze, interpret and present data using advanced graphing software e.g. Tableau, D3, QlikView, Highcharts. Knowledgeable of open source visualization tools, Java and social data extraction would be a plus.

· Experience with large data sets and knowledge of both structured and unstructured data.

· Familiarity with a variety of software development methodologies, e.g. Agile, Feature Driven Development, Rapid Application Development.

· Proven track record of solving challenging problems by applying advanced analytics.

· Expert analytical thinking and ability to provide thought leadership with the ability to communicate analytical findings to senior management.

· Self-driven as well as ability to work in a team setting. Good communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills are essential. Familiarity with working across multiple teams, local and virtual settings

· Passion for data and innovation

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
SVP / VP, Data Architecture / Data Management - Product Owner, Transformation Group - (WD25395)

Business Function
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! 
Responsibilities
As a specialist in Data Architecture and Data Management in the DBS Data Platform Business team, you will drive the definition of relevant practices and adoption of best-in-class solutions to drive adherence to the bank standards and empower data producers/consumers to deliver greater business outcomes with the Data Platform.
  • Define data management principles and guidelines for the various patterns of usage of DBS Data Platform, covering areas such as business data architecture, metadata, data security, data quality and reference data.
  • Govern adherence to data management principles by project implementation teams and components of the data platform.
  • Function as a Product Owner to operationalise data management principles and other data management initiatives, defining requirements and collaborating with Technology teams to implement solutions and embed them into the data delivery lifecycle.
  • Identify areas of improvements and explore opportunities to adopt emerging data management practices and technologies, experimenting solutions and developing business cases to open the way for effective adoption.
  • Contribute to shape the future of DBS Data Platform, engage with stakeholders across the organisation to develop forward-thinking approaches and solutions.
Requirements
  • At least 10 years of experience in related fields including at least 5 years in data architecture/data management roles. Experience in banking industry would be an advantage.
  • Broad exposure to data architecture/data management practices and challenges involved in building modern data and analytics platforms, in areas such as metadata, reference data, data security, data quality.
  • Experience in a product ownership or product management role, excellent project leadership and execution skills: set up a vision and strategy, define requirements and priorities (user stories), coordinate with stakeholders and manage expectations, manage planning and risks, drive adoption of solutions etc.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, proficient in PowerPoint & Excel, clear ability to articulate messages and develop presentations for senior management.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
