115,data,/en/job/head-of-data-analytics-asean-9311906,9311906,Head of Data & Analytics ASEAN,False,False,9000,12500,SGD,Reckitt Benckiser (Singapore) Pte Ltd,22-Mar-22,False,,21 days,197702628K,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"

About RECKITT

Our world is constantly changing. So it's reassuring to know that there are some things we can always trust to help us take the best possible care of ourselves and the ones we love.

This trust inspires us. We’re a diverse, global family of over 43,000 people united by one passionate purpose: a cleaner, healthier world for all.

We are Reckitt. Home to the world's best loved and trusted hygiene, health and nutrition brands.

Our Purpose 

We exist to protect, heal and nurture in the relentless pursuit of a cleaner and healthier world. We fearlessly innovate in this pursuit across our Hygiene, Health and Nutrition businesses.

Our Fight 

We have a fight on our hands. A fight to make access to the highest quality hygiene, wellness and nourishment a right and not a privilege. Information and products that promote good health and hygiene are daily necessities for us all. 

Our Compass

Our compass guides us. We use it to navigate the way we need to behave as individuals, as teams, and as a company. Our culture builds on what has made us successful; and equips us for sustainable growth so that we may continue to protect, heal and nurture the generations to come.

","

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Lead the delivery of regional analytics workstreams Marketing/Sales effectiveness, ROI, and Revenue Management - scope/design/deploy the pns, models, dashboards, etc.
  • Identify data/system challenges, requirements to improve speed to insight and action.
  • Lead regional initiatives to educate business working teams in interpreting and using analytics.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) field is an advantage, Masters or MBA is a plus.
  • 4 to 6 years of overall experience in scoping, managing, and implementing advanced analytics projects with significant experience in the delivery of work streams related to marketing mix optimization, digital media performance optimization, trade/promotion spend optimization, pricing, assortment/product mix optimization, salesforce /resource allocation.
  • Media Agency/FB/Google Analytics team experience a plus.
  • E-commerce and/or Modern Retailer side Analytics Team experience a plus.
  • Solid understanding of how data & analytics can be used to drive business impact - comfort and good intuition around advanced analytics, with a good basic understanding of modeling techniques and advanced applied skills.
  • Previous experience in how Machine Learning / AI can be leveraged, scaled, and used to derive insights and business impact is a plus.
  • The ability to tell a compelling story using analytics outputs and data from primary, secondary, and third-party data sources, with an ability to understand how the related insights might drive business impact.
  • Strong project management, organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills.
  • Programming - Minimum: Advanced Excel and PowerBI, R/Pyth.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

Job Description
Senior Associate / Associate, Data Scientist (NLP), Analytics Center of Excellence, Group Transformation - (WD29773)

Business Function
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play. We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! 
Job Purpose
Deliver data science analysis to support business decisions for various business and support units of the bank. Develop Advanced NLP components to be included in innovative applications by creating prototypes. Develop solutions based on advanced analytics, leveraging internal data sources and external data assets.
Key Responsibilities
  • Build machine learning solutions to solve various business questions.
    • Perform ad-hoc exploratory statistics and data mining tasks on diverse datasets from small scale to big data
    • Select features, build and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques
    • Perform data wrangling and feature engineering
    • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
    • Extend company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
    • Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
    • Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
    • Carry out ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear manner
  • Build NLP solutions
    • Build end to end NLP solutions and prototypes for business problems
    • Perform data cleansing and build data pipelines
    • Develop traditional NLP models as baseline and compare with deep learning models wherever applicable
    • Build solid evaluation framework for NLP models and able to identify where model fails and how can the solution be improved
    • Develop bank NLP capabilities such as NLP python package and web UI for internal users
    • Develop visualization interfaces that help business make more insightful decisions
  • Maintain cutting edge in data science
    • Take initiative in evaluating new approaches from data science research
    • Test new tools, platforms and packages
    • Support the programs for changing the business culture towards more data driven decision making
    • Create helper functions to automate frequently encountered wrangling and feature engineering tasks
Skills and Experience
  • 3 years of industry experience in data science/machine learning projects working in a big data environment
  • 2 years of industry experience working in NLP projects
  • PhD/Masters/Bachelors in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or related majors.
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Random Forests, XgBoost etc.
  • Familiar with sklearn
  • Familiar with text processing tools like nltk, spacy, huggingface
  • Familiar with NLP algorithms like topic modelling, sentiment analysis, Bert / Roberta and other deep learning models, text classification
  • Familiar with NLP frameworks like tensorflow, keras, pytorch
  • Experienced in building end to end NLP workflows from data acquisition, EDA, modelling, evaluation to deployment
  • Experienced with NLP use-cases like chatbots, translation, search and recommendation
  • Highly proficient with data wrangling and feature engineering
  • Familiar with programming tools such as Spark, Python and SQL.
  • Great communication and presentation skills
  • Data-oriented personalityand able to multi-task
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column3: Marina Bay Sands® is Asia’s leading destination for business, leisure and entertainment delivering once-in-a-lifetime experiences. The landmark building is situated in the heart of Singapore’s Central Business District and transforms Singapore’s skyline and the country’s tourism landscape.

The destination offers a luxury hotel, state-of-the art convention and exhibition facilities, theaters, world-class entertainment and the best shopping and dining in the region. The three hotel towers are crowned by the Sands SkyPark® on the 57th story.

column1: <div>
<div>

column3: Conveniently located in the heart of the Central Business District and 20 minutes from Changi Airport.

• Hotel: The Marina Bay Sands hotel has three 55-story towers with 2,561 luxury rooms and suites. The three towers are capped by the Sands SkyPark, which offers 360-degree views of Singapore’s skyline. It is home to restaurants, lush gardens, an infinity edged swimming pool and the world’s largest public cantilever housing an observation deck.

• Expo and Conventions: The Sands Expo and Convention Center has 1.3 million square feet of flexible convention and exhibition space. It can host over 45,000 delegates, 2,000 exhibition booths and 250 meeting rooms. It features Southeast Asia’s biggest ballroom, which can accommodate 6,600 people for a banquet, and up to 11,000 for an auditorium-style lecture.

• Shopping: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands has 800,000 square feet of retail and dining space. Luxury retailers include Bally, Cartier, CHANEL, Ferragamo, Franck Muller, Gucci, Hermès, Hublot, Hugo Boss, Louis Vuitton, Miu Miu, Omega, Patek Philippe, Prada, Tiffany & Co. and Yves Saint Laurent. New brands include Anne Fontaine, Henry Cotton’s, Leviev, Marisfrolg, Moiselle, Rabeanco, Stefano Ricci, and Wolford.

• Restaurants: Dining at Marina Bay Sands is a gourmet experience with over 50 dining choices. These include celebrity-chef restaurants helmed by Mario Batali, (New York), Daniel Boulud (New York), Wolfgang Puck (Los Angeles), Guy Savoy (Paris), Tetsuya Wakuda (Sydney) and Justin Quek (Singapore). Marina Bay Sands features signature restaurants, modern bistros and a premium food court.

• Entertainment: Marina Bay Sands energizes the entertainment and nightlife scene in Singapore with nightclubs, world-class entertainment, a museum and a casino. The museum, which has a lotus-inspired design, will feature blockbuster exhibitions from around the world. Two state-of-the-art theaters will open with a total of about 4,000 seats. The Broadway hit The Lion King will debut in Sands Theater, with Le Theater presenting shorter-run shows such as concerts, award ceremonies and gala events. The outdoor event plaza along the promenade next to Marina Bay will host audiences for watching events on the bay or on the plaza.

Job Summary & Expectations

As a Data Engineer, you will build and maintain end to end Data & BI solutions for the Data Platform to address various business requirements.

You will be an individual contributor who has deep understanding and experience building data solutions. In this role you need to use various tools not limited to; Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft BI Tool Stack (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS), MDX, DAX, Power BI, Tableau, Windows batch scripting, PowerShell, Web Services, Python, R, C#.Net etc.  You are also expected to do development, automation and maintenance of data solutions as an active contributor in current Team.

Job Responsibilities

  • Build and maintain reliable, efficient and consumable data solutions by delivering all phases of the software development life cycle, including gathering requirements, design, development, testing, deployment, integration, documentation, and post-deployment maintenance.
  • Work on change requests from the business units.
  • Maintain documentations of projects.
  • Maintain user experience in term of availability, query performance and quick turnaround time.
  • Resolve any data related issue like data discrepancies.
  • Set up monitoring processes to alert any issue.
  • Create & Maintain required business reports.

Job Requirements 

  • 3-5 years of hands-on experience in designing & building data solutions.
  • Highly proficient in T-SQL, data modeling and problem-solving.
  • Hands-on experience in building and maintaining an end-to-end data solution involving data exploration, data analysis, data ingestion, data transformation, data processing to deployment for both real time and batched data is mandatory.
  • Hands-on experience with Reporting tools is mandatory. Working experience with Tableau / Power BI / Qlik / SSRS would be preferred.
  • Experience in big data tools and technologies will be an added advantage.
  • Proactive, Self-starter & Go-getter attitude is expected in this role.
  • Good time management and ability to meet deadlines.
  • Experience with financial analysis, trend analysis or any large volume data crunching and analysis would be an advantage.
  • Prior experience with Hospitality and/or Gaming domain would be a BIG plus.
  • Very good team player & attention to details.

You agree that it is a condition of employment that you adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures including without limitation the rules of conduct of the Company.

column2: Sentosa, The State of Fun, is Singapore’s premier island resort getaway and Asia’s leading leisure destination. This 500-hectare resort island is home to an exciting array of themed attractions, award-winning spa retreats and resort accommodation, alongside lush greenery, golden sandy beaches, world-renowned championship golf courses and even a deep-water yachting marina and luxury residences - making it a compelling destination for business and leisure for millions of visitors from all around the world. Making Sentosa its home, too, is Singapore’s first integrated resort, Resorts World Sentosa, which operates Southeast Asia’s first Universal Studios theme park.

column1: <div>

column2:
Unique among leisure destinations, Sentosa (meaning peace and tranquility in Malay) is situated on the fringe of Singapore’s city centre, just minutes away from the central business district. The island is easily accessible via various modes of transport including the Sentosa Express from VivoCity and the Singapore Cable Car Sky Network which offers an aerial view of the HarbourFront precinct. Visitors can also choose to take a leisurely stroll via the Sentosa Boardwalk, the only garden-themed boardwalk in Southeast Asia. The island was formerly a fishing village and British military base during World War II and was transformed into an idyllic island resort in 1972 as a recreational space for Singaporeans to enjoy. Today, Sentosa has become a premier leisure destination with some 20 million local and foreign guests visiting the island annually.","
JOB PURPOSE: 
As an Integration and Data Analyst, you are responsible for assisting the CoE PMO team in maintaining and supporting SDC’s Sales, Distribution and Fulfilment (SDF) platform. 
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

You will be responsible for
  • Working in a team and providing Operation and Support requirements for the SDF and its business partners
  • all integration aspects between the SDF system and the other applications as required to integrate SDF with other applications.
  • driving the requirement and solutioning, and also define the integration rules to ensure robustness and exception handling
  • overseeing all reporting requirements for the main ticketing system, able to create new reports and change the existing reports using SQL queries.
  • Participate in all phases of product development life cycle including design, development, testing, debugging, documentation and post go-live support.
  • Liaising with cross-functional business users and IT partners on bugs, enhancement and feature requests for supported systems.
  • Trouble-shooting and delivering technical level root-cause analysis, proposing creative and scalable solutions and considering code optimizations, cost effectiveness, risk, practicality, technical limitations and criticality.
  • Read and analyze system logs of supported systems to escalate to the relevant teams where necessary
  • Support Data extraction/analytical requests, analytical report development and enhancements.
  • Develop, maintain documentation for technical processes/procedures.
  • Ensure systems adhere to Audit, Compliance and Risk guidelines.
JOB COMPETENCIES:
  • Degree in Computer Science or a related field from an accredited tertiary with 3-5 years of relevant work experience in a similar or related field. 
  • Strong hands-on experience in API design and exception handling
  • Knowledge in SIEM, JAVA/J2EE, JSP, C++, Nodejs, JavaScript framework, HTML5, CSS, Web services API Integration (JSON REST, SOAP), shell scripting is an advantage.
  • Proficient hands-on experience in SQL queries using Microsoft SQL
  • Experience in administering cloud services and tools like AWS, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud platform is an advantage.
  • Good communication, problem-solving skills and experience in supporting complex projects, liaising with cross-functional business users and vendors.
  • Effectiveness with time management, priority setting and meeting deadlines.
  • Experience in change request assessment for impact, time and effort.
  • Working experience in a Centre of Excellence PMO environment is an advantage.
  • Must be willing to work outside normal business hours when required.

column1: 121,data,/en/job/business-intelligence-analyst-9379985,9379985,Business Intelligence Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,Carro Singapore,11 hours ago,False,,9 days,201525411C,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:center"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.

Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.

Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee.
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace

Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.

In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.

","

Carro is on a mission to redefine what car ownership is and transform the way that people and businesses across Asia interact with one another to get the cars they need. Our digital platforms are game-changers in the automotive trading industry, seamlessly integrating the buying and selling user journeys for speed, efficiency, and transparency.

Since 2016, Carro has continually disrupted the existing business models and practices within the automotive trading industry, launching numerous market-first services, and grown to more than 800 people across 4 countries in Southeast Asia. Our platform serves nearly every need that car owners have, and does it in a more tech-enabled, efficient, and delightful way. Today, Carro transacts more than $1Bn in cars annually and has won numerous industry awards for innovation and marketing excellence.

Find out more about our journey to become Singapore's No 1 fastest-growing company in 2021, and the successes across business lines and countries, in the last 5 years here. https://carro.sg/blog/carro-5-year-journey/

The Business Intelligence team plays an important role in empowering Carro’s data-driven & data-informed decision-making strategy. The successful candidate will be passionate about using data insights to answer strategic business questions, and have strong analytical and problem-solving skills:

What you will be doing:

  • Collaborate with various business teams to translate business operation data requirements into tracking metrics
  • Design/perform business-oriented reporting system/analysis, and data visualization dashboards to monitor the performance of the business
  • Perform ad-hoc analysis to understand certain business cases and challenges, providing conclusions and advice based on data analysis
  • ​Be the trusted partner with the management team to find actionable insights from data to drive high impact business strategy
Requirements

Who are we looking for:

  • Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Data Science, Engineering etc.)
  • Relevant experience in data analyst/ business intelligence role
  • Proficiency in technical skills with Python, R, SQL for data analysis and building of automated real-time dashboards and reports with dashboarding tools like Tableau and Data Studio
  • Detail-oriented with strong data sense, with good problem-solving skills
  • Strong communicator with ability to translate numbers to business stakeholders
  • Ability to work independently and effectively in a fast-paced environment
  • E-commerce and start-up experience a plus

Job Responsibilities

Lead the Data Architecture activities spearheaded by Enterprise Architecture Team

  • Design and develop the architecture roadmap for big data platforms including data modelling, data security, master data management, etc..
  • Architect the data platform for the organization leveraging cloud native services and capabilities following best practices from industry and guidance/standards from LVMH group.
  • Design data models and associated metadata for mission critical and high-volume data systems, real-time and distributed data processing systems, data lakes/data warehouse
  • Work with systems and project teams in the overall IT solution, with the responsibility to ensure successful data design and implementation
  • Leading the teams to conceptualize, build and maintain the Data Infrastructure for relational as well as Big
  • Data Infrastructure to deliver a high-performance Data Environment to process Retail, Digital, Supply Chain, and Customer Data from various partners.
  • Being responsible for Data Warehousing Design, Data Integration Processes, Database Resource Planning, Infrastructure Performance, Data Governance and Security Management as well as design, architecture, implementation, and documentation of new, scalable ETL processes, pipelines, pathways and dimension aldata models.
  • Work with Data Scientist, Business Consultant and Frontend Developer to build scalable Data Analytics Apps using advanced analytics.
  • Audit and QA data and processes to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the data ecosystem
  • Design technology stack that can support Data Governance people and processes
  • Supervise Data Governance technical team removing roadblocks and mentoring the team to accelerate knowledge and Data Governance maturity.
  • Participate and lead data requirement gathering sessions with subject matter experts, data analyst/scientists, user communities, and other IT stakeholders
  • Responsible for data profiling, data analysis, data specification, data flows mapping, business logic documentation associated with new or modified data capture requirements
  • Navigate challenges in terms of uncertainty and focus on delivering high value at any given time
  • Communicate risks and issues to different stakeholders including senior/executive management

Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent (MS preferred)
  • Work Experience Min. 8+ years of experience in data platform architecture

Critical knowledge & skills including tools, software applications, language, etc.

  • You have 10-15 years hands-on experience and a passion for data architecture in a big data environment, data warehousing, ETL Processes and related services as well as experience and a very good understanding of supporting technologies.
  • 3-5 years experiences architecting big data solutions on Alicloud/GCP leveraging cloud native services (i.e., PaaS). ·
  • Fluency in English language, Mandarin as added advantage
  • You should have a minimum of 3-5 years of designing and implementing Data Governance tools from a business perspective
  • Minimum 3 years working with visualization tools, data ingestion tools, API knowledge and has successfully executed application integrations
  • Ideal candidate will understand how people, process and technology can come together to enable advanced analytics, Data Science and data management
  • Experience in data quality, data governance, and supporting tools
  • Proven experience of cross functional leadership in complex organizations with strong emphasis on influencing and collaboration
  • Strong analytical orientation
  • Teach, mentor, and provide value on a consistent basis to stakeholders
  • Ability to translate strategy into an operational plan and can execute delivering consistent value to the organization·
  • You are a highly motivated, challenge-taking Personality with a positive attitude.
  • You feel comfortable in developing on your own but also in working with a team of developers
  • You like to work in a dynamic environment and collaborate with teams to build exciting new Data Products ·
  • You have very good experience in Database Technologies, like SQL and Big Data Technologies and Database Performance Tuning
  • Knowledge on Chinese Market and Chinese Language

123,data,/en/job/specialist-data-management-industrial-asia-pacific-9379861,9379861,"Specialist, Data Management, Industrial Asia Pacific",False,False,,,SGD,Schaeffler (Singapore) Pte Ltd,11 hours ago,False,,,199604030H,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

Schaeffler Group – We pioneer motion

As a leading global supplier to the automotive and industrial sectors, the Schaeffler Group has been driving forward groundbreaking inventions and developments in the fields of motion and mobility for over 75 years.

With innovative technologies, products, and services for electric mobility, CO2-efficient drives, Industry 4.0, digitalization, and renewable energies, the company is a reliable partner for making motion and mobility more efficient, intelligent, and sustainable. The technology company manufactures high-precision components and systems for powertrain and chassis applications as well as rolling and plain bearing solutions for a large number of industrial applications.

","

The role will be responsible for the operative material data creation and maintenance for Demand Management in Industrial Asia Pacific to secure the operative business for Trading Plants including Regional Levelling Points, Distribution Centers and Satellite Distribution Centers. He/she will be responsible for relevant data quality indicators and process KPIs based on global rules in Industrial Asia Pacific.

Key Responsibilities

Operative Material Data Management 

  • Release and processing of RfMM (Request for Material Master) workflows in SAP_EP1
  • Manual creation of material data in SAP_P66
  • Material Purchasing Data creation, including Purchase Info Record (PIR), PREF, Quality Info Record (QIR) and Vendor List
  • Definition and maintanence of Field Entry Documentation (FED) rules
  • Maintenance of data and improvement of the material data quality
  • Support and execution of group-wide changes in Material Data for Industrial Asia Pacific Trading Plants for e.g. SOCO Master Data Fixation 
  • Identification of master data inconsistencies inside and outside the Industrial Asia network
  • Requesting master data changes and tracking outside of the Industrial Asia Pacific network
  • Execution of product replacements and relocations within the system to ensure fulfilment of the global product management strategy

Schaeffler Quality Initiatives & KPIs

  • Responsible for the monitoring and achievement of relevant process KPIs/Data Quality Indicators for material data including RfMM, DQ-MMR PlanMats (Data Quality of relevant Material Master Record fields for Demand Planning materials), Material Status Release and MDSC/DQ-DC & DQC etc., for Industrial Asia Pacific Trading Plants and to define improvement activities in case of any deviations

Project Management

  • Implementation of projects in the context of continuous improvement process and quality management
  • Support and particiapte in (sub-)projects with focus on Demand Management Material Data
  • Alignment with process owner regarding extensive process changes or requirements 

Pre-requisites

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration (specialization on Supply Chain Management) or relevant field
  • Minimum of 1-3 years professional experience in the related field of Material Data Management
  • Proficient in SAP-R/3 (MM, PP, SD Modules) and Microsoft office applications
  • Detailed oriented to ensure data accuracy within SAP system based on defined guidelines
  • Team player and able to communicate effectively

Note:

We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Please state your current and expected salary in the resume.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Who you are:You're no doubt a data whiz. You are adept at using data, research and analytical insights to help businesses and organisations make informed decisions. You're particularly invested in utilising data to drive decisions that have a direct impact on the lives of individuals. It's where your interest in Human Resource stems from (after all, people lie at the heart of HR).With the power of data at your disposal, you're known to be both a problem-solver and an opportunity-explorer. Others count on you - and your exceptional eye for details, analytical mind and hearty curiosity - to diagnose their needs, identify opportunities and seek out solutions. And you're not one to let them down.As an individual expert in data science, you have the necessary hard, and soft, skills to succeed. These include being comfortable with interacting with colleagues from across various job functions and levels (whether or not they 'speak your language'), and leveraging best practices from the field and industry.Your role involves:
  • Work amongst a team of data scientists in partnering with business intelligence developers, visualisation and insights experts, and HR business specialists to assess our organisation's human capital needs and identify opportunities to apply data analytics.

  • Improving the way we design our end-to-end employee journey through experimentations.

  • Defining analytical strategy, problem statements and hypotheses to address identified opportunities, including analytical approaches, data and technology requirements.

  • Developing predictive models and performing statistical analyses to identify key areas of risk and predict risk events, across a range of banking functions.

  • Designing and implementing tracking and feedback mechanisms to allow for capturing of actions and the impact of data-driven decisions on business outcomes.
Your background:
  • You have the track record:
    • You have at least 5-8 years of hands-on experience with analytical tools and techniques, and of which, past 5 years of relevant experience being in an analytical function building and implementing various statistical models, working with large amounts of data and articulating business questions, data extraction and use of statistical approaches to arrive at an answer.

    • You've built and operationalised the analytical capability of a business or organisation.

  • You have the basics covered:
    • Able to translate business problems into mathematical formulations? Check.

    • Understand mathematical and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning (ML) modelling techniques? Check.

    • Proficient in data manipulation and analysis? Check.

    • Programming experience in R, Python, Spark or other statistical software? Check.

    • Other programming languages can include SQL, Hadoop, Java, Hive, and/or MariaDB? Check.

    • Experience using 'Git' as a version control tool, preferably with the ability to work in Linux environment? Check.
Ideally, you should have:
  • Experience working with unstructured datasets, and knowledge in text mining and text analysis.

  • Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends and applied knowledge of statistics, measurements and model evaluation.

  • HR domain knowledge and/or People analytics-related experience is a plus.
Who we are:We're known as Group Human Resources, and what this means is we're obsessed about our employees. Our goal is simple: to attract, retain and nurture individuals who are serious about taking banking to the next level, regardless of the role or function they are in.Like the rest of the organisation, data is in our blood, and we have the in-house capabilities to make informed, data-driven decisions concerning our people. Our Human Capital Analytics team acts as an integral innovation lab, using diagnostic, advanced analytical approaches to identify opportunities and solve challenges in areas such as organisational health.We're putting our people first, and as always, we start by listening. It not only allows us to stay connected to them, but also harness their feedback to drive change for the better.If you're just like us, we'd love to hear from you.Note: Candidates with lesser experience may be considered for a lower level position.Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

125,data,/en/job/data-analyst-9394863,9394863,Data Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,OSIM International Pte. Ltd.,18-Mar-22,False,,2 days,198304191N,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"

Established in 1980, OSIM is a pioneer and global leader in branded healthy lifestyle products. Always at the forefront of innovation and development, OSIM constantly uses innovative retail concepts and enhances its research and development capabilities to produce the most comprehensive range of well being products. These award winning designs and patented technologies further strengthen our vision to inspire well being across all aspects for our customers.

OSIM is about the experience of total well-being living an inspiring life. This is channeled at each and every customer touch point, communicating our values through our products, our outlet, our brand image, our service excellence and in-depth knowledge of holistic health.

With consistent exemplary performance in all our key markets, our effective and direct control over our expanding global retail network and the innovation of new products, OSIM now operates a wide point of sales, with more than 435 outlets in more than 89 cities across 20 countries in Asia, Oceania, the Middle East, Europe and North America.

As the world turns to healthy lifestyle alternatives, there has never been a better time for OSIM to inspire life by bringing in our philosophy of holistic well being to the world. Discover what it means to work at OSIM, where inspiring well being begins with you.

","

126,data,/en/job/management-information-systems-mis-student-data-reporting-assistant-manager-9314301,9314301,"Management Information Systems (MIS), Student Data & Reporting Assistant Manager",False,False,4000,5800,SGD,North London Collegiate School (Singapore) Pte Ltd.,11 hours ago,False,,27 days,201621489R,,,51 - 200 Employees,,130 Depot Road,"
Since 1850, NLCS (UK) has maintained its reputation for providing an outstanding education. The NLCS programme has been synonymous with excellence, ambition and aspiration. NLCS () is the third addition the NLCS family of schools, following the successful establishment of its overseas branches in Jeju Dubai.  NLCS in will be an International Baccalaureate Continuum , offering the Primary Programme (PYP), Programme (MYP) the IB .
","

NLCS (Singapore) believes that each employee makes a significant contribution to our success and that contributions should not be limited by the assigned responsibilities.  

Therefore, this position description is designed to outline primary duties, qualifications, and job scope, but not limit the employee, nor NLCS (Singapore), to only the work identified. It is the expectation of the school, that each employee will offer his/her services wherever and whenever necessary to ensure the success of our organisation.

Our School is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. The School expects all teaching staff, non‐teaching staff and volunteers to share and uphold this commitment.

Management Information Systems (MIS), Student Data & Reporting Assistant Manager will be responsible for the management information system and related reporting functions.

The successful candidate will have an international outlook and an appreciation for the impact the support staff can have in the School and on the staff at the School. This person will be quick to learn about the organization and begin to interact with various key stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities

Management Information Systems (MIS)

  • To ensure the effective management and administration of the School’s MIS (including iSams, ManageBac, SchoolsBuddy, Room Booking System and any other MIS adopted by the School).
  • To maintain an excellent working knowledge of the MIS.
  • To oversee the day-to-day operation of the School’s MIS, addressing any problems as they arise.
  • To monitor and communicate updates to MIS user interfaces and functionality to staff as appropriate.
  • To liaise with MIS providers as appropriate.
  • To provide training and support to staff, parents and students in the use of the MIS.
  • To work with the Timetable Coordinator to ensure that the timetable is successfully imported into the MIS and any changes to it are reflected in a timely and accurate manner.
  • To liaise with relevant members of the Junior School and Senior School Management Teams to ensure that changes in student timetables, such as movement between option classes, are reflected in the MIS in a timely and efficient manner.
  • To liaise with the Admissions Department to ensure that details of new students are transferred into the MIS in a timely and efficient manner.
  • To liaise with the Admissions Department and Senior Team to ensure that student withdrawals are reflected in the MIS in a timely and efficient manner.
  • To liaise with the ICT Manager to ensure that Google accounts for new students are provisioned.

Student Data & Reporting

  • To ensure that the data held in the School’s MIS is up-to-date and accurate, including overseeing an annual check of data integrity.
  • To provide regular and ad hoc reports to appropriate members of the Senior School and Junior School Management Teams including, but not limited to, the following:

o  Attendance/absence/lateness (cohort level—monthly)

o  Attendance/absence lateness (individual students—as requested)

o  Rewards & sanctions (cohort level—termly)

o  Rewards & sanctions (individual students—as requested)

o  CCA uptake, engagement & attendance (cohort level—per CCA season)

  • To carry out an analysis of student assessment data following each reporting session, including:

o  Summary data by subject, year group and phase

o  Summary data per student, including progress from term to term overall and in each subject

  • To provide assessment & reporting data to the University & Careers Guidance department for use in student transcripts as required.
  • To oversee the printing and distribution of both draft and final versions of Settling-In Reports, Progress Cards and End of Year Reports.

Safeguarding:

  • Abide by the school safeguarding policy and keep abreast of any changes

Qualifications/Skills

  • Degree and above, with at least 3 years of relevant experience
  • Excellent communication skills, to liaise with internal and external stakeholders
  • Proficient IT skills including Google Workspace
  • Through analysis and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to foster positive working relationships
  • Able to prioritise work, multi-task and work in a fast paced environment
  • Experience working within a school or other educational environment

To apply:

Please refer to the application process on the school website.

Please note incomplete submissions will not be processed and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews.

We are partnering with one of the well-established Banks in Singapore that provides the full range of services in Consumer, SME and Corporate banking activities across Asia and Middle East. They are currently looking for a Data Scientist to join them. The Data Scientist will work with DevOps & Site Reliability Engineering team to define the enterprise metrics and insights. The Data Scientist will also be responsible to apply AI/ML models to cluster and draw predictions on application reliability & maintainability.  The Data Scientist is responsible to identify data sources, analyze existing data and ensure capture of new data by collaborating with multiple stakeholders and deliver successful implementation of the respective initiative
Key Responsibilities:
  • Perform systemic analysis of current state and define solution for control gaps, data gaps, reporting gaps and any other gaps
  • Map workflows and identify opportunities to automate manual tasks across applications
  • Analysis of extracts to identify patterns, gaps (data inconsistencies), structures and perform data mapping between sources
  • Perform data quality analysis and ensure authenticity and accuracy of the data
  • Perform data conversion and cleansing to in order to translate into desired format
  • Demonstrate development experience using Java, Python and Excel macros.
  • Stay up to date with application changes and updates
  • Willingness to learn new technologies and platforms

You should have: -
  • Degree holder in a technical discipline (Computer Science, IS/IT or related disciplines)
  • About 2–4-year experience in data analytics, AI/ML
  • Solid experience in using APIs on platforms and tools to extract data
  • Working knowledge in leveraging data from DevOps toolsets & SRE Metrics
  • Possess experience in developing live control dashboards
  • Proven working experience in Data Analytics and Data Models and applying these in solving business problems
  • Good exposure to system / software development life cycles in Agile environment
  • Hands-on experience of at least 5 years in Python / JavaScript programming
  • Team player with strong interpersonal skills
Interested candidates may send their resumes to peggy_koh@persolkelly.com or apply through the application system. Shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column1:
","
Business Function
 Group Finance aims to deliver world-class standards in reporting, financial planning and finance processes. We provide insights and analyses that help the bank make sound business decisions - whether in the areas of product development or customer profitability. We also provide capital management, business planning, forecasting, and tax and accounting advisory services. The bank is also a certified Accredited Training Organisation (ATO) for the Singapore Qualification Programme by the Singapore Accountancy Commission and an Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA) Approved Employer. 
Responsibilities
  • To research, develop, and operationalise algorithms/models to address specific business problems around the areas of Portfolio Management & Balance Sheet Management
  • To understand business requirements from users and develop solutions to address their problems, specifically the experimentation and in-depth study of various algorithms and machine learning models.
  • To work closely with business leads to identify opportunities for collaboration and exploration of advanced models in the field of A.I and Deep Learning, such reinforcement learning algorithms and generative models.
  • To operationalize model pipelines into re-usable libraries for the team
  • To automate models by leveraging on existing tools and frameworks
Requirements
  • Individual with a strong interest and natural curiosity in exploring various technical domains in the areas of analytics and machine learning.
  • 8-10 years of experience in applied statistical learning, machine learning and data science with tangible outcomes.
  • In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in deep learning with tangible outcomes.
  • Deep understanding of statistics, math and optimisation theory.
  • Excellent written and communication skills, especially one who can explain how machine learning models and statistical learning algorithms are applied.
  • A keen learner who desires to learn and acquire new knowledge both in business and technical domains, as well as to acquire proficiency in new tools, languages and techniques.
  • A strong team player who can contribute as an individual
  • Extremely proficient in software development, with in-depth knowledge of TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, PySpark as well as big-data tools such as Spark, Hive & Alluxio.
  • Master's or Ph.D in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Engineering or other quantitative disciplines
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Our client, a well-known company is looking for candidates for the position of Data Scientist. 
JOB SUMMARY
  • Leading Data Business Strategy & planning among South East Asia Region
  • Leading Data Business expansion for the region including team member(s) management

  • Leading initiatives to expand data business among the region by coordinating with project members, distributors,  headquarter or other external stakeholders

REQUIREMENTS
  • Degree in Business or any other relevant disciplines with at least 9 years of working experience

Job Description
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements and tools to automate data processing and ensure data integrity while meeting data security standards
  • Build tools for better discovery and consumption of data for various consumption models in the organization – DataMarts, Warehouses, APIs, Adhoc Data explorations
  • Architect and create data views from big data store to feed into analysis engines, visualization engines etc.
  • Coding and scripting for test and product (consumer and commercial) development
  • Work with IT, data scientist, vendors, factories and business analytics team to assist in data ingestion and data-related technical issues
Responsibilities
  • Responsible for the direction of the software systems development function, including the design, development, troubleshooting and debugging of software programs.
  • Oversees the development of software for operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases, etc.
  • Responsible for determining hardware compatibility and/or influencing hardware design.
  • Applies advanced subject matter knowledge to complex business issues, and is regarded as a subject matter expert.
  • Frequently contributes to the development of new ideas and methods.
  • Works on complex problems/projects where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors.
  • Exercises significant independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices to determine best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives.
  • Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives.
  • May provide mentoring and guidance to lower level employees.
  • Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies
Job Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Business Analytics or equivalent
  • Experience in data ingestion, cleaning and processing tools.
  • Excellent experience in data processing using Scala/Python/Java
  • Experience with the cloud (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure)
  • Experience implementing batch and streaming data pipelines
  • Experience with database security
  • In-depth knowledge of both SQL and NoSQL databases, including performance tuning and troubleshooting
  • Familiar with DevOps tools such as Git, Docker, Terraform
  • Strong in user requirements gathering, maintenance, and support (design and conduct user acceptance testing)
To Apply:
Interested candidates, who wish to apply for the above position; please send in your resume to emily.ng@persolkelly.com or click the ""Apply Now"" below.

133,data,/en/job/principal-clinical-informatics-analyst-data-analytics-3473br-9404501,9404501,Principal Clinical Informatics Analyst (Data Analytics) - (3473BR),False,False,,,USD,National Healthcare Group Corporate Office (HQ),22-Mar-22,False,,,200002150H,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div>

column2: The National Healthcare Group (NHG) is a leader in public healthcare in Singapore, recognised at home and abroad for the quality of its medical expertise and facilities. Care is provided through an integrated network of six primary care polyclinics, acute care and tertiary hospitals, national specialty centres and business divisions. Together they bring a rich legacy of medical expertise to our philosophy of integrated patient-centred care.

column1: <div>

column2: NHG's vision is ""Adding Years of Healthy Life"". This vision goes beyond merely healing the sick to the more difficult and infinitely more rewarding task of preventing illness and preserving health and quality of life. With some 20,000 staff, NHG aims to provide care that is patient-centric, accessible, seamless, comprehensive, appropriate and cost-effective.

column1: <div>

column2:
As the Regional Health System (RHS) for Central Singapore, it is vital for NHG to partner and collaborate with stakeholders, community advisors, and voluntary welfare organisations. Together with our patients, their families and caregivers, we aim to deliver integrated healthcare services and programmes that help in Adding Years of Healthy Life to all concerned.","Job Purpose
Support the Group Chief Clinical Informatics Officer (GCCIO) and Group Clinical Informatics (GOCI) in the development and implementation of clinical informatics & analytics related applications and solutions in the electronic medical records (EMR) system. The Principal Clinical Informatics Analyst shall assist the Specialist Principal Clinical Informatics Analyst in coordinating with IT partners and disciplines across the NHG institutions to manage and deliver the systems, and governance processes that facilitate the optimal delivery of patient care and the conduct of research.

MAJOR DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Programme Management/Delivery

Be involved in programme management work areas including but not limited to conducting requirements analysis, functional testing, solution implementation, end-user training and coordinating with appointed IT partners for on-going support to NHG users, specifically in the area of data science & analytics for the Electronic Medical Records (EMR). These include:

  • Work on real world big healthcare data to develop AI/prediction models for patient risk stratification, disease prognosis, treatment recommendation, healthcare services delivery etc.

  • Implement and deploy AI/prediction models in EMR to integrate with application workflows to support real time patient care and health services delivery.

  • Develop and implement other clinical data solutions like reports and dashboards in EMR to facilitate daily patient and operations management.

Engage internal/external stakeholders (senior management, clinicians, pharmacists and other healthcare professionals etc.) regularly to understand day to day operations, business needs and system needs and recommend appropriate solutions to add value to healthcare.  

Work with IT engineers and health care professionals to formulate strategies on the development and maintenance of an effective and efficient EMR system to continuously improve quality of care, patient outcomes, and safety.

Establish programme governance by defining and monitoring a management framework to support decisions made within the analytics group.

Guide S/CIA in providing administrative and secretariat support for project and workgroup meetings.

Process Engineering

Identify and implement process improvements within and across Functional Groups and/or respective programmes. Processes include business processes and programme delivery processes.

Identify opportunities for continuous process improvement.


Product Value Creation

Draft product blueprint and conduct periodic product review with the analytics group.

Guide workflow design, complete some content build and testing of the system.

Explore machine learning algorithms, deep learning, NLP or other big data analytics relevant to the businesses.

Other duties directed by GCCIO and the office of Group Clinical Informatics.

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education/Training/Experience

  • M.S. or Ph.D. degree in IT/Quantitative Sciences - Data Science, Medical Informatics, Mathematics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Computational Science or related fields Preferably a tertiary degree from a recognized university in IT.

  • Solid experience with programming and scripting skills (Python, R, SQL or AWS cloud computing).

  • Preferably at least 8-10 years of relevant working experience with project/programme management pertaining to data analytics in a healthcare/healthcare IT setting, with at least 3 years in a team management role.

  • Candidates with Epic Cogito certification, and/or with experience in deep learning, NLP or other big data analytics are preferred.

(b)  Personal Attributes
  • Excellent organizational, people management and communication skills, with attention to details.

  • Ability to initiate, deliver and drive to complete projects with minimal supervision

  • Ability to work effectively as an individual as well as in a team

  • Ability to work on complex issues simultaneously.

column3: 200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.
Our services extend across five core categories:
• Multimodal Transport
• Customs and Regulatory Compliance
• Logistics
• Global Supply Chain
• Industrial Projects

Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years in delivering robust solutions with complete visibility tailored to specific industry needs in:
• Aerospace
• Automotive
• Fragrances & Flavors
• Healthcare
• High End Retail
• High-Tech & Telecom
• Mining
• Oil & Gas
• Perfumes & Cosmetics
• Power Technologies

Corporate responsibility and sustainability is at the heart of Bolloré Logistics’ culture. We adopt a pro-active approach to introduce sustainable development and social responsibility in every partnership we build. We are also committed to ensure the health and safety of our employees and subcontractors by making Ethics & Compliance a prerequisite in all business activities.

","
Job Summary:
The incumbent will be part of a larger team within the Innovation department in providing seamless and customerfocused solutions to support the achievement of business objectives.
Job Responsibilities:
  • Able to understand business requirements, design schemas, and implement them.
  • Work with the data team to develop & maintain scalable, reliable and test-driven data pipelines to collateand store data from multiple sources. This data will serve as the single source of truth for all analytical and engineering needs - generating analytic reports, decision making, data science etc.
  • Develop and promote org wide data definition layer consisting of data dictionaries, and establish a complete metadata management specification and index system;
  • Build data quality system and complete data monitoring/verification process and root cause analysis of data issues.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements and tools to automate data processing and ensure data integrity while meeting data security standards
  • Sort out the company's data assets, and establish the value of data services in product building;
  • Build tools for better discovery and consumption of data for various consumption models in the organization – Data Marts, Warehouses, APIs, Adhoc Data explorations
  • Work with various business teams to support applications through the support of data tools and processes
  • Promote good data governance practices and security initiatives.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards in Tableau
  • Keep up to date with available relevant technologies, to solve business problems
Job Requirements:
  • Possess 3-5 years of experience in Data Engineering (e.g. data modeling, data pipeline, data architecture, ETL Reverse ETL).
  • Extensive experience in SQL, Python or other scripting languages. Comfortable in deploying scripts and familiar with data management / ETL tools.
  • Experience with Talend is a plus
  • Experience with Cloud technologies (Azure) is a plus
  • Advocate of data value exploration and application in business decisions, have strong business understanding and abstraction ability
  • Good at analytical thinking, have good communication skills and problem-solving skills;
  • You are open to exploring new territories. You would need to collaborate with different business stakeholders to identify their needs and support their analytics requirements.
  • Good interpersonal skills and good team player.
  • Highly organized, self-motivated, pro-active, flexible and able to plan
  • Attention to details, a self-starter and self-learner continuously keeping up to date with industry developments
  • Creative problem solver and ability to think out of the box
  • Good communication and presentation skills
Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.

Due to the current COVID-19 situation and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we will be prioritizing candidates who are currently based in Singapore and do not require relocation. We will be reviewing the pandemic situation and will adjust our position in accordance and adherence to local authority.

We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in Bollore Logistics Singapore.

135,data,/en/job/avp-senior-associate-analytics-lead-%7C-customer-operations-co-wd26978-9409743,9409743,"AVP/Senior Associate, Analytics Lead | Customer Operations (CO) (WD26978)",False,False,,,SGD,DBS Bank Limited,5 hours ago,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
AVP/Senior Associate, Analytics Lead - Customer Operations (CO) , Customer Centre, Technology & Operations - (WD26978)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
About the role
Anchored within the SG Customer Centre, agenda of Customer Operations (CO) is to drive optimized customer journeys, by reducing journey breaks and deploying customer interception strategies through a data-driven proactive & predictive servicing framework. The Analytics Lead will oversee the analytical arm supporting CO, responsible for partnering multiple cross-functional teams and stakeholders (spanning across business and technology) to drive business outcomes through a data-driven and experimentation-based approach. The individual will lead and develop a team of data science analysts, to effectively run data science deliverables and to provide thought leadership on advanced analytics. Focus will be to leverage on in-house data science capabilities and design for real-time experimentation to drive better customer journeys and optimizing the customer's experience across our digital touchpoints. The lead will support the Business Analytics Manager in a deputy role, to oversee and guide the wider team, supporting the team in driving key analytical projects and outcomes. This is a role that span four domains of skills: statistical/mathematical reasoning, business knowledge/acumen, programming and managerial skills.
Responsibilities
  • Lead a team of Data Science Analysts to work in a cross-functional AGILE manner with stakeholders in defining problem statements, collecting data and building analytical models to make suitable recommendations to drive business targets under Customer Operations (CO)
  • Overseeing and leading the wider CCTR Analytics Team, supporting key functional stakeholders within SG Customer Centre through data analysis and having an overview of the team's data infrastructure and pipeline
  • Partnering working teams closely to design experiments through use of data and iterate towards the targeted business outcomes
  • Effectively bridge the gap between business needs and data science capabilities - to identify areas of opportunities, leveraging on real-time analytics to shape stronger intervention strategies in achieving our digital outcomes.
  • Provide thought leadership based on current business and industry trends in advanced analytics, and to scale the team's data science and modelling capabilities
  • Oversee and assess the effectiveness and accuracy of data models, better improve and scale-up our current Hyper-Personalization solutions
  • Lead the team to apply statistical approaches and proactively identify meaningful insights through exploratory data analysis, and to present/share results of the data analysis with the squad members in an easily digestible format
  • Work with stakeholders to measure and report on business outcomes; routinely communicate findings, trends, recommendations and other key indicators to leadership
  • Design and build automated reporting dashboards on our data visualization platforms
  • Be a catalyst for creating a culture of experimentation (test, learn, scale) to drive growth
  • Facilitate sharing of knowledge within CCTR Analytics Team
Requirements
  • Minimum University degree in mathematics, applied statistics, data mining, machine learning, computing or related quantitative discipline with a strong background in statistical concepts and calculations
  • Preferably at least 6-8 years of experience in a business/data analyst function or in building statistical data model sets
  • Good understanding of advanced statistical techniques and predictive modelling concepts, machine learning approaches, NLP concepts, and recommendation and optimization algorithms
  • Proven track record in delivering outcomes even in a complex environment 
  • Strong working experience in the following:
    • Python, Pyspark, Spark SQL, MySQL

    • Hadoop eco-system (Hive, HDFS, Pig etc.)

    • End to end data science workflow experience, starting from data extraction, wrangling, modelling and deployment in production environment
  • Experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis, using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
  • Preferably to have some knowledge/experience in development of data science projects
  • Good to have related experience in process improvements, AGILE methodologies, project management and leading change management
  • Business Knowledge or prior experience in the consumer banking/customer centre area would be advantageous
Core Competencies
  • Strong leadership capability and highly adaptable with a strong appetite for challenges
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a multi-disciplinary team.
  • Good Business Acumen/Knowledge to prioritize business needs & promote effective analysis for respective stakeholders
  • Ability to see beyond the parameters of a single project to identify patterns, risks, trends and strategic context more broadly within the organization
  • Comfortable working in a fast paced, hypothesis driven, collaborative, and iterative engineering environment
  • Comfortable deconstructing complex/open-ended problems which may not yield a clear-cut solution
  • Meticulous, structured and systematic individual with an eye for detail and possessing good organizational capabilities
  • Integrity and maturity to manage the sensitivity of data
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with good analytical and problem-solving skills
Technical Competencies
  • SQL Coding Expertise
  • Excellent working knowledge with programming languages such as SQL, R, Python
  • Mathematical/Statistical Knowledge (Basic Statistics and Relational Studies including ANOVA, Chi-Square, Clustering etc; Machine Learning & Predictive Algorithms expertise would be an advantage)
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Qlikview/Tableau will be advantageous
  • General proficiency in MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint)
  • Knowledge of data science techniques and technologies with adequate understanding of details associated with each (e.g. data instrumentation and acquisition, overfitting/underfitting, model refresh, etc.)
  • Familiar with machine learning framework and different tasks performed during the modelling process
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
