138,data,/en/job/svp-data-scientist-human-capital-analytics-group-human-resources-%5Bwd27246%5D-9406015,9406015,"SVP, Data Scientist, Human Capital Analytics, Group Human Resources [WD27246]",False,False,,,SGD,DBS Bank Limited,23-Mar-22,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Business Function
  • Group Human Resources has the important role of attracting, retaining, and nurturing talent to ensure that DBS continues to be a competitive employer in Asia. With a well-established team of HR partners, we support and deliver effective people-based solutions and services across businesses.
  • Our goal is to build a high-performance organisation by empowering and engaging our employees. Because we believe that banking is about people.
  • At DBS, data drives all of our decision-making, and Group Human Resources organisation is no exception.
  • We have been redefining human resources in the way we work closely with our management teams to attract, hire, develop and reward talented people that is reinventing the HR practice. 
  • The Human Capital Analytics team acts as an integral innovation lab, using diagnostic, advanced analytical approaches to making DBS a joyful place to come work, and is focused on bringing this discipline to the next level.
  • The team provides critical support to the business through surfacing people operation opportunities and solving challenges around organizational health, whereby we are not just taking the pulse of our people, but also harnessing their feedback to drive change for the better.
  • As a data-loving member of the team, you will use data, research and analytical insights to both build new and improve existing experimental Career Development, Learning and Talent Management activities.
  • Our Data Scientists in Human Capital Analytics are changing the way we design our employee journey through experimentations.
  • What we will love about you is that you are detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. Not only that, you are an exceptional problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who identifies the 'So what?' from data and insights you will be diving deep into, often wonders about the ""What if?"" and then seeks out the solution.
  • We are looking for someone who excels at diagnosing clients' needs and finding a way to satisfy them, has strong presentation skills and can lead a team to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Leaders in Data Science can see the different angles of a business opportunity or challenge, and you know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions.
  • You have substantial leadership and hands-on experience with analytical tools and techniques, and you bring a solid skillset in analysing data and communicating recommendations.
  • You will leverage best practices and deepen your skillset by working with analytical thought leaders at the bank. In this role, you will develop HR domain knowledge and serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using a combination of facts, data and advanced analytical approaches to derive at informed, meaningful insights to help them make thoughtful, data-driven decisions.
Responsibilities 
You will lead a team of Data Scientists, and work with Business Intelligence Developers, Visualisation and Insights experts who partner with HR business partners and specialists to assess human capital needs and identify opportunities to apply data analytics.-    Define analytical strategy, problem statements and hypotheses to address identified opportunities, including analytical approaches, data and technology requirements
  • Develop predictive models and perform statistical analyses to identify key areas of risk and predict risk events, across a range of banking functions
  • Design and put in place tracking and feedback mechanisms to allow for capturing of actions and impact on business outcomes due to the implementation of analytics solutions
  • Present key findings to senior management and/or other stakeholders with actionable recommendations
  • Work with other data scientists and data translators to drive and operationalize analytical outputs.
 Requirements   
  • 10+ years of hands-on working experience, and of which, at least 8 years of relevant experience in an analytical function building and implementing various statistical models, working with large amounts of data and articulating business questions, data extraction and use of statistical approaches to arrive at an answer.
  • Mathematical problem formulation skills.
  • Deep understanding of mathematical and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning (ML) modeling techniques. An ability to translate business problems into mathematical formulations. Proficient with data manipulation and analysis. Ability to approach data in creative ways and from different angles for use in predictive and prescriptive modeling.
  • Experience in building and operationalizing the analytical capability.
  • Programming experience in R, Python, Spark or other statistical software. Proficient in SQL. Proficient with Hadoop, Java, Python, SQL, Hive, and/or MariaDB.
  • Experience working with unstructured datasets with knowledge in text mining and text analysis is preferred.Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends and applied knowledge of statistics, measurement and model evaluation.
  • Distinctive problem solving skills and impeccable business judgment.
  • Capable of translating complex modeling and analysis results into recommendations in a manner accessible by non-statisticians. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Experience working in a horizontal/cross-functional organization.
  • Independent self-starter with ability to multi-task and has a 'can-do' attitude.
Note: Candidates with lesser experience may be considered for a lower level position.
Apply Now
  • We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements.

139,data,/en/job/reporting-manager-lead-crm-9312454,9312454,Reporting Manager /Lead (CRM),False,False,,,SGD,JobStreet,22-Mar-22,False,,,199904130N,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: <div>

column4: SEEK has evolved from being a domestic online employment classifieds business, to the largest global online marketplace, operating in 19 countries. Our reach includes Australia, New Zealand, China, Brazil, Mexico, South East Asia, Southern Africa, India and Bangladesh.

column3: <div>

column4: Founded in Melbourne, Australia in 1997, there are now over 6,000 people working for SEEK globally. We believe the key to our success is creating a work environment which is challenging, rewarding and inclusive.

column3: <div>

column4: We are committed to making a difference to our community as well as to our company.

column3: <div>

column4: SEEK’s strategy is to match more candidates to opportunities than anyone else through using its marketplace scale to build a radically more efficient and effective marketplace.

column3: <div>

column4: A cornerstone of SEEK’s growth since its inception has been the quality of its people, its award winning culture and strong commitment to its values. This will continue to be at the core of ongoing success and growth for SEEK in all locations.

column3: <div>

column4: Formed from the recent merger of the two leading portals in the region, JobStreet.com and jobsDB, SEEK’s Asian operation now employs 1,500 people operating across 7 countries in South East Asian countries. Operating across 7 countries in South East Asian countries, it now has ambitious growth plans that includes expanding its product set and customer base. To support this, we are transforming our sales and service organization including moving to a more solution based selling approach, increasing use of digital channels and becoming more data driven.

column1:
","

The Role

One of the significant transformation programs that SEEK is undertaking is the Asia CRM project. The Asia CRM project is focused on replacing SEEK Asia’s custom CRM systems with Salesforce, aligning to the existing implementation in Australia and New Zealand. A key objective of the Asia CRM project is to have all client data integrated and available through one central platform, so SEEK can become more efficient in how it manages multi-functional relationships with its customers, and more sophisticated and targeted in how it engages and delivers insights. This is a large-scale transformation, which has change implications across the entire business.

Given the scale and complexity of change involved, the project has identified the need for an experienced Reporting Lead dedicated to deliver on the project’s reporting needs for the next 18-24 months. This person will play a key role in requirements gathering, reporting analysis and subsequently the design and implementation phases.

You will have an in-depth understanding of Salesforce and CRM systems and extensive experience across enterprise application design, development and support. Prior experience with Salesforce or similar CRM systems as well as exposure to AWS (or similar cloud platforms) in a complex enterprise environment will be highly regarded.

As part of a multi-disciplinary Agile delivery team you will be involved in systems analysis, process design, stakeholder management and vendor engagement. You will facilitate all stages of planning as well as successful execution of the transformation across Sales, Service and Billing by collaborating with business users and technical resources.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement reporting governance frameworks and processes to ensure reporting quality standards are met. Data and reporting quality accuracy, relevance and availability are key success criteria.
  • Be an advocate for the Salesforce CRM system within the organisation and promote its expanded use as a means of capturing deeper data & insights
  • Lead and manage resources to gathering reporting requirements and design future state reports
  • Understand the data landscape and ensure platform integrations support master data governance principles/best practice.
  • Ensure data hierarchies are set up to support CRM Master Data, Reporting and business practicesCollaborate with the Architecture Teams across SEEK to ensure the recommended Salesforce CRM solution architecture (including integration) is well considered and appropriate.
  • Facilitate workshops for requirements gathering, produce stories that articulate the business rules for cleansing, transforming and reporting
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of standards, procedures and processes to promote and maintain data and reporting quality
  • Harmonise the catalogue of Sales, Service and Billing reports across AsiaTranslate new and existing reporting requirements into actionable requirements for delivery via CRM, business intelligence applications and tools Improve business operation reporting by conducting data & reporting analysis and recommending changes in data and reporting
  • Ensure the right technology team members are sourced and available to deliver to program timelines.
  • Maintain ongoing collaboration and planning with relevant stakeholders to effectively manage resources and dependencies.
  • Drive clear communication and status reporting to inform project planning and resourcing requirements as well as managing expectations for broader stakeholder groups.
  • Lead a productive, empowered, high performance team-driven environment to enable the project team to perform to the best of their ability.
  • Resolve issues and mitigate risks through effective collaboration and negotiation with the project team and stakeholders.
  • Drive a continuous improvement culture in delivery stream through regular retrospectives, as well as ongoing practice and process adjustments.
  • Share knowledge with other project and business teams to ensure learnings and improvements are implemented throughout the wider SEEK business. 

So, what are we looking for?

  • Proven experience in managing successful reporting and analytics solutions
  • Demonstrated ability to co-ordinate business and technical teams and managing vendors in large scale complex landscape
  • End-to-end delivery of operational and management reporting across a CRM implementation
  • Hands on experience with reporting tools
  • Expert knowledge and experience in executing reporting and data projects
  • Experience and understanding of cloud services and applications (specifically AWS) is highly desirable
  • Manage delivery teams in line with This is SEEK and principles ensuring consistent delivery processes.Experience in maintaining and developing all required documentation, including design documents, standards, processes and procedures.
  • Demonstrated experience working in an Agile software development environment
  • Demonstrated experience liaising with subject matter experts, understanding of reporting processes, developing operational reports and reconciliation reports to enable business reporting self-service
  • Experience in working closely with business representatives and business analysts to seek clarity on reporting requirements and define reports standards
  • Experience in conducting workshops with business and technical audience
  • Excellent judgement and decision making skills.
  • Exhibit strong emotional intelligence skills.
  • Ability to build effective relationships and deliver exceptional service to both internal & external key stakeholders.
  • Well-developed interpersonal and leadership skills, including the ability to influence and drive productive development teams and business stakeholders at all levels.
  • Proactively build and leverage strong and extensive network of key relationships across SEEK.
  • Ability to challenge the status quo.
  • Strong reporting and presentation skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to quickly breakdown problems and find innovative solutions.
  • An ability to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment.
  • Experience with Salesforce reporting and analytics would be advantageous, however certainly not mandatory
  • Successful record of meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Great time management, prioritisation and follow-up skills.

Additional Information

At SEEK, the health and safety of our people is our highest priority. For this reason, SEEK has introduced a policy requiring all employees and visitors to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 within our offices, unless a formal medical exemption applies. In addition, all employees attending in-person work related meetings or events outside the office will also need to be fully vaccinated. We have chosen to share this information early in our hiring process, so that candidates can make an informed choice. On this basis, as part of the application process you will be asked to confirm that you have read and understood this policy, and would like to continue with the hiring process. Further details about this policy will be shared during the hiring process, as required.

Senior Associate / Associate, Data Scientist, Analytics Centre of Excellence, Group Transformation - (WD31203)
Business Function:
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play. We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! 
Job Purpose:
Deliver data science analysis to support business decisions for various business and support units of the bank. Develop advanced machine learning components to be included in innovative applications by creating prototypes. Develop solutions based on advanced analytics, leveraging internal data sources and external data assets.
Responsibilities:
Build machine learning solutions to solve various business questions.
  • Perform ad-hoc exploratory statistics and data mining tasks on diverse datasets from small scale to big data
  • Select features, build and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • Perform data wrangling and feature engineering
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
  • Extend company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
  • Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
  • Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
  • Carry out ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear manner
Maintain cutting edge in data science
  • Take initiative in evaluating new approaches from data science research
  • Test new tools, platforms and packages
  • Support the programs for changing the business culture towards more data driven decision making
  • Create helper functions to automate frequently encountered wrangling and feature engineering tasks
Requirements:
  • Masters or Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or related majors.
  • 3 years of industry experience in data science/machine learning projects working in a big data environment
  • Industry experience in NLP, search, recommendation systems, time series modelling is a plus.
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Random Forests, XgBoost etc.
  • Familiar with sklearn
  • Highly proficient with data wrangling and feature engineering
  • Familiar with programming tools such as Spark, Python and SQL.
  • Great communication and presentation skills
  • Data-oriented personalityand able to multi-task
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2: A brand leader in leisure, hospitality and integrated resort developments worldwide, Genting Singapore Limited (“GENS”) is one of the largest public listed companies on the main board of the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: With more than 30 years of destination building experience in Australia, the Bahamas, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore and the United Kingdom, GENS is best known for the award-winning flagship project, Resorts World™ Sentosa in Singapore, one of the largest fully integrated destination resorts in South East Asia.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
GENS is a constituent stock of the FTSE Straits Times Index and MSCI Singapore Free Index and Nikkei Asia 300 Investible Index.","
Responsibilities
  • Support the Internal Audit department to incorporate data analytics into financial, operation, compliance and technology audits within the departmental and professional standards using risk-based audit approach.
  • Verify the integrity of the audit data mart to ensure the completeness / accuracy before developing the required scripts / reports.
  • Develop exception-based scripts / query reports to facilitate the team in their conduct of audits and/or investigations in identifying outliers / anomalies / trends.
  • Create structured and meaningful insights to identify red flags / areas of improvements / detect potential fraud.
  • Ability to communicate effectively to the team during the conclusion of the work.
  • Key data analytics champion for the team to promote the usage of data analytics techniques consistently and enhance data analytics skills of the team members continuously.
  • Identify opportunities for advanced data analytics, robotic process automation, AI and Machine Learning to support continuous auditing and auditing initiatives.
Requirements
  • Diploma/ Degree in Business, IT, Computer Science, Engineering or any equivalent discipline with additional recognised diploma in analytics.
  • 1 years of relevant full time experience as a data scientist / data analyst. Experience in applying data analytics for audit / compliance  / hospitality / gaming industry will be of added advantage.
  • Strong experience in using Python, R, SQL, Microsoft Office Suite or similar software.
  • Experience with data visualisation tools, such as Tableau, Power BI and Qlikview.
  • Able to work independently in handling, cleansing and conducting analysis on large and complex data sets from various business processes and systems.
  • Self-motivated, eager to learn and stay up-to-date on the latest trends and technologies.
  • Good written, analytical, communication and presentation skills.

AVP / Senior Associate, Data Engineer, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (2100009H)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. 
Responsibilities
  • Design and build from scratch for enterprise observability infrastructure
  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline.
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing Jobs/code for greater scalability, etc.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Product owner, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
  • Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Requirements
  • Working SQL knowledge and experience working with RDBMS, NoSQL DB and Time-Series Database
  • Experience with Kubernetes and Python programming language
  • Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, Jobs and data sets.
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Strong analytic skills related to working with structured and unstructured datasets.
  • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
  • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.
  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
  • We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a Data or Software Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools:
    • ELK, Kafka & Grafana

    • Relational SQL and Time-Series databases, such as MariaDB and InfluxDB

    • Data pipeline and workflow management tools: Airflow, Nifi, etc.

    • Stream-processing systems: Spark-Streaming, Flink etc.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Since inception, Avensys has helped clients use IT more efficiently to improve their operations and profitability, focus on core competencies and achieve business results such as increased agility, innovation and profitable growth. Our in-depth technical knowledge coupled with industry experience and our unique methodologies enable us to successfully deliver and meet our customer’s expectations.","
Job Description
Avensys is a reputed global IT professional services company headquartered in Singapore. Our service spectrum includes enterprise solution consulting, business intelligence, business process automation and managed services. Given our decade of success, we have evolved to become one of the top trusted providers in Singapore and service a client base across banking and financial services, insurance, information technology, healthcare, retail and supply chain.
We are currently looking to hire Data Engineer who has proven track record in IT Industry. This is an exciting opportunity to expand your skill set, achieve job satisfaction and work-life balance. More details as below.
Data Engineer
Responsibilities:
• Design & Architecture: You help to design and implement an optimal data pipeline architecture for the client’s analytics system.
• Identify, design, and implement improvements to automate manual processes, optimize speed and efficiency of data delivery, architecting and designing for high availability, scaling, and reliability.
• Architect and design infrastructure to facilitate data extraction, transformation, export, and query of data from a variety of data sources, both internal and external, both small and large.
Massive data: You will source / examine, analyze, engineer data pipelines for gigabytes/terabytes of structured and unstructured data with our platform to create value for customers. You will also be working with Enterprise data.
Requirements:
• Bachelor's / Master's in Information Technology / Computer Science, or related degree AND you have a strong ethos of continuous learning.
• You have 11+ years of professional software development experience in multiple programming languages, including modern virtual-machine languages such as Java, as well as common scripting and glue languages such as Python and version control (git), with good analytical & debugging skills.
• Experience performing root-cause analysis on bugs and performance problems in distributed systems, including network and source-level debugging.
• Big data: You have extensive experience with data analytics and working knowledge of big data infrastructure such as Google Cloud, Big Query, Data Flow, Hadoop Eco System, HDFS, Apache Storm, Apache Spark. You've routinely built data pipelines with gigabytes/terabytes of data and understand the challenges of manipulating such large datasets.
• Cloud Exposure: Strong experience implementing systems and applications using distributed and cloud infrastructure. GCP preferred, but AWS or Azure are also okay.
• Data Modeling: Flair for data, schema, data model, PL/SQL, Star & snowflake schema, how to bring efficiency in data modeling for efficient querying data for analysis, understands criticality TDD and develops data validation techniques. Working knowledge of distributed relational and tabular data stores, message queues, stream processing facilities, and other scalable big-data platform technologies.
WHAT’S ON OFFER:
You will be remunerated with an excellent base salary and entitled to attractive company benefits. Additionally, you will get the opportunity to enjoy a fun and collaborative work environment, alongside a strong career progression
To submit your application, please apply online or email your UPDATED CV in Microsoft Word format to seema@aven-sys.com Your interest will be treated with strict confidentiality.

CONSULTANT DETAILS:
Consultant Name : Seema Verma
Avensys Consulting Pte Ltd
EA Licence 12C5759

Privacy Statement: Data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Personal data provided will be used strictly in accordance with the relevant data protection law and Avensys' privacy policy.

column1:
","
SVP / VP, Data Architecture / Data Management - Product Owner, Transformation Group - (WD25395)

Business Function
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! 
Responsibilities
As a specialist in Data Architecture and Data Management in the DBS Data Platform Business team, you will drive the definition of relevant practices and adoption of best-in-class solutions to drive adherence to the bank standards and empower data producers/consumers to deliver greater business outcomes with the Data Platform.
  • Define data management principles and guidelines for the various patterns of usage of DBS Data Platform, covering areas such as business data architecture, metadata, data security, data quality and reference data.
  • Govern adherence to data management principles by project implementation teams and components of the data platform.
  • Function as a Product Owner to operationalise data management principles and other data management initiatives, defining requirements and collaborating with Technology teams to implement solutions and embed them into the data delivery lifecycle.
  • Identify areas of improvements and explore opportunities to adopt emerging data management practices and technologies, experimenting solutions and developing business cases to open the way for effective adoption.
  • Contribute to shape the future of DBS Data Platform, engage with stakeholders across the organisation to develop forward-thinking approaches and solutions.
Requirements
  • At least 10 years of experience in related fields including at least 5 years in data architecture/data management roles. Experience in banking industry would be an advantage.
  • Broad exposure to data architecture/data management practices and challenges involved in building modern data and analytics platforms, in areas such as metadata, reference data, data security, data quality.
  • Experience in a product ownership or product management role, excellent project leadership and execution skills: set up a vision and strategy, define requirements and priorities (user stories), coordinate with stakeholders and manage expectations, manage planning and risks, drive adoption of solutions etc.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, proficient in PowerPoint & Excel, clear ability to articulate messages and develop presentations for senior management.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Business Function

As business analyst in Future of Work (FoW) you will work together with various business units to build the best workplace and deliver best employee experience within the bank. You will take care of data analytics, visualisation and reporting for on-going employee experience enhancement initiatives. We'll require your regular engagement with relevant business stakeholders and work closely with the technology delivery teams, to ensure timeliness and quality of the delivery of data, model, and business insights.
Responsibilities:
  • Conduct strategic data analysis on employee experience, identify area for improvement and make strategic recommendations to executive and senior management, develop data stories that clearly communicate complex analysis, models and ideas
  • Work closely with technology team to analyse, formulise and source in the needed data to address business problem and provide valuable insights
  • Design and execute primary research like bank wide surveys to collect perceptive employee data, feedback and insights
  • Maximize data capabilities focusing on employee science in areas such as predictive/ prescriptive/ text analytics
  • Develop and maintain business dashboards with Tableau and other visualisation tools to support regular business reporting, data storytelling and data driven enhancements
  • Perform exploratory statistics and data mining tasks on diverse datasets from small scale to 'big data'
Requirements:
  • Degree (and above) in Information technology, Computer science, Statistics, Applied mathematics, Business analytics, or equivalent quantitative fields preferred
  • 5-8 years' experience in business analytics, modelling and data visualisation, preferably with exposure to technology projects within banking industry
  • Exposure in data mining and machine learning on large amount of data, building and implementing various statistical models. And/or with demonstrated track record of insight generation and implementation of insights into tools/processes delivering results
  • Experience in NLP models and other text analytic models is big plus
  • Proficient in Tableau dashboard development and access control
  • Hands on experience with CDSW or DBS ADA environment is big plus
  • Quick learner on new analytics tools
  • Self-motivated and a desire to learn and develop professionally
  • Contribute towards team building and maintaining team morale
  • Good communication skills (both oral and written)
  • Ability to work in a team and under pressure
Required skillsets
  • Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL, R
  • Strong knowledge in data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau)
  • Proficient in Microsoft applications like Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint
Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

152,data,/en/job/data-security-senior-engineer-9312818,9312818,Data Security Senior Engineer,False,False,8000,15000,SGD,Roadget Business PTE. LTD.,11 hours ago,False,,,201939698G,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"

Founded in 2012, SHEIN is a leading brand platform for global fast fashion E-commerce, with operations in Guangzhou, Singapore and Los Angeles, along with other key markets. SHEIN reaches consumers across more than 150 countries and regions around the world. 

We place a premium on choice, delivering more than 6,000 new fashion, beauty and lifestyle products daily with more than 600,000 items available. Our mission is to help people express their individuality through the latest trends that are accessible and affordable. To learn more about SHEIN, follow us at shein.com, instagram.com/sheinofficial and youtube.com/shein.

","

Job Responsibilities

1. Follow up national and industry regulations, policies and related standards such as data security and personal privacy, and build regulatory compliance programs and rules to ensure business compliance and smooth operation.

2. Improve the company's privacy protection systems, processes, and technical systems, carry out privacy compliance communication and training, risk identification, business improvement, and post-event evaluation for the companies’ international business, and promote the development of data privacy protection tools.

3. Establish a good communication and collaboration mechanism, provide privacy compliance consulting for business departments, and promote the formulation and implementation of data governance implementation plans, and support various data and privacy related reviews and certifications.

4. Cooperate with other team members to jointly establish data management workflow, specifications and methods.

5. Responsible for leading the design and writing of overall technical solutions for data security, as well as the design of some landing products.

6. Responsible for the overall plan design of the company's big data governance (metadata, data standards, data quality, data security, data asset catalog, etc.).

7. Participate in the security audit of the company's external data export, monitoring of data security risks and handling emergency response to security incidents.

8. Responsible for the monitoring, process optimization and promotion of data leakage prevention;

Job Requirements

1. At least three years of experience in personal information protection, cross-border data, privacy risk operations, etc., and understand relevant laws and regulations.

2. Good business perception and understanding of risk identification, analysis, research and judgment, management and control, and relevant experience in Internet industry is preferred.

3. Familiar with and studied data security life cycle, data governance, personal privacy protection, GDPR, big data security, DSMM is preferred.

4. Master data governance related methods and knowledge, understand data quality management, data standard management, enterprise-level data modeling, master data management and other methods.

5. Familiar with the development of big data security and network security industry at home and abroad.

6. Have good inter-organizational coordination skills and team awareness, as well as communication skills and self-driven mindset.

153,data,/en/job/product-analyst-9353283,9353283,Product Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,Carro Singapore,21-Mar-22,False,,9 days,201525411C,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:center"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.

Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.

Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee.
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace

Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.

In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.

","

Singapore's No 1 fastest-growing company in 2021 is looking for a Product Analyst. We’re looking for analysts to harvest insights, and build a competitive advantage using predictive data to improve every aspect of our business, including our pricing strategies, demand and supply matching efficiencies, and operational excellence.

You will have ownership over important project areas that include defining the roadmap of product analytics. You will partner closely with Engineering, Product, Design and other stakeholders to help us make better data-driven decisions about our products.

What you will be doing:

  • Determine what needs to be tracked and measured. You will be responsible for tracking user interactions and clickstream data to understand customer behaviour
  • Evaluate and define product and business KPIs and metrics along with Product Managers and Product Designers
  • Democratize data by building customized dashboards & reports for relevant stakeholders
  • Offer deep dive analysis to key stakeholders across all teams and products, in order to determine product features and UX optimization strategies
  • Combined with the performance of product data, support the design of data strategy, data products, user portraits and other related data modules.
  • Analyse usage, conversion, adoption and retention data and share actionable insights across all the product teams
  • Explore and extract insights from dataset of car users and vehicle data, including behavioural, economic, and interaction of supply and demand on ours, and our partners' platforms across SEA
Requirements

What you will need:

  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or quantitative discipline
  • At least 3 years of professional experience in a similar role or quantitative/analytical field in the technology space (e.g. product analytics, data science, performance marketing, growth analytics, etc)
  • Excellent analytical and modelling skills, ideally with considerable proficiency in data analysis languages such as R, Python, and database SQL
  • Proven experience in using data to drive product development and decision-making, preferably working directly with engineers and a wider cross-functional product teams.
  • Experience with Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics and web analytics
  • Experience with creating dashboards and visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Google Data Studio, Looker and etc
  • Experience with tools such as Rudderstack is highly preferred

column1:
","
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for developing technical data solutions to solve business problems.  This usually begins with defining, analysing, and documenting the requirements.  Managing requirements at the project level can help fulfil business needs. Solutions often include a software-systems development component, but may also consist of process improvement, organizational change or strategic planning and policy development.   
The candidate should value simplicity and impact, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and have the ability and desire to learn.  Candidate also require having greater flexibility, greater discipline, and the willingness to work in an evolutionary manner.
Roles & Responsibilities
  • Work with business stakeholders on solution requirement including mapping business process, establishing project scope and goals.
  • Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure requirements are clear and delivered successfully.
  • Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure solution design is optimized for efficiency.
  • Facilitate conflict resolution and be able to influence business and technical stakeholders towards a common objective.
  • Develop, execute and manage the project plan, and take corrective actions when project deviates from plan.
  • Coordinate with business and technical stakeholders to ensure smooth cutover during schedule releases.
  • Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues.
  • Initiate User Requests (Request for Service) for enhancements on behalf of the business
  • Bridge the communication between the development team and business stakeholders, by providing the details explaining the requirements to the team.
  • To identify stakeholder needs, negotiate priorities between repeating stakeholder factions, and then collaborate with developers to ensure that the requirements are implemented effectively. 
  • Advise during the business development life cycle by serving as a domain expert to help identify and qualify business priorities.
  • Provide clarity in business requirement to allow developers to provision estimates, and serve to represent stakeholders, to provide business priorities
Requirements
  • At least 5-7 years + of development or system design working experience
  • Significant and solid understanding of software development life cycle
  • Significant and demonstrable experience of ability to identify the business needs of stakeholders who will be impacted by the change and understand their influence and authority. 
  • Significant and demonstrable experience in facilitation skills for requirement workshop planning, ability to manage requirements during requirement change management. 
  • Significant and demonstrate experience to understand conduct interface analysis, the understanding of technology infrastructure and how it interconnects, including sharing data to achieve a business goal.
  • Strong analytical skills and proven ability to simplify and clearly communicate complex analytical outcomes, linkages and messages 
  • Experience in Data Modelling, Data Warehouse, ETL tools and banking functional knowledge. 
  • Guide the Development Team on building the required solution
  • Strong programming skills in SQL, Python, Pyspark, Spark SQL, MySQL
  • Experience in Hadoop eco-system (Hive, HDFS, Pig etc.)
  • Familiar with Data storytelling
  • Experience/Exposure in dashboarding tools like Qlikview or Tableau preferred.
  • Experience in working with agile software development methodologies and tools (Jira, Confluence)
  • Experience in working with multi location teams will be an added advantage
  • Team Player with ability to work independently around tight deadlines and able to prioritise and multi-task in a dynamic, fast-paced environment 
  • Data science workflow exposure
  • Cloud pipelines (AWS or Google Cloud)
Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2: Resorts World Sentosa (RWS), Asia’s premium lifestyle destination resort, is located on Singapore’s resort island of Sentosa. Spanning 49 hectares, RWS is home to world-class attractions including Universal Studios Singapore, S.E.A. Aquarium, Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark. Complementing the adventure and adrenaline of its theme parks and attractions are six unique luxury hotels, the world-class Resorts World Convention Centre, a casino and the Asian flagship of a world-renowned destination spa. RWS offers award-winning dining experiences and exciting cuisines from around the world across its many renowned celebrity chef restaurants, establishing itself as a key player in Singapore’s vibrant and diverse dining scene and a leading gourmet destination in Asia for epicureans. The integrated resort also offers world-class entertainment, from original resident productions to concerts and public shows such as Lake of Dreams. RWS has been named “Best Integrated Resort” since 2011 for nine consecutive years at the TTG Travel Awards which recognises the best of Asia-Pacific’s travel industry.

Job Description
Freight Management:
  • Monitor and track freight shipments
  • Attend to BU/FF queries on freight matters including provision of expertise to BUs for special shipments (gaming machines, unique live fish shipments etc.)
  • Coordinate freight damages activities, including other freight related activities as and when required (maintenance of SOP, freight guides, sending market updates etc.)
  • Participate and work with key stakeholders in contracting of freight management.
  • Preparation of quarterly reports freight shipments reports for insurance declaration
  • Record keeping of all freight related matters (cargo permits, shipping documents)

Master Data Management:
  • Manage and work with internal and external users on other master data set-up and accuracy, including monitoring of sourcing events as and when required. (Vendor master set-up, risk assessment related issues, catalogs set-up, maintenance of master data etc.)
  • Manage and coordinate related system projects
  • Responsible for both internal and external users access to the Procurement systems and monitor their activities
  • Provide L1 Helpdesk for both internal and external users on Procurement systems and processes
  • Manage and coordinate Procurement systems related projects
  • Manage and work with internal and external users on other master data set-up and accuracy, including monitoring of sourcing events as and when required
  • Produce related Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reports to monitor and manage Procurement’s performance
  • Conduct internal audit checks on Procurement systems and processes to ensure company’s policies and procedures are adhered to accordingly
  • Undertake any other tasks assigned from time to time as maybe required in his/her role

Job Requirements
  • Diploma holder and above
  • Proactive and able to work under tight schedule
  • Meticulous and able to work independently
  • Good interpersonal and communication skill
  • Logical thinking, curiosity and analysis abilities
  • Strong awareness of quality, reliability and responsibility

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Data Management Office and Big Data Analytics function answers the demand for quality and credible data across the Group.

Data Management Office

We govern the use of data across the Group and provide guidance for data management and usage. This optimises the value of data to enable smarter, faster and more accurate decision-making as well as improve operational efficiency. Above all, we ensure adherence to all data governance standards as determined by regulators.

Big Data Analytics

We are a centralised analytics function that supports Group-wide business units and their analytical needs. We aim to establish ourselves as an analytics centre of excellence and drive analytics adoption and the utilisation of new big data technology across the Group. Our key areas of service range from business intelligence, strategic analytics to data science.

Job Responsibilities

-    Perform the role of a Test Analyst on the Enterprise Data Architecture and Governance (EDAG) Programs
-    Provide Change-the-Bank support for the existing data warehouse within the EDAG Program
-    Perform impact analysis for any changes / enhancements within the EDAG Platform
-    Provide end-to-end support on the User Acceptance Test (UAT) and its acceptance criteria
(i.e. Test Scripting, Test preparation and Test Execution)
-    Assist on the Change requests and change implementation
-    Review the changes and enhancements to the documentation (e.g. functional/ non-functional specification doc, interface file specification, mapping documents and test report)
-    Review the Data model to comply with UOB's SDM standards
-    Provide end-to-end post-implementation support to the EDAG users, from across the regional subsidiaries

Job Requirements

-    Degree in Business Computing or Computer Science or related disciplines.
-    5+ years of relevant working experience.
-    Strong knowledge of SQL tools (e.g. Teradata Studio) and familiar with banking products
-    Knowledge on Hadoop and Discovery tools (e.g. Qliksense, HUE)
-    Familiar with Metadata tools (e.g. Informatica Metadata Manager)
-    Familiar with general data architecture concepts, including data warehouse and big data technology is preferred
-    Able to work independently with stakeholders on requirements gathering or issues investigation
-    Proficient in MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint
-    Possess good analytical and problem-solving skills

Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

","
Business Function
 
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play. We are passionate and committed to making banking joyful (while having lots of fun)!
Responsibilities:
  • Work with business and tech to develop end-to-end advanced analytic solution, from problem formulation, data sourcing to develop and deploying the solution into production
  • Work with tech to continue improving the enterprise analytic platform, tooling and reusable assets
  • Work with analytic community to continue develop advanced analytic capabilities, adoption of best-in-class techniques and practices
  • Coach junior members
Requirements:
  • Advanced degree with strong focus in machine learning, data mining or statistical / mathematical modellings with deep theoretical knowledge with machine learning and statistical modelling.
  • 10+ years relevant working experience (or 5+ years’ experience for candidate holding PhD in relevant area)
  • Familiar with analytics and machine learning platforms and how it integrates with upstream and downstream data and production systems
  • Experience of working with analytics platform users to gather/understand user requirements and working with Technology team to improve analytics platform to resolve user pain points
  • Experience of managing complex and cross departments projects
  • Full stack data science experience covering end-to-end problem formulation, developing training pipeline and deploying solution to production
  • Familiar with developing machine learning pipelines following dev practice such as versioning, branching, merging, linting, testing and writing codes in structured and modularized way
  • Able to analyze business needs, articulate the solution framework including the model output, business decision and potential impact to drive the adoption of the solution
  • Solid written and oral communication skills
  • Technical skills: SQL, Python, PySpark, ML packages and tools
  • Practical experience of Cloud based analytics tools will be a plus
Apply Now
 
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.​

159,data,/en/job/data-scientist-9343266,9343266,Data Scientist,False,False,,,SGD,Singapore Pools (Private) Limited,18-Mar-22,False,,8 days,196800202G,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div>

column2:
Singapore Pools is Singapore’s legal gaming operator set up by the Ministry of Finance in 1968.  Surplus from gaming revenues are channelled through our parent, the Tote Board, to fund charitable donations and worthy causes that benefit the community in Singapore.","

We are looking for a passionate and professional Data Scientist to join our team to help us with our mission of helping us define and analyze the data across the company.

Based in Singapore and reporting into the Director, Strategy & Analytics, the Data Scientist will work on team projects and individual projects. The right candidate will have day-to-day responsibility of ensuring accuracy of data for business decisions.

However, we also recognize that each Data Scientist has a unique blend of skills. Whether your strength is in data modeling or in analytical, we want to talk to you.

What You’ll Do

  • You will identify, undertake, and implement analytics projects including formulation of use cases, gathering of data, development, implementation and maintenance of models.
  • You will be instrumental in supporting the development of Singapore Pools’ in-house analytic capabilities through the implementation of structured methodologies and creation of infrastructural capabilities to process and analyze data.
  • You will work with strategy to identify opportunities to enable the implementation and realization of the long-term strategic vision of Singapore Pools.

Who You Are

  • You will need to be a graduate or undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Statistics or Data Science.
  • You will need to have relevant work experience though it is not necessary but would be an advantage.
  • You will have working knowledge of Python/R, Pyspark, SQL and Big Data technologies.
  • You should be proficient in various statistical methods used in data sciences.
  • You should have the ability to communicate complex ideas to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • You should be familiar with machine learning techniques in CNN and RNN.

Benefits

  • Competitive salaries
  • Flexi Benefits
  • Staggered working hours
  • Medical Insurance
  • Corporate Mobile Plans

Singapore Pools welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, helping us in contributing back to the society. So, feel free to express who you are, and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us!

Singapore Pools was established by the Government on 23 May 1968 to provide safe and trusted betting to counter illegal gambling. As a not-for-profit organisation, all of Singapore Pools’ surplus is channeled to Tote Board to fund a wide range of causes in social service, community development, sports, the arts, education and health. Currently, Singapore Pools contributes about $2 billion annually to the Government in the form of taxes and duties, and for the funding of good causes.

If you are interested, please apply through jobstreet.

","
Business Function
 Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank's risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure.  
Responsibilities
  • To develop high impact deliverables for RMG units, which includes dashboards, machine learning models, etc., to support risk decision making process
  • To identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in structured and unstructured data
  • To conduct research, validate and build statistical/machine learning models in areas such as forecasting and classification 
  • To develop proof of concept/ prototypes for predictive risk management
  • To work closely with development teams and business users to translate models into technical solutions 
Requirements
  • At least a Bachelor's degree in statistics, analytics, applied mathematics, computer science or a related technical field
  • Knowledge in data analytics, machine learning, and other relevant statistical techniques
  • Programming experience to manipulate data and draw insights from large datasets (Python, R , Scala, C++, Java, etc.)

  • Good oral and written communication skills

column1:
","

About you

You'll have an enquiring mind and be willing to learn new things. You'll probably have graduated from University in the area of Computer Science, Analytics, Data Science or similar, and will have two or more years of experience of data engineering, deploying with automation and perhaps some data science, creating machine learning models. You would have worked with senior data engineers and be ready to take the next step with us, documenting everything as you go is a must especially given that you want to be responsible for all aspects of the technical platform form Discovery through design to the final release as part of delivery.

You might have also been working in industry in similar areas and have commensurate experience. You'll be very enthusiastic about data and the journey it goes on, moreover how our journeys are shaped through and by it. You'll want to dive in and experiment, but this will be tempered by understanding how important this data is to the people who depend on it, and you'll always consider it's correct and proper use first.

Business Function

The Data, Pipeline and Infrastructure Engineer is part of the CISO team in Information Security Services (ISS) as part of Technology Services, Technology & Operations. The team addresses the protection of customer and bank information in line with the applicable regulation, standards and policies. The organization is seeking to use data to better understand dataflows and to enhance the relevance, timeliness and accuracy of its responses to issues. There are numerous diverse data sources and several viewpoints and timeframes to bring together to develop and share understanding working with a small number of core stakeholders and wider number of teams who need our input to allow them to innovate safely and securely.

Responsibilities

The Data Pipeline Engineer will be involved in analyzing various sources of data, designing data models & writing efficient ETL process using the bank standard solution to cleanse data and implement business logic as needed with the available data processing tools. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Think about the 'inside out' and the second order consequences with all our data.

  • Lead data acquisition efforts for the program, you'll analyze data sets, understand their meaning with a quick turn round time.

  • Work with stakeholders to understand their data and platform needs and provide appropriate data solutions for getting the data and models to work together.

  • Work with data scientists to understand the data requirements they have and how you can help them to deploy their models to best consume the data and features you work with.

  • Document the requirements with the ISS team's assistance and ensure that we design and implement understandable data and deployment pipelines with captured rationales in the documentation. Good designs tend to be easy to modify.

  • Incrementally Improve data reliability, efficiency and quality for our project.

  • Establish and maintain continuous delivery pipelines for the deployment of Data Pipelines and Models.

  • Design, document, refine and implement CI/CD processes to deliver customer data and models to production, working with the ream to foster a culture of continuous process improvement. Complete ownership of the full working documentation for data pipelines is a must

  • Continuously learn the architecturally possible options within the banks technology stack and aim off to ensure that the appropriate components are utilized and maintained.

Requirements

One of the requirements to work well with real data is recognizing that nothing is perfect, however ideally you would cover most of these items:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering or greater equivalent knowledge and experience.

  • Certified Data Engineer using Cloudera, Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS, MongoDB or similar.

  • Experience of container management platforms. Experience of container build and management (OpenShift, and Docker) is important

  • Hands on experience with modern distributed data architectures (2-3 years in industry focusing on similar work, 4-7 years plus is desirable, and should include exposure to big data projects either as a Generalist or Pipeline-Centric Data engineer)

  • Knowledge of Spark, preferably using Cloudera;

  • Working knowledge of at least one programming language such as Java/ Python, especially if it's used for data projects

  • CI/CD experience pushing data and models(containers) into production via infrastructure as code (Jenkins, GitHub)

  • Working knowledge of Linux to include the shell (BASH), scripting and common data structures (Filesystems, SQL, NoSQL)

  • A clear understanding of cloud service and deployment models, some self-service experience with IaaS Public, Private or Community;

  • Working knowledge of Extract, Load and Transform (ELT) is very desirable, and you'll be able to create dashboards using Excel, Tableau, Superset or similar.

  • Experience working with teams performing systems automation and integration (leveraging an agile methodology(scrum) / Kanban/ lean techniques) is nice to have, as would be experience or knowledge of working in under more traditional project management.

Apply Now 

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2:
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.","
Summary:
Reporting to Director Finance, The Business Intelligence & Analytics Senior Manager position is responsible for creating digital advantage through partnership with functional leaders and IT organization to implement leading finance technologies and advanced analytics solutions that transforms business processes, culture and customer experiences in order to meet the changing business and market dynamics. As a pivot in Thermo Fisher Scientific APJ Comprising Japan, Korea, South Asia, South East Asia, Australia & New Zealand, Revenue Size: $3.5B, Business Analysis Manager shall lead data-driven analytics and solutions throughout the entire APJ Finance organization. This role shall lead a team of data/business analysts to maximize the data potential and assist boosting top line and bottom line growth. The BA Manager works closely with multiple divisions and teams to bring everyone to the same page with solid, high quality, consistent, and consolidated data. The candidate will play a critical role in the data warehouse architecture and design, data governance, and end-to-end solutions, and will not only oversee but be a pioneer in the digital transformation in the entire organization. The key responsibilities of this role is comprised of the following:
Essential Functions:
  • Lead a high performing & high potential team to deliver proactive data-driven analytics on revenue, margin, expenses, sales effectiveness, pricing, market growth and share, business development opportunities, etc. Provide insights in daily/weekly/monthly and other ad-hoc reporting and dashboard from both data and business angles, data support for daily operations to teams including Finance and BD
  • Provide end-to-end data solution to enable various teams across the company to save time on data preparation and reconciliation and routine and ad-hoc reporting
  • Seek opportunities in driving digital transformation, especially finance digital transformation, throughout the organization by deploying standalone and integrated systems
  • Direct the data pipeline development and system integration from a corporate data architectural perspective and supervise the progress
  • Lead the communication with teams and stakeholders on request analysis, feasibility study, solution walkthrough, and cross-team project collaboration
  • Conduct full life cycle analysis from requirements gathering, business analysis, and design to implementation of ideas and processes
  • Interpret data and analyze results using data mining and statistical techniques from ERPs/data warehouse to set up predictive analysis models and reports
  • Streamline existing and introduce enhanced reporting and analysis solutions that leverage complex data sources derived from multiple internal systems
  • Look for process automation opportunities and partner with various teams to implement business transformation ideas
  • Partner with the business and IT teams to acquire data from primary or secondary data sources or to build data repositories
  • Collaborate with functional teams to provide analytics support for recurring business operating mechanisms, as well as ad hoc, time sensitive requests to advance key initiatives
  • Help define standardized reporting and ensure data source integrity for high fidelity analytics
  • Translate business intelligence into concise presentation formats to guide discussion and critical decision making for intended audience
Education:
Bachelor’s / Master’s degree in finance, accounting & MIS, data science or computer science
Experience:
  • Eight to Ten years of relevant experience in business intelligence development, FP&A and process transformation
  • Experience with relational and dimensional datasets, data warehouses, and ETL techniques to deliver BI solutions
  • Advanced experience in ERPs (SAP, Oracle E1, etc.) and MS Power BI
  • Solid and proven knowledge in database design skills. Familiar with mainstream DBMS and SQL, BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlickView, etc.), big data platforms (Spark, Hadoop, etc), and familiar with at least one of the programming languages (php, Java, C#, Python)
  • Proven ability to drive requirements elicitation and practice the design thinking lifecycle
  • Strong and demonstrated system integration capabilities
  • Solid knowledge in accounting, demonstrated financial analysis capabilities and fluent Excel techniques
  • Willingness to learn state-of-the-art techniques (data warehousing, big data, database techniques, machine learning, deep learning, visualization, etc.) and ability to apply them in daily work
  • Excellent communication skills, including ability to communicate technical topics to non-technical audiences
  • Ability to establish trusted and effective business relationships
  • Customer Focus: Using data to deliver exceptional customer experience
  • Ability to lead projects and processes independently

Responsibilities:
  • Represent the ENGIE Group Cybersecurity team in Singapore & South East Asia.
  • Implement ENGIE Group cybersecurity strategy within the region, potentially adapting it to specific local regulations & laws; consolidates, reports and follows the related cybersecurity KPIs.
  • Set up a single transversal cybersecurity team, allowing the implementation of the ENGIE Group cybersecurity strategy, processes, and solutions covering all entities in the region.
  • Define and manage the budget allocated to cybersecurity in all aspect of the business operations that covers internal (IT, Digital, and Industrial Systems), and external (customers compliance, and project bids costings) requirements.
  • Identify, quantify, document, report the cyber risks, and follows-up the risk remediation or mitigation action plans closely.
  • Implement the relevant processes and controls to ensure the integration of cybersecurity within business projects (digital and industrial) and IT projects.
  • Establish a regulatory watch to stay apprised of local cyber regulations and laws and ensures compliance of the local information systems and industrial control systems with these.
  • Represent ENGIE towards their clients, partners, suppliers, and local authorities on all cybersecurity-related matters.
  • Implement standardized operational cybersecurity processes at Country/Regional level, including but not limited to security audits & pen testing, vulnerability & patch management, obsolescence management, firewall & remote access management, incident response, disaster recovery planning, cyber crisis management, identity and access management etc. – applying ENGIE Group standardized processes and procedures when they exist.
  • Relay & report cybersecurity alerts and incidents in a timely manner, and actively contributes to their resolution in close collaboration with the ENGIE Global Security Operations Center (GSOC) and Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT).
  • The preferred intermediary for all cybersecurity topics for the other support functions in the South East Asia region (HR, Legal, Data Privacy, Procurement, Finance etc.).
  • Ensure cybersecurity is addressed in the supply chain, and in particular ensures that the contracts with suppliers and partners but also with clients contain the relevant cybersecurity and data privacy clauses as well as a Security Assurance Plan clarifying roles and responsibilities between the parties.
  • Create a strong cybersecurity culture at all levels of the organization (employees, managers, industrial workers etc) and advise and educate regional senior management on all cybersecurity matters.
Requirements:
  • At least 7 years of Information Security work experience in the area of Risk Management, Governance or Compliance.
  • At least 5 years or more experience in industrial systems security.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent.
  • At least one of the security-related certifications such as CISSP, CISM or CISA.
  • Good knowledge on information security standards such as ISO27001, IEC 62443, and IM8 would be an added advantage.
  • Good understanding of networking, IOT technologies, Web applications, AWS cloud technologies, Windows server, and authentication services.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.
  • Self-disciplined and diligent in driving deliverables within defined timelines.
  • Strong communication/presentation/writing skills with proficiency in English.
  • Logical and methodological, with good planning & organizational skills.
  • An effective team player with good communication & interpersonal skills.
  • Has a good safety mindset and displays good WSH behaviour
Please attach your CV with current and expected salary, and your availability.
Due to the volume of applications we receive, we seek your understanding that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
