column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Overview

- You will be responsible for the execution of HR processes and transactions according to documented procedures for assigned area of responsibility within OHR Shared Services, so as to fulfil internal and external service commitments.
- You will also handle the daily workload and deliver day-to-day HR transactions in a timely and accurate manner with minimum supervision. 
- You will ensure Service Level Agreements (SLA) are met in the delivery of HR transactions. 
 

Roles & Responsibilities

HR Process Execution
- Responsible for ensuring accuracy of employee and employment data.
- Manage job postings on various job boards.
- Update changes in staff particulars and training records.
- Maintenance of staff personnel files. 
- Use HR tools and systems appropriately to complete assigned work and ensure HR systems are maintained accurately based on agreed procedures and team standards. 
- Ensure data integrity when meeting deadlines and timely delivery of services. 
- Able to multi-task and manage the workload during peak periods and work closely with the team as back-up resources for timely delivery of services. 
 
Partnership 
- Partner with both internal and external stakeholders to ensure completion of HR processes or redirect/escalate to the relevant parties/authorities for follow-up/ decisions. 
- Often the 'Expert' in assigned area of service delivery work. Be a valuable partner to management, colleagues and staff by providing accurate and expert advice for own area of work. 
- Understand the scope of process work and the SLAs for each service, and ensure all process documentations are current, accurate and complete.
- Keep abreast of changes in the organisation and work with the relevant stakeholders to ensure that HR requirements/processes are met. HR process Improvement & Innovation. 
- Proactively identify ways to enhance work processes for improved performance either through self-discovery or seeking feedback from stakeholders. 
- Recommend process changes, participate and support improvement projects from time to time. 
- Generate improvement ideas and translate them into plans and actions. 

Requirements

Project Responsibilities 
- Participate in projects within OHR SS including migration of new processes and technology or process enhancements. 
- Work with process owners to identify the project scope, manage the project plan, co-ordinate with IT on testing, training and communication to impacted Shared Service teams. 

Qualification/Experience 
- Degree Holder with 1-2 years of relevant work experience
- Diploma Holder with 3-5 years of relevant work experience 
 
Competencies/Skill Sets 
- Results oriented and have a process-focused mindset 
- Good analytical skills, problem solving skills, IT-savvy and good numeracy skills and meticulous
- Proficiency with Microsoft Office suites; Working experience with SAP HR, Jobs Bank and Training Grants Administration is advantageous. 
- Good communication and interpersonal skills
- A Good Team Player 

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Office of Human Resources

Department : Shared Services

Employee Referral Eligible: No

Job requisition ID : 8255

column2: Founded in Singapore in 1990, Achieve Group is a multi award-winning organisation and HR outsourcing partner-of-choice for local conglomerates and multinational corporations within the Asia Pacific region.

With offices in Singapore and Malaysia, Achieve Group offers a full suite of Talent Acquisition and HR Consulting solutions for your company's HRM needs. As the experts in talent recruitment and human resource engagement services, we pride ourselves on the timely delivery of these services through our team of dedicated and experienced professionals.

As a progressive organization that firmly believes in the pursuit of excellence, Achieve Group is always constantly evaluating and seeking to improve ourselves to fulfill our mission, because we believe that 'Your SUCCESS is our ACHIEVEment'!","
 Basic Salary of up to S$10,000 (salary will commensurate according to experience & qualifications)
 Minimum 7-10 years of working experience in a professional contract role
 Candidate with strong knowledge of research contracting terms, good understanding of data privacy laws 
 Good contract negotiation skills and a collaborative, solutions-oriented approach 
 Candidate with paralegal experience and/or commercial law and technology transfer certification, or equivalent work experience would be advantageous
Our Client has been an implementer of IT systems that have supported the operations of various hospitals, specialty centres & nursing homes. They are currently inviting qualified candidates to fill the position as Contract Manager.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Engage various stakeholders (government, academic research and industry) to develop and execute the contracts in a timely manner
  • Analyse contracts to identify risks, liabilities or gaps. Work closely with stakeholders to resolve contractual issues in timely manner.
  • Responsible for ensuring that contract amendments and reviews are monitored, gathered and acted upon as appropriate.
  • Ensure that contract documentation is carried out systematically, e.g. assist to set up system to maintain contractual records and ensure adequate processes and policies are in place; proper filing of all contractual documents (hardcopy and softcopy)
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Minimum 7-10 years of working experience in a professional contract role, Minimum Degree in related discipline. skills
  • Paralegal experience and/or commercial law and technology transfer certification, or equivalent work experience would be advantageous.
  • Strong knowledge of research contracting terms, good understanding of data privacy laws (Singapore and International); and appreciation of the local health and biomedical research ecosystem.
  • Good contract negotiation skills and a collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong communication
  • Critical thinking skills, identify business, legal and financial implications of the different contracts.
  • Excellent written and verbal skills with an eye for detail.
  • Versatile in working independently as well as an effective team player
OTHER INFORMATION:
Salary  : Up to S$10,000 (salary will commensurate according to experience & qualifications).
 
HOW TO APPLY:
If you are a team player, meticulous & organized, and more importantly, believe that YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE, we would like to hear from you.
Simply submit your application by emailing a detailed copy of your updated Resume in MS Word Format to Tan Dyin Yin
(DY) (EA Personnel Reg. No.: R1986524)
dyinyin.tan@achievegroup.asia
or call your friendly Consultant at 6590 9862 for a confidential discussion.
By submitting any application or résumé to us, you will be deemed to have agreed and consented to us collecting, using, retaining and disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration.
YOUR SUCCESS IS OUR ACHIEVEMENT!

Shopee, a Sea company, was first launched in Singapore in 2015, and has since expanded its reach to Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan, Indonesia, Vietnam and the Philippines. Sea's mission is to better the lives of consumers and small businesses with technology, and is listed on the NYSE under the symbol SE. The Shopee team comprises over 8,000 employees from across the region, and with our rapid expansion, we are constantly on the lookout for potential talents who have the passion and drive to become part of a fast-moving and dynamic team.","

column2: The National University Polyclinics (NUP) is a member of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.

NUP provides primary care treatment for acute illnesses, management of chronic diseases, women and children health services, and dental care at its network of polyclinics at Bukit Batok, Bukit Panjang, Choa Chu Kang, Clementi, Jurong, Pioneer, Queenstown (with Tengah and Yew Tee to come).

As part of an integrated academic health system, NUP collaborates with the hospitals and national specialty centres within NUHS as well as partner general practitioners, grassroots, the community and social care partners to provide patient-centred care for the population.
For more information, please visit www.nup.com.sg | www.nuhs.edu.sg
·         National University Centre for Oral Health, Singapore
·         NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine

·         NUS Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health","

The National University Polyclinics (NUP) is on a transformative journey to further develop primary care in the west. You will be part of the Corporate Strategy Planning team to provide support for Data Governance and Personal Data Protection.

Reporting to the Manager of Corporate Strategy Planning, you will also be providing support to the department in the financial and administrative aspects.

You will be responsible for the following:

  • Prepare monthly report of PDPA incidents to monitor how the organisation is performing.
  • Track and monitor for any repeat in data breach.
  • Track and monitor the follow-up actions taken following the PDPA incidents to ensure proper closure of investigations and ensure that the proposed mitigating measures for PDPA incidents are implemented.
  • Assist with the preparation of notification reports to Senior Management in the event of reportable data breach.
  • Assist in PDPA audits as well as the subsequent reporting and follow-up on recommendations.
  • Maintain organisation's awareness of PDPA and Data Governance requirements by keeping abreast of PDPA and Data Governance requirements as well as amendments to regulations and guidelines.
  • Raise awareness on PDPA and Data Governance by regularly providing updates/reminder to staff on the requirements, regulations and guidelines.
  • Respond to queries that may arise in the organisation's collection, use and/or disclosure of data. And provide appropriate advice to staff on the organisation's data management and protection policies & procedures.
  • Handles queries, complaints and disputes on the organisation's management of data.
  • Assist in the formulation of policies and procedures to align with the requirements of MOH and/or NUHS level in terms of data governance as well as follow up on compliance and necessary measures.
  • Assist in operational implementation and maintenance of new system under the department's care
  • Responsible for financial and administrative duties to keep the department running.
  • Plan, organise and coordinate meeting and events for the department when required.
  • Any other duties assigned or participate in department projects when required.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor degree in any discipline with experience in data governance and/or PDPA will be advantageous. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
  • Positive work attitude with strong initiative and demonstrate the ability to multi-task and work effectively under pressure.
  • Organised, meticulous, analytical and able to work independently.
  • Self-motivated and possess good interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Strong team-player with willingness to contribute to the team
  • Possess high level of integrity, willingness to learn and embrace knowledge sharing.

column1: 230,data,/en/job/assistant-vice-president-data-analytics-9344552,9344552,"Assistant Vice President, Data Analytics",False,False,,,SGD,NETS,19-Mar-22,False,,25 days,198500065G,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The NETS Group is a leading payments services group, enabling digital payments for merchants, consumers and banks across the entire payments value chain.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Group operates Singapore’s national debit scheme enabling customers of DBS Bank/POSB, HSBC, Maybank, OCBC Bank, Standard Chartered Bank and UOB to make payments using their ATM cards or mobile devices at more than 100,000 acceptance points in the country as well as online payments. The NETS network also accepts NETSPay, UnionPay and BCA cards, and includes 35,000 Unified POS terminals and 30,000 QR acceptance points. NETS is also the issuer of CashCard and Flashpay cards.
The NETS Group manages and operates the clearing and payment infrastructure for the Singapore Clearing House Association and core electronic transfer services FAST, Inter-bank GIRO and PayNow.

It is the market leader for payment and clearing solutions (Real-Time Gross Settlement system and Cheque Truncation System) in the region with some S$1 trillion in transaction value processed through its systems every year.

NETS is a member of the Asian Payment Network and a council member of UnionPay International.","
Position Summary
This role is responsible for extracting value from collected data thus helping in building and influencing corporate and business strategies. This role is instrumental in providing actionable insights which help business to grow, solve long standing business problems, develop new revenue streams and overall improve execution efficiency.
Key Responsibilities
  • Follow the trail: Understand the flow of data from once it’s captured to how we calculate key metrics to how business leaders consume it
  • Draw a picture: Build visuals to provide clear visibility and quick insight into the health of individual businesses as well as at the NETS Group level
  • Plan the journey: Define roadmap for Data Product solutions, manage and lead delivery of analytical assets including analytical deep-dives, and identify future AI and machine learning solutions to help businesses and the NETS Group leverage their internal/external data assets for strategic decision making
  • Make it run like clockwork: Automate regularly tracked metrics/reports/ dashboards
  • Drive action: Analyze the data to interpret patterns, pin-point challenges, and help craft solutions to drive value realization from data and analytics
  • Keep it simple: Translate data into human language to empower business leaders to make data-driven decisions and execute better
  • Build relationships: Manage close relationships with various business teams to integrate timely and relevant analytics into their business objectives and outcomes
  • Create synergy for the NETS Group: Ensure that analytical assets and data capabilities built for business units are scalable and reusable at NETS Group level
  •  
Requirements
  • Minimum six years’ professional experience in analyzing large datasets and translating it to business insights for banking and finance industry
  • Strong knowledge in at least one of the following areas would be advantageous: payments, credit/debit/stored value cards, mobile wallets, POS, fintech or e-commerce
  • A passion for solving problems anchored on what the data tells us and developing strategy in relation to the application of analytics in business strategies
  • Excellent track record in running projects from end to end, managing stakeholders’ expectations, and being a trusted partner to Business and Technology teams
  • Proficiency in Excel and Powerpoint
  • Working knowledge of SQL as well as experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Domo, etc.)
  • Strong presentation skills and ability to articulate priorities to cross-functional audiences
  • Self-starter, good team player, fast learner, curious, adaptable and entrepreneurial with an automation mindset
  • Bachelor’s degree, preferably in engineering, computer science, statistics, mathematics or business-related fields
",[],Senior Manager,,6 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Medical', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Benefits Allowance', 'Smart Casual']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9344552&advertisement_id=9342923&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70170,Central,sg

#Salary:Upto $5,475/mth (depends on qualification and experiences)
#Contract duration: 11 months
#Nearest MRT: Labrador Park MRT
#Working Hours: Monday - Friday (Office Hour)
#Experience in creating automated scripts for data cleansing
#Experience in creating automated forms using Microsoft Office Tools and/or SharePoint
#Experience in grant policy and process review/implementation, risk management or investigation, will be a plus
#Ability to perform basic statistical analysis, and experience with data preparation (e.g. using MS Excel) and analytic tools.
What the role is

To manage and implement grant fraud management system:
  • Perform data extraction from grant systems and consolidation of data.
  • Extract grant details from supporting documents attached in grant system and consolidate such data in another file.
  • Process, cleanse and verify the suitability of existing datasets in various grant systems used for grant fraud data analysis.
  • Review and automate grant governance tools/templates
What you will be working on
  • Acquiring data, i.e. identifying relevant variables, cleaning/filtering data, web-scrapping
  • Ensuring data quality, i.e. ascertaining data sufficiency, verifying data source, removing duplicates
  • Preparing data, i.e. performing exploratory surface analysis, describing data structure, exploring variables & data types, formatting and cleaning data, developing tools to annotate and visualize the labels
  • Processing and cleaning large datasets
Job Requirements:
  • Only Singaporean
  • Degree and up
  • Good written and presentation skills
  • At least 3 years relevant experiences
  • Data analytics techniques and approaches for large datasets
Interested candidates please click 'Apply Now' or send your resume to sherlian.lim@bgc-group.com.
We regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidate will be contacted for further discussion.
Sherlian Lim
Outsourcing Team
BGC Group Pte Ltd
EA License No: 05C3053

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

Senior Cloud Engineer, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (210000BA)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
  • Participate in efforts that tailor the company's security policies and standards for use in cloud environments
  • Propose and/or design technical solutions, which include creating prototypes and proofs of concept while maintaining a security mindset
  • Work closely with cloud platform architects to deliver creative solutions to complex technology challenges and business requirements. 
  • Automate security controls, data and processes to provide better metrics and operational support
  • Utilize Public cloud-based APIs when appropriate to write network/system level tools for securing cloud environments
  • Stay current on emerging security threats, vulnerabilities and controls.
  • Identify detect and remediate failures in security controls by executing continuous instrumentation and validation of security capabilities
Requirements
  • Has a demonstrable experience as a Public Cloud Engineer ( Experience in Openshift or any other containerization software would be nice but not evaluated as a primary skill)
  • Bachelor's degree on any STEM academic discipline
  • Minimum of 5-7 years of IT Security and/or security engineering experience in Public Cloud (on premise administration or any network experience will not be evaluated)
  • 5-7 years related experience in Cloud Engineering. Clear passion for Cloud Security and Cloud technologies.
  • Must have experience with virtualization (cloud or non-cloud)
  • Expert knowledge of Cloud infrastructure, security architectures, and standards
  • Deep technical knowledge of Amazon Web Services (more than 5 years in demonstrable projects, we will request evidences to cover this point)
  • Able to demonstrate clear understanding of current threats to Public Cloud infrastructure 
  • Able to automate/script daily tasks through Python and/or JavaScript (last 5 years of demonstrable hands-on experience)
  • Experience with web-based applications or web-services
  • Proficient in Linux system administration, automation and operations
  • Experience in designing and implementing standards, specifications and procedures.
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative and accountability for achieving results.
  • Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of network and web related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, routing protocols)(not only applied to onprem infrastructures)
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column1:
","
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Our goal is to build T&M NLP core engine to handle all T&M related ML use cases, e.g, sentiment analysis, text summarization, classification, NER, trade info extraction, etc. We have extended BERT base vocabulary with T&M domain specific words, and completed T&M BERT pre-training with training dataset of 5,000,000 plus T&M documents. Our next milestone is to build a generic T&M NER engine to extract trades details from free-text documents, e.g, emails, chats, pdf, etc. The traditional NER engine, i.e, Spacy, could only recognize the default entities, but not able to understand the trades entities, e.g, forex rate, settlement date, coupon rate, counterparty, etc.
Responsibilities
  • Work with large and complex financial datasets to build end-to-end data science solutions. 
  • Deploy machine learning products into production and perform sub-system integration as required.
  • Refactor and document code into reusable libraries, APIs, and tools.
  • Automate CI/CD pipeline for model training, testing and deployment.
  • Assist organizational adoption of industry leading ML ecosystem (feature/eval store, model zoo)
  • Optimize machine learning algorithm efficiency (GPU distributed computing, concurrent programming)
Requirements
  • Experience building scalable machine learning system architectures (microservice, distributed) and big-data pipelines in production.
  • Good understanding of the data science production life cycle with demonstrable experience working with structured, semi-structured and unstructured data.
  • Excellent software skills (Python, SQL, bash) and knowledge in design patterns and code optimization.
  • Good grasp of Machine Learning models and concepts, their mathematical underpinnings, and trade-offs (model selection, tuning, problem formulation, drift, semi-supervised learning)
  • Experience using NLP techniques (NER, Sentiment Analysis, Topic Modelling, transformers)
  • Experience using machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, Pytorch, Spark, Hydra)
  • Familiar with software development best practices and tools (Agile, TDD, Jira, Jenkins, Git)
Good-to-have:
  • Familiar with Linux operation system
  • Financial domain expertise (Treasury & Markets) 
  • Experience with statistical modelling and time series analysis.
Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

236,data,/en/job/data-scientist-9392379,9392379,Data Scientist,False,False,,,SGD,Keppel Infrastructure Holdings Pte Ltd,18-Mar-22,False,,30 days,201305009N,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: Keppel Infrastructure (KI) drives the Group's strategy to invest in, own and operate competitive energy and infrastructure solutions and services. Keppel Infrastructure, while tapping the expertise of its environmental engineering and technology, will continue growing its integrated power and gas business as well as its environmental and energy efficiency businesses.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: In Energy Infrastructure, KI has a track record of developing, owning and operating power plants in Brazil, China, the Philippines and Nicaragua. In Singapore, it operates a 1,300 MW gas fired combined cycle power plant on Jurong Island.

Through its subsidiary, Keppel Seghers, its advanced technology solutions addresses a wide spectrum of environmental issues such as solid waste, wastewater, drinking and process water, biosolids and sludge. Keppel Seghers’ in-house Research & Development capabilities, as well as strategic alliances with global research institutes enable it to continuously improve its technology.

Keppel DHCS, a KI subsidiary, is the first and largest district cooling systems (DCS) developer and service provider in Singapore, providing DCS services though the development and operation of such systems at major business and industrial parks, including Changi Business Park, one-north and Woodlands Wafer Fab Park. In 2010, Keppel DHCS made its first foray into China to provide district heating and cooling systems services in the Eco-Business Park of the Sino-Singapore Tianjin Eco-City. The plant incorporates geothermal technology to support its heating and cooling requirements and commenced commercial operations in August 2013.

column1:
","
The Data Scientist supports stakeholders in the organisation with insights gained from analyzing company data. The key responsibilities are:
  • Identify and develop core data and artificial intelligence (AI) models for the delivery of projects and business transformation initiatives
  • Architect specialized data stores and computing environments, explores and visualizes complex data set to provide insights
  • Integrate data from various sources and create advanced models and algorithms suitable for the business use case
  • Conduct testing on data and AI models, interpret findings from testing, and evaluates model performance for scaling and deployment.
  • Develop compelling and logically structured communication materials on research and/or analytics findings to facilitate stakeholder buy-in
  • Such other duties and responsibilities as may be reasonably requested by your immediate supervisor / the head of department from time to time
Key tasks include:
• Manage data preparation and modelling
  • Define objectives and hypothesis for research on data and AI models
  • Analyze the ways in which datasets may be biased and address this in safety measures and deployment strategies
  • Conduct extraction and integration of data including features from different data sources
  • Develop multiple models and algorithms suitable for the use case
  • Perform model comparison to draw inferences on variable importance
  • Select the best model based on pre-defined evaluation criteria
  • Account for data ethics and policies in model selection and evaluation process
  • Interpret and evaluate model performance for scaling and deployment
• Build and assess models
  • Conduct testing on final model in real-time business conditions prior to deployment
  • Scale and deploy models in real-time business conditions for end user consumption
  • Initiate autonomous monitoring to scale human oversight
  • Document modelling techniques used and assumptions made against test outcomes
  • Enable end user capability to use AI/ Data Science products effectively
• Present data driven business value of data science/AI models
  • Create reports and deliverables based on insights derived from the model results
  • Develop compelling, logically structured presentations including story-telling of research and/or analytics findings to secure stakeholder commitment
  • Contribute to the creation of leading-edge resources, including playbooks, guides, blog posts, videos, etc.
Job Requirements
  • Bachelor Degree or above in Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Technology/Engineering with at least 5 years of working experience in Data Science or 7 years on Data Analytics areas
  • Knowledge on the relevant software/cloud platforms such Azure, AWS, Google, etc
  • Passionate about analyzing and resolving complex business problems, displaying intellectual curiosity towards using data and AI to address business needs and challenges
  • Knowledge of analytical and distributed data/computing tools like SAS, Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Spark, etc. to extract useful insights out of cleaned and organized data sets
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to effectively identify and analyze business problems and propose relevant solutions
  • Strong knowledge on the application of the ethical principles when using, storing, and disposing of data
  • Familiar with statistical and data mining techniques (3 or more) such as Regression, Classification, Clustering, Prediction, Decision Tree, Pattern Recognition, etc
  • Familiar with data visualization software like Power BI, Tableau, etc. to create graphs or charts that are used to share findings and help stakeholders better understand the data
  • Proficient in statistics, scripting and programming languages (2 or more) such as C++, Java, Javascript, R, SQL, and Python for tasks like data gathering, data visualization, AI modeling, etc
  • Knowledge on designing data models and data flow using popular cloud services (1 or more) such as Google Dataflow, Google Bigquery, AWS Data Pipeline, AWS Glue, Azure Data Pipeline, Azure Databricks, etc
  • Strong acumen on the emerging technology trends and ability to leverage these new developments to enhance business growth
  • Positive attitude towards changes and respond promptly to the varying needs of the business
  • Strong communication skills to convey findings and recommendations to decision makers
  • Strong critical thinking skills to better interpret and understand the data to solve problems and implement new solutions
  • Domain knowledge on plant operation and asset maintenance will be advantageous
  • Completed Data Science training with certification and trainings on ML, AI, data engineering, data analytics, critical thinking with certification will also be an added advantage
""In accordance with the requirements set by the Singaporean Government and due to the nature of the role requiring work onsite, it is a requirement for all new employees, as well as contractors, to be fully vaccinated* against COVID-19.

Applicants will have to provide full vaccination details during recruitment process, in compliance with company’s regulations.""

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Senior Cloud Enablement, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (210000BC)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
DBS is a leading regional bank, embracing innovation and digital technologies with a vision of Making Banking Joyful for our employees and our customers. We are underway with a Technology Transformation strategy, known as 'Gandalf', with clear vision to 'Design for Modern Systems' and 'Automate Everything', including to fully embrace both private and public cloud.In 2018 we intend to accelerate our Public Cloud journey, already in place for a number of applications in production, to adopt AWS natively, with confidential data, and at scale.A team has been created and is striving to deploy applications with confidential data and native services, and our target is to progressively enable more workloads with a scalable, automated, self-service approach.
Key Accountabilities
Work in a small multi-functional team to facilitate Public Cloud adoption across the organization for all workloads. Partner with and assist all Technology teams.The Cloud Engineer is expected to;
Responsibilities
  • Implementation of the compliance engine in coordination with the Platform Architect and Engineers
  • Implementation of the directive and detective control surface as per the detailed designs provided by Platform Architect and Security Architect
  • Implementation of test cases for the Canary testing framework
  • Daily operational review of all open compliance alerts and action remediation
  • Produce reporting and insights into the compliance landscape on a repeating basis
  • Provides T2 escalation support for key platform services such as networking, core services, identity, compliance frameworks, and other core services
  • Diagnoses, reports, and produces root-cause reports for review and feature/bug tracking by the Platform Architect and Operations Architect
  • Monitors and maintains the overall compliance against the latest DBS SOE and assists with remediation activities
Requirements
  • 2+ years in enterprise operations and automation development environments 
  • 2+ years working in a production support environment implementing at-scale monitoring, failover, or recovery technologies 
  • Thorough understanding of cloud operational controls and practices 
  • 1+ years of experience with native cloud technologies such as Auto-Scaling, healing, CloudWatch, Lambda 
  • 1+ years in scripting skills - working with operational and services level controls such as system.d 
  • Strong experience with CI/CD methodologies, processes and tools, such as Atlassian Bamboo, Jenkins, CodePipelines, CloudFormation 
  • Strong experience with logging & event management tools such as Splunk etc 
  • Solid skills in technical writing and production of technical documentation 
  • Experience in working in and with Agile delivery teams / projects / programs 
  • Cloud certification preferred i.e. AWS/AZURE/G Cloud 
  • Programming language proficiencies include NodeJS, Python, Java and C# 
  • Experience with DevOps Tools such as Ansible, Chef, Jenkins, etc. 
  • Hands-on experience with writing code i.e. AWS Lambda, CloudFormation 
  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or commensurate experience
Critical Competencies
  • Strong grasp of operational processes for an enterprise-grade cloud platform; 
  • Experience developing new and enhancing existing ITSM processes; 
  • Core understanding of 'at scale' cloud engineering principles and architectures 
  • Lead software development and automation skills 
  • Expert knowledge of service offerings and operational behaviours 
  • Expert knowledge of Continuous delivery and change automation principles
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

VP, Data Engineer, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD32991)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Responsibilities
  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline.

  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.

  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing Jobs/code for greater scalability, etc.

  • Work with stakeholders including the Product owner, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.

  • Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Requirements
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with RDBMS, Hadoop and NoSQL DB.

  • Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, Jobs and data sets.

  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

  • Strong analytic skills related to working with structured and unstructured datasets.

  • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

  • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.

  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.

  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

  • We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools:
Experience with:
  • Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.

  • Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.

  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools: Airflow, etc.

  • AWS cloud services or GCP.

  • Stream-processing systems: Spark-Streaming, Flink etc.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Our esteemed client is looking for an ETL Consultant who will be responsible for the following primary functions:
Job Description & Requirements
The Data Integration Consultant is a strong ETL Developer that works as part of the Data Warehouse and Integration team. The developer has strong design, development and testing knowledge in data warehouse technologies. The Consultant will develop, unit test, support and maintain ETL jobs based on business requirements and technical specifications following project standards.
You will be based in Singapore, and be involved in solutions project delivery and support, and pre sales. The position offers a challenging environment with leading edge technology and strategic organizations as its customers.
Responsibilities:
  • Implementing Data-platform solutions based on requirements defined by line of business owners and stakeholders, and staying within budgeted estimates
  • Crafting functional requirements for the implementation of their ECM solution
  • Maintain a high degree of proficiency with the relevant Data-product modules and their appropriate application to DI /ETL requirements
  • Responsible for testing, monitoring and validating data integration activity, including data extraction, cleansing, transformation, movement, loading and updating processes
  • Ensures data integration processes meets service level requirements
  • Designs and writes the scripts required to extract, transform, clean and move data and metadata so it can be loaded into a data warehouse, data mart or operational data store
  • Coding and testing program modules; assisting in design
  • Assisting in the integration of technical and application components
  • Maintaining, tuning and repairing applications; providing user support
  • Participating in execution and documentation of tests
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot operational issues impacting deployed solutions; work collaboratively to resolve issues
  • Provide knowledge transfer to customers appointed representatives and users
  • Collaborate with other appointed professionals, transferring expertise in delivering and supporting solutions
Requirements:
  • Possess a Degree or Diploma in Information Technology or equivalent
  • Preferably 2 years relevant experience in DI / ETL solution design, implementation, and support
  • Hands-on experience in implementation and deployment of any of the following Data Integration Technologies/Solutions: SAP, Oracle, IBM, Informatica, Microsoft SQL Server and on SAS Data Quality Solution is a plus
  • SQL writing experience
  • Understanding of Data warehouse concepts, project lifecycle, and roles and responsibilities
  • Understanding of change management practices
  • Understanding of Data modelling and able to read Data models
  • Able to work in a team and independently and meet timelines
Interested candidate who wish to apply for the advertised position, please click on “Apply Now”. Alternatively, you may email us an updated copy of your resume (ATTN: JIAP)  for a confidential discussion. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Job Code: JIAP
Email Address: Tech1_sg@persolkelly.com
EA License NO.: 01C4394
PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd • RCB No. 200007268E • EA License No. 01C4394 • EA Registration No. R21100346 (Pa Jian Wei)

242,data,/en/job/master-data-specialist-6-mth-contract-9399703,9399703,Master Data Specialist (6 mth contract),False,False,,,SGD,Pacific Refreshments Pte Ltd (The Coca-Cola Company),21-Mar-22,False,,29 days,200801763N,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

Established in 1886, The Coca-Cola Company is the largest beverage manufacturer, retailer, and marketer of non-alcoholic beverage concentrates and syrup in the world. Our company produces concentrates, which is then sold to licensed bottlers throughout the world. Our products could be found in over 200 countries worldwide, with consumers downing more than 1.9 billion company beverage servings each day. The Singapore manufacturing plant started its operations in 2010 and the company believes in investing and developing the best talents who can make a difference in their lives, in their lives of their families, in the workplace, as well as in the world. We live the values by being an ambassador of our beverage brands and we bring values to the, lives of others through community outreach programmes and supporting initiatives that further the well-being of the lives we touch. We welcome passionate and committed individuals who are able to pro-actively be engaged in the workplace and strive to achieve the organizational goals. If you have what it takes to be one of us, don’t hesitate, join us now!

","
MASTER DATA SPECIALIST
Based in Tuas, Singapore (Hybrid-working mode)

The Coca-Cola Company - Coca Cola Pacific Refreshment is a strategic concentrate manufacturing plant in Asia. We are an export facility, specializing in the manufacturing of concentrates and beverage bases, with a complex portfolio, supporting the ASEAN, South Pacific and South West Asia business units. The plant just completed an Expansion wing, incorporating Industry 4.0 practices, which will take it to the next level of doubling its manufacturing capacity in the next 3-5 years.

Pacific Refreshments Pte Ltd is a winner of 2020 HR Asia Best Companies to Work for.
POSITION OVERVIEW

• Coordinate and execute the activities related to creation, extension, validation and change management of materials including Bill of Materials and Recipes in the SAP (R/3) system for CPS Asia concentrate plants
• Partner and collaborate with CPS Master Data Management Specialist and Global Data Services (GDS) Teams in master data maintenance activities in compliance with the global data standards.
• Ensure that all master data is created and maintained in accordance with Company and operation requirements.
RESPONSIBILITIES

• Transfer information into master data elements to be created, extended and maintained in SAP and related systems and tools for new product launches, reformulations, changes of pack configuration and business contingency programs.
• Create and validate through audits, and maintain master data (material master, BOMS, Master Recipes) in the SAP R/3 production module for packaging, raw materials, in process, finished goods and sales kits.
• Data lifecycle management – working with CPS Master Data Management Specialist to implement standards and perform review and obsolete redundant data.
QUALIFICATIONS & RELATED EXPERIENCE

• Diploma / Bachelor’s degree
• At least 2-5 years SAP Master data experience from MM, SD, PP, FI, CO environments
• Knowledge of MS Advanced Excel, Access/SQL and SAP Query would be an advantage
If you're interested in this role, we look forward to meeting you in our Happiness Factory!

  • Deliver data requests in a timely manner, including but not limited to data extraction, data analysis, data solutions and data visualization
  • Advise reliable and best practices of data extraction methods
  • Perform deep-dive data analysis and studies into problems raised by business teams
  • Facilitate problem-solving process by suggesting hypotheses and corresponding data solutions
  • Support Data Scientists on machine learning models for a better understanding of user behaviors
  • Construct data pipelines to ease retrieval and analysis of key information
  • Support any other ad-hoc data requests from Garena teams
Requirements:
  • Minimum Diploma in Information Technology, Computer Engineering or equivalent.
  • Experience in data models and reporting packages, BI or BWH
  • Ability to analyse large datasets and write comprehensive reports
  • Strong in SQL or Python, good knowledge of statistical modeling, and basic understanding of machine learning with prior working experience
  • Strong in logical thinking and clear in data presentation

Established on 15 June 1936, Bank of China Singapore Branch holds the Qualifying Full Bank License (QFB) in Singapore. It has a network of five sub-branches and one remittance centre. With over 70 years of presence in the local banking industry, leveraging on the Group’s extensive global network and team of experienced professionals, Bank of China Singapore Branch provides a full range of financial services to its customers from Singapore, China as well as the surrounding region. Over the years, it has demonstrated its long-term commitment to promote bilateral economic and trade relations between China and Singapore.

The main businesses of Bank of China Singapore Branch include corporate banking, retail banking, trade financing and international trade settlement, with specialized knowledge and expertise in China-related trade financing and settlements, and remittance services

• To provide production operation support including system & network monitoring, datacenter management, incident management, change management, capacity management, case escalation & etc.

• To provide and response for IT technical support via emails, conference call, online messaging platform, as well as on-site or remotely.

• To prepare and update IT documentations including technical specifications, inventories, user manuals, configuration record, change logs, incident report, implementation guideline & etc to ensure proper management of records.

• To recommend new technologies and automations to enhance general IT operations.

• To co-ordinate with external vendors and /or service providers to implement the new projects or system upgrade.

• Able to work shift duty in morning or afternoon including Saturday.

Requirement and Pre-requisite:

• Minimum Diploma or Degree in IT or equivalent.

• At least 3 to 5 years of relevant working experience in IT support or IT operation within Financial Industry.

• Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, verbally or written, openly and professionally to users, co-workers and stakeholders in English & Chinese, on problems, root causes and solution.

• Possess good time management, documentation skills and quality delivery.

• Self-starter, multi-task and effectively prioritise tasks to ensure timely closure of tickets and issues.

• Meticulous and able to work methodically to diagnose, analyse and troubleshoot IT issues.

• Take initiative, good team player, taking ownership of issues, process driven and great attention to details with a positive attitude and high energy.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Contract Staff (Senior), Risk Data Enabler, Risk Management, Technology and Operations
Technology and Operations
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
The Technology & Operations group is key to enabling the DBS vision of being the best bank in the world.
The key mandate of T&O Risk Management (T&O RM) - Risk Analytics is to drive a data driven risk management culture and establish the analytics capabilities across T&O Risk and Control.
The Risk Data Enabler supports the data on-boarding, data governance, data management and data administration of Risk Analytics related projects for the implementation and support of analytics solutions to enhance our risk management capabilities using data and data analytics.
The role will be the focal point for making sure risk data is ready-to-use, map out, maintain and explore the holistic risk data universe as the risk data foundation and enablement of Risk Analytics
Responsibilities
  • Explore and build the platform/environment to host shared risk data for access by T&O Risk management and key stakeholders, liaising with Technology on the underlying enterprise solutions and data dependencies
  • Manage the readiness of the shared risk data by liaising with technology & relevant stakeholders on:
    • Data source identification and lineage
    • Data cleansing/ ETL as needed
    • Data accessibility / compatibility with self-service bi/analytics tools, realtime dashboards, 3rd party solutions
    • Platform, Security, Data Architecture 
  • Establish framework/process to govern the risk data i.e. entitlement/access, integrity, quality, performance
  • Ensure management of risk data (Risk Data Documentation, Definition, Security i.e. Format/ Encryption/ Anonymization/ Transmission)
Requirements
  • Advanced degree holder in, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
  • Min 6-10 years of experience in a financial institution, with experience in large scale project management involving technology and analytics requirements.
  • Min 5 years of hands on experience in Data Engineering, Database Administration
  • Min 5 years of hands on experience in Data Management and Governance
  • Knowledge and experience in technology project management, agile methodology will be a plus
  • Good understanding of banking terminology, products and technology operational processes
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills (verbal & written), ability to conceptualize and articulate concepts
  • Strong analytical skills with ability to identify root cause in order to derive the right solution
  • Ability to problem-solve, be creative and think out-of-the-box.
  • Has a 'can-do' attitude/ mindset, initiated to drive change, and open to changes.
  • Know ETL Tools, REST/APIs and common programming languages
  • Know NoSQL (Hadoop Ecosystem) / SQL (Teradata)
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

249,data,/en/job/solutions-advisor-data-analytics-engineering-4867213/origin/my,4867213,"Solutions Advisor , Data Analytics & Engineering",False,False,8000,11200,SGD,DXC Technology Singapore Pte Ltd,19-Mar-22,False,,12 days,198400958N,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"

DXC Technology helps our customers across the entire Enterprise Technology Stack with differentiated industry solutions. We modernize IT, optimize data architectures, and make everything secure, scalable and orchestrated across public, private and hybrid clouds. We combine years of experience running mission-critical systems with the latest digital innovations to deliver better business outcomes and new levels of performance, competitiveness and experiences for our customers and their stakeholders. DXC invests in three key drivers of growth: People, Customers and Operational Execution. The company’s global scale, talent and innovation platforms serve 6,000 private and public-sector customers in 70 countries. DXC’s extensive partner network helps drive collaboration and leverage technology independence. The company has established more than 200 industry-leading global DXC Partner Network relationships, including 14 strategic partners: Amazon Web Services, AT&T, Dell Technologies, Google Cloud, HP, HPE, IBM, Micro Focus, Microsoft, Oracle, PwC, SAP, ServiceNow and VMware. DXC is a recognized leader in corporate responsibility, and ranked among the world’s best corporate citizens. DXC is a Fortune 500 company and represented in the S&P 500 Index. Learn more about the DXC story and our focus on people, customers and operational execution at www.dxc.technology.  Website: https://www.dxc.technologyTwitter: https://www.twitter.com/dxctechnologyFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/DXCTechnologyYoutube: https://www.youtube.com/DXCTechnologyInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/dxctechnology

","

As the world moves to digital business, the growing use of analytics is unlocking new value from data. DXC Technology Analytics and Engineering (A&E) understands the trend and industries, and thrives to help our clients envision, design and modernize their data environment, generate insights by providing the best-in-class analytics and AI platform. As a growing team, we are looking for a solution architect to join us, who can be a trusted advisor both technically and strategically, who knows the cutting-edge technology, has established thought leadership in analytics domain, and who can work with our colleagues across multiple teams. Together, we drive DXC A&E’s portfolio.

Responsibilities:

  • Technical Solutioning and Consultancy:
  • Understand client’s existing source systems and data flow
  • Collate technical and functional requirements with our client’s senior stakeholders
  • Design and propose end-to-end enterprise cloud-based and on-premise data analytics solutions under senior team member’s guidance
  • Collaborate with partners to define and characterize technologies or process problems to develops new solutions.
  • Advise customer over the best selection of vendor products for their requirement.
  • Provide technical consulting to proposal efforts and solution design.
  • Assist in designing and conducting Proof of Concept (PoCs) and Demos for pre-sales purpose.
  • Customer facing – be able to communicate and present to key stakeholders.
  • Create and support sales activities.

Delivery:

  • Work with project team on deployment strategy, resource allocation and timeline.
  • Collaborate with cross functional teams
  • Provide technical advice to resolve technical issues or new requests to ensure on-time delivery.
  • Hands-on experience in any of these domains—Cloud Platform, Enterprise Data Warehouse, ETL, AI / ML models, Business Intelligence Reporting.
  • Having data science model development experience is an advantage

Industry domain knowledge:

  • Having experience in Singapore Public Sector or Banking / Insurance industry is an advantage

Technical Skills:

  • Mandatory skills (minimum 3)
  • Good exposure and experience in analytics software.
  • Having SAS experience is an advantage
  • Worked or solutioned using at least one of the big data platforms -- Hadoop on AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.
  • Familiar with Data Management tools -- Talend, Master Data Management, Meta data, etc.
  • Used one of these programming languages -- Python, R, SQL, Java, JavaScript, React.JS, etc.
  • Experience in using one of the Business Intelligence tools -- Power BI, Tableau, and Qlik, and configuring the BI reporting pipeline on Cloud or on-prem.

Other Skills – It will be advantage if you are / have

  • Willing to work at customer’s premises (onsite) in Singapore
  • Experience on Agile/SCRUM practices
  • Detail-oriented
  • Fast learner, positive, enthusiastic, confident and committed
  • Team player

Talento Meld is a specialist recruitment business started in 2015 as a recruitment firm focused on IT projects. We have since evolved into a full specialist recruitment consultancy covering practice areas with the following dimensions in Accounting and Finance, Banking and Finance, Creative and Digital and Information Technology.

Talento Meld is the recruitment partner for international clients and multilingual candidates in Singapore. We strive in providing a personal touch and dedication in any assignment we undertake. We manage our clients’ and candidates’ expectations

","

Role: Data Center Operator

Location: Novena

Possible Planned Visits: Choa Chu Kang/Cantonment

Working Hours: 8am – 5pm/9am to 6pm (Mondays to Fridays)

Standby: Willing to perform standby on weekends and after office hours (Time-off provided if need to work late)

Type of Role: Contract (12 months renewable) (Possible conversion to Permanent)

Remuneration: Base Salary

Responsibilities:

  • Perform daily operations role and responsible for the day-to-day smooth execution and continuous operations.
  • Assist to oversee the IT equipment hardware inventory on individual racks inside the DC.
  • On site management of works conducted within the DC such as preparation, site survey, network cabling, electrical wiring, air-conditioning, building power supply (including power generator) test, infrastructure & System maintenance, on site / off site standby activities etc.
  • Shall conduct proactive monitoring on the Environmental Equipment in the DC to ensure they are operating acceptable level and escalate promptly to the relevant authority or third-party vendors to rectify any defects alerted.
  • Administer Security Management Systems (CCTV, Keypress, Visitor Management System) and validate visitor security clearance approvals during DC access application processing.
  • Management of the physical access to the DC.
  • Accompany third party vendors to carry works for the Data Center.

Requirements:

  • ITE/Diploma/Degree in Information Technology or equivalent.
  • Minimum 1 year of hands-on experience in Data Center environment.
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server and understanding of Networking concepts.
  • Experience with Veritas NetBackup Software usage.
  • PC Skills such as Word and Excel.
  • Able to communicate in English effectively in writing and verbally.
  • Will be willing to travel within 2 other different sites(Choa Chu Kang/Cantonment) on a planned basis unless there are urgent escalations.
  • Singaporeans only.

For a confidential discussion, interested applicants please kindly send your updated resume.

column2:
Founded in 1975, Eng Kong Holdings Limited as a warehouse and container services operator. Within just 3 years of establishment, the group broadened its business portfolio by setting up a new segment to grow and develop its container depot business. Today, Eng Kong Holdings has evolved into an integrated logistics operator and is a key provider of container related services such as storage, handling, repair and maintenance to global firms operating in the Asia-Pacific region.","

Operations (Data Entry) Assistant

Responsible for updating container movements and ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Manning the Container Depot Counter area by providing timely and efficient coordination to internal and external parties.

Responsibilities :

• Perform data entry and maintain proper filling system.

• Update container movements.

• Collecting cash and issuing receipt.

• Liaise with external parties with issues pertaining to releasing/ pick-up of containers.

• Liaise internally to ensure smooth operations.

No working experience are welcome to apply as long as you fulfil the following requirements:

• PC literate

• Familiar with MS Word, MS Excel, etc.

• Willing to work OT

• Demonstrate ability to handle work independently and efficiently with a strong customer service mindset.

column3: TP ICAP group, operates at the heart of the world’s financial, energy and commodities markets. We are professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world’s financial markets, covering FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy & Commodities.

Globally, we are a leading provider of market participants, with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes. Matching buyers and sellers, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. We operate a hybrid model where brokers provide business-critical intelligence to clients. It’s supplemented by proprietary screens for historical data, analytics and execution functionality.

column1:
","

Corporate culture and guiding principles:

TP ICAP operates at the heart of the world’s financial, energy and commodities markets.

We are professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world’s financial markets, covering FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy & Commodities.

Globally, we are a leading provider of market participants, with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes. Matching buyers and sellers, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. We operate a hybrid model where brokers provide business-critical intelligence to clients. It’s supplemented by proprietary screens for historical data, analytics and execution functionality.

Our clients include banks, insurance companies, pension and hedge funds, asset managers, energy producers and refiners, as well as risk and compliance managers and charities.

We are known in the market for our Honesty, Integrity and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Employees are expected to uphold the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties.

Job Duties:

· Ensuring optimal accuracy and timeliness of Data on a real-time basis while implementing monitoring tools to detect data issues.

· Collaborating closely with internal teams and businesses units to manage data to drive sales channel targeting and accommodate client needs.

· Resolving Data quality issues, this includes root cause analysis while managing internal and external vendors to resolve Data issues.

· Ensuring Data security, this includes facilitating Data protection and compliance of customer's Data while incorporating emerging technologies to enhance existing Data Warehouse.

· Flexibility to stretch and take challenges

· Communication & Interpersonal skills, a team player.

· Attitude to learn and execute

· Role requires individual to work on weekends or public holidays to support or deploy solutions.

· Resilient under pressure, have a mind-set of continuous improvement and can-do desire to provide excellent service.

· Proactive approach to spotting problems, areas for improvement, performance bottlenecks, etc.

· Act with integrity and due skill, care and diligence in carrying out your duties

Principal Responsibilities

· The candidate will be responsible for supporting and troubleshooting components that connect to electronic trading venues such as exchanges and client feeds. This includes related components such as integration with pre-trade risk checking systems.

Qualifications/Skills Required

· 5+ years of professional experience in financial institutions and/or financial services.Comfortable to dive into exchange specs and protocol definitions such as FIX protocol.

· Proficient with OS and network level tuning and editing scripts on Windows/Linux platforms.

· Scripting experience (Python or Linux bash or tcl).

· Understanding of Asian feeds across the board. Experience of market-data platforms i.e. Refinitiv, Bloomberg, direct feed providers, cloud technology such as AWS, GCP. Basic networking/connectivity skills (e.g. Multicast, routing, TCP/IP working knowledge).

· Ability to conduct self-learning, pick up new tools and able to be independent with minimal guidance from the project leads/managers

Person Specification

Knowledge

· Degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or equivalent

· Good to have: Financial markets/ trading business knowledge with exposure to market data products eg. Refinitiv (TREP), Refinitiv Workspace, jpassoc subscriber and compositor, contex, cityvision excelerator, Geneos, BPIPE , MPF experience with large scale/ high frequency/low latency distributed applications

· Understands ideas and has a viewpoint on the markets and economy

· Ability to collaborate with stakeholders outside of the immediate department ‘to get the job done’

· A thorough knowledge of at least 1 of the following must be demonstrated:

a) TREP

b) FIX protocol as used for Market Data

· Knowledge of market Data Terminals such as EIKON or Bloomberg a distinct advantage

· Basic knowledge of Excel using Real-Time data should be shown

Skills

Client Focused

· Personable and engaging

· Communicates effectively and efficiently to internal and external stakeholders

· Build relationships and networks with both internally and externally wherever possible

· Demonstrates strong customer focus

· Demonstrates ability to work effectively with others

· Constructively handles disagreements to reach a resolution

· Ability to work with diverse groups/ personalities

Innovative

· Open to innovative ideas/ experiences and ability to create new ideas, approaches or insights

· Seeks opportunities for improvements

· Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativity

Dynamic & Competitive

· Demonstrates high levels of energy in seeking out and achieving new goals

· Goes that “extra mile”

· Is a self-starter

· Shows evidence of being comfortable working in fast paced or pressured environments

· Enjoys a challenge and is able to escalate

· Does not give up easily

Open & Communicative

· Adapts communication style to suit audience

· Projects personal credibility

· Interacts confidently without being overbearing

· Ability to work effectively in a high pressure environment

· Keeps emotions under control in difficult situations

· Handles criticism constructively

Professional Integrity

· Able to demonstrate honesty, integrity and professionalism

· Promotes loyalty to TP ICAP and its principles

· Works ethically and shows respect for both professional and company values

","['Collaborative culture', 'Rewarding environment']",Senior Executive,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9405439&advertisement_id=9403810&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70170,Central,sg
