478,data,/en/job/quality-data-coordinator-9383753,9383753,Quality Data Coordinator,False,False,,,SGD,Air Liquide Advanced Materials Singapore Pte. Ltd.,15-Mar-22,False,,,202009052C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,26 Tuas W Ave,"

Air Liquide Advanced Materials (ALAM) is transforming the science of electronics and technology. We innovate with atomic scale engineering to open up countless new possibilities in how the world lives, works and connects. Today, our ALOHATM and Voltaix® products are critical to the manufacture of the newest computer chips required for Big Data and the Internet of Things. To enhance our execution from discovery to delivery we are adding talented people to our team.

","

The science of electronics is transforming exponentially through innovation and connectivity around the planet. Every day, breakthroughs are making technologies – from micro-processors, memory chips and flat panels to photovoltaic cells – even smaller and more powerful, opening up countless new possibilities in how the world lives, works and connects. Air Liquide Advanced Materials grows by enabling our customers to innovate. Our ALOHA™, enScribe, and Voltaix® product lines are critical to the manufacture of the newest computer chips required for Big Data and the Internet of Things. To enhance our execution from discovery to delivery (“lab-to-fab”), we are adding talented people to our team.

Air Liquide Advanced Materials is actively seeking a Quality Data Coordinator to be located at our Singapore manufacturing facility. Reporting to the Quality Manager, the Quality Data Coordinator will provide data entry, system, and administrative support. This includes development of tools and continuous improvement of administrative processes within ALAM. In addition, this position provides administrative project support and practical input for special initiatives and projects within ALAM. Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize, and organize diversified workload and recommend changes to continuously improve practices and procedures.

Responsibilities: 

  • Enters accurate data into computer software programs (information databases, spreadsheets), assembles data from multiple sources, and compares to standards. 
  • Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
  • Completes data entry as necessary with the ability to analyze, reconcile, and provide evaluation of data collected.
  • Project-based efforts involving data comparison, reporting, etc.
  • Reports and summarizes data used to characterize business metrics and objectives.
  • Analyzes trends within administrative systems (including analytical results, SPC, SQC, document control, MOC, records management, etc.), and suggests and implements corrective or preventive actions to promote continuous improvement.
  • Develops and executes follow-up processes to ensure management system user compliance with company procedures and policies, including auditing content of documents, forms, requests, etc. and making recommendations to users to drive global consistency across the organization.
Qualifications
  • Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields: Computer Science, Chemistry, Mathematics, Engineering
  • 3+ years of experience with data entry, data comparison and / or manipulation
  • A thorough understanding of statistical analysis and quantitative problem solving tools and methods
  • Data comprehension and understanding, ability to compare data, utilize data to determine other parameters, recognize differences in data, manipulate data to reach conclusions and/or identify trends, develop data based reports
  • Proficient with an understanding of data relationships / hierarchies, data format / struction, ability to offload, manipulate and compile data, understanding of data mapping and derivation, experience with sql tools
  • Computer proficiency – excellent Microsoft Excel or equivalent skills, database experience
  • Ability to learn new software systems and effective use them
Additional Information
  • Experience in setting up systems and statistical methodologies to evaluate control limit data, customer complaint information, and other metadata sources.
  • Knowledge and experience in one or more quality software systems (ERP, LIMs, Doc Control, Statistical Analysis Software)
  • Proficiency with Google Suite applications
  • Database administrator experience
  • Some programming experience with a skill set for data consolidation, analysis and dashboarding of information.

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Job Summary:
A software developer position is available in the Data Management department at Singapore Institute for Clinical Sciences (SICS), Agency of Science and Technology Research (A *STAR). The focus of our group is the management of the clinical data from national and international birth cohort studies. The successful candidate will involve in develop, enhance, and maintain existing applications.
Job Responsibilities:
  • Perform requirements gathering with end users and translate business requirements into software solutions.
  • Perform a mix of maintenance, enhancements and new development as required.
  • Provide internal support for application deployed.
  • Resolve findings from vulnerability assessment and penetration testing (VAPT).
  • Create documentation for software and systems, as appropriate.
  • Works to keep informed on the latest trends, technologies and best practices in software development.
Job Requirements
Qualification & Field of Study
  • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering or equivalent
Min. Years of Experience
  • At least 2 years of working experience in software development
Other Requirements (e.g. Skills, Competencies)
  • Self-motivated, independent, and initiative individuals.
  • Good analytical, problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills
  • Experience in PHP, MYSQL, Linux, Javascript, JQuery and Bootstrap.
  • Experience in going through full software development life cycles (SDLC)

6. Strong sense of responsibility, good external communication and teamwork skills, active and eager to learn.

484,data,/en/job/head-%7C-assistant-head-%5Binfo-data-management%5D-a*star-graduate-academy-9390960,9390960,"Head | Assistant Head [Info/Data Management], A*STAR Graduate Academy",False,False,,,SGD,"Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)",17-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0002C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
The A*STAR Graduate Academy (A*GA) plays a key role in nurturing and developing a steady pipeline of young scientific talent to A*STAR and Singapore. Focused on talent attraction and development through scholarships and collaborative programmes with universities, schools and other stakeholders, A*GA augments Singapore’s scientific workforce with very bright young talent.
A*GA is looking for a motivated and resourceful individual with strong analytical abilities as well as a keen interest in  R&D manpower/talent policies and strategies that support A*STAR’s and national goals and objectives. Meticulous and detail oriented, you must be comfortable with conducting quantitative data analysis. A significant focus for this portfolio would be  managing information, especially data, pertaining to A*GA and research manpower, as well as other key data that may be required to monitor trends, track performance or progress; this data/information would better inform policy and scheme reviews as well as internal processes for A*GA.
Your work would involve oversight of information/data pertaining to A*GA and talent, connections (data sources upstream as well as downstream applications), processing of the data to conduct quantitative data analysis, interpretation of data; this will contribute towards providing timely and accurate performance, data and/or statistical reports to Management. As a member of the broader Planning & Info Management team, you would work closely with the Planning team, and may also need to collaborate with other officers in the Info Management team with regard to data residing within the information management system(s) used in A*GA.
From time to time, you may also be called upon to play a role in other areas under A*GA’s remit such as talent development programmes, policies, resources and budget requirements, governance or policy functions for A*GA, or conceptualize/ implement strategic manpower initiatives.
You will develop a deeper understanding of R&D manpower policy and its wider impact on Singapore, as well as skills in interpretation of data to make informed policy recommendations. You will hone your interpersonal and communication skills to engage a diverse set of stakeholders within and outside A*STAR, including at the senior management levels.
Job Requirements
  • Degree in any discipline
  • Strong strategic and analytical thinking skills
  • Comfortable dealing with data and numbers
  • Effective communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills
  • Able to work independently and in a team to deliver results under tight timelines
  • Proficient in Microsoft office suite (e.g. Microsoft Excel)
  • Relevant experience in using statistical software would be an advantage
  • Relevant working experience in the public sector, strategic and/or corporate planning, data analysis or project management would be an advantage
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Manager,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://careers.a-star.edu.sg/JobDetails.aspx?ID=fLnAqpaQ5qkbTUbI8zuW7Q%3d%3d,70000,Singapore,sg

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
About Digital Transformation, Innovation & Data Division (DTID)
The Digital Transformation, Innovation & Data Division (DTID) is the business transformation office to drive A*STAR towards a digitally enabled and data-driven organisation. The office is responsible to define the digital vision, formulate digital strategies and develop the digital roadmap to frame and provide directions towards our digitalization efforts. DTID acts as the catalyst in driving digital transformation and is the bridge between business owners and technology supports. As the central office, DTID performs the role as the horizontal integrator to synergise and harmonise digital efforts and drive complex and cross-cutting digital initiatives for A*STAR. Beyond business-technology, the roles of DTID also entails the raising of digitally skilled and creative workforce to empower our workforce to harness digital technology and embrace business transformation. To support digitalization efforts, the office is also responsible to set digital/data policies and put in place governance and standards.
Job Description
As the Deputy Director DTID, you are responsible to support the Director/Chief Data Officer (CDO) and lead the DTID team to transform A*STAR into a digital organisation. You are expected to be a hands-on and lead your team to:
  • Support the Director to implement the digital/data strategies, roadmap and initiatives to achieve A*STAR’s digital vision
  • Assist the Director to develop and implement digital/data policies and governance to support A*STAR’s digital efforts
  • Assist the CDO to drive data culture in A*STAR and build data infrastructure to harness the full potential of data for insights and decisions
  • Work and collaborate with our training department to drive digital literacy and innovation programme to uplift A*STAR workforce to equip them with the skills to embrace digital technology and business transformation
  • Drive complex digital projects and deliver outcomes
    • Apply Design Thinking / Service Journey methodologies to facilitate the definition of problem statements, draw insights, formulate business requirements and develop new business models to transform our business processes
    • Help business owners to derive functional/technical specifications and source for most cost-effective solutions that best meet A*STAR’s needs
    • Ensure your digital projects is aligned with the digital architecture so as to ensure seamless system and data integration
    • Manage project risks and adopt the appropriate development methodology (e.g. Agile or Waterfall)
    • Ensure your digital project is ready for smooth deployment with clear adoption and operations roll out plans.
    • Analyse impact of requested changes and propose improvements to continuously address changing business needs
Job Requirements
  • At least 12 years of experience in strategy planning, technology development, business process re-engineering and project management skills
  • Exposure with design thinking, user journey mapping and project management methodologies (e.g. waterfall, agile)
  • Good understanding and working knowledge of current IT trends and modern digital technologies
  • Experience in facilitating business users to define problem statements, articulate desired business outcomes and drive business transformation or process re-engineering
  • Ability to translate business needs to technological requirements and propose digital solutions to achieve the desired process outcomes
  • Project management skills to drive large scale projects and manage technical implementation to deliver outcomes within the approved budget and timelines
  • Familiarity with Government / Public Sector Financial, Procurement and Cybersecurity Instruction Manuals and experience in governance, risk management and compliance is preferred
  • Possess strong leadership qualities with the ability to provide guidance to your team members
  • Good organisation acumen, excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage leadership, internal and external stakeholders as well as technology staff
  • Dynamic and self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and excellence
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills as well as oral and written communication skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column1: 491,data,/en/job/senior-analyst-manager-analytics-4108br-9409682,9409682,"Senior Analyst / Manager, Analytics - (4108BR)",False,False,,,USD,National Healthcare Group Corporate Office (HQ),6 hours ago,False,,,200002150H,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,One-North,"<div>

column2: The National Healthcare Group (NHG) is a leader in public healthcare in Singapore, recognised at home and abroad for the quality of its medical expertise and facilities. Care is provided through an integrated network of six primary care polyclinics, acute care and tertiary hospitals, national specialty centres and business divisions. Together they bring a rich legacy of medical expertise to our philosophy of integrated patient-centred care.

column1: <div>

column2: NHG's vision is ""Adding Years of Healthy Life"". This vision goes beyond merely healing the sick to the more difficult and infinitely more rewarding task of preventing illness and preserving health and quality of life. With some 20,000 staff, NHG aims to provide care that is patient-centric, accessible, seamless, comprehensive, appropriate and cost-effective.

column1: <div>

column2:
As the Regional Health System (RHS) for Central Singapore, it is vital for NHG to partner and collaborate with stakeholders, community advisors, and voluntary welfare organisations. Together with our patients, their families and caregivers, we aim to deliver integrated healthcare services and programmes that help in Adding Years of Healthy Life to all concerned.","To enhance NHG's effectiveness as an accountable care provider by providing the best available evidence; collating and disseminating research findings to share knowledge on the best practices for improving healthcare system and patient outcomes; and facilitating the translation of research findings into the NHG's integrative care programmes.

Support organisational strategic growth and development for GIC Clinical division in data related work. The primary responsibilities and duties include supporting the Director in enabling the translation of technical requirements into visualisation for data analysis and trending for indicators related but not limited to Population Health and Cluster performance.

Work in partnership with the expanded cluster-wide clinician team comprising of multi-disciplinary team members - to facilitate a healthcare analytics' lens in evaluating transformational work at the meso-macro level, with an eye to scale, sustainable Integrated Care Programmes. He or she is expected to be a team player, working closely with various NHG institutional colleagues, liaising, and collaborating with stakeholders such as the Ministry of Health and Integrated Health Information Systems (iHIS).

Major Duties & Responsibilities

1. Enhance NHG's effectiveness as an integrated care provider 

  • Strategizing empirically-based research and analysis to advance knowledge on patient and population health in support of NHG's role in Population Health Management and the War on Diabetes; 
  • Formulating epidemiological and population health research questions and designing robust and methodologically sound studies to provide evidence-based decision support for NHG Group Integrative Care efforts for stratified patients / population; 
  • Conducting analyses/research and collaborate with clinicians to support clinical initiatives and healthcare transformation across various clinical-horizontal programmes, pre-disease & chronic disease programme development and evaluation using large administrative and clinical database to provide strategic support for informed decision making;
  • Working with GAC & GIC colleagues to facilitate the seeding of evidence-based, impactful integrative care initiatives that optimizes health for the different population segments in NHG's population catchment.
2. Harnessing NGEMR Registries to support reporting of integrative care initiatives
  • Work with various clinical & NGEMR stakeholders in understanding NGEMR EPIC Disease Registries to aid in holistic Population Health reporting and to enrich design of various clinical-horizontal dashboards & metrics.
3. Integrate care-integration programme findings into various NHG care models 
  • Helping other department staff & colleagues to understand the implications of the evaluation, research & analytics findings; and 
  • Facilitating the incorporation of evidence-base into various NHG's chronic disease prevention or management programmes.
4. Administer population health research studies
  • Providing inputs to & writing related Population Health research & evaluation proposals; 
  • Administering DSRB applications; and
  • Administering Project Agreements on programme evaluation studies to protect patient/client data usage and ensure data confidentiality is observed by all working partners.
5. Developing others
  • Taking a mentoring / leading role in establishing evaluation & research designs and analysis framework for the junior members of the department; and
  • Providing consultation to NHG colleagues (including those in NHGP, IMH, TTSH, etc) on matters pertaining to analytics, evaluative design & research methodologies.

Job Requirement
  • Minimum Degree or advanced graduate training in Public Health
  • At least 8 years of full time experience working in an applied quantitative research setting in healthcare industry
  • Formal training in research methods and a strong understanding of basic statistical concepts
  • Proficient in the use of statistical software (SPSS, Stata, R or SAS)
  • Strong analytical skills 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Adaptable, goal-oriented, self starter who is proactive and able to work under pressure as well as in rapidly evolving environments
",[],Manager,,,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Medical', 'Bonus']",https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=fb4348af2cf3a8a460b59acc47c2889b,70100,Singapore,sg

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:

Bioinformatics Specialist, Machine Learning and Genome Data Analytics (GIS)
The Single-Cell In Situ Spatial Omics at subcellular Resolution (SCISSOR) team is looking for smart, motivated machine learning and data analytics researchers who can contribute to the development of new imaging-based methods for understanding and diagnosing cancer.  The candidate should have strong mathematical intuition and programming skills, and be comfortable working in a highly collaborative multidisciplinary environment that includes biologists, imaging technologists, pathologists and medical oncologists. This will be a unique opportunity to learn cutting edge data analytics and computational biology techniques in the rapidly growing field of spatial Omics.
SCISSOR is a well-supported multidisciplinary program that creates spatial and non-spatial genomic technologies, applies them to clinical samples, generates massive multimodal datasets and interprets them to infer the molecular drivers of tumor growth and response to immunotherapy and other treatments. We have a track record of combining cutting-edge computational and experimental approaches to infer disease mechanisms and develop clinical applications (Chen et al., Science 2015; Li et al., Nat Genet 2017; Sun et al., Cell 2016; Fukawa et al., Nat Med 2016; del Rosario et al., Nat Methods 2015; Kumar et al., Nat Biotechnol 2013; Ku et al., Lancet Oncol 2012).
Requirements:  
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, or a related field
  • High proficiency in scripting language (Perl, Python and statistical languages such as R, particularly in the use of packages such as Bioconducter or Biopython)
  • Additional programming skills in Java or C++ will be useful and candidate should be experienced working in Unix environments with computing clusters/servers
  • A strong background and course work in statistics, computer science and data science is preferable    
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2:
Antalpha is a financial institution that trying to open channels between traditional finance and blockchain finance. The company lead by visionary leaders who are always focusing on risk management trying to build a compliant crypto asset management platform.With offices located in Singapore, Hongkong, USA and Switzerland, Antalpha aims to continue our rapid growth and expand our innovative platforms towards providing more financial services to our customers.Antalpha is a venture capital firm focused on early-stage blockchain companies. A blockchain is a distributed database that is shared among the nodes of a computer network. As a database, a blockchain stores information electronically in digital format. Blockchains are best known for their crucial role in cryptocurrency systems, such as Bitcoin, for maintaining a secure and decentralized record of transactions. The innovation with a blockchain is that it guarantees the fidelity and security of a record of data and generates trust without the need for a trusted third partyWe leverage our strategic partnerships and years of experience in the blockchain space and cryptocurrency investments to help our portfolio companies build disruptive decentralized web 3.0 businesses.Comprised of an international team of financial professionals and technology specialists that are leaders in their respective fields, Antalpha aims to support its portfolio companies by leveraging its insights, network, and access to proprietary resources.Our headquarter is in Singapore, with offices in Hong Kong, Zurich, and San Francisco","

The BD assistant is directly report to CIO, and assist CIO to grow across different channels for the business. He/ she is required to develop business strategies and initiatives to drive the overall business performance, explore and expand into new markets as well as use analytics to study existing practices and identify areas of improvements. His/her primary responsibility will be to bring in new customers through leads generated from various sources. He/ She will be expected to provide a high level of service to these prospective customers.

Responsibilities

1 Provide necessary admin and follow up support to CIO

2 Compilation of reports and general filing and documentation, compilation for tender/proposal documents and submission

3 Follow up current client database for CIO, understand and collect any connected party interest as well as try to reactivate existing customers’ business

4 Promote long term relationship and loyalty, responsible for database management

5 Prepare meeting minutes for CIO meeting

6 Attend to inquiries about company services

7 Continuous collect the development of partners and corresponding the market demand

8 Other duties as and when assigned

Requirements

1. Study in Finance and Economic preferred

2. Effective communicator

3. Passion for crypto and digital assets have financial backup will be an advantage

4. A team player, with outgoing, pleasant personality and positive attitude

5. A passion for crypto and digital assets with an astute understanding of B2B client needs

6. Fluency in English is a must and business/advanced level of Chinese will be considered as an asset

7. Able to work independently in a fast-paced working environment attitude

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
JOB DESCRIPTION
We are looking for highly-motivated and skilled data scientist to work on a new initiative that can develop models and gain insight into the bioprocessing of glycoprotein drugs. The work will result in the creation of advanced algorithms for the prediction and control of processes for glycoprotein therapeutic drug quality. 
The successful candidate will work with a team of data scientists, chemists and engineers to develop novel methodologies to consistently manufacture quality glycoprotein therapeutics. The developed methodologies will have the ability to assist scientists through automation and help them understand how to control the process. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to tap into a large pool of in-house data from different disciplines and to interact with industry to understand how the algorithms can be translated. Successful candidate will also engage in project scoping with industry companies to develop solution to address the data analytics needs.
JOB REQUIREMENT
  • PhD in the field of computer science, computer engineering, mathematics and statistics, electrical engineering, or other data science intensive program. With expertise in at least one of the following areas: biological data analytics, data mining and management, machine learning and statistical learning.
  • Entry Level candidate with relevant experience may apply
  • Ability to work independently to innovate, and develop prototypes to demonstrate the feasibility of research ideas
  • Good knowledge on data analytics, machine learning, data mining and experiences in solving real-world problems. Particularly biological problems.
  • Proficient in Python, R, C++ or Java
  • Prior industry experience with computational biology or modelling of biological processes is a plus.
  • Able to deliver under tight schedule
  • Good team player with both research and engineering ethics
  • Eagerness to learn new science
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column1: 501,data,/en/job/data-analyst-mgr-avp-digital-transformation-%5B210000y1%5D-9378003,9378003,"Data Analyst (Mgr/AVP), Digital & Transformation, - [210000Y1]",False,False,,,SGD,OCBC Bank (Singapore),14-Mar-22,False,,30 days,193200032W,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: The OCBC Bank group of businesses comprises a family of companies owned by Singapore’s longest-established local bank.

OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. Since the time of our founders, we have always understood the financial needs of our customers and developed financial solutions that meet their needs.

To address increasingly diverse needs across different communities and geographies, OCBC Bank has expanded and acquired businesses beyond the realm of commercial banking. OCBC Bank has been ranked by Bloomberg Markets magazine as the World's Strongest Bank for two years, 2011 and 2012.

column1:
","
Data Analyst (Mgr/AVP), Digital & Transformation, Global Corporate Banking - (210000Y1)

At Global Corporate Banking, we serve a diverse group of domestic and multinational corporations across a range of industries including government agencies, real estate, utilities, infrastructure, healthcare, technology, transportation, commodities and energy amongst others. We have dedicated relationship managers in offices across the world who provide comprehensive and personalised coverage to our clients through deep understanding of their activities and needs.
We are looking for an individual with data analytics and storytelling experience to join the Digital & Transformation Office to help the businesses organise and wrangle valuable information from big data. The individual should be a self-starter, energetic and have a passion for both problem-solving and telling compelling stories using data. He/she will also work closely with our colleagues from the Group’s data analytics teams as well as Product Owners of digital transformation projects to solidify Global Corporate Banking's data foundation and directly impact divisional automation initiatives and customer experience. We require an individual with an agile and nimble mindset, good understanding of emergent industry tools and best practices in data automation for delivering solutions at a rapid pace.
Roles & Responsibilities
  • Design data driven solutions by collaborating with business stakeholders and analytics team to enable Global Corporate Banking to identify risks and capture new business opportunities;
  • Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes;
  • Regular interaction with Business Heads and Relationship Managers to understand their business objectives. Proactively recommend how you think data & analytics could help them achieve their goals;
  • Independently create and design data analytics prototypes and Proof-of-Concepts (POCs) to get buy-in from end-users, and collaborate with platform Product Owners to implement successful POCs on our digital platforms;
  • Identify and collect measurements of success of each digital product to prepare and deliver usage/metrics reports to senior/business stakeholders with the use of slide presentations, product demonstrations, email newsletters or white papers
*LI-VN

Qualifications

Requirements
  • BA/BS degree in math, statistics, economics or related quantitative field
  • At least 3 years of hands-on experience in the practice of data programming and visualisation tools such as Python, SQL, and Hadoop for data analytics and data storytelling.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, writing, presentation, statistical and data analysis skills
  • Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Experience with project management and working cross-functionally with data services, engineering, marketing and sales teams
  • Expert knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel), database structures and big data
  • High attention to details, meticulous and able to work in an ambiguous environment with minimal supervision
  • Track record of working creatively and analytically to solve complex problems
  • Strong ability to create visually impactful and effective data presentations to influence decisioning
  • Good knowledge of Corporate & Transaction Banking

502,data,/en/job/associate-business-analyst-consumer-banking-group-wd31715-9407053,9407053,"Associate, Business Analyst, Consumer Banking Group - (WD31715)",False,False,,,SGD,DBS Bank Limited,23-Mar-22,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Business FunctionAs the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you.Responsibilities
  • Drive Cognitive and Automated Banking initiatives through Machine Learning models, development and automation of Control Towers / Alerts

  • Leverage Data Driven Operating Model (DDOM) to maximise value from data in business management, and deliver shared goals with Branch Banking partners

  • Identify opportunities and develop strategies to drive retail customer engagement for financial planning opportunities

  • Accelerate Control Towers development. Present clear, concise and actionable insights to key partners. Lead discussions on analytics and interpretation of results
Requirements
  • Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computing or related disciplines

  • Strong SAS, SQL, MS Excel, PowerPoint skills. Python experience is an advantage

  • Team player with ability to work independently around tight deadlines and able to prioritise in a dynamic, fast-paces environment

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

  • Self-driven, passionate with a strong desire to learn to develop professionally

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Minimum 2 years of business analytics working experience
Apply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column3: Ninja Van is an express logistics business created to take the hassle out of the parcel delivery process for online shoppers and catering to the logistics needs of Southeast Asia’s thriving e-commerce sector.
Driven by a desire to revolutionise the logistics industry, Ninja Van’s three co-founders - Lai Chang Wen, Shaun Chong, Tan Boxian - set up the company in 2014.

Encouraged by the success of the business in Singapore, Ninja Van subsequently expanded their operations in other parts of Southeast Asia and now has a presence in six of Southeast Asia’s key markets: Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam and Philippines.

504,data,/en/job/manager-it-governance-office-of-data-and-digital-governance-9330564,9330564,"Manager (IT Governance), Office of Data and Digital Governance",False,False,,,SGD,Singapore Health Services Pte Ltd (SingHealth HQ),16-Mar-22,False,,,200002698Z,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div>

SingHealth HQ is the headquarters of SingHealth, the largest public healthcare cluster in Singapore. We focus on cluster-wide, strategic core functions for the organisation and work closely with our institutions and care teams to facilitate excellent care for our patients.

We offer a diverse variety of roles that you can fulfil your career aspirations in. You can choose from domain areas such as medical and clinical services, regional health system, research, education, organisational transformation and informatics, as well as corporate services including operations, finance, human resources, legal and communications. These comprise healthcare administration roles and other unique jobs such as genetic counsellors and clinical research nurses.

","

As part of SingHealth’s digitalisation drive to further enhance patient services and innovation, you will ensure that SingHealth’s IT systems operate with essential IT governance practices to facilitate system robustness and safe use of data.

You will act as an internal independent party to review compliance with established IT Security policies and procedures. You will also participate in the development of IT governance procedures in line with requirements in the healthcare sector, with relevant dashboards for tracking purposes.  

In addition, you will review IT systems to ensure that the IT & Data control measures are in place and comply with SingHealth’s standards. You will validate projects and ensure they meet the control procedures before deployment to production.   

Being part of the advisory team, you will participate in recommending IT governance procedures and controls in new IT systems or in existing IT processes.

You will also identify trends in the information technology governance domain to help the organisation achieve business objectives while ensuring robust governance and security.

Job Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science, Information Management or Management Information Systems or related fields
  • Minimum 8 years of Information Technology experience, preferably with at least 5 years in IT governance and risk management. Preference will be given to candidates with Project Management experience.
  • Certification in ITIL, COBIT, PMP would be advantageous
  • Possess strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to get buy-in from stakeholders
  • Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19
",[],Manager,,8 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)', 'Subject to Designation']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9330564&advertisement_id=9328935&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg

column2: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
TikTok is a global short-form mobile video platform that allows you to express yourself by creating content. It gives rise to engaging, interactive challenges and trending topics in which anyone can participate. TikTok aims to capture and showcase the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter, directly from your mobile phone. TikTok has global offices in many cities, including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.","

About Us

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, Moscow, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

We are looking for an Talent Acquisition Program Manager who is eager to help ensure our processes are compliant internally and externally, wants to be part of the piece to improve our operational efficiency, and can commit to a 1 year contract.

Responsibilities

- First-tier support for administrative tasks and execution of HR related matters.

- Assist in the preparation of documentation and recruitment data/reports

- Exercise judgment and discretion to determine appropriate actions or solutions to problems.

- Partner with recruiters and sourcers to ensure a deep understanding of fullcyle recruitment and find ways to value add to the processes.

- Identify opportunities for processes to be improved and enhanced for efficiency

- Any other general administrative duties/ad-hoc projects as assigned by immediate supervisor.

Minimum Qualifications

- Experience in a fast-paced, high growth Tech company.

- Understanding of Singapore employment hiring practices

- 1+ years of People Operations/Human Resources related experience.

- Fast learner, and ability to digest instructions and connect the dots with logical thinking

- Experience with HRIS systems will be an added advantage

- Experience as an HR Generalist.

- Basic knowledge of excel formulas and data processing and analysis

- Ability to cope well with ambiguity and change in a dynamic environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

About the Role

A global digital advertising agency, is currently looking for a motivated and capable Data Analyst with experience in e-commerce. This role will requires you to manage the overall e-commerce performance analysis. You will report directly to the Director. 
Job Description
  • PurePlayer “Brand Store” monthly website performance report through Seller Center Dashboard
  • Key Performance Index(KPI) performance tracking by attribution frame work (Visit/ Engagement/ Conversion by Traffic source/ Device/ frequency and regency/ demographic profile)
  • Feed analysis and management for improving SEO (Suggested Keyword) with product information optimization
  • Real-time competitor analysis and optimization for price, promotion, stock, and etc.
  • On demand Campaign performance analysis
  • Purchase propensity analysis of certain listed product in PurePlayer (Conversion by visitor’s segment)
  • Hypothesis validation with the data (Hypothesis condition & Actual performance correlation)
  • Dashboard building
  • Transfer analytics data to Dashboard based on the given solution (Google Studio, Datorama, etc.)
  • Automate the reporting process build the proper illustration chart format as executive summary
  • Advanced Analytics
  • More in-depth user profiling and attribution analysis by using SQL Query based on Google Big Query
  • Data is merged in Google Big Query based on Google Analytics + Google AdWords + CRM campaign
  • Keeping up to date with new software and technology developments. 
  • Responsible for any other ad hoc duties assigned.
Requirements
  • Diploma/ Bachelor in relevant field.
  • At least 3 years of relevant working experience in relevant field and role.
  • Solid working experience with website analytics tools, like Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics or PurePlayer data analytics. 
  • Solid working experience or collaboration on Analytics code tagging and auditing (Google Tag manager, FB Pixel, GG UTM Tag, etc.)
  • Working experience in SQL query for raw data access.
  • Working experience in Seller center dashboard tools running like Google Studio, Dataroma, etc.
  • Working experience in e-commerce and on-demand campaign performance analysis experiences. 
  • Experience in Python, JavaScript and CRM data analytics is preferred. 
  • Experience in importing and exporting data with JavaScript is a plus. 
  • Experience in Similarweb, Alexarank, or Appannie is a plus. 
  • Experience in FB/GG audience insight tools (Goodle keyword planner, Display planner, FB audience insight) is a plus. 
  • Experience in CRM data analytics like SalesForce or SAP Hybris is a plus. 
  • Comfortable working in a fast paced and global environment.
  • Highly adapatable and keen to learn new technologies and skills. 
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, and time management skills.
  • A desire to thrive in a hard-working, fast-paced and collaborative team.
  • Great communicator, negotiator and team-player.
About the Company
Our client offers the benefits of a work environment that is stimulating and challenging. Located in the Central, you will enjoy working in a cohesive environment, with up-to-date technology, and opportunity for growth. 
Interest & Apply
Interested applicants please send your resume to cv_janice@goodjobcreations.com.sg with your current resume and expected salary for a confidential discussion.
EA Personnel Name: Janice Meidalina Salim
EA Personnel Registration No.: R1987396
EA License No: 07C5771

Making Business Flow

CEVA Logistics is a leading global supply chain management company. We provide end-to-end design, Implementation and operational solutions in contract logistics and freight forwarding to large and medium-sized national and multnational companies.
CEVA focuses on a diverse range of market sectors including:
<ul>

For more information, please visit us at www.cevalogistics.com.","

The data quality manager will coordinate and manage data integrity in the operating system for CEVA CLL origin operations affecting the customer’s Global Supply Chain, including provision of managerial leadership to data quality team managing milestones and reports:

·      Forwarder Management and Performance

·      Event Disruption

·      Crisis Management

·      Milestone Management

 

Key Accountabilities:

  • Manage and support a team responsible for driving Data Quality errors to resolution
  • Work with cross functional teams e.g. Operations Account owner, System Super User, System Customer Solutions etc. to liaise on business requirements to support the Account and Data Reconciliation initiatives
  • Lead and drive 3PL required milestone completeness and timeliness data integrated into CLL origin operation’s operating system with the relevant parties
  • Create and manage recurring and ad hoc reports
  • Capture and communicate system deficiencies that impacts milestone visibility of customers’ shipments
  • Provide decision support to business leadership by developing meaningful insights from data analysis and/or from piecing together data from different sources
  • Ensures operational compliance with contractual requirements and commitments e.g. Customers’ KPI
  • Coordinate and provide input and assistance for regional data cleansing projects
  • Identify improvement areas for milestone visibility and engage appropriate teams to drive proactive solutions or implement required changes

Education, Experience & Training

  • Equivalent of a Diploma or higher in business management or Supply Chain Management. Freight Forwarding experience and a thorough understanding of global transport logistics (air/ocean/ground)
  • 8 years operational experience of working experience in completing similar tasks to those above 
  • Advanced knowledge of office products, Excel, PPT, Word

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","

Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

As part of Group T&O, our team is dedicated towards the governance of frameworks and libraries are, with a critical eye towards architecture and best practices. As these frameworks and libraries are used across a wide swathe of DBS applications, it is imperative that they remain grounded in sound software development principles, allowing for higher code quality and maintainability.

Responsibilities

  • Analysis and interpretation of business requirements to functional and development specification.

  • Implementation of web-based applications within all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

  • Drive components contribution and reusability across platforms.

  • Understand notion of Web and Mobile framework and how it applies to overall standardization and re-use.

  • Work as part of the squad and deliver in agile model.

Requirements

  • 3+ years professional development experience.

  • Strong communication to collaborate with stakeholders in all levels - (business, product, design, and development).

  • Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Sketch.

  • Hands on experience on at least two of the following JavaScript frameworks:

  • ReactJS (highly preferred)

  • ANGULAR (4 and above)

  • VueJS.

  • Knowledge of JavaScript and web technologies (HTML/CSS).

  • Knowledge of Popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux).

  • Prior experience with data structure libraries (e.g., Immutable.js).

  • Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools.

  • Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.

  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements.

  • A knack for benchmarking and optimization.

  • Testing experience, ideally Cucumber, Cypress, Selenium or PACT.

  • Demonstrable experience in Object Oriented JavaScript without the use of a library or framework.

  • Mobile development experience is a big plus.

Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

SingHealth HQ is the headquarters of SingHealth, the largest public healthcare cluster in Singapore. We focus on cluster-wide, strategic core functions for the organisation and work closely with our institutions and care teams to facilitate excellent care for our patients.

We offer a diverse variety of roles that you can fulfil your career aspirations in. You can choose from domain areas such as medical and clinical services, regional health system, research, education, organisational transformation and informatics, as well as corporate services including operations, finance, human resources, legal and communications. These comprise healthcare administration roles and other unique jobs such as genetic counsellors and clinical research nurses.

","

You will be responsible for developing and optimising the data and data pipeline architecture to support data quality and insight needs of SingHealth users. You will also oversee the development and use of the data systems, perform data analysis, gap analysis, impact analysis to improve data quality, data governance, policy compliance and data standardisation. You will also monitor the data integrity within the analytics ecosystem for quality control, compliances and standardisation.

You will drive self-service analytics through data democratisation and collaboration with stakeholders across the organisation. You will drive the growth of data literacy across SingHealth and ensure that your solutions benefit users with varying proficiency in data literacy.

Job Requirements

  • Masters or Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Business Analytics, Information System, System Engineering or other relevant quantitative disciplines.
  • At least 7 years of hands-on experience in data management, data architecture and data modeling. Candidates with additional years of experience may be considered for the Senior Principal Analyst position.
  • Prior experience in Healthcare is an advantage.
  • Working experience in data lake related technologies, building and optimising big data pipelines, building processes supporting data transformation and automated metadata capture.
  • Strong knowledge of database structure systems and the DataOps methodology.
  • Proficient in software languages such as SQL, R, Python and database reporting tools.
  • Strong problem-solving and quantitative computational skills
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Desire to grow and help others grow in technical competencies
  • Meticulous and able to work effectively both independently and in a team
  • Passionate in contributing to public healthcare
  • Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19
",[],Senior Manager,,7 years,Not Specified,,Full-Time,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)', 'Subject to Designation']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9382831&advertisement_id=9381202&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,701702,Bukit Merah,sg

516,data,/en/job/marketing-data-analyst-9320928,9320928,Marketing Data Analyst,False,False,4000,5000,SGD,Carro Singapore,12-Mar-22,False,,9 days,201525411C,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:center"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.

Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.

Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee.
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace

Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.

In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.

","

You will get to collaborate with talented individuals from various departments including product, data and business teams. You will also be given the opportunity to drive actionable insights through analytics across owned and paid channels, backed by data-driven approach to marketing.

What you will be doing:

  • Collaborate with the internal marketing team, sales team, and tech team to integrate data
  • Create and manage detailed marketing analysis & report in a different format (spreadsheets, dashboard, and presentation)
  • Develop and monitor data quality metrics to ensure business data and reporting needs are met
  • Keep up to date with the latest practices on data visualization and management to improve reporting/business analytics at scale
  • Report directly to Group Performance Marketing Manager

What you will need:

  • Bachelor degree from a recognised local university, ideally from Marketing, Statistics, or Maths
  • At least 1 to 2 years working experience in related field with proven track record
  • Must be proficient at Excel, PowerPoint, and Google Data Studio. SQL is plus point
  • Excel at working with big data and highly analytical
  • Attention to detail and take ownership of projects
  • Ability to work in a fast pace environment that always change
  • Highly resourceful, business minded and consumer focused
  • Knowledge in industry level digital marketing tools such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Google Analytics are big plus points.
",[],Junior Executive,,1 year,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Medical', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)', 'Variable Bonus']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9320928&advertisement_id=9319299&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,701701,Bishan,sg

518,data,/en/job/senior-freight-optimization-and-management-data-analytics-9385842,9385842,Senior Freight Optimization and Management (Data Analytics),False,False,,,SGD,Applied Materials South East Asia Pte Ltd,16-Mar-22,False,,30 days,1995070151,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"
At Applied Materials, our innovations make possible the technology shaping the future. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels on an industrial scale is used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world.

First establishing its presence in Singapore in 1991, Applied Materials (Applied) has since grown to a strategic hub for the company in Southeast Asia supporting diverse functions including manufacturing, R&D and customers’ support services in the region.

Today, Singapore’s Asia Production Center (APC) is responsible for half of Applied’s annual production of semiconductor equipment globally, the largest outside the United States. Applied is the largest contributor of output and employment for Singapore’s semiconductor equipment industry.","

Key Responsibilities

  • Experienced cross border / global supply chain network design / freight optimization professional.
  • Perform, Identify and drive spend reduction opportunities. Align delivery to internal and external customer needs. Drive and optimize total landed cost for inbound raw materials. Includes inventory holding, operations (warehousing and x-dock), indirect tax (customs, etc.) and freight costs.
  • Initiate / identify design and implementation of new business processes.
  • Develop and drive Freight process improvement projects to increase service level performance and/or minimize costs.  Project scope is significant in complexity and has global impact; includes integration of processes with Outsourced Logistics Operations providers.
  • Assist in the development of metrics/KPIs. Analyze exception trends and identify and drive potential systemic issue resolutions.  
  • Report on weekly performance and the impact to strategic goals and cost structures. Establish corrective action initiatives based on root cause identification, and work with outsourced and regional logistics partners to implement systemic improvements.
  • Develop and maintain cost estimates and demand forecasts for logistics modeling and tracking.  Provide monthly freight accrual recommendation.
  • Navigate internal stakeholder (Direct materials sourcing, Manufacturing, Inventory Planning, and sales operations) to obtain buy in, and drive opportunities to fruition.
  • Lead cross functional project teams and mentor lower level personnel:
  • Coach / Manage junior Freight Analyst / SCND Freight Engineers. Work with remote stakeholder and across time zones.
  • Educate coach junior team members on data analytics tools, Inventory and SCND software.
  • Support contract setup with Outsourced Logistics Operations; define routing guides and align to necessary service levels.
  • Freight modes in scope: Multi-modal, Air freight, Parcel, FTL, LTL, FCL, LCL, Road, Dedicated fleet, milk runs, x-dock).

Functional Knowledge

  • Regarded as the technical expert in their particular field
  • Demonstrates in-depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline and broad knowledge of other disciplines within the function
  • Greater than 8 years in similar functions.

Business Expertise

  • Anticipates business and regulatory issues; recommends product, process or service improvements 

Leadership

  • Leads projects with notable risk and complexity; develops the strategy for project execution

Problem Solving

  • Solves unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business; requires conceptual and innovative thinking to develop solutions

Impact

  • Impacts the direction and resource allocation for program, project or services; works within general functional policies and industry guidelines

Interpersonal Skills

  • Communicates complex ideas, anticipates potential objections and persuades others, often at senior levels, to adopt a different point of view

519,data,/en/job/manufacturing-power-bi-specialist-%5B187476br%5D-9404920,9404920,Manufacturing Power BI Specialist -- [187476BR],False,False,,,SGD,Thermo Fisher Scientific,22-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200510503Z,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.","
How Will You Make an Impact?
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $35 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 90,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com
What will you do?
  • Participate as Specialist/Developer for Manufacturing Power BI development.
  • Drive and develop Power BI project in Manufacturing to create a visual system.
  • Support MES (Camstar) deployment to convert the paper-based system into digitized record system.
  • Work closely with operations team to develop Power BI dashboard to monitor the production daily performance.
  • Analyzing raw data and using the resulting insights to tell data stories for the team to carry out the necessary actions.
  • Work on transferring real time information from MES (Camstar) to Power BI dashboard.
  • The visual system will be used to analyze, and present data through the creation of insightful and actionable reports.
  • Make appropriate decisions on issues with minimum guidance.
  • Provide MES training to production personal to ensure end users are competent.
  • Plan and execute activities with other department to ensure common goals are met.
  • Participate in improvement programs (e.g. cost reduction, capacity improvement, work efficiency improvement, etc.).
  • Handle/ resolve issues and when necessary, escalate to the respective owner for disposition.
  • Develop technical or training material as needed.
How will you get here?
Education:
  • Relevant Diploma in IT/Computer studies
  • Higher Nitec, Nitec or related technical certifications i.e. NTC certificates with 3 years of relevant working experience
Experience:
  • 2+ years’ experience in Power BI, Power Automate, Power Apps.
  • 2+ years’ experience in MS office suite (Excel, PowerPoint & Word)
  • Basic knowledge in Manufacturing execution system (MES).
  • Experience in manufacturing environment.
  • 1 years’ experience with Python/R script language programming.
Competencies Preferred
  • Understand ISO9001 & ISO13485 requirements.
  • Understand basic of project management.
  • Good problem-solving and data analysis skills.
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Independent and self-motivated.
  • Ability to present and communicate at all levels
  • Working Location: Marsiling
  • Join our Talent Community for exciting career opportunities!
  • https://jobs.thermofisher.com/i/global/en/jointalentcommunity
