612,data,/en/job/media-analyst-9393897,9393897,Media Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,CARMA ASIA PTE. LTD.,18-Mar-22,False,,28 days,201814771W,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"

CARMA is the world's most globally diverse media intelligence agency and the leading provider of media monitoring and analysis solutions.

Our expansion into the Asia Pacific region provides an exciting new opportunity and a working environment with the best of both worlds; an entrepreneur-lead start up with access to the resources, technology and funding of an established international enterprise.

The mission is to provide media intelligence solutions, media monitoring and analysis across platforms including print, online, social and broadcast to organizations throughout Asia. Our solutions allow clients to make well-informed business decisions and thus the successful applicant will directly contribute to their success and ours.

Our clients include PR, communications, and marketing professionals in all industries in the private sector, governments and NGOs.

We pride ourselves in creating an exceptional work experience for our employees and we are seeking out top talent due to an exciting phase of expansion.

","

Job Description: Media Analyst

Job Highlights

  • The successful applicant will gain global industry exposure
  • Elevate your skills with comprehensive training provided by industry leaders
  • Work with some of APAC’s most dynamic and innovative brands

Job Purpose

  • We’re looking for a talented analyst with a passion for media and communications to join our team. As a media analyst based in Singapore you will provide in depth media analysis reports to some of APAC’s leading brands. Your exceptional communications skills and your analytical ability will be a key asset to our growing team.

Job Description

  • Manage complex quantitative and qualitative media analysis projects in order to provide clients with high level reporting on their media performance and brand reputation.
  • Analyse and interpret mainstream, social media and market research data sets in order to provide meaningful insights for clients
  • Design visually compelling reports via PowerPoint and Tableau
  • Brainstorm and strategise ways to evolve and improve report quality and team
  • efficiency
  • Manage your portfolio of projects to ensure reports are of an exceptional quality and delivered to deadline
  • Support the Commercial Team by advising and contributing best practices in quantitative and qualitative reporting techniques

What we’re looking for:

  • Exceptional corporate writing skills with strong attention to detail
  • Excellent project management and time management skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Exceptional data analysis skills in Excel and/or data visualisation platforms
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and one other native
  • language (Chinese/Malay/Tamil)
  • Ability to work effectively individually and in a fun team environment
  • Passion in news, current affairs and social media trends

Qualifications

  • 2+ years of experience in a related industry (essential)
  • Advanced Skills in MS Excel and PowerPoint (essential)
  • Degree in Media, Communications or Public Relations (desirable)

About CARMA

CARMA is the world's most globally diverse media intelligence agency and the leading provider of media monitoring and analysis solutions. Our solutions allow clients to make well-informed business decisions and thus the successful applicant will directly contribute to their success and ours.

Our clients include PR & Communications and marketing professionals in all industries in the private sector, governments, and NGOs. We take pride in creating an exceptional work experience for our employees and we are seeking out top talent due to an exciting phase of expansion. The successful applicant can expect a dynamic working environment with plenty of scopes to develop a long career within the business and contribute directly to organisational growth.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

column3: <div>

column4: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

column3: <div>

column4: NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

column3: <div>

column4: Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

column3: <div>

column4: Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column3: For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

The Centre for Healthy and Sustainable Cities (CHESS) in Wee Kim Wee School of Communication and Information (http://www.wkwsci.ntu.edu.sg) invites interested candidates to apply for a Research Associate position.
The position will support a SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) funded project to identify i) skillsets needed by current and future seniors to stay employable in the Retail Sector in the post Covid era; ii) barriers to learning and training (to support skilling/reskilling/upskilling) among current and future seniors, including barriers caused by COVID-19.
Job Responsibilities
  • Conduct secondary data analysis from multiple sources on identifying skill gaps
  • Prepare literature review on skills transfer, reskilling, upskilling, and lifelong learning
  • Contribute to research presentation, and writing of academic papers, grant proposals, management and technical reports
Job Requirements
  • Master Degree from recognized University in the discipline of Ageing Studies, Data Science, Informatics, Psychology, Sociology or related fields
  • Experiences in writing and publishing academic papers
  • Familiar with research methodology and data analytic methods in behavioral and social sciences
  • Knowledge of statistics packages (e.g. SPSS, R, Python)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently and in a team with people of diverse skillsets and cultural background
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column3: Xilinx is now part of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD).

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible.  We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results.  It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world.   If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

column1:
","

Xilinx is now part of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD).

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies ' building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the 'extra mile' to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Job Description

As a Business Management Pricing Analyst, you will be responsible for managing complex business engagements with key Datacenter and Communication customers across the globe.

Pre Opportunity Win, you will work with the Sales and Marketing teams to win the right deals with the right commercial terms, aligning to the Business Unit strategy. You will support the pricing proposal part of this engagement.

  • Field new opportunities from Sales and put together pricing analyses
  • Assess the value proposition of AMD-Xilinx offers verses our competitors
  • Develop win-win customer proposals for sales while continuing to meet company revenue and profitability goals
  • Responsible for pricing approvals covering silicon and non-silicon items
  • Drive pricing discussions / escalations with BU management (and Executive management team if needed)
  • Drive commercial contract negotiations with internal stakeholders and customers where needed
  • Develop relationship with factory, Sales and BU to help drive profitable growth

Post Opportunity Win, you will manage the ongoing business to maximize the accounts / regions revenue and profitability.

  • Analyse business and report on results, both internally and externally
  • Evaluate the effectiveness of pricing strategies
  • Work on projects for key Business Operations initiatives aimed at improving processes and results
  • Participate (if required) in forums such as QBRs, MARs or GMF

Key Competencies / Skills

  • Strong business and financial acumen
  • Pricing knowledge / experience will be a plus. Including an understanding of Value Based Pricing.
  • Strong communication skills across all levels of the organization
  • High proficiency level in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
  • Use objective analysis and sound judgment to identify the best course of action
  • Ability to work independently and influence across different levels of the organisation
  • Team player
  • Strong attention to accuracy and detail is required
  • Having market segment or semiconductors knowledge will be a plus

The successful candidate’s minimum qualifications will include the following:

  • At least 1-2 years of business experience, preferably in the Hi-tech or semiconductor industry
  • Understanding of the Sales Process
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, finance, business or equivalent work experience

column3: The OCBC Bank group of businesses comprises a family of companies owned by Singapore’s longest-established local bank.

OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. Since the time of our founders, we have always understood the financial needs of our customers and developed financial solutions that meet their needs.

To address increasingly diverse needs across different communities and geographies, OCBC Bank has expanded and acquired businesses beyond the realm of commercial banking. OCBC Bank has been ranked by Bloomberg Markets magazine as the World's Strongest Bank for two years, 2011 and 2012.

column1:
","
What does GDMO do?
The Group Data Management Office (GDMO) plans, priorities and executes key data initiatives that build long-term data governance and management capabilities, to enable OCBC Group in meeting its regulatory obligations and digitalization objectives.
Position Available
Candidate for the role will be expected to oversee and coordinate the administrative, finance, planning and compliance aspects of GDMO’ function which would include:
  • Oversee and coordinate finance, planning and performance monitoring against targets and objectives for GDMO, including:
    • coordinating department plans and budgets
    • tracking milestones and operating expenses against approved budget and planned timelines
  • Monitor GDMO’s compliance, audit and regulatory issues and completion status
  • Coordinate submissions of internal regulatory attestations
  • Be the initial liaison officer for all Group Risk Divisional matters involving GDMO
  • Perform routine administrative functions, such as organizing department meetings, maintaining paper files, etc.
*LI-AL

Qualifications and Qualities
The successful candidate will be expected to be/have:
  • Polytechnic Diploma or equivalent
  • Good oral and writing skills, interpersonal skills and organizational ability
  • High level of initiative and commitment to work independently and as part of a team
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications, i.e. Excel, Word, Powerpoint, and Sharepoint
  • Ability to multi-task and work under tight timelines

column3: <div>

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

column3: <div>

column4: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

column3: <div>

column4: NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

column3: <div>

column4: Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

column3: <div>

column4: Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column3: For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

column1:
","
The Centre for Healthy and Sustainable Cities (CHESS) in Wee Kim Wee School of Communication and Information (http://www.wkwsci.ntu.edu.sg) invites interested candidates to apply for a Research Associate position.
The position will support a SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) funded project to identify i) skillsets needed by current and future seniors to stay employable in the Retail Sector in the post Covid era; ii) barriers to learning and training (to support skilling/reskilling/upskilling) among current and future seniors, including barriers caused by COVID-19.
Job Responsibilities
  • Conduct secondary data analysis from multiple sources on identifying skill gaps
  • Prepare literature review on skills transfer, reskilling, upskilling, and lifelong learning
  • Contribute to research presentation, and writing of academic papers, grant proposals, manment and technical reports
Job Requirements
  • Master from recognized University in the discipline of ing Studies, Data Science, Informatics, Psychology, Sociology or related fields
  • Experiences in writing and publishing academic papers
  • Familiar with research methodology and data analytic methods in behavioral and social sciences
  • Knowledge of statistics packs (e.g. SPSS, R, Python)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently and in a team with people of diverse skillsets and cultural background
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

","

The School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Principal Research Scientist.

The Principal Research Scientist will work on a project related to Smart Nation IoT-system Threat Analytics. The role entails the responsibility of project planning, scheduling and formulating operation management policies, coordination with stakeholders for operations management and organization of cybersecurity events like hackathons, seminars etc. The job also requires coordination with researchers for preparation and submission of reports.

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Perform project planning, scheduling and formulate operation management policies

  • Coordination with stakeholders for operations management

  • Organization of cybersecurity events (like hackathons, seminars etc.)

  • Coordination with researchers for preparation and submission of reports

Job Requirements: 

  • ​A PhD degree in IT, Computer Engineering, or any other relevant field

  • Minimum 8 years of experience after PhD degree, preferably in cybersecurity research or IoT system architecture, including at least 4 years of project management experience

  • Applicants with a master's degree and a minimum of 12 years working experience will be considered

  • A proven track record of international publications in relevant fields

  • Familiar with IoT, virtualization and distributed systems

  • Experience in international research collaboration, security information and event management (SIEM), malware analysis, machine learning, cyber physical systems (CPS), or security architectures/frameworks is a plus

  • Proficient in technical reporting/presentations

  • Good verbal communication skills and be ability to work independently and in a team to realize the proposed works

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Position reports to Group Corporate Development
  • Gather information and data points on technology, regulatory and economic themes and events that impact or drive the evolution of the industry
  • Perform in-depth research and analysis of new markets, including macroeconomic data, competitive landscape, pricing , relevant regulations and communication channels as part of market entry studies
  • Combine internal, external research and market intel to provide actionable insights, commentary and reports to senior management
  • Maintain database of gathered information and data points for internal referencing
  • Produce ad hoc and periodic State of the market analysis pieces for an internal audience
  • Support development of new products, business models and revenue streams where applicable
  • Front external consultants and internal stakeholders for commissioned market reports
  • Support ad hoc research needs in sustainability and renewable energy projects
Requirements

  • Min 5 years in an analyst, corporate development or strategy role
  • Exceptional analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Deep understanding of tech, enterprise and cloud services
  • Possess network of industry contacts across providers and users of tech, enterprise and cloud services
  • Familiarity with north & Southeast Asia Markets and its nuances, providers and users of colocation services.
  • Strong PowerPoint and Excel skills
  • Self-driven individual with demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills

624,data,/en/job/executive-healthcare-information-analytics-and-training-9362934,9362934,"Executive, Healthcare Information (Analytics And Training)",False,False,,,SGD,SingHealth Polyclinics,18-Mar-22,False,,29 days,52928775K,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"
SingHealth Polyclinics, a leader in family medicine, provides seamless, patient-centred and preventive healthcare that is affordable and accessible to all.

SingHealth Polyclinics' network of polyclinics provides primary healthcare services to the community. It plays an integral role in promoting a healthy lifestyle within the community and empowering families with the knowledge of common health issues, care and treatment options.
<div>
SingHealth Polyclinics is a member of Singapore Health Services (SingHealth) - a public healthcare cluster which also manages three hospitals and five specialty centres.

","

The SingHealth Polyclinic’s (SHP) Healthcare Information (HI) team’s Vision takes after that of SHP’s Data Administration Group (DAG), which is “A data-driven approach to better and safer care, with seamless access to data and analysis”. 

To that end, the Executive of HI’s Analytics and Training team will deliver the most viable solution to data problems in a timely manner by:

  • Facilitating requirements gathering sessions, digging deep to uncover users’ needs to set up project parameters
  • Brainstorming within or outside the team for viable solutions, then leading, coordinating and iterating through efforts to ensure timely project delivery
  • Turning insights into comprehensible narratives, guiding SHP’s evidence-based decision-making process by:
  1. separating the overly-technical/irrelevant chaff from the wheat when proposing solutions or explaining to the layman
  2. creating aesthetically-pleasing and functional visualisations that leads users to the desired narrative
  • Conducting training sessions to upskill the entire organisation in terms of simple data analyses

You will also assist in managing some general administrative duties.

Requirements:

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Analytics or Data Science with 2-5 years of relevant experience; OR graduate of other disciplines with 3-6 years of relevant experience
  • Experience in data management and analytics work, with proven and relevant project delivery experience; preferably with experience in the Healthcare industry
  • Grounded in data management and analytics methods and processes to lead the team’s data management and analytics-related work and to be the subject matter expert within SHP
  • Intermediate-level skills in platforms/software like Oracle Business Intelligence (OBIEE), Tableau, R/Python; able to quickly wrangle data to the required form for analysis and presentations
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills; able to dig enough to uncover users’ needs, work within a cross-matrix team or solo, and create and present comprehensible narratives
  • Able to prioritise tasks and requests – all pressing and urgent – and yet maintain good relationships with stakeholders

625,data,/en/job/research-associate-9393199,9393199,Research Associate,False,False,,,SGD,Media Partners Asia,20-Mar-22,False,,,201133928N,,,1 - 50 Employees,,Raffles Place,"
Founded in 2001, Media Partners Asia (MPA) is the leading independent provider of advisory, consulting and research services, focusing on media, telecommunications and entertainment industries in Asia Pacific. To learn more about MPA and its capabilities, visit www.media-partners-asia.com
","

Established in 2001, Media Partners Asia (MPA) is the leading independent provider of research, advisory and consulting services across digital media and telecoms industries in Asia Pacific. The company provides definitive reports with proprietary industry models and forecasts. Our reports are used and sourced for business planning, strategy and capital market transactions. Our advisory and consulting services help clients enter new markets and sectors, rollout products, and acquire businesses with our teams providing commercial due diligence, customized research and strategy recommendations. MPA also provides independent consultant industry analysis for equity and debt offerings. 

Our offering includes AMPD, a fast growing research platform incubated in 2019 with an IMDA trust certificate. AMPD Research uses passive measurement to provide actual customer behaviour data and insights across the rapidly growing digital ecosystem. AMPD is focused primarily on the rapidly growing digital streaming video landscape as well as connectivity and telecoms. The AMPD Vision Analytics platform operates in 14 markets and its sector focus will expand in the future to deep dive insights on Advertising, Gaming and Streaming Audio / Music. 

As a Research Associate, you will join MPA’s analyst team based in Singapore (hybrid model), supporting the team in the production of research reports, maintenance of MPA & AMPD databases, support delivery for client projects and more primarily in the form of Excel Models and Powerpoint Presentations. You will be expected to build familiarity and proficiency in data analysis in the APAC TMT sector with a heavy focus on Online Video Streaming, Content & Consumer Insights, TV Broadcasting, Telecommunications and more. 

MPA’s analyst team is small, highly focused and fast-paced, with room to grow skills, expertise and role (s) in deep data analysis, deck-building, report-writing and more in Asia’s rapidly evolving media and tech landscape. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research and understand market 
  • Develop and maintain key MPA databases
  • Support across MPA research reports and client projects

Required Skills/Experience:

  • Entry level candidates are welcome, additional work experience is a plus.
  • A passion for the media and entertainment industry and familiarity or interest in developments in media and tech in the region.
  • Proficient in Excel, Powerpoint and research writing.
  • Comfortable working with large data sets and distilling sharp insights and takeaways.
  • Team player with good communication skills + ability to work independently and reliably on assigned tasks.
  • Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools such as Tableau, Power BI etc. is a plus
  • Knowledge of Asian languages is a plus

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Short Description

The NUS School of Computing (SOC) traces its roots back to the Nanyang University Department of Computer Science that was established in 1975.  Since then, SOC has developed into one of the leading computing schools in the world, with faculty members who are both internationally recognised researchers and inspiring teachers.

Today, SOC offers undergraduate and graduate degree programmes across the full spectrum of the field of computing, including Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Business Analytics and Information Security, as well as specialisations in emerging areas of importance such as artificial intelligence, fintech, blockchain, analytics and security.

SOC Advanced Computing for Executives (ACE) unit was established to help business leaders, managers and professionals learn about emerging technology and how to harness them for digital transformation and business competitiveness.  ACE drives the expansion of SOC's lifelong learning offerings in a concerted and strategic way and aims to be the premier educator and thought leader in advanced computing and information technology.
 

Long Description

To augment our manpower resources in the School, we are looking for a suitably qualified candidate to join ACE unit.  Reporting to the Head, Executive Education, the incumbent shall develop, review and deliver executive education programmes/seminars related to Data Science, Business Analytics and Applied Statistics to business leaders, managers and professionals, as well as provide support in outreach activities and consultancy work.

The incumbent will be emplaced at an appropriate appointment grade, based on the individual merits of the candidate.
This role is offered on a 3-year renewable contract basis; renewal is subject to satisfactory on-the-job performance of the incumbent, and demand for the assigned programmes. 
Remuneration is on a 12- month salary package plus variable performance bonus, as well as regular employee benefits such as leave, medical and insurance coverage.
 

Job Description
  • Initiate, design, conduct and administer programmes, workshops and seminars as assigned
  • Liaise with Programme Managers and clients in determining training needs such that course materials are designed and contextualised to achieve desired learning outcomesDevise training strategies and create training materials, including testing and reviewing created materials
  • Monitor and assess learners' work, invigilate examinations
  • Source for and harness resources for instructional technology
  • Provide credible training consultancy services for ACE's clients
  • Participate in business development, marketing and promotion activities of assigned programmes
  • Research and stay current on the state of the art in artificial intelligence, business analytics and other information communication technology (ICT) practices
  • Supervise and coach training assistants in supporting training sessions
  • Carry out administrative duties as required
     
Qualifications

Academic & Professional Certification

  • At least a Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, or an IT-related discipline from a reputable university
  • In-depth knowledge of and experience in advanced business analytics and data visualisation 
  • Sound technical experience with applications like Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau and QlikSense, as well as coding using R and Python, preferred
  • Exposure to data mining, machine learning, deep learning, big data, artificial intelligence, simulation and deployment of production data science models an advantage 

Experience & Attributes 

  • Minimum 5 years' relevant working experience including the teaching of adult learners, especially business leaders, managers and professionals, with at least 3 years in a similar capacity
  • Excellent presentation skills; ability to present and explain difficult concepts clearly, concisely and in plain simple English
  • Familiarity with the use of live streaming technologies, smart boards, etc. is a plus
  • IT savvy and proficient in information systems and business analytics
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly numerate, analytical and meticulous with strong administration skillsResults-driven, self-motivated and highly disciplined
  • Strong team player, able to work collaboratively with various stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes
  • Resilient, resourceful with good problem-solving and critical-thinking skills, and thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented and ambiguous work environment
     
More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: School of Computing

Department : Department of Information Systems And Analytics

Employee Referral Eligible: Yes

Footer

To apply, please submit a comprehensive CV stating the expected monthly salary, together with a copy of all academic certificates before 30 Apr 2021.
Shortlisted candidates should be prepared to complete other administrative formalities before the interviews.

Our client, one of the world’s largest data center companies is looking for suitable candidates for the position of Facility Engineer.
Responsibilities:
  • Gain a complete understanding of all aspects of data center operations including the operation, maintenance and repair of all mission critical equipment and systems supporting a 24x7 data center operation to achieve 100% uptime and 100% compliance with all customer SLAs.
  • Supervision of construction activity and installations as required.
  • Ability to be the executor in the site specific change management processes including the creation of Method of Procedures (MOPs) for low risk preventative maintenance and repairs as well as the oversight of those maintenances as they are carried out.
  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot site mechanical and electrical systems.
  • Ability to respond to unplanned events without immediate supervision.
  • Ability to efficiently complete rounds/inspections and to detect anomalies during those rounds.
  • Develop or improve SOPs for site specific equipment.
  • Gain a good understanding and knowledge of the local customers business and data center operation.
  • Support various accreditation initiatives, including, but not limited to, SSAE16, SOC2, ISO 27001, etc. as may be required by company.
  • Complete DLR Critical Awareness Training

Job Requirements:
  • At least 1 years’ experience in mission critical facilities operating / engineering or equivalent equipment experience including assets associated with mission critical engineering relevant to the specific site. (UPS, HVAC, generators, fire/life safety systems).
  • Hands-on electrical or mechanical skill and competence in the area of non-expertise (for example, electrical expertise with mechanical competence, or vice-versa).
  • Strong knowledge of various UPS Systems and architectures.
  • Strong knowledge of various cooling systems and architectures.
  • Strong understanding of infrastructure redundancy configurations and equipment and their risks (N+1, 2N, ATS/ STS, Failover Scenarios)
  • Strong knowledge of energy efficiency principals.
  • Strong interpersonal, presentation and communication skills. Ability to respond effectively, verbally in writing to sensitive issues, complex inquiries or complaints.
  • Basic understanding of emergency situations and escalation processes.
  • Strong understanding of Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS), Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM), and power metering systems
For interested applicants, please apply online or send your resume in WORD format to sheennie_chiang@persolkelly.com
Thank you for your application but we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column3: Ninja Van is an express logistics business created to take the hassle out of the parcel delivery process for online shoppers and catering to the logistics needs of Southeast Asia’s thriving e-commerce sector.
Driven by a desire to revolutionise the logistics industry, Ninja Van’s three co-founders - Lai Chang Wen, Shaun Chong, Tan Boxian - set up the company in 2014.

Encouraged by the success of the business in Singapore, Ninja Van subsequently expanded their operations in other parts of Southeast Asia and now has a presence in six of Southeast Asia’s key markets: Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam and Philippines.

Reporting to the Regional Insights Manager, the incumbent is responsible for providing market insights analysis tailored to the stakeholders needs. He/she helps to support business decision making through data analysis and reporting.

Responsibilities

  • Design surveys and questionnaires
  • Perform qualitative research to attempt to understand why people do, buy, or think a certain way by researching their attitudes, opinions, and actions
  • Design, organize, and manage the distribution of research materials
  • Write and present insight reports

  • Make recommendations to Ninja Van stakeholders about how resulting information could be used
  • Collect information from various locations on the Internet such as forums and review websites on key market trends
  • Evaluate success and failures of competitors
  • Organize and present data in clear, concise manner
  • Evaluate effectiveness of advertising method

Requirements

  • Minimally a degree in a relevant field, with 0-2 years of marketing research experience

  • Proven stakeholder management skills 
  • Detail-oriented and quality-conscious 
  • Possess a can-do spirit, must be resourceful and independent

  • Proficiency in English (Reading, Writing & Speaking) is a must, ideally coupled with fluency in a second Southeast Asian language.

Competencies

  • Resource management - Effective managing of  time and resources 
  • Interpersonal skills - Team-working,  leading projects which require participation from various stakeholders
  • Communication skills - Clear communication with stakeholders who are unfamiliar with research
  • Data competencies - Comfortable with handling quantitative and qualitative data, including data cleaning and data analysis

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
About Digital Transformation, Innovation & Data Division (DTID)
The Digital Transformation, Innovation & Data Division (DTID) is the business transformation office to drive A*STAR towards a digitally enabled and data-driven organisation. The office is responsible to define the digital vision, formulate digital strategies and develop the digital roadmap to frame and provide directions towards our digitalization efforts. DTID acts as the catalyst in driving digital transformation and is the bridge between business owners and technology supports. As the central office, DTID performs the role as the horizontal integrator to synergise and harmonise digital efforts and drive complex and cross-cutting digital initiatives for A*STAR. Beyond business-technology, the roles of DTID also entails the raising of digitally skilled and creative workforce to empower our workforce to harness digital technology and embrace business transformation. To support digitalization efforts, the office is also responsible to set digital/data policies and put in place governance and standards.
Job Description
As the Deputy Director DTID, you are responsible to support the Director/Chief Data Officer (CDO) and lead the DTID team to transform A*STAR into a digital organisation. You are expected to be a hands-on and lead your team to:
  • Support the Director to implement the digital/data strategies, roadmap and initiatives to achieve A*STAR’s digital vision
  • Assist the Director to develop and implement digital/data policies and governance to support A*STAR’s digital efforts
  • Assist the CDO to drive data culture in A*STAR and build data infrastructure to harness the full potential of data for insights and decisions
  • Work and collaborate with our training department to drive digital literacy and innovation programme to uplift A*STAR workforce to equip them with the skills to embrace digital technology and business transformation
  • Drive complex digital projects and deliver outcomes
    • Apply Design Thinking / Service Journey methodologies to facilitate the definition of problem statements, draw insights, formulate business requirements and develop new business models to transform our business processes
    • Help business owners to derive functional/technical specifications and source for most cost-effective solutions that best meet A*STAR’s needs
    • Ensure your digital projects is aligned with the digital architecture so as to ensure seamless system and data integration
    • Manage project risks and adopt the appropriate development methodology (e.g. Agile or Waterfall)
    • Ensure your digital project is ready for smooth deployment with clear adoption and operations roll out plans.
    • Analyse impact of requested changes and propose improvements to continuously address changing business needs
Job Requirements
  • At least 12 years of experience in strategy planning, technology development, business process re-engineering and project management skills
  • Exposure with design thinking, user journey mapping and project management methodologies (e.g. waterfall, agile)
  • Good understanding and working knowledge of current IT trends and modern digital technologies
  • Experience in facilitating business users to define problem statements, articulate desired business outcomes and drive business transformation or process re-engineering
  • Ability to translate business needs to technological requirements and propose digital solutions to achieve the desired process outcomes
  • Project management skills to drive large scale projects and manage technical implementation to deliver outcomes within the approved budget and timelines
  • Familiarity with Government / Public Sector Financial, Procurement and Cybersecurity Instruction Manuals and experience in governance, risk management and compliance is preferred
  • Possess strong leadership qualities with the ability to provide guidance to your team members
  • Good organisation acumen, excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage leadership, internal and external stakeholders as well as technology staff
  • Dynamic and self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and excellence
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills as well as oral and written communication skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column3: Mediacorp is Singapore’s leading media company with the most complete range of platforms, spanning television, radio, newspapers, magazines, movies, digital and out-of-home media.
It pioneered the development of Singapore’s broadcasting industry, with the broadcast of Radio in 1936 and Television in 1963.
Today, Mediacorp has over 50 products and brands in four languages (English, Mandarin, Malay and Tamil), reaching out to all adults in Singapore every week.
Initiatives in the new digital space include Internet TV-on-demand, High Definition TV broadcast and Over-the-Top (OTT) interactive services.

column2: Beyond Singapore, Mediacorp is an active regional player through co-productions in TV dramas and movies, magazines publishing, as well as Channel NewsAsia International, one of the first Asian-owned English news channels.

column3: Our financial and strategic relationship in the region includes International Media Corporation in Vietnam, which was set up to develop and produce television entertainment and economic news content. Mediacorp also has a stake in Singapore-based retail firm Reebonz, one of the region's fastest growing luxury online retailers and a majority stake in Cubinet Interactive, a Malaysian digital games publisher.

column2: Winner of numerous international awards and accolades including Asian Television Awards' Terrestrial Broadcaster of the Year, Mediacorp’s mission is to engage, entertain and enrich audiences by harnessing the power of creativity.

633,data,/en/job/research-analyst-media-research-9339760,9339760,"Research Analyst, Media Research",False,False,3200,4200,SGD,GfK Asia Pte Ltd,19-Mar-22,False,,,199606060Z,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

We are a trusted partner to our clients helping them make better fact-based decisions to grow their businesses. We passionately focus on addressing our clients’ needs and improving their knowledge through the best digital research solutions in the world. We do this by integrating data from all sources and by providing prescriptive analytics giving insightful answers to their key business questions. We call this Growth from Knowledge.

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together and encourages an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. As a trusted leader in market research present in over 100 countries, we know what makes consumers' hearts beat - globally and locally. We work on projects for successful companies in virtually every major industry.

","

This is an exciting opportunity to join our Media Measurement team in Singapore. The selected candidate will have the opportunity to start on a fulfilling career in market research, media and digital measurement, working with local and global professionals in the media and market research field.

Pre-requisites

At least 2-3 years of market research experience, familiar with the quantitative data collection, data processing process, strong numeracy, preferably with statistics background and good writing skills. Good in SPSS and Advanced Excel. Experience working on statistical modelling e.g. Logistic Regression, imputation. Curiosity in consumer behavior, and interest in drawing market insights from research studies.

Key Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Project management of market research studies (questionnaire design, set up, data collection, processing, analysis and reporting)
  •  Analyse, chart and report quantitative survey results
  • Deliver accurate and insightful presentations to clients
  •  Work on business proposals to meet client’s marketing
  • Work on representativeness of sample studies
  • Quality assurance of the running measurement system
  • Liaise with clients on regular quality reports, queries, survey progress, etc.
  • Liaise with external fieldwork agencies on fieldwork and data cleaning, and delivery
  • Resolving issues relating to quality and methodology
  • Work on universe projections extrapolated from survey results
  • Work with global teams in media measurement – global expertise, local knowledge

Skills and Personal Attributes

  • Interest in media research and measurement development
  • Sound analytical skills, data-focused
  • Have worked extensively on SPSS using syntax, R, and Advanced Excel
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills
  • Team player, self-motivated, able to work independently
  • Ability to work under pressure of deadlines
  • Thorough with a strong attention to detail
  • Responsible and take ownership of issues
  • A good degree in Statistics/Business/Marketing/Economics
  • Candidates with at 3 years of experience in quantitative Market Research preferred

634,data,/en/job/software-security-team-lead-9377733,9377733,Software Security Team Lead,False,False,7000,10000,SGD,Shopline Commerce Pte. Ltd.,22-Mar-22,False,,,202013665N,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"

Founded in 2013, SHOPLINE is Asia’s biggest smart commerce platform that empowers merchants to succeed everywhere. We provide a full-featured platform that allows merchants to easily build their online shop and deliver a seamlessly omni-channel experience. 

SHOPLINE’s key services include inventory and sales management, regional logistics, payment gateways, data analytics tools, storefront theme designs, local customer support, and everything you need to create a store. SHOPLINE has offices in Hong Kong, Taiwan, Kuala Lumpur, Ho Chi Minh City, Shenzhen, Guanzhou, Singapore and Bangkok. To date, SHOPLINE has helped over 250,000 merchants to open their online stores.

Our team is agile and we provide benefits and support comparable to overseas startups. If you are interested in e-commerce or working in a startup environment, come talk to us!

","

About SHOPLINE:

SHOPLINE is Asia’s largest smart commerce platform. With our customers in mind, we strive to deliver scalable commerce solutions to merchants of all sizes. We’re a full-featured platform with services including online store opening, O2O solution, retail POS systems, advertising placement, business strategy consultation, marketing, and more to empower merchants to succeed in omnichannel retailing and cross-border commerce.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Ensure technologies meet security requirements including the company’s policies, external guidelines, regulatory expectations, and appropriate controls in information security, secure design, and cyber security.
  • Work closely with the Devops and Development teams in architecture design and review to provide specific security expertise.
  • Work with the Engineer Director and IT Director to define and assess the security strategies, architectures and practices.
  • Develop and maintain security architecture artifacts.
  • Act as a Security SME and provide implementation design to the application and Infrastructure team.
  • Conduct Technical risk assessments to capture security exceptions and design associated compensating controls based on the assessment results.
  • Define and maintain the infrastructure and application security framework and provide security assessments.
  • Work closely with managed SOC service provider on the setup, daily operations and coordinating incident response
  • Evaluate and assess new / emerging technologies to cope with changing risk of the E-Commerce environment.

Who we are looking for:

  • Proven experience as a Cyber Security Architect or Information Security Consultant with design and architecture experience
  • Experience with Incident Response within cloud environments and applications
  • Bachelor or Master Degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Proven experience building security reference architecture for all-in cloud deployments and hybrid scenarios
  • Experience deploying applications in cloud-based platforms such as AWS and Google Cloud
  • Experience with cloud security technologies and platforms such as cloud network policy and firewalls, data encryption and key management
  • Subject Matter Expertise in enterprise security solutions such as the below
  1. Identity and Access Management
  2. IPS and Anti-DDOS
  3. Security Incident and Event Management
  4. Endpoint Protection
  5. Data Loss Prevention
  6. Mobile Security
  7. Cloud Access Security Brokers
  8. Others

about the company

The company is a well-known and strongly established private equity firm with solid presence especially in Asia Pacific. This role is a newly-created headcount within the Investor Relations team.

about the job

The role is responsible for ensuring data in our proprietary database is accurate, complete, and scalable. This data is a critical input which will impact the team's investment decisions and investor relationship management. You will be responsible for the quality and consistency of data used on the company's web-based database system with the primary goal of ensuring data integrity. You will need to cross-check, refine, and resolve data quality issues from both tactical and strategic perspectives. You will be required to research on investors/ contacts (i.e. new investors, investor update/ contact movements etc), create and upload relevant details into CRM database, as well as update investor & contact info accordingly when new information is available.

about the manager / team

This role reports into the Head of the team and there are 4 other team members.

skills & requirements for the job

Being a self-starter is essential because as the team's Data Specialist, you will grow with the team, develop a deep understanding of complex transactions and work with their business partners to support new business requirements. This role is well-suited for somebody who is highly motivated, meticulous and has strong attention to details. Experience in CRM systems and experience in data analytics is preferred but not required. Please note that shortlisted candidates are required to pass a test as part of the interview process.



To apply online please use the 'apply' function. Consultant-in-charge: Tammie Phua
(EA: 94C3609/ R1109745 )

column3: SATS – Feed and Connect Communities

SATS is Asia's leading provider of food solutions and gateway services. Using innovative food technologies and resilient supply chains, we create tasty, quality food in sustainable ways for airlines, foodservice chains, retailers and institutions. With heartfelt service and advanced technology, we connect people, businesses and communities seamlessly through our comprehensive gateway services for customers such as airlines, cruise lines, freight forwarders, postal services and ecommerce companies.

Fulfilling our purpose to feed and connect communities, SATS is delighting customers in over 60 locations and 13 countries across the Asia Pacific, UK, and the Middle East. SATS has been listed on the Singapore Exchange since May 2000. For more information, please visit www.sats.com.sg.

column1:
","

About SATS - Feed and Connect Communities

SATS is Asia's leading provider of food solutions and gateway services. Using innovative food technologies and resilient supply chains, we create tasty, quality food in sustainable ways for airlines, foodservice chains, retailers and institutions. With heartfelt service and advanced technology, we connect people, businesses and communities seamlessly through our comprehensive gateway services for customers such as airlines, cruise lines, freight forwarders, postal services and eCommerce companies.

Fulfilling our purpose to feed and connect communities, SATS delights customers in over 55 locations and 14 countries across the Asia Pacific, UK, and the Middle East. SATS has been listed on the Singapore Exchange since May 2000. For more information, please visit www.sats.com.sg.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Contract and Data Management:

  1. Work closely with PAs to ensure that the system contracts and master data (vendor, material and other mater data) are duly approved before creating and/or updating them in a timely and accurate manner in the sourcing and procurement systems

  2. Work closely with relevant PAs, BUs and Digital Consumer Experience & Analytics (DNA) to extract and collate data from sourcing and procurement systems, and other systems such as payment systems

  3. Work closely with DNA and PAs to analyze data and update the dashboard to ease the monitoring of key expenditures and/or contracts

  4. Present curated data to stakeholders (Management, PAs and BUs)

Vendor Management:

  1. Review, recommend and improve existing procedures and processes for vendor on-boarding and performance management

  2. Oversee the on-boarding of vendors on Ariba and the creation of Business Partner (vendor master) record in S4 Hana and other sourcing and procurement systems

  3. Screen vendors including onsite due diligence assessment, if required, before the on-boarding process and on a periodic basis to manage associated vendor risks. Red flags found must be thoroughly investigated and if required, escalate to Ethics & Compliance

  4. Support vendors and attend to queries on vendor on-boarding processes, Company's policies and guidelines including Supplier Code of Conduct, as and when required

  5. Support PAs and BUs to improve vendor performance

  6. Set up and oversee a dashboard to track vendor performance

Other Matters:

  1. Any other matters / projects assigned by Reporting Officer from time to time.

KEY REQUIREMENTS

  1. The position holder should preferably be a degree holder (preferably in Business Analytics, Business Informatics, Information Systems or equivalent) and have a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in contract, data and vendor management

  2. Prior experience in Ariba and S4 Hana is preferred

  3. Knowledge of data analytic tools - Tableau, Power BI and data visualization and support experience - would be an advantage.   

  4. The person must have analytical mind with attention to details, good communication, interpersonal and leadership skills.

  5. Knowledge of MS office suites is essential.   

#LI-HH1

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 . Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
  • Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new IT software projects and initiatives to support and enhance our existing applications.
  • Provide assistance and advice to business users in the effective use of applications and information technology.
  • Work with business users to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access.
  • Define and document business functions and processes, functional requirements. Write technical procedures and documentation for the applications including operations, user guide, etc. Write detailed universally understood processes/steps/requirements for use in development and training
  • Assist in the creation of the system design and functional specifications for all new development projects.
  • Ensure appropriate standards and procedures are adhered to during the development process to support quality deliverables.
  • Assist the project team in issue resolution to meet the requirements and timelines
  • Define the training materials, and conduct formal system and user training sessions; facilitate train-the-trainer approach. Assist in training/mentoring other staff on the project     
  • Anticipate, analyze, address and resolve any functional or non-functional issues or risks either independently or together with the relevant stakehers and propose alternative solutions as necessary
Job Requirements
  • Bachelor  / Diploma in Computer Science / IT
  • At least 10  of technology experience with at least 4 hands-on technical roles in the field and relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
  • Extensive knowledge of data processing, hardware platforms, and enterprise software applications.
  • Technical experience with systems networking, databases, Web development, and user support.
  • Good background in data technologies including streaming, real-time analytics, real-time events processing, decisioning and offer manment
  • Good working knowledge skills with Microsoft Office Products, MS-Visio, MS-Excel and MS-Project.
  • Experience in the development and implementation of standards, procedures and guidelines to support operational processes.
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's , race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

column3: StarHub is Singapore's fully-integrated info-communication company, offering a full range of information, communications and entertainment services for both consumer and corporate markets. StarHub operates Singapore's fastest two-way HSPA+ mobile network that delivers up to 21Mbps for downlink to complement its nation-wide GSM network, and an island-wide HFC network that delivers multi-channel cable TV services (including High Definition Television and on-demand services) as well as ultra-high speed residential broadband services. StarHub also operates an extensive fixed business network that provides a wide range of data, voice and wholesale services.

Launched in 2000, StarHub has become one of Singapore's most innovative info-communications providers, and the pioneer in 'hubbing' - the ability to deliver unique integrated and converged services to all its customers. The role will be responsible to work with massive amounts of data to develop Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence (Al) models with Telco and other sets of data to help enterprises realise key business value through the use of Telco Insights. The data analyst will work closely key internal and external stakeholders to develop new Al products or new application areas for Al. The data analyst would develop Al applications for both internal and external stakeholders.
Responsibilities
  • Design and develop next generation of scalable Telco Big Data Analytics Models to support commercial projects across various business verticals.
  • Propose and design effective analytical approaches taking into consideration performance and scalability to large datasets, adhering to best practices for model development, and perform unit and system testing to validate the results of the analytics models. Constantly review and ensure that current methodology conforms and meets industry standards.
  • Participate and contribute to stakeholders' requirement gatherings sessions, co-creation workshops to size up stakeholders' problem statements and formulate and review best approaches to analytic solutions and models.
  • Propose and develop new analytics models and innovative techniques and algorithms to enhance SmartHub capabilities and value proposition of Telco Big Data,
  • Work with industry collaborators or research institutes for technical collaboration including proposing new potential areas for collaboration.
  • Any other related or ancillary duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you from time to time depending on StarHub's business and operational needs.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, Analytics or related disciplines, along with at least 3 years of relevant experience in Big Data analytics application development OR Master’s degree or PhD in computer science or related disciplines
  • Experience with Big Data Technologies
  • Experience in the following technologies: Hadoop, Kafka, Spark, PySpark
  • Programming experience in one or, preferably more, of the following languages: Python, Java, Scala
  • Experience in relational as well as NoSQL databases.
  • Exposure to real-time streaming technologies (e.g. Spark Streaming, Apache Flink)
  • Good understanding of software agile development
  • Basic understanding of continues integration and deployment
  • Basic understanding of docker orchestration tools, such as Kubernetes
  • Attention to details, a self-starter and self-learner continuously keeping up to date with industry developments
  • Creative problem solver and ability to think out of the box
  • Experience in Telco industry will be an advantage
*We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

EA Registration No. 12C5526","

Digital Transformation Architect

As a Digital Transformation Architect, you'll be working in a team that'll help other business units to implement new digital solutions. This role is perfect for someone who can work in a consultative approach to bring forth new ideas and insights.

Some ideal backgrounds include, but are not limited to: current digital consultants, candidates with experience in an in-house innovation/digital team, or those with experience within robotics, analytics, or IoT.

This is a full time role, the office is located in the CBD area, but it's mostly remote at this time.

The In-Depth Responsibilities:

  • Consult with different business units to deeply understand their processes, pain points, and then come up with potential solutions to improve.
  • Develop short-term and long-term strategy in support of growth and revenue targets. We'll need you to communicate various options and explain the benefits of digital transformation for each respective team/business unit.
  • Develop tech roadmap for business transformation with strong digital mindset and working with technology partners
  • Continuously stay curious and up to date with market trends/evolving tech - such as Machine/Deep Learning, Blockchain, Robotics, IoT, etc. Propose benefits, trade-offs and implementation strategies to business stakeholders.
  • Build innovative consumer-centric service models and revenue models for respective businesses.

Requirement:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree preferably in Engineering, Computer Science or related degrees
  • Successful track record in consultancy or Digital Transformation experience in high growth areas such as renewables, healthcare, food protein/nutrition, mobility and consumer platforms.
  • Ability to inspire and promote an entrepreneurial spirit of resourcefulness and adaptability across the organization while portraying a professional image.
  • Experience working with various business users, senior management, IT teams and external vendors effectively.
  • Ability to explain technical concepts in non-technical language. Be able to articulate and passionately present digital concepts to stakeholders.
  • Open to global opportunities

Preferably:

  • Experience in data science, analytics strategy development and/or data analytics execution
  • Experience in working with cutting edge tech
  • Strong interest in diverse industry segments
  • PMP and/or SCRUM certified

Please send your resume in WORD format by clicking the apply button below or contact Ronald Cheung on +65 6701 1521 for a confidential discussion. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.CEI Reg. Number R2090722 (Cheung Ronald).

column1: 649,data,/en/job/executive-panel-management-9410444,9410444,"Executive, Panel Management",False,False,2800,3500,SGD,GfK Asia Pte Ltd,2 hours ago,False,,,199606060Z,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

We are a trusted partner to our clients helping them make better fact-based decisions to grow their businesses. We passionately focus on addressing our clients’ needs and improving their knowledge through the best digital research solutions in the world. We do this by integrating data from all sources and by providing prescriptive analytics giving insightful answers to their key business questions. We call this Growth from Knowledge.

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together and encourages an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. As a trusted leader in market research present in over 100 countries, we know what makes consumers' hearts beat - globally and locally. We work on projects for successful companies in virtually every major industry.

","

A unique opportunity to join our expanding Television Audience Measurement team in Singapore. The successful candidate will be working in a team responsible for communication with households in a research panel and data maintenance including quality checks and reports.

This function is reporting to the Manager, Panel Management, Media Measurement

The Television Audience Measurement Team in Singapore is supported by the global GfK TAM team. After an intensive training your key responsibilities will include:

Responsibilities

  • Working together with Panel Management team to run a household research panel and a digital panel
  • Run quality control procedures, including regular outgoing calls to panel members for quality control purpose
  • Assist in handling recruitment processes to attract new respondents to participate in the media measurement studies
  • Handle telephone and email enquiries from panel members
  • Help manage database of household, individual and technical information
  • Conduct regular market research fieldwork to collect media consumption and social demographic information from panel members
  • Proactively engage partners to support Panel Management and Redemption programme
  • Assist in preparing newsletters, notifications, and letters to circulate to panel members

Requirements

  • Excellent communication/inter-personal skills
  • Excellent skills in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel
  • Basic knowledge of databases welcomed, how they are managed, and store data, understanding of relational databases
  • Good attention to detail and the ability to check all work thoroughly.
  • Good level of numeracy and logical comprehension
  • Prior experience in Market Research fieldwork and analysis is an added advantage
  • Prior experience in consumer/digital panels or customer service will be an added advantage

column4: The Singtel Group is Asia's leading communications group. We provide a diverse range of services including fixed, mobile, data, internet, TV and infocomms technology (ICT) as well as digital solutions.

column3: <div>

column4: Our main operations are in Singapore and Australia. Headquartered in Singapore, Singtel has more than 130 years of operating experience and has played a pivotal role in the country's development as a major communications hub. Today, we continue to lead and shape the local consumer and enterprise market. Our Australian arm, Optus is a leader in integrated telecommunications, constantly raising the bar in innovative products and services.

column3: <div>

column4: We are a major communications player in Asia and Africa through our strategic investments in five regional mobile operators, namely Telkomsel (Indonesia), Globe Telecom (the Philippines), Advanced Info Service (Thailand) and PBTL (Bangladesh). The Group also has investments in Bharti Airtel (India), which has significant presence in Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and Africa.

column3: <div>

column4: We are a long term strategic investor and work closely with our associates to grow the business by leveraging our scale in networks, customer reach and extensive operational experience. The Group serves over 500 million mobile customers around the world.

column3: Singtel is the largest listed company on the Singapore Exchange by market capitalisation. We are also listed on the Australian Securities Exchange following our acquisition of Optus in August 2001. To serve the needs of multinational corporations, Singtel has a vast network of offices in countries and territories throughout Asia Pacific, in Europe and the USA, while Optus has a network of offices around Australia.  The Group employs more than 22,000 staff worldwide.

Responsibilities: 
DC Operations Management
  • Ensure incidents are responded and attended to, or escalated for 2nd/3rd level resolution based on criticality, impact and SLA
  • Customer Request fulfilment and system management such as Electronic Visitation Management System
  • Remote Hand support for – media management, visual inspection, reboot devices, staging room, physical connect/disconnect of HDD, network cable connectivity test, insertion of fibre SFP
  • Manage equipment movement, asset tagging, labelling and tracking
  • Perform shift duty to support 24x7 DC Operations
DC Facilities Management
  • Perform Event Monitoring for all Data Centre Facilities infrastructure to ensure Data Centre is in normal function (eg. UPS, power, temperature control, humidity, water detection sensor, etc.).
  • Ensure all DC supporting infrastructure (i.e. Building Monitoring System (BMS), Environment Monitoring System (EMS), Access Control Systems, Electronic Visitation Management System, etc) are functioning well.
  • Update and maintain all DC related documentation, including reports generation where needed
  • Coordinate with various stakeholders to fix the technical issues to provide timely support to customers.
  • Coordinate maintenance and shutdowns (eg. working with vendors for DC electrical and mechanical systems)
Incident / Change / Customer Management and other requirements
  • Manage Incidents and Closure, including Root Cause Analysis on incidents
  • Raise the necessary requests from such as Change Request or notifications requests to the customers as part of service maintenance
  • Liaise with internal and external customers and ensure that customers’ contractual service level agreements are met
  • Perform other duties such as access clearance, and participate in projects as required
The ideal candidate should possess:
  • Diploma in Engineering / IT with at least 4 years of experience in DC Operations
  • Good knowledge in Data Centre Facilities and Operations Support as well as Data Centre Operations Best Practice
  • Possess Basic Certificate of Infocomm Technology and ITIL Foundation Level Certification
  • Team player who is also able to perform independently
  • Able to multi-task and work under pressure
  • Well organized and able to reschedule priorities as circumstances change 
  • Good communication skills (both verbal & written)
  • Analytical with good problem solving skills
  • Positive attitude and Proactive 
We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.
