column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
Our history spans more than 80 . Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department

The Data Manment Office and Big Data Analytics function answers the demand for quality and credible data across the Group.
The Data Manment Office (DMO) is a business function that covers Enterprise Data Governance, Data Manment, Big Data Analytics and Enterprise Data Strategy. Data Manment Office ensures that UOB meets all data governance standards set by data regulators and optimize data manment and us to help UOB make smarter, faster and more accurate decisions and to improve operational efficiency.
The Big Data Analytics Centre (BDAC) leads the transformational build, use, and deployment of the banks next generation analytics capabilities across the organization. This exciting role will play a pivotal part as an Analytics Centre of Excellence that will take analytics to the next level through use of latest data and analytics technology currently being deployed. You will work either individually or in project teams as a subject matter expert to deliver new Big Data and Machine Learning solutions for our business partners.
Job Responsibilities
  • Champion the utilization and adoption of our enterprise data platform incorporating big data, data warehousing and analytics capabilities into our Regional Offices and businesses.
  • Lead and champion the bank’s data monetisation programs and use cases across the region incorporating key functional areas such as data strategy, analytics and data governance
  • Trusted advisor senior executives and business stakehers to provide deep data expertise and advisory on integrating data and analytics into business objectives and outcomes
  • Develop and execute the Data and Analytics Strategy Roadmap for the UOB Regional offices to drive value realization from data and analytics
  • Man and lead delivery of analytical assets including analytical deep-dives, dashboards, AI and machine learning solutions to help businesses lever their internal/external data assets for strategic decision making
  • Ensure all Data and Analytics projects and enhancements align with the Group Enterprise Data Architecture and Governance
  • Have in-depth knowledge of regional data landscape and recommend improvements and controls (in terms of processes and systems) to enhance quality of the data and support regulatory needs in each of our Regional Offices and businesses.
  • Involved in assigned business/support units in our regional offices data and analytical asset build to ensure capabilities are reusable from enterprise level
  • Champion innovation under the manment’s guidance and directives.

Job Requirements
  • Minimum tertiary in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering , Computer Science or a related field
  • Min 15 working experience in Data, Analytics or Business Intelligence
  • Strong track record and in-depth knowledge of Business Intelligence and Big Data platforms and excellent Technical to Business and vice versa translation skills
  • Solid experience in regional manment, operating models, and delivery of data analytics in the banking and finance industry
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and demonstrated success presenting in a clear and compelling manner to cross-regional stakehers that persuades action
  • Demonstrated project manment to help drive organizational results and outcomes
  • Good working knowledge of BI Tools, Data Marts, AI/machine learning and data governance
  • Strong leadership and team manment capability
  • Good team player who possesses drive and initiative to lead both direct and virtual teams located in various countries

Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's , race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.
Apply now and make a difference.

column2: Founded in Singapore in 1990, Achieve Group is a multi award-winning organisation and HR outsourcing partner-of-choice for local conglomerates and multinational corporations within the Asia Pacific region.

With offices in Singapore and Malaysia, Achieve Group offers a full suite of Talent Acquisition and HR Consulting solutions for your company's HRM needs. As the experts in talent recruitment and human resource engagement services, we pride ourselves on the timely delivery of these services through our team of dedicated and experienced professionals.

As a progressive organization that firmly believes in the pursuit of excellence, Achieve Group is always constantly evaluating and seeking to improve ourselves to fulfill our mission, because we believe that 'Your SUCCESS is our ACHIEVEment'!","
 Basic Salary of up to S$10,000 (salary will commensurate according to experience & qualifications)
 Minimum 7-10 years of working experience in a professional contract role
 Candidate with strong knowledge of research contracting terms, good understanding of data privacy laws 
 Good contract negotiation skills and a collaborative, solutions-oriented approach 
 Candidate with paralegal experience and/or commercial law and technology transfer certification, or equivalent work experience would be advantageous
Our Client has been an implementer of IT systems that have supported the operations of various hospitals, specialty centres & nursing homes. They are currently inviting qualified candidates to fill the position as Contract Manager.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Engage various stakeholders (government, academic research and industry) to develop and execute the contracts in a timely manner
  • Analyse contracts to identify risks, liabilities or gaps. Work closely with stakeholders to resolve contractual issues in timely manner.
  • Responsible for ensuring that contract amendments and reviews are monitored, gathered and acted upon as appropriate.
  • Ensure that contract documentation is carried out systematically, e.g. assist to set up system to maintain contractual records and ensure adequate processes and policies are in place; proper filing of all contractual documents (hardcopy and softcopy)
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Minimum 7-10 years of working experience in a professional contract role, Minimum Degree in related discipline. skills
  • Paralegal experience and/or commercial law and technology transfer certification, or equivalent work experience would be advantageous.
  • Strong knowledge of research contracting terms, good understanding of data privacy laws (Singapore and International); and appreciation of the local health and biomedical research ecosystem.
  • Good contract negotiation skills and a collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong communication
  • Critical thinking skills, identify business, legal and financial implications of the different contracts.
  • Excellent written and verbal skills with an eye for detail.
  • Versatile in working independently as well as an effective team player
OTHER INFORMATION:
Salary  : Up to S$10,000 (salary will commensurate according to experience & qualifications).
 
HOW TO APPLY:
If you are a team player, meticulous & organized, and more importantly, believe that YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE, we would like to hear from you.
Simply submit your application by emailing a detailed copy of your updated Resume in MS Word Format to Tan Dyin Yin
(DY) (EA Personnel Reg. No.: R1986524)
dyinyin.tan@achievegroup.asia
or call your friendly Consultant at 6590 9862 for a confidential discussion.
By submitting any application or résumé to us, you will be deemed to have agreed and consented to us collecting, using, retaining and disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration.
YOUR SUCCESS IS OUR ACHIEVEMENT!

column3: PERSOLKELLY is one of the largest recruitment companies in Asia Pacific providing comprehensive end-to-end workforce solutions to clients.

Today, we are an integrated one-stop provider of M&E services such as extra low voltage (“ELV”), low voltage (“LV”) and high voltage (“HV”) electrical systems; air-conditioning and mechanical ventilation (“ACMV”) systems; and fire protection (“FP”) systems.
The past few decades have seen our services stretching across and over the M&E engineering value chain to project management service to meet the full spectrum of our customers’ needs.
<div>
Honed by years of experience, our project management skills have contributed to the successful and timely execution of all projects – in varying levels of size, complexity and timeline.
Being equipped with specialised knowhow and experience also means that we can take on projects such as data centres as well as plants and refineries which require high level of
technical expertise.

As we grow, so has our network. Working with people with the right expertise has been pivotal to our ability to not only deliver our work efficiently, but also to offer the highest quality engineering solutions possible.

","

Job Description:

  • To be responsible for all the execution of Contracts progress.
  • To monitor the installation progress as well as co-ordination with Clients, Consultants, Subcontractors to ensure efficient and timely delivery of assignment.
  • To report and monitor of progress of project to Project Manager.
  • To supervise and ensure works are in accordance to the contract drawings and specifications.
  • To prepare method statement, shop drawings, installations / T&C check sheets, work progress report and other relevant documents for M&E related works with project teams.
  • To coordinate with subcontractors and consultants on preparation and submission of shop drawings.
  • To coordinate / prepare technical submissions with suppliers / subcontractors.
  • To assist the Project Manager to negotiate / procure materials, equipment and labour in accordance to (or below) the allocated approved budget.
  • To hold technical discussions with various stakeholders to resolve technical / site issues.
  • To liaise and work with relevant authorities / subcontractors / clients on shop drawings / equipment submissions, inspections, testing requirements and commissioning.
  • To have experience in working at Data Center.
  • Mechanical: Familiar with VAV / VRV / cooling tower / Chillers / chilled water pipe / A&A works.
  • Electrical: Familiar with retrofit / renovation / lighting control / BMS.

Job Requirements:

  • Diploma or Degree in Electrical / Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
  • Min. 3-5 years’ experience in construction industry in Singapore.
  • The candidate will assist and support the Project Manager in handling and monitoring the progress of projects.
  • Well versed in English.
  • Able to commence work immediately or short notice.

657,data,/en/job/business-analyst-low-code-9409152,9409152,Business Analyst (Low Code),False,False,,,SGD,Changi Airport Group (Singapore) Pte. Ltd.,7 hours ago,False,,,200910817N,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"
As one of the world's leading airport companies, Changi Airport Group manages Changi Airport and undertakes key functions including airport operations and management, air hub development, commercial activities and airport emergency services. We aspire to build a company where ordinary people achieve extraordinary results; one where our people possess a passion for service and are committed to teamwork, integrity and excellence. Working together with our colleagues and partners to achieve the best outcome, we deliver innovative services and create a world-class experience for our passengers. With a set-up of multiple businesses, we present challenging work and diverse opportunities for our employees to further their personal and professional growth, providing a platform for them to develop and see through their ideas and contributions, making an impact to our organization and to the communities we serve locally and globally. Together, we are exceptional people, connecting lives.
","
As part of our ongoing digital transformation, Changi Airport Group (CAG) has established a Low Code Centre of Excellence (CoE) to encourage and support enterprise-wide adoption of low code tools like Microsoft Power Platform, help teams design and build their own digital solutions and automation, and enable our people to develop new digital skills along the way. CAG has also set up an internal Accelerator to more readily connect teams with ideas to the right expertise to design and implement their solutions, and help teams develop new digital skills while doing so.
We are looking for an Assistant Manager to support the business analysis and program management functions of the Low Code CoE and eventually the CAG Accelerator too:

As a Business Analyst, you will:
  • Engage teams across CAG to discover opportunities to transform business processes and identify suitable use cases that would benefit from the speed and agility of low code development.
  • Help teams to define and clarify their business ideas, problem statements and requirements.
  • Connect teams to the right in-house (and sometimes external) expertise through the Accelerator, who can help to identify the right solution approach, design solutions, and take their ideas forward.
  • Serve as a subject matter expert for low code development to advise and help teams accelerate the ideation to solution journey.
  • Guide teams in articulating and documenting their requirements through process swim-lane diagrams and wireframes, and work with them to design appropriate data structures that support the envisioned digital solution.
  • Assist users to assess the benefits & impact of deployed solutions and communicate value to management and stakeholders.
  • Identify common data sources or solution components needed to advance digital transformation in CAG, and work with the right parties to put these in place.
As a Program Manager, you will:
  • Manage the operations of the Low Code Digital Kitchen, staffed by external developers, to ensure successful delivery of projects.
  • Work with our Corporate IT colleagues to equip CAG staff with the tools for low code development, manage necessary infrastructure and governance needs, and mitigate risks in developing and deploying low code solutions.
  • Organize regular awareness and introductory training to induct new users and citizen developers.
  • Run training and applied learning programs to enable teams to build, deploy and maintain their own solutions using low code tools.
  • Nurture and strengthen engagement with the citizen developers in CAG’s Low Code Community of Practice.
  • Build, maintain, and engage our panel of internal consultants for the Accelerator, drawing from colleagues across CAG who are practitioners in areas like AI, Data Science, RPA, Low Code development, and other emerging technologies.
This role might be for you if:
  • You have a passion to help others solve business challenges and real-world problems using digital technologies.
  • You communicate clearly and able to interact with teams from diverse backgrounds to guide them in clarifying their needs and translating ideas into impactful solutions.
  • You are hesitant to accept status quo on why things are done in a certain way and proactively challenge assumptions to draw out opportunities to transform business processes.
  • You find great satisfaction in equipping people with the right tools, showing them how to use the tools, and see them succeed in applying the tools to their ideas and problems.
  • You like to get your hands dirty in testing things out and producing your own solutions.
  • You are well-organized and have figured out how to push projects forward without direct or formal authority over stakeholders.
  • You are tenacious and resourceful.
It would be extra awesome if:
  • You already have the skills and experience in building and deploying solutions using Microsoft PowerApps, Power Automate, Power Virtual Agents and/or Power Query.
This is a three-years contract position.

658,data,/en/job/analyst-centre-for-population-health-research-and-implementation-cphri-contract-9368056,9368056,"Analyst, Centre for Population Health Research and Implementation (CPHRI) (Contract)",False,False,,,SGD,Singapore Health Services Pte Ltd (SingHealth HQ),19-Mar-22,False,,,200002698Z,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div>

SingHealth HQ is the headquarters of SingHealth, the largest public healthcare cluster in Singapore. We focus on cluster-wide, strategic core functions for the organisation and work closely with our institutions and care teams to facilitate excellent care for our patients.

We offer a diverse variety of roles that you can fulfil your career aspirations in. You can choose from domain areas such as medical and clinical services, regional health system, research, education, organisational transformation and informatics, as well as corporate services including operations, finance, human resources, legal and communications. These comprise healthcare administration roles and other unique jobs such as genetic counsellors and clinical research nurses.

","

The Centre for Population Health Research and Implementation (CPHRI) is a centralised platform for population health research, innovation, implementation and evaluation activities in the SingHealth Regional Health System. CPHRI aims to seamlessly leverage data and technology to guide and support population health initiatives and accelerate implementation of research findings in care delivery and improvement.

You will primarily support the outcome evaluation of the community-based programmes run by the SingHealth Regional Health System. You will work with various stakeholders to advise and contribute to the development of logic models and evaluation plans for the programmes. You will search, appraise and synthesise evidence from medical literature to inform stakeholders in the planning and delivery of care as well as in the investment of health technology. You will conduct program evaluations and perform statistical analysis required for outcomes research. You may be required conduct qualitative interviews and analysis. You will contribute to scientific manuscript writing and present the findings to the stakeholders.

You will offer technical guidance and research support to department staff on analytics and programme evaluation. You will support development of in-house training workshops for staff.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Healthcare, Social Science, Statistics, or quantitative related discipline
  • Two years of prior working experience in conducting health services research
  • Experience in conducting program evaluation or epidemiology studies would be advantageous
  • Knowledge in Microsoft Applications and analysis software (e.g. SPSS, STATA, NVIVO)
  • Strong project management, presentation and communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills

column3: <div>

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

column3: <div>

column4: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

column3: <div>

column4: NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

column3: <div>

column4: Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

column3: <div>

column4: Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column3: For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

column1:
","
A Research Fellow position is currently available in the School of Physical and Mathematical Sciences (SPMS). The candidate will be part of the staff working on a project within the Division of Mathematical Sciences of the SPMS. The project aims to develop coding techniques for DNA data storage by applying techniques from combinatorics, discrete mathematics, algebraic and constrained coding.
Job Responsibilities
  • Study and provide a survey on known algebraic and combinatorial techniques in designing reconstruction codes for deletions
  • Design and develop new solutions for the coded reconstruction problem
  • Identify new research directions in the coded reconstruction problem

Job Requirements
  • PhD in Computer Science or Mathematics
  • Research experience with strong publication record in algebraic or combinatorial coding theory
  • Knowledge of commonly used concepts in data storage and coding theory
The College of Science seeks a diverse and inclusive workforce and is committed to equality of opportunity. column2: The National Skin Centre (NSC) is an outpatient specialist dermatological centre with a team of dermatologists who have the experience and expertise to treat a wide variety of skin conditions. As a subsidiary of the National Healthcare Group, NSC shares the NHG vision of ‘adding years of healthy life’ to the Singapore population. With a comprehensive range of subspecialty services, and serving about 80 percent of dermatology outpatients in Singapore, NSC is firmly established as a reputable dermatology centre in Singapore and the region. The Centre also aims to facilitate subspecialisation and be the national focus for the treatment, research, and training on all aspects of skin diseases.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

  • Word processing and spreadsheet computer skills are essential and preferably with statistical software skills like SPSS

column3: Mediacorp is Singapore’s leading media company with the most complete range of platforms, spanning television, radio, newspapers, magazines, movies, digital and out-of-home media.
It pioneered the development of Singapore’s broadcasting industry, with the broadcast of Radio in 1936 and Television in 1963.
Today, Mediacorp has over 50 products and brands in four languages (English, Mandarin, Malay and Tamil), reaching out to all adults in Singapore every week.
Initiatives in the new digital space include Internet TV-on-demand, High Definition TV broadcast and Over-the-Top (OTT) interactive services.

column2: Beyond Singapore, Mediacorp is an active regional player through co-productions in TV dramas and movies, magazines publishing, as well as Channel NewsAsia International, one of the first Asian-owned English news channels.

column3: Our financial and strategic relationship in the region includes International Media Corporation in Vietnam, which was set up to develop and produce television entertainment and economic news content. Mediacorp also has a stake in Singapore-based retail firm Reebonz, one of the region's fastest growing luxury online retailers and a majority stake in Cubinet Interactive, a Malaysian digital games publisher.

column2: Winner of numerous international awards and accolades including Asian Television Awards' Terrestrial Broadcaster of the Year, Mediacorp’s mission is to engage, entertain and enrich audiences by harnessing the power of creativity.

column1:
","

Description

We are looking for a high-performing data engineer with full stack experience creating web-based data applications. You will be a key contributor to the Data Engineering team, primarily by applying and building tools to aggregate data from disparate sources, processing and loading the transformed data to support internal and external constituencies. You will be required to maintain and enhance our data infrastructure and proprietary analytical solutions. This role is a hands-on engineering position.

Job Responsibilities

  • Translate business requirements to responsive functional web solutions. This includes designing and building APIs, front-end interfaces and scalable tools that ingest and transform real-time data using a variety of open-source and proprietary big data technologies.
  • Recommend and implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality
  • Work closely with stakeholders to ensure high standards of data governance during implementation
  • Serve as technical subject matter expert on the latest big data technologies

Requirements

  • Hands-on proven track record in developing products from front-end interface, middle-tier, to backend infrastructure
  • 7+ years of superior experience developing commercial web-based applications
  • 4+ years of full-stack web development experience in Javascript (node.js and React framework)
  • Proficiency in SQL is mandatory
  • Excellent scripting knowledge in Python, Shell etc
  • Those with strong production experience in Scala or Spark programming languages will be considered favourably
  • Relevant experience in web, video, mobile or adtech domain is a definite plus
  • Demonstrated clear and thorough analytical thinking
  • Good eye for aesthetics and an attention to detail
  • A proven team player and contributor who can multi-task and deliver against timelines
  • Minimum degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent

Mediacorp is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where talent thrives. Our hiring decisions are made based on merit and fit-to-role. If you have a disability or special need which requires accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. We will be happy to support as necessary.


Thank you for your interest and application to this role. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

  • Flexible work arrangements and policies

column1: 666,data,/en/job/scientist-%5Bmachine-intellection%5D-%7C-i2r-9390611,9390611,Scientist [Machine Intellection] | I2R,False,False,,,SGD,"Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)",17-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0002C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
A research scientist position is available immediately at the Machine Intellection Department of the Institute for Infocomm Research (I2R), A*STAR, Singapore.  The projects focus on development of machine learning, deep learning and artificial intelligence algorithms to provide accurate predictions and valuable insights, that can be used to power critical decision making and improve the decision making processes through intelligent optimization.
Specific research themes of this position focus on optimization methodologies for decision support and advanced machine learning. Areas of interest include optimization with deep reinforcement learning, stochastic optimization, causal inference approaches, multi-objective optimization, combinatorial optimization, robust optimization, and learning with observational or imperfect data.  The candidate would develop optimization solutions for applications spanning healthcare, manufacturing, and traffic management.
The candidate will be involved in the execution of both applied industry projects and use-inspired research projects. In addition, the role would involve drafting of grant proposals and project scoping. Overall, the candidate will have the opportunities of doing cutting-edge research and solve real-world problems in collaboration with industry, public sector and academic stakeholders.
Job Requirements
  • PhD in the field of Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Operations Research, Statistics, or other Data Science and Decision Science intensive fields.
  • Candidates should have particular expertise in at least one of the following areas, in addition to a strong computational background and/or experience with large real-world datasets:
    • Machine Learning/Deep learning/Reinforcement Learning – especially underlying theoretic aspects
    • Causal Inference
    • Real-time Stochastic Optimization
    • Mathematical Optimization
    • Predictive Optimization
  • 2-5 years post PhD experience in corporate or application oriented environment is a plus.
  • Ability to work independently to innovate with advanced methods, and direct prototyping to demonstrate the feasibility of research ideas
  • Good team players with both research and engineering ethics
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Good publication record in leading data science, machine learning, applied mathematics and/or statistics venues.
  • Strong programming abilities (in at least one of Python – strongly preferred, C/C++, R, Java)
  • Familiar with optimization and data science tools and libraries (CPLEX, Gurobi, Pytorch/TensorFlow, etc)
  • Experiences in solving real-world optimization and data science problems
  • Experiences with biomedical and healthcare datasets, or spatio-temporal datasets is a plus
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column3: <div>

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

column3: <div>

column4: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

column3: <div>

column4: NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

column3: <div>

column4: Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

column3: <div>

column4: Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column3: For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

We are looking for an experienced data engineer to join our team and you will use various methods to transform raw data into useful data systems. This includes developing algorithms and conducting statistical analysis. Overall, your goal is to develop data systems in alignment with business goals.
To succeed in this data engineering position, you should have strong analytical skills and the ability to integrate data /data streams from different sources. Data engineer skills also include familiarity with apt programming langus and knowledge of machine learning methods. column3: IBM was established in Malaysia in June 1961 as a wholly-owned subsidiary of IBM World  Trade Corporation, one of the world’s largest and leading IT companies worldwide. IBM operates in 170 countries and employs 400,000 highly-skilled professionals.

Over the years, IBM has undergone major transformation. From a hardware company, it is today a solutions-based company and providing various services. It has also moved out of the commodity business and expanded its role to becoming a Globally Integrated Enterprise. IBM Malaysia celebrated its 50th anniversary in 2011. This was a significant milestone, marking half a century of innovation and information technology expertise contribution to Malaysia. IBM’s focus on innovation and R&D have resulted in the company’s ability to deliver value and address some of the most challenging societal, economic and technology
challenges via its smarter planet initiatives.

Smarter Planet is all about progress. IBM stands for progress. Over the years, IBM has steadfastly upheld its mission of delivering progress, undergirding it with its timeless core values -- dedication to every client’s success, innovation that matters – for our company and for the world, and trust and personal responsibility in all relationships.

IBM is committed to play a major role in cultivating the use and development of IT in Malaysia, a mission that mirrors the Government’s objective of making the country a regional and global hub of knowledge-based industries. In Malaysia, IBM has set up 19 Centers of Excellence that support global and regional operations of IBM.

The company is also heavily involved in developing local capabilities through a string of alliances. Its Business Partners represent IBM in almost all the country's industry segments. Together, IBM and its Business Partners deliver open, integrated, end-to-end solutions that help clients innovate for competitive advantage.

In an increasingly “flat” world, Malaysian companies will need a trusted business and IT partner which offers innovative solutions and services which are interconnected, instrumented and intelligent to build a smarter Malaysia. IBM is that partner.

column3: 200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.
Our services extend across five core categories:
• Multimodal Transport
• Customs and Regulatory Compliance
• Logistics
• Global Supply Chain
• Industrial Projects

Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years in delivering robust solutions with complete visibility tailored to specific industry needs in:
• Aerospace
• Automotive
• Fragrances & Flavors
• Healthcare
• High End Retail
• High-Tech & Telecom
• Mining
• Oil & Gas
• Perfumes & Cosmetics
• Power Technologies

Corporate responsibility and sustainability is at the heart of Bolloré Logistics’ culture. We adopt a pro-active approach to introduce sustainable development and social responsibility in every partnership we build. We are also committed to ensure the health and safety of our employees and subcontractors by making Ethics & Compliance a prerequisite in all business activities.

Job Summary: 
 
The incumbent will directly report to a Hub Manager with the key objective of providing customer-focused solutions in
support of operational objectives and business development strategies. The incumbent will also indirectly report to the
Operational Excellence team, which governs the framework and methodology of continuous improvement projects.
Responsibilities:
  • Leverage on lean principles to increase operational performance and optimise warehouse resources, creating value for internal and external stakeholders
  • Spearhead continuous improvement projects within the warehouse, from process gap identification to solution design and implementation, as well as operational change management
  • Support the Operations Manager in the monitoring and analysis of performance data such as KPI and productivity reports, as well as financial data such as billing reports and account P&L
  • Partner with the Key Account Manager in business development efforts through maintenance of customer satisfaction and solutioning of value creation opportunities
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts from the Innovation, Automation, and Warehouse Management System (WMS) team to implement new technology or fine-tune existing solutions within the warehouse
  • Contribute to the Operational Excellence (OpEx) community by sharing knowledge of best practices and new solutions, and participating in technical trainings and focus group workshops
  • Support the OpEx core team in OpEx-led events and group collaterals
Requirements:
  • Degree or Masters in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, or Business with a relevant specialization
  • Awareness and understanding of lean principles and continuous improvement tools
  • Strong in data crunching and analysis
  • Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel (including pivot tables)
  • Knowledge in VBA / SQL / database management structure is not necessary but will be a plus
  • Comfortable with presenting and communicating with customers and stakeholders within all levels of the organisation
  • Good and adaptive team player with strong interpersonal skills
Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.

Due to the current COVID-19 situation and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we will be prioritizing candidates who are currently based in Singapore and do not require relocation. We will be reviewing the pandemic situation and will adjust our position in accordance and adherence to local authority.

We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in Bollore Logistics Singapore.

column1:
","

Who are we looking for

We are looking for a Business (Data) Analyst that will be working closely with all our business units, their respective functions from the Group level. You will have a passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. You will be collaborating very closely with the Data (Engineer) analyst, responsible for delivering both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. You would come with amazing traits that are self-driven, critical thinking, analytical abilities, flexibility, adaptability, effective verbal & written communication, time management, self-confidence, open to changes & challenges, eye for detail, perseverance, discreetness & diplomacy, analytical thinking, sound independent decision making and team work.

The incumbent will

• Be the conduit between all business units and the group function.

• Gather requirements from the Client by studying their business functions and analyzing business requirements; construct workflow designs based on system capabilities and write design specification and modifications to ensure successful delivery of output and formats

• Facilitate communication between the business stakeholders and the analytical function.

• Communicate /collaborate with other data analyst and IT teams (interfaces, data modelling, support)

What your day-in-a-life could look like

• You will need a good grasp of the various business trends and its customers.

• Support and help spearhead all types of analytical building efforts and initiatives

• Assist in managing special projects to problem-solve and practically execute across all functions of the Group and work with senior stakeholders.

• Documenting business requirements to use different analytical techniques to distil data and draw out the right insights for business action.

• Building and improving processes to automate KPIs and business metrics

• Build a view of data sources, guide its curation into meaningful metrics and create visualizations for analysis, business case presentations, with reports, and dashboards.

• Ready to identify, track down and resolve data quality and code issues to ensure that databases and dashboards remain error-free and organized

• Define, develop & document business processes and procedures

• Prepare ad-hoc data models, regular management reports, analysis, and quarterly performance metrics

• Maintain trustworthy and reliable forward-looking forecast data, strong commitment to accuracy and thoroughness in all aspects of data collection and curation.

• Effectively presenting options and recommendations to stakeholders.

• Monitoring project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.

• Maintaining system protocols by writing and updating procedures. Ideally preparing technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends (internal and external).

Desired profile

• Demonstrates business acumen and perspective beyond the numbers

• You would probably come from organizations that deals with high volume transactions and product, such as, e-commerce, FMCG/ CPG.

• Be extremely hands-on in solving any type of business or organisational problem and interested in driving practical outcomes

• Structured thinker with ability to frame and solve unstructured problems

• Highly detail oriented with strong analytical skills, troubleshooting and data / information organizational skills.

• Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines

• A great communicator, turning numbers into insights.

• Ability to synthesize data and develop meaningful conclusions and predictive insights

• BA/BS required; Relevant graduate degree is a plus

• Strong MS Excel and PowerPoint skills

• Proficient in, Python, R, Tableau, SAP Business Objects or other business intelligence platform would be ideal.

• Minimum 5 years of experience in an analyst function.

column2:
​​​​The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) was set up in 1959 when Singapore attained self-governance. Housed at the Empress Place Building, it remained there until 1963 when Singapore joined the Federation of Malaysia and internal security became a federal responsibility.","
What the role is
We work as a team, in partnership with the community, to make Singapore our safe and secure Best Home.
What we offer
  • Employees will be able to attend language training locally while promising employees may have overseas opportunities to deepen their understanding of foreign languages and cultures
  • Certified proficiency in foreign languages (such as Arabic, Hindi, Javanese, Malayalam, Myanmese, Punjabi, Russian, Tagalog, Thai, Urdu, Vietnamese etc) may be eligible for additional allowances
What you will be working on
  • Work independently on various local and/or foreign languages and various information sources e.g. Internet and other media sources
  • Translate, transcribe, scan and analyse information in both written and spoken languages
  • Identify information gaps and conduct checks to provide insights
  • Write clear, concise and accurate reports to support mission critical operations
  • Work with different data-sets and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders
  • May be required to respond to operational exigencies over weekends and/or Public HolidaysWhat we are looking for
What we are looking for
  • Degree or equivalent competencies will be preferred
  • Only Singaporeans need apply.
  • Proficiency in English and respective mother tongue language is preferred
  • Good grasp of spoken dialects / languages would be an added advantage
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills, with attention to details and accuracy
  • Basic proficiency in data analysis (Microsoft Excel and Power BI) will be preferred
  • Past experience in translation, investigative or analytical work will be preferred

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

","
VP, Engineering & Architecture, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD33346)
Business FunctionGroup Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.Your Responsibilities
  • Able to work closely with the applications teams and other architects to drive high quality application development, raising the bar of engineering practises and value adding to the technical delivery

  • Directing the architecture and development teams using a hands on approach

  • Establishing and owning engineering practise by improving current practises and coming up new practises were ever required

  • Create strategy, guidelines to improve software development, delivery with world-class quality outcomes

  • Define and own software standards, patterns, methodologies and practices including software quality, execution of agile software delivery

  • Able to project manage and allocated development capacity to completing scheduled task

  • Ensure agreed architecture is implemented by development team using agreed on patterns with engineering teams and architects

  • Perform POC's and come up with patterns and frameworks

  • Be part of team of architects and domain experts to provide fit for purpose solutions.

  • Transform requirements into architecture and blueprint for the solution being created. Conversion that is based on several factors: previous, successful design patterns, reference architectures and enterprise architecture guidance.

  • Understands business functions, construct a solution architecture around Microservices and APIs, and be able to decompose monolith applications into meaningful implementable Microservices and APIs in a Cloud/DevOps environment.

  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to the development team, during the SDLC. Get development team's buy-in into accepting the design to be implemented.

  • Ensure that the solution architecture aligns with the roadmaps established by the enterprise architecture, and that it adheres to the enterprise architecture principles. Act as the bridge between Enterprise / Application Architecture and Delivery.
Requirements
  • Experience and understanding of Engineering practises

  • Experience in design Cloud native, Event based and Microservice Architecture.

  • Deep End-to-End Enterprise Architecture understanding, including Enterprise Java Stack (JEE), Rich UI and Front-End technologies, Middleware technologies (Tibco, Solace etc), Mainframe technologies, Databases (SQL & No SQL), Data Warehouses, and Core Banking solutions.

  • Experienced in streaming technology or framework such as Kafka and able to select suitable technology for given situation, code quality Api/tool, logging/tracing, circuit breakers.

  • Experienced working in a cloud native work environment, spring cloud data, Spring Security, oAuth, service monitoring on cloud, PaaS environment such as Pivotal, Kubernetes.

  • Deep understanding of Enterprise Integration and Messaging Patterns, SOA Governance practices

  • Strong communication skills including engaging senior management on strategic plans, leading project steering committees and status updates etc

  • Experienced in Agile methodology.

  • Ability to work independently and handle multiple concurrent initiatives

  • Excellent organizational, vendor management, negotiation, and prioritization skills

  • Excellent team player and strong interpersonal skills

  • Proactive and able to work under pressure, strong problem-solving skills and positive 'can do' attitude
Apply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job Description:

  • Perform method developments to continuously expand laboratory capabilities.

column2: HAND Global Solutions (HAND) is a leading global IT professional service provider with headquarters in China to deliver IT strategy, ERP implementations and support. We leverage our offshore and onshore teams from around the world to provide our customers with the most competitive, convenient and reliable experience.
With global offices in China, USA, Japan, Taiwan, India and Singapore, HAND has successfully completed 20,000+ HAND’s application, SAP, Oracle / Netsuite projects for 6000+ global and local clients.

In Singapore & ASEAN Countries, HAND focuses on providing Smart Manufacturing, Business Process Management, RPA, Supplier Relationship Management and ERP solutions for various industries. HAND is  currently expanding its big data and data analytic, and Netsuite capabilities in South East Asia.
With a track record of over 100+ for Oracle Fusion and 50+ Netsuite live project, our customers value us for our RAPID deployment capability and cost effectiveness for ORACLE ERP projects.

HAND offers implementation and consulting services for SAP products including: S/4 HANAN Cloud, S/4HANA and S/4HANA Upgrades.","

HAND Global Solutions is expanding its Big Data and Data Analytics capabilities from China to Singapore. HAND believes in developing people before products and encourage creative thinking and innovations to help our clients to achieve their business objectives and drive business growth thru’ data sciences and analytics.

Working with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Software Engineers and external service providers, Solution Architect designs and builds Big Data system architecture and solutions.

Responsibilities:

·        Building and integrating information systems to meet the company’s needs.

·        Assessing the systems architecture currently in place and working with technical staff to recommend solutions to improve it.

·        Resolving technical problems as they arise.

·        Providing supervision and guidance to development teams.

·        Continually researching current and emerging technologies and proposing changes where needed.

·        Informing various stakeholders about any problems with the current technical solutions being implemented.

·        Assessing the business impact that certain technical choices have.

·        Providing updates to stakeholders on product development processes, costs, and budgets.

Requirements:

·        Bachelor’s degree in information technology, software engineering, computer science, or related field.

·        Proven experience in engineering and software architecture design.

·        Previous project management experience is advantageous.

·        In-depth understanding of coding languages (Java, JavaScript).

·        Sound knowledge of various operating systems and databases.

·        Efficient communication skills.

·        Strong organizational and leadership skills.

·        Familiar with cyber security / data security aspects of the solutions

·        Ability to architect on premise and cloud solutions

·        Preferably having solution architect level certifications from AWS or Microsoft Azure or equivalent

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

The duties and responsibilities of the incumbent, in the Data Analytics Consulting Centre (DACC), Department of Statistics and Data Science, include, but are not limited to the following -

  • Secure, co-ordinate and supervise consulting projects for the DACC.
  • Lead student teams and work hands-on to create practical solutions for our clients.
  • Take lead in solving problems from consulting projects by using state-of-the-art methodology from statistics, data science, mathematics and computer science.
  • Take lead in producing technology ('minimum viable products) for the delivery of consulting project results.
  • Assist with literature reviews for consulting and advisory projects.
  • Handle student walk-in consultations.
  • Build and maintain relationship with companies.
  • Manage consulting and research legal contracts.
  • Obtain funding approval for the DACC Executive Training courses and workshops.
  • Organize data science conferences and meet-ups.
  • Manage executive training courses and workshops.
Qualifications/Requirements/Other info
  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics/Mathematics/Computer Science or other relevant subject, with experience in managing research projects. Masters/PhD holders are also welcome to apply.

- Remuneration is based on a 12-month salary structure, with annual variable bonus which is subject to incumbent's performance and the University/School's prevailing remuneration policies. 

- The incumbent will be emplaced at an appropriate appointment grade based on his/her individual merits.

- To expedite application processing, a copy of academic certificates and transcripts from GCE O-level onwards should be uploaded via the online application portal.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Faculty of Science

Department : Statistics and Data Science

Job requisition ID : 13146

column3: The Adecco Group is the world’s leading HR solutions partner. We provide more than 700,000 people with permanent and flexible employment every day. With more than 34,000 employees in 60 countries, we transform the world of work one job at a time.

Adecco is Singapore’s leading HR solutions partner. For more than 34 years, Adecco provides a comprehensive array of HR solutions and consulting services which includes mid to staff level talent acquisition, contract recruitment, outsourcing, field sales and marketing as well as payroll services. Our teams are specialized in accounting & finance, administration, banking, engineering, healthcare & life sciences, human resources, IT&T, retail & events, sales & marketing, supply chain & logistics and other corporate functions.
Speak with an Adecco consultant to find out how we may be able to help you in your career and life goals.

column1:
","

The Opportunity

  • Opportunity to work for one of the leading global Private Banks as a Human Resources Specialist (HR Analytics)
  • Great Benefits

The Opportunity

  • Opportunity to work for one of the leading global Private Banks as a Human Resources Specialist (HR Analytics)
  • Great Benefits

The Talent

  • Degree in HR, Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Information Technology, Data Sciences, Math or related fields is a plus
  • Relevat experience in human resources. Minimum of 1 year related experience in HR analytics/data analytics/business analysis
  • Experience in SQL and VBA is highly preferred
  • Passionate about solving problems - possesses a relentless need for investigation and data exploration
  • Robust stakeholder management skills and ability to work confidently and collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders of varying seniority.
  • Strong foundation in data query/manipulation of large-scale data using SQL
  • Ability to make sound judgement calls independently when presented with difficult decisions, especially when only partial information is available
  • Results and detail-oriented
  • Able to present analysis in a manner accessible by non-statisticians through data visualization techniques.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Independent self-starter with ability to multi-task and has a 'can-do' attitude.

The Job

  • Partner with HR business partners and specialists to assess human capital needs and identify opportunities to apply data analytics.
  • Define analytical strategy, problem statements and hypotheses to address identified opportunities, including analytical approaches, data and technology requirements
  • Develop models and perform statistical analysis to identify key areas of risk and predict risk events, across a range of banking functions
  • Design and put in place tracking and feedback mechanisms to allow for capturing of actions and impact on business outcomes due to the implementation of analytics solutions
  • Present key findings to senior management and/or other stakeholders with actionable recommendations
  • Work with other data scientists and data translators to drive and operationalize analytical outputs.

Next steps:

  • Drop your resume and contact us to follow-up, or send your resume to sarah.ng@adecco.com
  • Email Topic: Apply Human Resources Specialist (HR Analytics| Banking)
  • All shortlisted candidates will be contacted

column2:
Our mission is to enrich the lives of our members, our communities, and our franchisees by being a positive, encouraging, and welcoming company that cares.","Job Description

Do you have a natural ability to take charge and lead a team with ease? Are you passionate about health and fitness?

If you think you have what it takes to motivate, train, and manage our portfolio of clubs in Singapore to boost sales and drive our clubs to unprecedented levels of success, we want to meet with you!

We seek a dynamic and passionate Area Business Manager to meet our rapid expansion needs. The growth opportunities are tremendous, with more clubs opening in Singapore. 

*EXPERIENCE IN THE FITNESS INDUSTRY IS A MUST*

Roles & Responsibilities: 

  • Working directly with the Senior Leadership team you will ensure club profitability and exceed EBITDA targets through operational excellence within our network of managed and co-owned clubs,
  • Manage staff performance through recruiting, training and accountability based on our standard operating procedures, systems, and best practices,
  • Ensure operational excellence through maintaining a close relationship with Club Managers and Fitness Managers to drive performance through the achievement of monthly KPI’s and targets,
  • Ensure sales, marketing, and operational frameworks and standard operating practices are being implemented every month.

Candidate Requirements: 

  • Exceptionally hard-working, self-motivated and be willing to do whatever it takes to achieve targets,
  • A proven record of achieving profitability of fitness clubs, gyms preferably within a 24-hour franchise model,
  • Strong attention to detail, the ability to read and understand financial statements, calculate revenue, expenses, and EBIT targets,
  • A proven record in business coaching other franchised owners in the fitness industry,
  • Degrees in business management, business administration, finance, and other related fields are highly sought-after,
  • Experience in club operations, management, and business coaching within Singapore's fitness industry is highly sought-after.

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 . Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Global Market function levers our in-depth knowledge of markets to provide timely financial advice, products and solutions to our clients. Together with our segment manrs, we man our clients' investment, liability and risk manment needs through a comprehensive suite of treasury products and services across multiple asset classes.
Job Responsibilities
The Quantitative Analytics team is responsible for pricing and risk manment models used across UOB Global Markets. This role offers the opportunity to work closely with trading desks to develop and integrate solutions into the daily trading activities. This work is done in collaboration with the Risk and IT departments.  
Responsibilities:
  • Build and maintain independent pricing engines and toolkits for Global Markets across multiple asset classes (IR / FX / Commodities / Equities)
  • Implement new exotic models and payoffs for all asset classes 
  • Build and implement risk manment tools in collaboration with traders
  • Participating in testing of implementations and back testing of effectiveness of our models
Job Requirements
  • Masters or Doctoral in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) subject
  • Over 5 of quantitative related experience with minimum of 3 in a front office Quant Analytic environment
  • Strong mathematical background, preferably in numerical methods, stochastic calculus and probability
  • Proficiency in C++ necessary, proficiency in Python desirable
  • Experience in modelling exotic/structured products
  • Able to communicate effectively to deliver solutions quickly
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's , race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

Medpace is a global, full-service clinical research organization with expertise and therapeutic specialization in multiple areas. Medpace has quickly become a global leader in providing pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies with customized solutions in the drug development process.

At Medpace, our experienced and accomplished employees give us a competitive advantage across the range of clinical research services we provide. Their commitment to quality has made us a global leader in research-based drug development and they are our most important asset. We invite you to join Medpace – a firmly established and continually growing company with a focus on quality, not quantity. You will also enjoy a stimulating work environment with exciting opportunities to work in international teams and develop your career.","

We are currently seeking a full-time, office-based Data Coordinator to join our Medpace Reference Laboratory team in Singapore. 

Responsibilities

  • Track case report forms;
  • Clean and update the clinical database, which includes generating and resolving data clarifications;
  • Reconcile clinical data;
  • Maintain study documentation; and
  • Perform QC audits of the clinical database.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in science/health related field with strong attention to detail and working knowledge of Excel and Word;
  • 1-2 years of experience in a CRO or Lab setting preferred;
  • Knowledge of medical terminology is preferred; and
  • Working hours is from 9:30am to 6:30pm to be worked over 5 days between Monday to Saturday (Saturdays being rotational). Able to work on public holidays upon required.

WHY MEDPACE?

At Medpace, you will find work that is both challenging and rewarding. At Medpace, you will be given the tools and training to succeed. At Medpace, you will be rewarded for strong performance and provided opportunities to grow professionally.

WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT?

We look forward to receiving your application. A member of our recruitment team will review your qualifications. You will be contacted for an interview, if you are shortlisted.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

column3: <div>

column4: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

column3: <div>

column4: NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

column3: <div>

column4: Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

column3: <div>

column4: Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column3: For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

Our client is actively searching for a Manager, HR Data Governance & Operations to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!
As a successful candidate, you will be instrumental to shape and provide specialized advice and support in the areas of HR Data Governance Framework and Compliance with the PDPA.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in the service delivery of the day-to-day HR operational matters and to provide related HR support in an accurate and efficient manner which will establish a trusting relationship with our stakeholders at varying levels within the organization.
You will work closely with other team members within the Human Resource Division that places importance on our ability to support each other.
The responsibilities of this role are:
  • Develop and implement data related policies and procedures while ensuring compliance with PDPA
  • Develop and manage the data retention policy while meeting legal and business data archival requirements
  • Seek inputs from HR units to develop and maintain Personal Data Inventory and Data Flow Mapping
  • Implement initiatives to create data protection awareness and compliance while ensuring all applicable data transactions are correctly classified by HR work groups
  • Manage data breaches according to the data breach management plan
  • Review compliance and risk assessment of HR areas of work and familiarisation on risk “heat maps”
  • Conduct assessment to identify and address potential risks. Alert management and liaise with the PDPC as applicable
  • Guide employees on data-related policies and respond to internal queries/complaints regarding data handling
  • Facilitate and conduct data protection compliance checks
  • Coordinate the data audit performed by internal/external auditors & regulators
  • Provide applicable support and initiatives to the relevant HR work groups to ensure data compliance in daily operations
  • Obtain regular ground feedback on data compliance with processes and procedures
  • Administer key HR processes including but not limited to onboarding, employees’ contract renewal, benefits, and termination while ensuring compliance with PDPA
  • Perform standard HR Master Data changes in line with the University’s policies and relevant legislation requirements
  • Partner with HRBP/TA team members (as appropriate) for the executions of HR related task(s)/assignment(s)/project(s)
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:
  • A relevant degree with at least 3 to 5 years of related experience in data protection work with high understanding of PDPA
  • Relevant certification(s) and/or HR experience will be an added advantage
  • Proficient in MS Office
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Excellent data analytical skills
  • Strong stakeholder management skill and ability to communicate (written and verbal) with all
  • levels of the organization
  • Well-connected and resourceful in drawing valuable information and/or insights from stakeholders
  • Ability to navigate in a dynamic and fluid environment where quality and speed are of essence\\
  • Ability to work as part of the team and/or on own initiative
  • IT savvy and proficient in systems such as SAP and software such as Microsoft Office (Words, Excel, PPT etc.)
  • Ability to perform with a high degree of accuracy and confidential data
  • Critical analytical thinking skills, detail-oriented, structured, and consistent follow-through
  • Anticipates and/or escalates problems (as appropriate)
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click ""Quick Apply"" to register your interest now.
All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
