column2:
Ensign InfoSecurity is the largest pure-play cybersecurity service provider in Asia. The company is headquartered in Singapore. We specialise in the provision of these services; cybersecurity advisory and assurance, implementation and management of advanced cybersecurity controls, cybersecurity monitoring, threat hunting, and incident response. Underpinning these competencies is in-house research and development in cybersecurity.","
Duties and Responsibilities
  • Conduct reverse-engineering of malware in support of incident response/threat hunting and threat intelligence requirements
  • Conduct static and dynamic analysis of malware, including building a semi-automated lab environment that is capable of prioritising and analysing large pool of samples
  • Extract Indicators of Compromise, and using the resulting data to create detection model and knowledge base to detect similar activities
  • Develop scripts and solutions to automate the triage and analysis process, including automating sandboxes for dynamic analysis
  • Participate in threat analysis to correlate and attribute malware to threat actor
  • Conduct and/or manage joint research initiatives with industry partners and Institutes of Higher Learning
Requirements
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science/Information Systems/Computer Engineering or equivalent
  • Knowledge of threat actor APT and cybercrime groups. Experience and understanding of both cybercriminal and nation-state group motivations and typical TTPs (Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures)
  • Knowledge of x86/x64 Instruction sets, C/C++, Windows API, and Windows OS internals
  • Knowledge of modern offensive techniques and APT TTPs such as Living off the Land binaries (LOLBins)
  • Knowledge in interactive disassembler and debuggers such as IDA Pro, Ghidra, WinDbg, OllyDbg, Immunity Debugger, x64dbg
  • Knowledge of packers and obfuscation techniques as well as experience in defeating anti-analysis/anti-vm techniques
  • Ability to document and report technical details/findings clearly and concisely

column1: 854,data,/en/job/data-engineer-revenue-optimization-9370127,9370127,"Data Engineer, Revenue Optimization",False,False,,,SGD,Marina Bay Sands Pte Ltd,11-Mar-22,False,,,200507292R,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Marina Bay Sands® is Asia’s leading destination for business, leisure and entertainment delivering once-in-a-lifetime experiences. The landmark building is situated in the heart of Singapore’s Central Business District and transforms Singapore’s skyline and the country’s tourism landscape.

The destination offers a luxury hotel, state-of-the art convention and exhibition facilities, theaters, world-class entertainment and the best shopping and dining in the region. The three hotel towers are crowned by the Sands SkyPark® on the 57th story.

column1: <div>
<div>

column3: Conveniently located in the heart of the Central Business District and 20 minutes from Changi Airport.

• Hotel: The Marina Bay Sands hotel has three 55-story towers with 2,561 luxury rooms and suites. The three towers are capped by the Sands SkyPark, which offers 360-degree views of Singapore’s skyline. It is home to restaurants, lush gardens, an infinity edged swimming pool and the world’s largest public cantilever housing an observation deck.

• Expo and Conventions: The Sands Expo and Convention Center has 1.3 million square feet of flexible convention and exhibition space. It can host over 45,000 delegates, 2,000 exhibition booths and 250 meeting rooms. It features Southeast Asia’s biggest ballroom, which can accommodate 6,600 people for a banquet, and up to 11,000 for an auditorium-style lecture.

• Shopping: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands has 800,000 square feet of retail and dining space. Luxury retailers include Bally, Cartier, CHANEL, Ferragamo, Franck Muller, Gucci, Hermès, Hublot, Hugo Boss, Louis Vuitton, Miu Miu, Omega, Patek Philippe, Prada, Tiffany & Co. and Yves Saint Laurent. New brands include Anne Fontaine, Henry Cotton’s, Leviev, Marisfrolg, Moiselle, Rabeanco, Stefano Ricci, and Wolford.

• Restaurants: Dining at Marina Bay Sands is a gourmet experience with over 50 dining choices. These include celebrity-chef restaurants helmed by Mario Batali, (New York), Daniel Boulud (New York), Wolfgang Puck (Los Angeles), Guy Savoy (Paris), Tetsuya Wakuda (Sydney) and Justin Quek (Singapore). Marina Bay Sands features signature restaurants, modern bistros and a premium food court.

• Entertainment: Marina Bay Sands energizes the entertainment and nightlife scene in Singapore with nightclubs, world-class entertainment, a museum and a casino. The museum, which has a lotus-inspired design, will feature blockbuster exhibitions from around the world. Two state-of-the-art theaters will open with a total of about 4,000 seats. The Broadway hit The Lion King will debut in Sands Theater, with Le Theater presenting shorter-run shows such as concerts, award ceremonies and gala events. The outdoor event plaza along the promenade next to Marina Bay will host audiences for watching events on the bay or on the plaza.

Job Summary & Expectations As a Data Engineer, you will build and maintain end to end Data & BI solutions for the Data Platform to address various business requirements. You will be an individual contributor who has deep understanding and experience building data solutions. In this role you need to use various tools not limited to; Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft BI Tool Stack (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS), MDX, DAX, Power BI, Tableau, Windows batch scripting, PowerShell, Web Services, Python, R, C#.Net etc.  You are also expected to do development, automation and maintenance of data solutions as an active contributor in current Team. Job Responsibilities
  • Build and maintain reliable, efficient and consumable data solutions by delivering all phases of the software development life cycle, including gathering requirements, design, development, testing, deployment, integration, documentation, and post-deployment maintenance.
  • Work on change requests from the business units.
  • Maintain documentations of projects.
  • Maintain user experience in term of availability, query performance and quick turnaround time.
  • Resolve any data related issue like data discrepancies.
  • Set up monitoring processes to alert any issue.
  • Create & Maintain required business reports.
Job Requirements 
  • 3-5 years of hands-on experience in designing & building data solutions.
  • Highly proficient in T-SQL, data modeling and problem-solving.
  • Hands-on experience in building and maintaining an end-to-end data solution involving data exploration, data analysis, data ingestion, data transformation, data processing to deployment for both real time and batched data is mandatory.
  • Hands-on experience with Reporting tools is mandatory. Working experience with Tableau / Power BI / Qlik / SSRS would be preferred.
  • Experience in big data tools and technologies will be an added advantage.
  • Proactive, Self-starter & Go-getter attitude is expected in this role.
  • Good time management and ability to meet deadlines.
  • Experience with financial analysis, trend analysis or any large volume data crunching and analysis would be an advantage.
  • Prior experience with Hospitality and/or Gaming domain would be a BIG plus.
  • Very good team player & attention to details.
  You agree that it is a condition of employment that you adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures including without limitation the rules of conduct of the Company.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers our Bank with an efficient, nimble, scalable standard infrastructure through a strategic focus on Productivity, Quality & Control, Operating Models, Technology and People. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. COO-BMO (Business Management Office) is the Centre of excellence and it plays a key role in leading the transformation agenda for Treasury and Market Operations.  Our area of focus includes - People Transformation, People Productivity, Financials and Stakeholders Management. As change agents, the COO team drive change and people excellence, towards Treasury and Market Operations (TMO) Control Tower and making Banking Joyful in a Data Driven Way.
Essential Job Functions
  • To think strategically in the pursuit of DBS' Business intent, set goals & objectives in line with the Firm
  • Strives for people excellence, co-partner to future proof the people and takes ownership of the development of self and others within COO and TMO as a whole
  • To be customer centric building strong relationship with business dependents and business partners, ensure SLA is met or exceed stakeholders' expectations through consistent delivery of COE service standard
  • Takes accountability and demonstrates commitment in issues and problems
  • Participate, partner with LOB to develop KPI score card, Strategy document, and tracking of benefit and Productivity saves
  • Provide Analytic Insights into MTK productivity metrics, Operational MIS dashboard and analysis on resource capacity as well as Analytics insights and identify opportunities for OPPR3.0 Employee Roadmap
  • Partner and Enable Stakeholders to use Report/Dashboard for strategic planning, review on performance metrics, measure, access/identification of risks, opportunities, areas of improvement etc applying data analytics & prioritizing actionable insights
  • Support People Development: Map training and development roadmap for staff and Graduate Associates under TMO. Design program for people development, training and growth (inclusive of Talents)
  • Drive insights when engaging stakeholders on Management Review, Business Forums, COO Engagement
  • Manage Financials, Budget cycle, Future Ready Workforce and Strategic Workforce Planning
  • Drive TMO events, Offsites, Town hall, Roadshow, People Engagement, Management Meeting when required
  • Play key role in people engagement and Learning and development e.g. On boarding Orientation, Dialogue session, set up people KPI etc
  • Embraces PRIDE, communicates and share information with the team, promotes team collegiality
Requirements
  • Bachelors Degree or equivalent qualification
  • Able to drive innovation, and embrace PRIDE
  • Critical thinking,  analytical,  ability  to  work  independently,  organized  and  have  a problem solving mindset, ability to design analytical dashboards
  • Excellent interpersonal, communications, public speaking and ability to articulate with strong presentation skills
  • Able to multi-task and work under tight deadlines
Other Skills/Abilities
  • Strong PC skills in Microsoft Office, particularly in PowerPoint
  • Data Analytics, Design workflow
  • Proficient in Business Intelligence Tools (Example: Tableau)
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

856,data,/en/job/business-strategy-transformation-advisory-analyst-9357073,9357073,Business Strategy Transformation Advisory Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,BDO LLP,22-Mar-22,False,,,T10LL0001F,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,Bugis,"<div>
<div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div>
ONE ORGANISATION – GLOBALLY CONNECTED

BDO’s global organisation extends across 167 countries and territories, with 88,120 people working out of 1,809 offices – and they’re all working towards one goal: to provide our clients with exceptional service.

Our firms across the organisation cooperate closely and comply with consistent operating principles and quality standards. That means local resources who understand your business, your local and international markets and the specifics of your industry: all backed by a truly global organisation.
The fee income of all BDO firms, including the members of their exclusive alliances, was US$9.6 billion as of 30 September 2019.
EXCEPTIONAL CLIENT SERVICE, DELIVERED ACROSS THE WORLD

BDO’s vision is to be the leader for exceptional client service. This is not about reinventing our profession’s approach to service, but about delivering our services exceptionally well – and delivering that high quality consistently in every office, every country and every territory where we have a presence. No matter where you do business, we have people who can help.

We demonstrate our objectivity and independence when dealing with our clients’ business issues, and this helps us to build relationships based on trust. There are ﬁve key components that describe BDO and our consistently exceptional service delivery:
<ul>

column2: • CLIENT NEEDS: we anticipate our clients’ needs and are forthright in our views, in order to ensure the best outcome for you
• COMMUNICATION: we are always clear, open & swift in our communication
• COMMITMENT: we agree to and meet our commitments, meaning that we deliver what we promise, every day, for every client
• PEOPLE: at BDO we are proud to provide the right environment for our people to grow and develop – but also the right people to deliver for our clients
• VALUE: Our experts focus on creating value: we give our clients up to date ideas and valuable insights and advice that they can trust

column1: We  are a global organisation built on local relationships.
OUR GLOBAL COMMITMENT TO EXCEPTIONAL CLIENT SERVICE MEANS THAT WE DELIVER WHAT WE PROMISE, WHEN YOU NEED IT
We are the most agile and responsive of the global accounting organisations.

We’re big enough to be able to access the best group of experts for your needs from our national and international network, and we’re small enough to be responsive and innovative in how we tackle our clients’ challenges.

Our excellent global average staff to partner ratio of 10 to 1 means that our clients receive the right focus from the right people: people who are empowered and whose approach is hands-on. We can provide the perfect contact for your needs,  no matter where in the world you are.

column2: The National University Hospital (NUH) is a member of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.

column2: As Singapore’s first restructured hospital, NUH has been serving more than a million patients annually since 1985. NUH is a tertiary hospital with a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children, and a major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As part of an integrated academic health system, NUH is committed to transforming care, shaping the next generation of healthcare professionals and leveraging translational research to improve health outcomes. The hospital is also the principal teaching hospital for the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and the NUS Faculty of Dentistry.

column2: The CAP Consulting Group Pte Ltd (UEN.: 201417121 C) is a company registered in Singapore. It is a boutique recruitment firm specialising in mid to senior level searches for roles spanning across all industries in Singapore and parts of Asia ( China, Malaysia, Indonesia etc). The roles that the firm covers include Finance/Accounting, General Management, Corporate Affairs, HR, Supply Chain, Sales & Marketing, Risk, Business Development, Technology  etc. More info on the co can be found at its website is at www.cap-cg.com.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
CAP Consulting was founded by Caroline Poh, a finance search consultant/veteran with a stellar record of more than 20 years of recruitment/ search experience and success in the search industry. She has established her credibility as the “go-to finance search specialist” in successfully recruiting for mid to senior level finance roles in Singapore. ","
  • Have a finance/accounting background or an IT business background with min 2 years of SAP experience (in terms of extracting data from SAP) in addition to systems implementation exposure.
  • Some experience doing UAT testings for finance system implementation projects is required
  • Able to commit to a 6 months contract assignment (a completion bonus will also be made available)

Our client is a renowned/international commodity MNC.
For this role as a finance systems analyst (6 months contract), you will report to a finance lead and assist in the testing of some finance modules relating to a new system (Blackline) implementation applicable to the finance department. Specifically, you will be do the following functions and work closely with the finance users:
  • Understand the finance user requirements, process flow and use cases and work with business users to review/update the UAT test cases and data requirements
  • Test data for UAT to be provided in coordination with finance users
  • Participate in “show and tell” sessions with global IM/IT team
  • Shadow and help finance users during UAT evidence
  • Log UAT defects
  • Coordinate through system lead with Marketing and Global IM team to ensure required UAT access is provided, and that UAT test is set up and defects have been resolved.
A good performer may be considered for a contract extension or perm roles in the finance team (though this is not guaranteed). There will also be a completion bonus applicable at the end of the 6 months contract assignment.
Requirement:
  • A degree in accounting, commerce and/or business
  • Have a finance/accounting background or an IT business background with min 2 years of SAP experience (in terms of extracting data from SAP) in addition to systems implementation (be it SAP or other systems) exposure
  • Some experience doing UAT testings for finance system implementation projects is required
  • Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines in a commodity trading environment
  • Has strong communication skills. Have good time management skills
  • Able to commit to a 6 months contract assignment
To apply, please send your cv in word doc to resume@cap-cg.com . Please also include details on your current salary, expected salary and notice period in your cv.
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

","
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Finance and Corporate Services function manages the financial and administrative needs of the Group to help achieve its business goals.  
Corporate Real Estate Services We manage and administer matters relating to real estate on behalf of the Group. These include lease management, facilities management, as well as security and general service matters.
Job Responsibilities
  • Work with internal stakeholders in Corporate Real Estate Services (CRES) to understand their challenges with respect to data and gather, document, perform exploratory data analysis to propose solutions to address them
  • Design, build and implement data visualization/ dashboard, data analytics and reports for internal stakeholders to aid in key decision making in property related space
  • Developing mechanisms to track savings, measure KPIs and benchmarks arising from initiatives implemented or to be implemented
  • Support property related projects & initiatives with a financial perspective.
  • Standardizing accounting of property incomes and expenditures across UOB group
  • Perform cash flow or financial analysis for all projects undertaken by CRES as well as overseas property companies
  • Provide support for finance operations for overseas property companies such as invoice verification and approval, audit clearance, engaging external consultants, etc
  • Support monthly, quarterly and yearly financial closing activities
  • Develop and review charging rates for internal and external tenants for UOB owned properties.
  • Coordinate and record minutes for weekly/monthly management meetings
  • Provide guidance to junior team members
  • Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned
Job Requirements
  • Degree in accountancy, business, statistics or mathematics with background in real estate a plus
  • 5-7 years of working experience in similar capacity with a strong focus on data visualization and analysis.
  • Proficiency in visualization tools (such as PowerBI)
  • Experience with database management and SQL will be useful
  • Well conversant with MS Office
  • Ability to initiate, drive discussion and excellent communication skills
  • Strong problem solving, quantitative and analytical abilities
  • Hands on and able to multi-task and at the same time be an effective team player
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

column2:
SMRT Trains Ltd was incorporated in 1987 and operates Singapore’s first mass rapid transit system. Today, we manage and operate train services on the North-South Line, East-West Line, the Circle Line, the Thomson-East Coast Line, and the Bukit Panjang Light Rail Transit. With over 5,000 employees, more than 250 trains, and 141 km of rail tracks across 108 stations, we serve millions of commuters daily.","
Job Purpose

The Master Data Officer is required to ensure that data entered to the information system such as SAP, MAXIMO are verified and accurate. He/ She is required to manage the data in accordance with the operational strategy of supply chain policy and governance. These data are required for material support to Maintenance, Material Requirement Planning (MRP), Procurement, Logistics Support and Life-Cycle Management.

Responsibilities

The Master Data Officer is responsible for the correctness of the information submitted. He/ She is to ensure the integrity of the data managed, verify, and validate the data against the supply chain polices, work instruction and governing instructions. 

He/ She is required to validate the submission, vet the supporting documents before the creation of the master data in the information system. Where required, he/ she is to work with the requestors from the business units to clarify on the supporting documents and information submitted.

The tasks of the Master Data Officer include but not limited to:

1.    Perform Material Catalogue Tasks and to Maintain Material Master database in SAP MM
-    Tally request by stakeholders with supporting document
-    Creation of material catalogue
-    Amendment of values in material catalogue

2.    Maintain Manufacturer Part database in SAP MM
-    Tally request by stakeholders with supporting document
-    Verify Manufacturer (brand) authenticity (using Internet Search e.g. Google)
-    No duplicate Vendor Master in database
-    Liaise with stakeholders (as required) to facilitate data creation/amendment

3.    Perform Continuous Improvement Tasks
-    Propose ways to eliminate gaps and weaknesses in current operations
-    Propose innovative solutions that address customer's needs
-    Support Knowledge Library (e.g., prepare training guides)

4.    Perform Business Administration Tasks
-    Facilitate delivery of key outcomes within team/departmental projects
-    Facilitate team/departmental projects
-    Generate reports (as required)

Qualifications & Work Experience
  • ITE/ Diploma in Supply Chain/ Logistic
  • Experience in Supply Chain/ Logistic preferred
  • Knowledge of spare parts supply source
  • Knowledge of IBM Maximo system will be an advantage
Skills

Technical skills include:

  • SAP or MAXIMO will be an advantage
  • Proficient in MS Office 365 (Excel, Words, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, etc.)
  • Savvy with search engines (e.g., Google)

Generic skills include:

  • Good communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Critical Thinking
  • Process good judgement, consistency, and high accuracy
  • Able to quickly adapt and learn new skills
  • Ability to follow through task/project completion with minimum supervision

column1: 865,data,/en/job/research-associate-ocular-epidemiology-9354402,9354402,Research Associate (Ocular Epidemiology),False,False,3400,5000,SGD,Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI),22-Mar-22,False,,24 days,199704888Z,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

Singapore National Eye Centre (SNEC) was incorporated on 3 March 1989 and commenced operation in October 1990. It is the designated national centre for ophthalmology within Singapore’s public sector healthcare network, with a faculty of close to 80 ophthalmologists and more than 800 staff. SNEC spearheads and coordinates the provision of specialised ophthalmological services with emphasis on quality education and research.

SNEC manages more than 330,000 patient visits and performs over 35,000 surgeries and laser procedures annually.  The centre offers a full spectrum of subspecialties addressing every part of the eye – Cataract, Corneal & External Eye Disease, General Cataract & Comprehensive Ophthalmology, Glaucoma, Neuro-ophthalmology, Ocular Inflammation & Immunology, Oculoplastic, Paediatric Ophthalmology and Adult Strabismus, Refractive Surgery, Surgical and Medical Retina.

Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI) was established in 1997 as Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. It is the research arm of SNEC, and affiliated to the National University of Singapore (NUS) and the Duke-NUS Medical School, as part of the SingHealth-Duke-NUS Academic Medical Centre.

Over the years, SERI has invested considerable resources into its research infrastructure and in the training of the next generation of clinician-scientists, clinician-researchers and scientists. In two decades, SERI has grown from a founding team of 5 to over 200 researchers, doctors and support staff, and is the largest eye research institute in the Asia-Pacific region.

A global leader in eye research, SERI ranks ahead of its counterparts in the US, UK and Japan in terms of ophthalmology publications per capita. Tapping on its close affiliation to SNEC, SERI is in the unique position to translate basic research into cutting edge clinical care by enabling the development of new treatments for a variety of eye diseases.

","

Established in 1997, SERI is Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. SERI’s mission is to conduct high-impact eye research that prevents blindness, low vision and major eye diseases common to Singaporeans and Asians. Over the last decade, SERI has conducted landmark research projects that have led to tangible outcomes, patient benefits, and success stories. It has paved the way for significant improvements in how eye diseases are treated and prevented, not just for Singaporeans or Asians, but on a global scale.

SERI has grown from a founding team of five in 1997 to a faculty of more than 238 staff, encompassing clinician scientists, scientists, research fellows, PhD students and support staff. This makes SERI one of the largest research institutes in Singapore, as well as the largest eye research institute in the Asia Pacific region. SERI has also over 230 adjunct faculties from various eye departments, biomedical institutes and tertiary centres in Singapore. SERI has published an impressive array of 4,504 scientific papers, and has secured external peer-reviewed competitive grants worth more than $360 million. As of August 2021, SERI’s faculty has been awarded with more than 755 national and international prizes and filed 145 patents.

Are you searching for an opportunity to apply/develop your skills and expertise? Joining the SERI family would provide you the chance to join a global team and learn alongside with one of the top and globally renowned researchers, as well as develop your knowledge and skills further in a team-oriented, flexible and friendly working environment!

The Ocular Epidemiological Research Group at SERI conducts ophthalmic epidemiologic research via machine learning in Singapore and Asia under the Singapore Epidemiology of Eye Diseases (SEED) programme. SEED aims to determine the biomarkers, risk factors for cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disease and impact of major age-related eye diseases, including age-related macular degeneration, glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy, and vision impairment via machine learning. We conduct large population-based studies and multi-centre collaboration research with a particular focus on diseases that are prevalent in Asia-Pacific. In addition, together with Retina and Glaucoma Research Groups at SERI, we are conducting several clinical projects, collectively involving over 100,000 study subjects, with comprehensive image and genetic data.

We are inviting suitably qualified candidates for the position of Research Associate for machine learning under the Singapore Epidemiology of Eye Diseases (SEED) programme.

For the role of a Research Associate, you will be working in the Ocular Epidemiology Research Group with the following (but not limited to) responsibilities,

  • Assist Principal Investigator (PI) and Research Fellow in developing study plans and conduct literature reviews to aid grant applications and scientific manuscripts.
  • Prepare reports and ethics applications
  • Perform image processing (e.g. Python, MATLAB).
  • Perform data validation and analysis using advanced data analytics software (e.g., SPSS, STATA, SAS).
  • Perform data validation and analysis using advanced machine learning platforms (e.g., TensorFlow, Caffe, pytorch, etc.).
  • Coordinate and communicate with funding organizations, and collaborators
  • Assist in study execution, managing project timelines, and participate in the preparation of abstracts, posters and presentations
  • Interpret and present study results
  • Train and manage junior coordinators and students
  • Perform other related or additional duties assigned by the PI

Requirements:

  • A Master’s degree in computer science, computer vision, robotics, public health, biostatistics or relevant disciplines is preferable
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Advanced knowledge in statistical analysis and machine learning
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and to multi-task several projects at a time
  • An analytical mind, drive and dynamic personality
  • He/ She can additionally be assured of a fulfilling and challenging career in a fast-paced and dynamic organization. We strongly encourage continuous education and development through our in-house training programmes and external courses.

Note: Package offered will commensurate with qualifications and experience.

866,data,/en/job/machine-learning-engineer-9326995,9326995,Machine learning Engineer,False,False,6500,13000,SGD,Xiaomi Technologies Singapore Pte. Ltd.,15-Mar-22,False,,,202127014Z,,,,,,"

Xiaomi Corporation, registered in Asia as Xiaomi Inc., is a Chinese designer and manufacturer of consumer electronics and related software, home appliances, and household items. Behind Samsung, it is the second largest manufacturer of smartphones, all of which run the MIUI operating system, a fork of Android. In 2020, the company sold 146.3 million smartphones and, as of August 2021, its MIUI operating system had over 450 million monthly active users. It also is a major manufacturer of appliances including televisions, flashlights, unmanned aerial vehicles, and air purifiers using its Internet of Things and Xiaomi Smart Home product ecosystems. The name ""Xiaomi"" literally means millet and rice, and is based on the Buddhist concept of starting from the bottom before aiming for the top.

","

About The Company:

Xiaomi Corporation was founded in April 2010 and listed on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on July 9, 2018 (1810.HK). Xiaomi is a consumer electronics and smart manufacturing company with smartphones and smart hardware connected by an IoT platform at its core.

Embracing our vision of “Make friends with users and be the coolest company in the users’ hearts”, Xiaomi continuously pursues innovations, high-quality user experience and operational efficiency. The company relentlessly builds amazing products with honest prices to let everyone in the world enjoy a better life through innovative technology.

Xiaomi is one of the world's leading smartphone companies. The company’s market share in terms of smartphone shipments ranked no. 2 globally in the second quarter of 2021.

Job Description:

  • Based on a large number of user behaviors, use data mining and machine learning algorithms to model user interests and preferences to improve the user experience and user commercial value of advertising products;
  • Click-Through-Rate estimation, Conversion-Rate estimation, and closed-loop advertising ecology construction;
  • Research on advertising strategy mechanism, optimization of advertising conversion and monetization effects;
  • Innovative applications in models such as deep neural networks, reinforcement learning, transfer learning, multi-task learning, and research on industry-leading algorithms

Job Requirement：

  • Familiar with commonly used Deep Learning algorithms such as Wide&Deep/ DeepFM/ Transformer/ Coaction, etc., traditional Machine Learning algorithms such as GBDT/ LR/ LTR, etc.;
  • Familiar with commonly used feature engineering methods, and big data frameworks such as Spark/ Hadoop/ Hive/ Hbase;
  • Familiar with more than two programming languages in Python/ Scala/ Java/ C++;
  • Familiar with common distributed Deep Learning frameworks such as Tensorflow/ PaddlePaddle/ PyTorch/ Caffe;
  • Strong sense of responsibility, ability to learn quickly, good communication skills, technological innovation spirit, willingness to accept challenges, and able to withstand work pressure.

column3: Mediacorp is Singapore’s leading media company with the most complete range of platforms, spanning television, radio, newspapers, magazines, movies, digital and out-of-home media.
It pioneered the development of Singapore’s broadcasting industry, with the broadcast of Radio in 1936 and Television in 1963.
Today, Mediacorp has over 50 products and brands in four languages (English, Mandarin, Malay and Tamil), reaching out to all adults in Singapore every week.
Initiatives in the new digital space include Internet TV-on-demand, High Definition TV broadcast and Over-the-Top (OTT) interactive services.

column2: Beyond Singapore, Mediacorp is an active regional player through co-productions in TV dramas and movies, magazines publishing, as well as Channel NewsAsia International, one of the first Asian-owned English news channels.

column3: Our financial and strategic relationship in the region includes International Media Corporation in Vietnam, which was set up to develop and produce television entertainment and economic news content. Mediacorp also has a stake in Singapore-based retail firm Reebonz, one of the region's fastest growing luxury online retailers and a majority stake in Cubinet Interactive, a Malaysian digital games publisher.

column2: Winner of numerous international awards and accolades including Asian Television Awards' Terrestrial Broadcaster of the Year, Mediacorp’s mission is to engage, entertain and enrich audiences by harnessing the power of creativity.

Our client, one of the world’s largest data center companies is looking for suitable candidates for the position of Facility Engineer.
Responsibilities:
  • Gain a complete understanding of all aspects of data center operations including the operation, maintenance and repair of all mission critical equipment and systems supporting a 24x7 data center operation to achieve 100% uptime and 100% compliance with all customer SLAs.
  • Supervision of construction activity and installations as required.
  • Ability to be the executor in the site specific change management processes including the creation of Method of Procedures (MOPs) for low risk preventative maintenance and repairs as well as the oversight of those maintenances as they are carried out.
  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot site mechanical and electrical systems.
  • Ability to respond to unplanned events without immediate supervision.
  • Ability to efficiently complete rounds/inspections and to detect anomalies during those rounds.
  • Develop or improve SOPs for site specific equipment.
  • Gain a good understanding and knowledge of the local customers business and data center operation.
  • Support various accreditation initiatives, including, but not limited to, SSAE16, SOC2, ISO 27001, etc. as may be required by company.
  • Complete DLR Critical Awareness Training

Job Requirements:
  • At least 1 years’ experience in mission critical facilities operating / engineering or equivalent equipment experience including assets associated with mission critical engineering relevant to the specific site. (UPS, HVAC, generators, fire/life safety systems).
  • Hands-on electrical or mechanical skill and competence in the area of non-expertise (for example, electrical expertise with mechanical competence, or vice-versa).
  • Strong knowledge of various UPS Systems and architectures.
  • Strong knowledge of various cooling systems and architectures.
  • Strong understanding of infrastructure redundancy configurations and equipment and their risks (N+1, 2N, ATS/ STS, Failover Scenarios)
  • Strong knowledge of energy efficiency principals.
  • Strong interpersonal, presentation and communication skills. Ability to respond effectively, verbally in writing to sensitive issues, complex inquiries or complaints.
  • Basic understanding of emergency situations and escalation processes.
  • Strong understanding of Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS), Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM), and power metering systems
For interested applicants, please apply online or send your resume in WORD format to sheennie_chiang@persolkelly.com
Thank you for your application but we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd | EA License No. 01C4394 | RCB No. 200007268E

As a team member of the Finance Data Management, you are required to provide data stewardship oversight on GFRDM (Group Financial Reporting Datamart) through understanding the use of finance information in support of various reporting and analytical needs within GFCA.   Your key responsibilities would include :
GFRDM maintenance
  • Ensure data integrity and accuracy of GFRDM through reconciliation against source applications and GL.
  • Ensure that the Layer 1 xmaps are updated timely and acts as central coordinator with the various teams in GFCA in ensuring consistent data application between Layer 1 and respective Layer 2s’ specialised applications.
Project management and participation
  • Assess impact of new products and upstream system enhancements to GFRDM
  • Liaise between IT and GFCA finance users on data and information requirements and ensure appropriate data are mapped into GFRDM.
  • Perform user acceptance testing; working alongside other finance teams in supporting their specialised applications.
  • Assess the impact of the ERP 2.0 Accounting Hub on downstream GFCA datamarts, define change specifications to support use – reconciliation and analysis.
Others
  • Support GFCA finance users on data queries and data needs.
  • Participate in finance related projects as assigned; contribute in thought process on the appropriate use of data for information analysis.
Reporting to:
  • VP, GFCA-Finance Data Management
Qualifications

Requirements:
  • Degree in Finance and / or Computer Science qualification.
  • Minimum 7 years’ experience in the financial services sector, preferable in roles of finance, finance related systems and / or MIS.
  • Have a good understanding of project management, finance processes and banking products to help drive process efficiency and change.
  • Good oral/written communication and presentation skills.
  • Proactive team player with good interpersonal skills and the ability to foster collaboration with internal and external parties.

What You’ll Be Doing

We seek highly motivated scientists with talents and inclination to conduct cutting-edge research, develop and execute research strategies in Sustainable AI.Job Responsibilities
  • Build world-class capabilities and excellence in Sustainable AI to be recognized by international research communities

  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills

column1: 873,data,/en/job/commercial-analyst-9297692,9297692,Commercial Analyst,False,False,,,SGD,Pacific Carriers Limited,18-Mar-22,False,,,197300034E,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Pacific Carriers Limited (PCL) has established itself for more than 35 years as a global player in the shipping industry.

Starting out as a ship broker to the Kuok Group’s dry cargo shipping needs, Pacific Carriers Limited has grown to become a leading dry bulk operator. Other core activities include ship owning, ship management, container feeder and breakbulk operations.

column2:
A wholly owned subsidiary of Kuok (Singapore) Limited, Pacific Carriers Limited is poised to further develop its business building on its core strengths.","

This position is for Pacific Carriers Limited (PCL), a company under Kuok (Singapore) Limited.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

The Commercial Analyst is a key early career role, enabling strong candidates to get immersed in a Profit and Loss driven environment, develop core analytical skills and leverage and develop the Group’s management reporting and risk management platforms. The role feeds into other parts of the PCL and KSL business, including portfolio management, freight futures and bunker procurement.

Business Performance Monitoring

  • Maintaining a detailed position summary for respective business unit
  • Ensuring all commitments have an accurate and updated Mark to Market
  • Engaging with freight traders and charterers to ensure accurate and current P&L management
  • Tracking FFA and bunker positions in conjunction with bunker procurement and FFA execution team
  • Competitor and benchmarking analysis

Business Intelligence

  • Tracking cargo and/or vessel movements in and out of key markets to determine supply and demand balances that shape our fleet and operating portfolio.
  • Modelling optimization opportunities in the management of freight
  • Visualization of information through Business Intelligence Software (Power BI)

Research & Analysis

  • Conducting ad-hoc analysis as required by charterers, freight traders and management
  • Analyzing vessel speed, consumption and emissions performance

Requirement

  • Minimum 3 year of experience in the maritime, commodity or energy sector
  • Demonstrably commercial and results oriented
  • Proven interest in freight, commodity and energy markets
  • Strong attention to detail with a sharp intellect and clear judgment
  • An ability to handle multiple simultaneous tasks and work accurately under pressure
  • Team player with strong levels of personal integrity and a collaborative style
  • Able to generate creative, feasible and efficient solutions to solve problems
  • Bachelor’s degree in an analytical discipline, along with an excellent academic record, is essential
  • Advanced quantitative and analytical capability and comfortable with Excel
  • Clear understanding of accounting and DCF concepts

column3: <div>

column4: You’re an original. So are we.

column3: <div>

column4: We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

column3: We just might be the original startup. Our brands — Levi’s®, Dockers®, Denizen® and Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™ — stand for freedom and self-expression around the world. And for more than 160 years, we’ve used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world.
<div>

column4: There’s plenty of room to make your mark here. We employ more than 15,000 people around the world, and this is a place where everyone contributes to the conversation.

column3: Levi Strauss & Co. is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

column1:
","
JOB DESCRIPTION
At Levi Strauss & Co., you can be yourself — and be part of something bigger. We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We collaborate instead of competing. We believe that diverse perspectives make us stronger. And we try not to take ourselves too seriously. There’s plenty of room to make your mark here!As Dockers Allocation Analyst, you will be a trusted member of the Dockers Merchandise Planning team to support brand/category E2E strategy.
You will perform product initial allocations to the store level and manage in-season replenishment according to store needs and stock capacities. Your team will be composed of 3 Planners and 2 Allocators and with Sales partners and Inventory Management/Order management partners to increase Sell-out opportunities and minimize risk on inventories in-store and across Distribution Centers. You will have direct contacts with strategic customers, so it requires deep sense of communication and negotiation. You will report to the Dockers Merchandise Planning Manager.
ABOUT THE JOB: 
  • You'll translate seasonal buy plan into orders to stores.
  • You’ll support the negotiation process of the monthly replenishment budget by highlighting the real needs.
  • You’ll get the right stock in the right stores based on latest Sell-out trends and customer replenishment budget.
  • You’ll anticipate any stocks needs by following-up the company’s sales and product strategies, the sell-out trends and the seasonal promotional calendar (internal and external).
  • You’ll support sell-out activation initiatives through budget negotiation and replenishment management aligned to the business purpose.
  • You'll update weekly allocation parameters to increase store/door sell-through with an automated replenishment system.
  • You'll apply specific parameters for stock build-up for upcoming peak periods/lower trading periods in alignment within in- season trading strategy.
  • You'll analyze the outcome of replenishment orders to ensure accurate shipments to store and minimize workload in-store.
  • You'll report analysis of orders and fill rate; provide ad hoc reporting needs.
  • You'll build store opening orders for new stores.
  • You'll visit stores and customers to gather market intelligence and reflect take outs in replenishment strategy.
  • Travel: ~5-10%
ABOUT YOU:
  • You have a Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Retail Management or Business Administration.
  • 3-5 years in a corporate environment is an asset; apparel industry preferred. Stock Management experience preferred.
  • You have technical proficiency with computer software tools and learn new ones quickly.
  • You're proficient in Microsoft excel: able to perform complex functions, able to build reports and projections.
  • You have an analytical mindset and you can consider yourself as a problem-solver including the ability to quickly identify effects from consumer, internal, and marketplace information.
  • You're used to juggling with different projects simultaneously, being accurate.
  • You're proud of being highly organized and you have strong time management skills with strong attention to detail.
  • You're fluent in English, Mandarin is a plus.
  • You're independent, people-oriented, an active listener and enjoy working with diverse teams.
What we offer:
  • An opportunity to build a career with a world-renowned, historic fashion brand that lives by its values and is growing significantly
  • A diverse, international environment of smart, inspiring people
  • A fun, creative, modern casual dress culture

875,data,/en/job/avp-senior-associate-business-analyst-payments-%5Bwd28310-%7C-9407092,9407092,"AVP / Senior Associate, Business Analyst (Payments) - [WD28310 |",False,False,,,SGD,DBS Bank Limited,23-Mar-22,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

AVP / Senior Associate, Business Analyst (Payments), Future Ready Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD28310)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. What we are looking for as a Business Analyst
Business Analysts helps business do business better. You are an agent of change. As business analysts, you identify and define the solutions that will maximize the value delivered by an organization to its stakeholders. You will also work across all levels of an organization and may be involved in everything from defining strategy, to creating the enterprise architecture, to taking a leadership role by defining the goals and requirements for programs and projects or supporting continuous improvement in its technology and processes.
Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with business users and vendors/partners for solution planning and integration
  • Manage cross functional/matrix business stakeholders on solution requirement including mapping business processes, establishing project scope, goals and key value creation
  • Work closely with business stakeholders and system development team to gather requirements, Functional Specification Developments
  • Facilitate conflict resolution and able to influence business and technical stakeholders towards a common objective
  • Work with respective stakeholders on UAT planning, execution, identifying project risk and critical paths
  • Provide project dashboard reporting and metrics to business sponsor and key stakeholders
  • Coordinate with country business and technical stakeholders to ensure smooth cutover during schedule releases
  • Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues
  • Owns and manages process repository and is responsible for maintenance of all processes in the domain/sub-domain - (Payment utilities)
Requirements
  • Analytical and with drive to solve problems
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and good presentation skills
  • The ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, including executives, subject matter experts, developers
  • Pro-active and able to organize, coordinate, and direct users and teams
  • Familiar with project management and SDLC process and writing Business Requirement Document & Functional Specification
  • Process positive attitudes and able to adopt to changes fast
  • Working experience in Banking environments will be an advantage
  • Having mobile applications and payments knowledge will be an advantage
  • Delivery focused and results oriented
  • Attention to details and highly organized and able to work under pressure in a time-critical environment
  • Ability to work independently, and keep calm when under stress
  • Microsoft Excel/Powerpoint/Projects/Word/Visio
  • Good Understanding of Payment/External Partnership Integration will be a plus
  • High level understanding of technologies associated with API
  • Understanding and hands-on experience in both Agile and Waterfall approaches in SDLC
  • Familiar with Jira and Confluence tools will be an advantage
  • Excellent organizational, vendor and partner management, negotiation, and prioritization skills
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Founded in 2012, SHEIN is a leading brand platform for global fast fashion E-commerce, with operations in Guangzhou, Singapore and Los Angeles, along with other key markets. SHEIN reaches consumers across more than 150 countries and regions around the world. 

We place a premium on choice, delivering more than 6,000 new fashion, beauty and lifestyle products daily with more than 600,000 items available. To learn more about SHEIN, follow us at shein.com, instagram.com/sheinofficial and youtube.com/shein.

Job responsibilities:

1. Responsible for the MySQL database, ensure safe, stable and efficient operation;

2. Responsible for the daily maintenance, including the establishment and deployment of MySQL database, maintenance, and management, data migration, refactoring, etc.;

3. Responsible for MySQL database performance monitoring and optimization, fault handling and disaster recovery;

4. Responsible for slow query optimization of MySQL database, formulating specifications, and training on research and development;

5. Improve the current MySQL database operation and maintenance system, and provide highly available and high-performance MySQL database system services for business.

Job requirements:

1. Full-time bachelor degree or above, computer-related major, more than 3 years of professional DBA experience;

2. Master the operating mechanism and architecture of MySQL database, and have excellent MySQL database architecture design capabilities;

3. Master MySQL database performance tuning, monitoring, backup, exception handling, and failure recovery;

4. Master the principles of MySQL replication and high availability, and be familiar with the commonly used high availability architectures MHA, PXC, KEEPALIVED, etc.;

5. Familiar with NoSQL MySQL databases such as MongoDB and Redis, actual maintenance experience is preferred;

6. Familiar with data middleware such as DBproxy, actual maintenance experience is preferred;

7. Proficiency in using Python and shell development tool scripts, experienced in automated operation and maintenance is preferred.

877,data,/en/job/digital-signal-processing-engineer-9408115,9408115,Digital Signal Processing Engineer,False,False,,,SGD,DSO National Laboratories,23-Mar-22,False,,14 days,199701777M,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div>

column2:
Defence research and development (R&D) is at the heart of what we do at DSO. As Singapore’s largest national defence R&D organisation, DSO is entrusted with the critical mission of developing technological surprises to enhance Singapore’s defence capabilities. From research to systems development, our defence engineers and scientists push the boundaries to develop game changing technologies and solutions that are not available in the market, or not available to Singapore. DSO also invest and explore emerging technologies to ensure the nation’s defence and national security capabilities are future ready. With more than 50 research areas across the domains of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace, DSO shapes the future of defence with our imagination and dare-to-do spirit in the relentless pursuit of the next big idea.","
DSO National Laboratories (DSO) is Singapore's largest defence research and development (R&D) organisation, with the critical mission to develop technological solutions to sharpen the cutting edge of Singapore's national security. At DSO, you will develop more than just a career. This is where you will make a real impact and shape the future of defence across the spectrum of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace.
The Electronic Systems Division advances electronic warfare systems with radio frequency and micro-electronics technologies and provides electromagnetic superiority.
People are DSO’s greatest asset. You will get to realise your career aspirations and develop your own niche either as a deep technical expert or a leader in the team. With frequent career dialogues and a robust training and development framework, we will provide you with the necessary development tools for you to reach your potential. You will also be recognised and rewarded through competitive remuneration packages and scholarship opportunities.
Digital Signal Processing Engineer
In this role, you will:
  • Research and develop innovative signal processing algorithms that will enhance the capabilities of RF receivers and provide cutting edge performance
Requirements:
  • PhD / Master’s / Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical & Computer Engineering / Electrical & Electronics Engineering / Signal Processing
  • Keen interest in research work such as algorithms design and prototype development
  • Knowledge in Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning
  • Knowledge in Digital Signal Processing / RF Receiver Prototyping
  • Knowledge in RF receiver research, design and development
  • Experience in MATLAB and / or Python Programming
  • Experience in signal processing algorithms development

What We do
“Simplifying business through innovative IT empowerment.” is what sums up the core ethos of Icon Resources Group.

Icon Resources Group is committed to providing innovative IT solutions and services to clients and enabling them to simplify their business IT needs and driving them to gain a competitive edge in their world.
With nearly 20 years of experience and a myriad of satisfied customers across Asia, we take pride in delivering “real” business value to our clients.

We have many Fortune 500 companies as our customers across varying industry verticals. We take pride in claiming that we understand our client’s information challenges better than they do and offer simplified impactful business solutions to empower them.

Job Summary:

We are looking out for Software professional who are looking for a change in profile or technology and would like to pursue a career in Business Intelligence & Analytics. Freshers are also welcome to apply.

Job Responsibilities:

1. Understanding customer requirements,

2. Able to implement business requirements into technical solutions.

3. Design, model and develop document and process driven applications using BI solutions,

4. Implementation & demonstration of BI Solutions,

5. Provide Training & Support to the customers.

Minimum Job requirements:

1. Tech fresher’s with knowledge in SQL & RDBMS Experience (or) JavaScript, HTML & CSS (or) any programming technologies.

2. Should have good understanding of SDLC Project lifecycle

3. Exposure to Qlikview / BI desirable but not a must.

4. Functional knowledge about the KPI indicators for different industry Verticals like Pharma, Finance & Accounting, manufacturing etc. will be added advantage.

5. Understanding of Stored Procedures and Functions will be added advantage.

6. Understanding of any BI tool is added advantage (Qlik, Power BI, Tableau)

7. Exposure to churning data through Excel or any other data tool will be added advantage.

8. This is a permanent position directly on the payroll of the company.
